description:
We got the classic custard filled cream puffs, but apparently they now have green tea, strawberries n cream, and chocolate.  Holy cow I need to try the others!  

These are THE BEST cream puffs ever...and we make it a point to stop by whenever we are in town.
author: J B.

description:
You can only expect the best from Papas. 

I stumbled on Beard Papa while exploring the Food Emporium at Westfield Centre Mall on Union Square. Papa's is located on the bottom 'C' floor food court, and is serving up fresh and natural cream puffs!

When ordering your cream puff you get to choose both your shell and your filling. Shell options include the Original (puff with powdered sugar), Eclair, Green Tea Eclair, Strawberry Eclair, and Honey and Butter. These puffs are then filled with your choice of vanilla, green tea, or expresso cream. 

Since I was a little overwhelmed by the amount of flavor combinations, I asked the ladies at the counter what their best seller was - this was of course the Original Vanilla! The dessert was incredible with light and fluffy breading, and then cold flavorful cream on the inside.
author: Hayley H.

description:
At beard papas you get to choose the puff and the type of cream you get inside! This was news to me and I was really excited to pair flavors together.

I ordered the green tea puff with green tea cream and the strawberry puff with vanilla cream. Both were really delicious, and I really enjoyed how much the green tea flavor came out in the cream. The texture of the puff was crisp on the outside with the delicious hardened sugar on top.

Really yummy treat!! Highly recommend :)
author: Angelina H.

description:
My occasional 'after-work-treat' for when I'm heading back home. You select the shell that you want--plain, chocolate or strawberry covered puff and the filling--chocolate, vanilla, green tea or special of the week.

 I usually get the plain puff with the green tea cream; dark chocolate covered puff with green tea cream if I want to go all out. A bit pricey at $3+ tax but eh...reasonable for the mall. Sometimes they'll offer the Paris brest which is a hollow donut that you can fill with cream. They also sell other pastries and drinks but I stick with the puffs. It's light, not too sugary and it satisfies the sweet tooth. 

Service is always quick and they prepare it right in front of you. There's never a line whenever I come by, which is a plus. Sometimes your cravings can't wait! Check em out after a long day of shopping :P
author: Vicky L.

description:
I had always walked by this place and never realized they sell puffs until this past weekend, I'm so happy I finally saw it!! The puffs are awesome! Love the green tea flavor! The crust is crunchy and flavorful with lots of cream inside. Love how the cream is not overly heavy. 

Would absolutely come back and get more puffs next time!
author: Rachel G.

description: We always get the original. It's so good! Fresh cream filled goodness. My daughter got the strawberry one today and she liked it just the same. After trying the green tea and strawberry previously, I learned my lesson and always get the original with vanilla filling.
author: Young B.

description:
AMAZING!!!! Absolutely Amazing Cream Puffs!!! Our bellman suggested that we stop by Beard Papa. He said that we would not be disappointed and he was right. We were delighted by the delicious quality of the cream that is filled into the perfect choux pastry after being ordered and paid for. 

When you arrive you are asked to choose your shell and your filling. You can have them filled with vanilla, green tea or cookies & cream. Of course you can also have the final tasty creation dipped in chocolate. We choose to have the puffs filled with vanilla. ($3.20 a piece)

I wish that we had a Beard Papa in Central Florida but since we don't we will be on the look out while traveling. This is not a pastry shop that you will want to miss out on.
author: Laura G.

description:
I don't care what anyone says. I love the cream puffs here and I think they are amazing! I freaking love creme brûlée and when I noticed they had a creme brûlée cream puff, I HAD TO GET IT and it was sooo good! 

It gets messy when you eat it, but that's not a problem at all.
author: Sandra L.

description:
Ever since my mom tried this place in Japan, she's been infatuated with Beard Papa.  We've been to one in Seattle, one in Portland and now one in SF. 

I followed GPS so I only have technology to blame but I couldn't figure out where to park! Ended up dropping off my passengers and waiting at this "park" across the street. 

They arrived with pastries in hand and my momma was happy with Papa's.  Two originals were downed before we made it out of the neighborhood. 

I tried a little of three different ones and my favorite was the original shell with vanilla custard. Creamy cool, not too sweet.  

All in all, my mom loves the place so we will keep going whenever we get the chance.
author: Heidi D.

description: The custard and green tea eclair were sooo good!! This is a delicious place. Big thumbs up!
author: Rose F.

description: Always my fav. There is a brûlée flavor which I haven't tried before. But honestly speaking, it is very like the original puff. Also, there is honey&butter puff which is also special.
author: Claire Y.

description: Beard Papa is like heaven in your mouth. This place is the perfect treat after a day of walking around in the city. I ordered a strawberry cream puff with vanilla filling and it was soooo delicious. The staff was friendly and there were many choices to choose from. I will definitely be back whenever I come back to San Francisco to try their matcha cream puff!
author: Kimberly D.

description:
I finally had a chance to try Beard Papa when I was walking by downtown. 
I tried the Strawberry creme puff and I have to say I was underwhelmed. The strawberry flavor tasted a bit gritty, and did not taste like actual strawberries. The vanilla filling was good, but a bit soupy and the creme puff was overfilled. The filling spilled out everywhere when I was eating it and made a bit of a mess. If I come back I would try a plain cream puff and ask them to only fill it a bit.
author: Larissa S.

description:
I've been here twice now and it doesn't seem to ever get too busy, so you'll get served right away.

STAFF:
Honestly they seem kind of weird. The placement of my order was near a bunch of bags and closer to the kitchen so I wasn't sure if that order in a bag I see was for me.

ATE:

MATCHA CREAM PUFF - $3.50
The cream puffs with a frosting costs $0.30 more than the original, and it's worth it. The pastry itself was good because it had a light crisp to it. I'm never a fan of cream puffs because I never like the shell--just the custard filling. In this case, This was wonderful all the way though. The custard filling (vanilla in this case) was creamy, not too sweet, and  there was a generous amount of it!  Be careful not to spill!

This place is consistent. It's why people come here. The size is decent and they have quality in their product. 

Also, if you buy 6, it's $1 off!
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
Crispy and light cream puff shell filled with a tasty rich custard cream..... yummmmmm

Why I was here // chilling at the mall and was craving some dessert after dinner 

Cream puffs // 3.50 each 
-dulce de leche shell with vanilla cream // the vanilla custard cream is my absolute favorite, but I wasn't a fan of the dulce shell. The caramel was much too sticky on my teeth and it was extremely messy. Loved that they added a cute Christmas decoration on it. (My bf liked this one a lot) 
-honey butter shell with vanilla cream // I liked this one a lot more. The shell was crispy and sweet. You could really taste the notes of honey on the top of the shell. 

Overall // I've been to beard papa's a few times In different locations and I've always been a fan of the plain shell. I love when they have the matcha filling but this location only had chocolate, vanilla, and milky.
author: Emily T.

description:
Conveniently located in the B1F food court of Westfield Shopping mall, Beard Papa is known for their cream puffs. 

I tried their matcha cream puff with matcha filling (for $3.50), which was decent. The pastry shell had a good texture -- soft and flaky enough such that it was easy to bite into, but hard enough such that the cream doesn't spill out that easily. The layer of hardened matcha on the top of the cream puff was okay but I could barely taste the green tea flavor. The inner matcha cream was decent -- the oozing cream complimented the puff well, though I also found the flavor of the green tea weaker than I would have preferred. 

Price is okay for the portion, maybe a little on the pricey side. But not a bad place to stop by to satisfy a sweets craving.
author: Alvin W.

description:
Terrible customer service.

No smile.

No thank you.

Grunted and pointed to the menu.

And to add insult to injury - the puff pastry was brittle and hard. The strawberry filling was also yucky.

At $4 bucks a pop the quality needs to be better as I'm voting with my dollars to NOT spend it at Beard Papas.

That new cheesecake place with the line out to the BART station is looking good!
author: Charlie B.

description: I love cream puffs. Seriously love. I could eat about 5 a day if I knew I wasn't going to gain 100lbs! Beard Papa lets you order the type of puff you want, chocolate, strawberry, green matcha, mango are a few choices. Then you chose your custard filling, vanilla is my favorite so I can't comment on any other flavors. If you haven't tried this place, you're missing out!
author: Mai D.

description:
Hooray, a beard papas in the mall. They were currently having a 50% off vanilla special when I went so they were a great price. 

Normally they are about $3.20 for the regular vanilla kind so they can get kind of pricey. They are located within the mall and are pretty hard to miss!
author: Tyler T.

description:
I was so excited to try a cream puff! My family and I had beard papa in Japan so to see the shop was so exciting! 

I am happy to say it tasted just like the ones in Japan! The cream puff is flaky and just decadent! The custard so delicious! I could probably eat like 6 in a sitting.

The workers were friendly and I wish I could visit more often.
author: Dawn P.

description:
My friend came here this morning and bought us really awesome treats! 
They were all delicious, creamy, & smooth!
Even though I had just finish my lunch, I still ate 2.5 cream puffs
author: Fiona B.

description: I was so excited to see that there was a Beard Papa in the city. My boyfriend and I were looking for a snack before getting some real food and I had to get a cream puff. It was his first time trying it and he liked it as well. This will probably be a stop that I will need to make every time I come out to the city. I'll probably get extra to take home with me to enjoy at home. Definitely worth a try if you haven't had it before.
author: Jenn D.

description: Well aware of your camera in the restroom/supply room. You k ow what went down and you went inside immediately to squirt it down. Cheers!
author: Silicon W.

description: That refreshing cold burst of cream when you bite into a cream puff gets me every single time. I'm a loyal hoe to the original vanilla cream puff, although the other fillings are equally as delicious.  But sometimes simple does the trick~ Being a hoe for these vanilla puffs, I always find that one is never enough...so don't judge me if you find my fatass devouring a 6-pack of these....while covered in that powder and creamy goodness.
author: Charissa S.

description: The employees here are sooooo RUDE. I loved the branch in Cupertino. We wanted to get some cream puffs. We asked 2 questions about what kind of cream they were, the employee (pic attached)looked at us, annoyed and pointed at the menu on the counter, AWAY FROM WHERE THE ACTUAL PUFFS WERE, genius! He looked at other employees and made ugly faces, they all smirked. HELLO, YOU WERE HIRED TO WORK AND ANSWER QUESTIONS. How do you trust those people to serve you food?! Seriously, we couldn't walk away fast enough. They have ruined the brand for me!
author: Natalie C.

description:
Came here around lunch time- walked by and had to get one! 

Service: The line was short- only one person ahead of us. They fill up the cream puffs with cream when you order it so it's really fresh!

Puffs: I got a strawberry cream puff with matcha cream inside and my friend got matcha on matcha. Both were so good!!! Wow! I liked the strawberry with matcha cream better because I love the flavors together! So bomb. Everything about it.

If you're craving something sweet- this is a must try! :)
author: Hayley D.

description:
I suppose I took for granted all the cream puffs my auntie made throughout my childhood since these things at Beard Papa weren't cheap. I love the selection of flavors and will definitely be back to try the others.

The original weren't as sweet as I was hoping, but once I got rid of that expectation, I thought it was absolutely delicious. Both the cream and the texture of the puffs were just right. The creme brule was also great and gave me a bit more of the sweetness I was craving.

I usually associate mall eateries with overpriced and mediocre foods. But the puffs at Beard Papa were anything but mediocre (maybe a bit pricey though).
author: Albert L.

description:
I am not really a fan of creampuffs. When Beard Papa first came to San Francisco, I did try the vanilla and chocolate cream puffs and yes they were good. And ever since then I hardly ever went back. 

However last Saturday after I had lunch, I  happened to walk by and saw that they had green tea and strawberry cream puffs. I said, "oh my god! They have other flavors now!" Although I was full, I decided what the heck, I might as will buy two and try it out. The strawberry had the best flavor. The green tea was a very mild and wasn't strong enough for my taste and I had both custard inside the cream puff.  I Will keep my eye open for other specialty flavors.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I got the green tea cream puff
Sooo good
Kind of sweet though, I'm not a fan of super sweet things, but the cream puffs here = thumbs up
author: Helen L.

description:
I'm a Beard Papa regular whenever I come to the mall! Or maybe I just come to the mall for Beard Papa... it's definitely for people with a sweet tooth.

I would always always ALWAYS get the VANILLA filling over chocolate - it just tastes better. They fill the puff when you order it so that the puff stays fresh and crunchy. I love that the filling feels slightly colder than the puff, so whenever I bite into it, I get a satisfying combination of crunchy puff and cold, smooth cream.   

Here's what I've tried in order from my most favorite:
1. Chocolate Puff - right balance of chocolate when you get it with vanilla frosting ;) Also really sweet.
2. Honey Butter Puff - extra crispy, kind of like the crust of an Asian brioche/pineapple bun.
3. Matcha Puff - yup. Tastes like matcha. Depending on what cream you get, the cream might taste stronger (so I wouldn't pair this with a fancy cream).
4. Original Puff - if you get this among others, eat it first because it's the most boring... ;) I only get original if I'm just in it for the cream.
author: Sarina C.

description: The creme brûlée cream puff was delicious. You must try this place for an afternoon treat.
author: Bill B.

description:
Their cream puffs are absolutely amazing! Even though I live in the Bay Area, this is only my second time having these, and I haven't been disappointed so far!

I ordered their green tea cream puff (shell was green tea, and the filling was green tea), and it was really great! You have the option of dipping it in chocolate for an additional charge, but I think you don't need that when this green tea creme puff is already sweet, to complement the slight bitter taste of the green tea. It was light, had a bit of a flaky crunch, and was refreshing, especially on a warm/hot day. 

It'll get messy as you eat it, but I think it's all worth getting at around $3 a piece.

If you go on their website, they do have monthly specials, so watch if you're waiting on a specific flavor and love the flavors of Beard Papa. Just note that each location is different, so call ahead of time to see if they even offer it, otherwise the trip will be a waste!
author: Jun-Jun L.

description:
$3.40 for a specialty puff

I got the vanilla filled with chocolate on top (I guess it's called the eclair one). I enjoy cream puffs but I wouldn't say it's my favorite dessert. However this item was very good, the puff part was still crunchy, the filling was just right and had flavor, and the chocolate topping rounded out the puff with the right amount of sweetness. 

I'm pretty sure the other flavors would be just as good.
author: Spencer H.

description:
It definitely would've been better warmed but we were heading out in the cold and rain anyway to catch the bus.

We got the chocolate fondant ($3.75). The cake portion was too chewy, like a super thick and sticky brownie, and the fondant center was good but I wondered why it wasn't ganache or something less ....dense.

(Fondant? Well it was my little boy's choice so whatever).

But the service, oh my God. I think the young lady was having a nervous breakdown for the unnecessary dashing to and fro:

From the register to the back area of the store, quickly speaks with a colleague.

Returns with nothing, dashes away from us again and this time semi-hysterically shouts from several feet away, "do you want it warmed?!" (No)

Dashes back as I point to the vitrine right next to the register, "I just want this one, we're in a really big hurry now."

Dashes to the back of the store, picks up a box, puts it down, grabs a bag, is halfway to the register and turns around, stops. Spins and then in a frantic bid as if it were a lifejacket, grabs a napkin and rushes back to the terminal.

Finally she rings me and I hand her a $10 and grab my change as we dash out of Westfield Center and spot our 21-Hayes at a red light, about to leave... and it does, leaving us in the pouring rain with 29 minutes 'til the next bus.

#^+#}}@*

If Girl, Interrupted hadn't taken 12 minutes to serve 3 customers we wouldn't have had to hike in the pouring rain and high winds up two steep hills whilst praying our soaked paper bag full of Lego sets wouldn't bottom out before we reached our home.

Note to Beard Papa: Keep bags, napkins and small boxes BY the register and NEXT TO the product. 

Forget my missing a bus we shouldn't have: I watched several people walk away who tired of waiting. 

I wish we had.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I've always heard of Beard Papa, but never got the chance to try it. Never did I think that walking in SanFrancisco's Westfield Mall's first floor food court, will I get the opportunity to see Beard Papa alive right before my eyes.

Yes I know, the HYPE IS REAL. I was pretty excited about Beard Papa, thinking it'd be like Uncle Tetsu's, with a very similar marketing image, also relayed over from Japan. 

In short, Beard Papa sells massive cream puffs for $3.40. Ahhhh I know, it's just cream, not ice-cream. If it was ice-cream, I'd probably go haywire and buy a dozen to go! Beard Papa's cream puffs has vanilla, chocolate, strawberry and green tea flavours, where you can choose the flavour of the coating and the inside cream flavour.

We tried the green tea out coating with a vanilla inside. The outside coating is fairly hard - the texture of them reminds me of the filling inside the Koala Bear snacks (not the Panda Bear one's cause those are softer). The pastry itself wasn't anything particularly amazing, just tasted like a normal flakyish texture. Once you bite into the cream puff, the inside gooish cream texture oozes out, but not so much that it's drizzling all over the place! 

This was an okay cream puff for such an expensive price. I think I would like it more if the pastry shell was softer and if they had options for ice cream instead of cream! But, def worth a try!
author: Kristy N.

description:
I LOVE BEARD PAPA!! 

Regular cream puffs are $2.90, and cream puffs with topping (green tea, chocolate, strawberry) were $3.40. There was also a chocolate dipped mochi donut option but cream puffs were the only thing on my mind. You have a choice of three cream fillings: vanilla, chocolate and cherry. 

I got the original with vanilla. The outside was crusty and buttery while the filling was creamy yet light! This is the ultimate comfort food and definitely a go-to if you're ever in Westfield mall!

Definitely lives up to the hype
author: Laura E.

description:
Environment/Service
It's down in the food court! Very fast and efficient.

Food
Beard Papa is known for their cream puffs. I ordered a strawberry cream puff with vanilla filling.  It was the perfect crisp and not too sweet. The only down side is like other reviewers have noted their flavors constantly change.
author: Kristen L.

description: Got a chocolate puff with vanilla custard....when I took it out for my first bite....empty. It was only filled 1/4. So sad!
author: Tiffany L.

description: I love Beard Papa cream puffs. I love it so much I looked up franchising options. It's so so good! It's the perfect amount of sweetness. I prefer Japanese desserts because they don't tend to be overly sweet. The cream puff is also great! My favorite flavor is strawberry.
author: Theresa N.

description: If you like cream puffs and eclairs this is your spot. Good flavors but get there early it runs out sometimes
author: nancy w.

description:
Yummy! Yummy! Little bit expensive...I wish
I go to the city often for me to enjoy more !
Definitely something to look forward !
author: Xena R.

description:
If you woke up craving a Cream Puff then Beard Papa has got you covered! 

They have weekly flavors and then the standard chocolate or vanilla flavors. I'm sure the actual store has more options. So far I've tried vanilla, chocolate, hazelnut and my absolute favorite GREEN TEA. It was all super good. The cookie crumble cream puff is the best because of the crumbly crust on top. 

It's located in the mall so super convenient to take a quick shopping break and satisfy your sweet tooth at the same time.
author: Yinja L.

description: This was a great place to eat. I highly recommend trying the cuisine. Affordable and delicious.
author: Delvin D.

description: Delicious, fresh, crispy, light puff.  Had the chocolate icing with chocolate inside.   Definitely an awesome snack!
author: Bonnie L.

description:
I never heard about Beard Papa before until trying it / seeing it at this location.

It originated in Japan and started to rapidly expand as a franchise business. They offer a variety of eclair / cream puff pastries for about $3 - $4. And they're pretty huge. You can get plain, green tea, chocolate or strawberry coating for your cream puffs and choose green tea, vanilla or chocolate ice cream on the inside.

We decided to get the green tea coated cream puff with vanilla ice cream for $3.40. Keeping it plain and simple. I have to admit that trying it wasn't anything special. When I tasted the green tea coating, I thought it tasted fairly sweet but still pretty outstanding. But once I had it with the dough and the vanilla ice cream on the inside, it was pretty tasty, but wasn't anything super great.

I feel like there are a few reasons it isn't good. First, being in westfield mall the bar for quality of food is lower because you always know you'll get customers. Second, Beard Papa is a franchise with a well-known brand and it's known that business franchises degrade quality. So the one in Japan might still be quite good.

I think it's just an average place with average taste, what's different is they're massive. They still satisfy the sweet tooth though.
author: Christopher L.

description: Beard papa products are what they are anywhere else-- pretty good quality franchise snack. However, this location have failed to give me enough information before going ahead and putting in the order. They didn't ask me what kind of fillings I wanted for the 12 count that I'd bought, instead, it was just all filled with vanilla.... And 12 is a lot of creme puffs, and it is a box set. They didn't tell me the whole price until the very end when I can't change my order, which came out to be more than thought.
author: Jeeyoon P.

description: Was here when they first open and they were busy. My first experience with beard papa was when It was first introduced to SF and it was great experience. So glad they finally came to Fremont area. Service was great and loved the strawberry puff
author: TTrraaccYY H.

description:
I was so glad to be on the West Coast so when I ran into Beard Papa's I was thrilled!! The Beard Papa chain tried to open in Chicago and I think the location did not work out for them because their store was on the lower level of a building without too many other shops so it wasn't happening for them there. 

I love their custard puffs but they were out of the chocolate dipped ones that evening so had the plain one with vanilla custard and oh so scrumptious! I would like to try the Green Tea cream next time.
author: Lisa A.

description: The cream puffs here are refreshing and delectably sweet. It's location in the food court in Westfield is perfect after doing some shopping.
author: Linda V.

description:
I've been craving cream puffs from here for months...they refrigerate them after making them, so you might get a cold cream puff like I did, which makes it a little harder and denser in texture. The green tea filling is super tasty and smoothly creamy, and not too sweet! 

Make sure you grab a napkin, these bad boys get pretty messy once you bite into the filling!

There's almost always a line of about 3-5 people, but it moves quickly. Definitely come here if you're craving cream puffs.
author: Melanie W.

description:
"Basic Beard Papa"

Stopped in for an after brunch treat and got a cookie something or another puff with vanilla. It was decent. They weren't stingy with the cream (think Van Wilder with the pastries...but in an edible way). For the price probably could've gotten a better pastry elsewhere.

Compared to the other beard papas I've been to, this one isn't anything special. I've seen large cakes and other specialty items, but this one just had slices of a few random things. Basic.

Protip: Try out all the different flavors. They seem to change. Ain't never seen that caramel before.
author: Joel L.

description: The creampuff is consistent to other places. I always get the original cream puff with vanilla filing. So creamy and tasty!
author: Nhi D.

description:
Cream puffs are life! 

The strawberry and matcha glazed puffs are new and definitely a must try. 

The custards are rich but not overly sweet. Go with the vanilla. Far superior to the chocolate imo. There's nothing like biting into the light, flaky, slightly crunchy pastry shell coated and getting into the pasty cream. Perfect proportion of cream to shell.

The eclair donut, while Instagram worthy, is flawed by design. There just isn't enough room in the donut for the right cream to pastry ratio. Also the dough was soft (not fresh and crunchy like the shell on the regular puffs). Perhaps low turnover? Do yourself a favor and stick with the puffs.
author: Chris S.

description:
Recently tried it after about two years?

I dont recall the place having the matcha or strawberry then, so I was excited when I saw how pretty the puffs looked with the addition of their new flavors!

Food: Chocolate puff w/ chocolate filling | A+++
I have tried cream puffs that were just too much. Some people would probably think chocolate on chocolate is too much, but it really wasn't! I liked this much better than with the vanilla filling as I found the vanilla a bit too sweet.

Matcha puff w/ vanilla filling | A
I might be biased with my love for chocolate, so I found this one great but would definitely buy the chocolate again more than this.

Customer service: B
Person was helpful, but she didnt seem ecstatic to be there which is understandable after a long day of work

Overall: pricy... Almost $40 for eleven (plus one free) prob why I havent been back. Maybe it's only worth paying for every two years? lol
author: Kaneesia Kamil C.

description: Yum. Yum yum   I got the original cream puff with vanilla filling and the eclair with mango filling.  They were gone in 5 min.  I wish I got more.
author: Bianca B.

description: I've had cream puffs from Beard Papa for over 10 years now. This stuff is good. I've never had a bad experience or bad cream puff. All of them are delicious!
author: Dara S.

description:
Ordered the Vanilla, Chocolate and Green Tea Cream Puffs and later went back for the Cookie Crumble Cream Puff.

The shells are generally pretty fresh and then when you order them they insert the filling that you request. 

Very good and addicting, great for snack or dessert. They are located at various locations in CA and even in Hong Kong  and just have to keep an eye for them.

My favorite is still the Chocolate Creme Puff, can't go wrong with that.

Will certainly be back!
author: Dwayne O.

description:
One of our lovely talents brought us a box of cream puffs last Tuesday, June 28th. Even though it was only around 11:30am and I didn't have lunch yet, I adore Beard Papa's, so I dug in.

I ended up eating an Original Vanilla Flavor in Original Shell. (I believe the other flavor on the box was Dark Chocolate Flavor.) I loved the filling. It was light, but creamy with wonderful vanilla flavor. The shell was a little different than I remember though. It was crispy and a little crumbly on the edges. I prefer the shell a little more chewy, but I still enjoy the puff as a whole.

Great place to grab cream puffs. They also offer seasonal flavors, so be on the lookout. One of my old favorites is strawberry, so hopefully they'll bring that flavor back around soon.
author: Elena N.

description:
So gross!! 

Tried matcha puff with cookies and cream. The puff part was light and crispy, but the matcha frosting was just way too sugary to be called matcha. Probably green food coloring.

The cookies and cream filling was just a sugary disgusting mess. I scooped it all out as much as I could and just tossed it. It was nauseating. 

Don't get the hype about this place. PASS!!!!
author: Angela C.

description: I hadn't been to Beard Papa in FOREVER and today I had a random pang for a cream puff... so DUH, I moseyed on over to the counter of glorious Beard Papa. Okay, the counter itself isn't glorious. It's in a mall food court, so how amazing can it really be? The counter is doing its job. The cream puffs however, are there to cheer you up, make you forget about anything bad in the world, and to overall bring joy to man kind. I got one eclair shell filled with their classic vanilla flavor custard filling and one eclair shell stuffed with their filling of the month, cookies and cream. Before you sit there judging me and my future diabetes, do know that I took them home and shared with my husband, although in hindsight I wish I hadn't. I could totally have taken those bad boys down all by myself. Do yourself a favor and pop into one of the Beard Papa locations sometime soon and get a couple puffs to-go... I super promise you that your happiness meter will go up quite a few levels.
author: Liz M.

description:
I always come here every time I come to visit SF without a doubt. 
I get some to eat right when I  get there and some more to bring home. 

It's these light, fluffy, and decadent cream puffs with different flavor fillings inside. 
Their usual is either is chocolate or vanilla and then they have a new flavor of the week. 

I like the vanilla better than the chocolate personally, but this week's flavor of the week was cookies and cream and it was my first time trying that one. I think so far that it's my favorite! 

These serve so well as a snack or as a dessert. I wish we had these back home in TX.
author: Gloria C.

description: Today was my second time at Beard Papa. It wasn't as busy as the first time I went so my friend and I were pretty much helped immediately. The staff is friendly and quick. We were there for maybe less than 10 minutes. I highly recommend the green tea puff with vanilla filling. It's so goooood. When you are craving creme puffs, definitely try Beard Papa. You will not regret it.
author: Misty T.

description: Bordering on 4 stars. I still love this place but I'm sad to see they increased their prices! It now cost $3.20 for the original and $3.50 for the fancier ones. They also sell some other pastry selections now, though the main focus are still creme puffs. Ahh, I'm so sad at the price increase! A box of half dozens now cost close to $20. Its a dollar off half a dozen and $3 off a dozen.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Such good cream puffs!!! Ordered the chocolate and green tea cream puffs with vanilla filling and loved every second of it.

Will definitely be coming back here!
author: James D.

description:
How did a 4 star Beard Papa turn into 1 star?  Beard Papa is mediocre nuisance lately.  What was fresh and tasty has plummeted.  Customer service is not accommodating.   Black dots in the filling and a stale puff pastry.  The line has died.
