author: Anonymous T.

description:
What's not to love about Beard Papa? Cream Puffs and Eclairs!  Woohoo!
I first tried Beard Papa over 10 years ago when vacationing in the Philippines.  My sister and I were strolling through the Glorietta Mall in Makati, and she pointed out that there was a Beard Papa in the Philippines.

Several years, and several cream puffs and eclairs later, it turns out that Beard Papa is only a few blocks from where I work.  I walked by the stand, trying to kill a few hours, and I was tempted by the flavor of the week, Green Tea.

The prices have gone up a bit, $2.90 for a cream puff, $3.50 for an éclair.  But the green tea filling was slightly bitter (as green tea should be) but also rich, creamy, and refreshing - an absolutely perfect treat on the first day San Francisco hit 65 degrees this calendar year.  

There may have also been a dash of green tea powder along with the regular confectioner's sugar sitting atop by cream puff.  The staff at this location (Filipino guy) was exceedingly friendly.

Funnily enough, the wifey calls me a few hours after I've enjoyed my cream puff, and asks me to bring her an éclair from Beard Papa.  We never talk about this place, nor does she have a sweet tooth.  

Needless to say, she and I are truly soul mates, and my cream puff was quite serendipitous.
author: David D.

description:
I love their cream puffs. It's crunchy outside and creamy inside. They taste so goooood-!

When I have sweet tooth walking around inside this mall I always go there-!
author: Jang R.

description: Never dissapointed!! Fresh and delicious! Their basic cream puff plain, chocolate or green tea is great. Want to try their honey one next!!
author: Jan-marie V.

description:
finally got a chance to try these cream puffs and boy they did not disappoint 
custard cream cheese mini cakes - dense and not too sweet just the way I like it - when it comes to cheese cake I like a very small portion and these hit the spot 
also got the reg./orig. vanilla cream puff (delish!), the honey & butter with vanilla cream (yum-mo pastry) but by far my fav is the creme brûlée cream puff (swoon)
author: Mia C.

description: I love the mango cream puffs! However, it's easy to get my face dirty when eating it. When I bite the puff, the cream went everywhere! The restaurant needs to find some good ways to allow the customers eat happily with a clean face. Btw, We had green tea cream in its Shanghai brunch and I hope I can find this flavor at here too.
author: Minzhi Y.

description:
This place is a must try for its deeelicious cream puffs

My order:  Vanilla Cream Puff

Pros: flaky puff with creamy filling, not too sweet and a great mid afternoon snack/dessert

Cons: they have limited flavors that change each week
author: Mary-Ann F.

description: I have nothing to against the food there, but super super bad customer service at this location!!!!! The  guy who wears a hat all the time is very very mean!!!! I was trying to order six pieces for one box. I said I want two of each puffs which with toppings, and I pointed three flavors on the picture (strawberry, green tea and chocolate topping). Then the guy asked me what filling do I want. He said vanilla and chocolate are available. Then I told him to give me three of each fillings. That's total of six pieces. It's a very clear instruction. I was just following his questions to provide the answers. Then this crazy dude started to lecture me saying I confused him. Just keep going and going non stop!!! Oh my gosh!!! I'm spending money here and I have to listen to this dude to lecture me! I asked him what's his name? He didn't want to give his name, and he was trying to run away. He gave me a middle finger at the end and told me to go away. Such a horrible person! He doesn't deserve to work there! He doesn't know how to do customer service and doesn't know how to respect people!  I don't know if the owner of this location read yelp reviews??? If the owner does, the person shouldn't be there anymore! I attached a picture of this guy. You can see his middle finger is up!!!!! When you go to this location, watch out for this crazy guy! So lack of education!!!!!
author: Vanessa L.

description: Nothing could be better then these creamy , flaky bits of heaven. I just recently tried the American cherry pie flavor and it was wonderful. The ingredients are all fresh and sweet. These puffs are so addicting, They are also baked from scratch daily. I just bought me a whole bag full.
author: Luke S.

description: A little messy...but a lot of tasty!! Caramel coated and vanilla filled! Can't wait to go back.
author: Marc K.

description:
Review for cream puff with vanilla cream and chocolate icing.

The chocolate icing was very good, the vanilla cream inside was very good, the pastry was hard and tasteless. 
The cream puff shell fell apart and I used it as a pastry shovel to eat the cream with-and this is really messy to eat on the run. 

In a review here, someone mentions the counter-person asked if she wanted the cream puff warmed.
That would improve the texture of the shell a lot. I didn't get that offer, but I'll ask for it next time.

Find a spoon if you eat it out of the bag because a lot of cream falls out.

Bottles of water are $1+ here, unlike Beard Papa's neighbor Ghirardelli, where the same size water is $3+.
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description: Went in today to grab some cream puffs and I have to say that every single time we grab some it's always great, but the staff there seems to be all over the place. They seemed very standoff-ish and even when there wasn't a line I felt like I was being rushed.
author: Helga L.

description: Tbh.. It was LIT. I normally don't like sweet stuff but this man... Wow. I went for the Green Tea with Chocolate filling which was 3.5$. I expected the filling to be super sweet but it wasn't. Idc about how many calories that thing was because it tasted good. Btw guys they only accept cash. Give it a try tho.
author: Duy-Nam B.

description: The menu on this page is very misleading, they only serve cream puffs. Yes you can get vanilla, chocolate, caramel, and green tea frosting...but your only option is a cream puff and an average one at that. Enough said
author: Ciera C.

description:
Are you in a hurry? Do you love cream puffs? Are you debating whether to buy one or a dozen? 

Fear not! For I am here to help you in your time of need. First, I would like to ask for all those who do not like cream puffs to please exit the facility, thank you. Secondly, I would like to welcome all cream puff lovers to this paradise of creamy puffs! Finally, I would like to say that cream puffs are life! 

Now to get down to business. Needless to say that cream puffs and eclairs are amazing, whether it be for breakfast, lunch, dinner, midnight snack, or even a togo snack. There is nothing better to satisfy a creamy custard craving. For me personally I cannot bare to just buy one, I always have to buy 2. One to eat right away and another for a midnight snack. 

Overall, it is definitely worth the extra few mile run the next day just to grab a bite of pure bliss.
author: Benson M.

description: When I'm here, I like to order their vanilla cream puff for $2.90. It's good, 'nuff said.
author: Alice X.

description: Very interesting take on cream puffs. The crusty exteriors gives way to a perfectly chilled interior delight.
author: Austin C.

description:
Cream puffs are a great dessert option when you've just had a heavy meal. The pâte à choux pastry is so light, and the cream, be it vanilla, chocolate or green tea flavored, adds the sweetness and silky texture to this dessert.  Beard Papa makes delicious cream puffs! I almost always buy a puff or two for me and the hubby whenever we're in downtown SF.

The hubby always gets the chocolate filled one and I'll get the green tea flavor if it's available. Each puff is $2.50 and is generously filled with cream.  Make sure you eat it away from your body or else you will have a dollop of cream adorn your top, whether or not you like it. Happens to me all the time!  Oozing cream is a hazard worth risking for this dessert! 

I've had the strawberry cream puffs and they were very good too. I'd like to see pistachio cream puffs as a flavor.  Coffee cream puffs sound good too! I'd like to see more variety in their flavors!
author: Hazel C.

description:
A dependable choice if you want to hit the cream puff craving, otherwise, avoid.
I always avoid this when I come to the mall, but I had a hankering and went a little over two hours before closing. They had run out of vanilla filling. I'm sorry, as delicious as chocolate and your monthly cookies and cream filling were, some people like the classic vanilla. That was definitely a let down service wise. There's nothing notable, good or bad about here. It's there.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Mmmmmmm.... so delicious.
I've only ordered the cream puffs from here but let me just say they are delicious. Seriously.
I usually get the chocolate topped cream puff with chocolate filling. 

The outside has a nice crunch to it, the chocolate on top is nice and creamy and the chocolate filling is like a custard. I also like that the chocolate filling isnt overly sweet or overly powerful so when you take a bite all the sweet, yummy flavors really come together.
author: Xochitl T.

description:
As it turns out, I've been here a couple of times. I didn't remember the first trip (for better or for worse) so on a recent trip to SF I stopped in and it all came back to me.

The name of the game is cream puffs, which have caught on in certain circles and, while are always nice, are perhaps not known for being "the favorite" treat of too many people. 

Cream puffs are the game, and they keep it simple. Pick your puff, pick your filling, and they'll pump it right there in front of you. It's not terribly cheap, but it's a luxury buy. The surroundings belie the "luxury" nature of a cream puff, however, as this spot isn't cutesy or fancy or... anything really distinctive. With a name like Beard Papa you would expect something hipster or old school or... I dunno. But you can't really pin it into any one vibe. 

I actually enjoy that the stuff here isn't cloyingly sweet, however I do think it could stand to have more flavor. I went with the basics--not chocolate or pumpkin--just the regular custard filling and the regular shell. Maybe you get all crazy and it gets tastier? I dunno. It was plain, and I think that's probably okay, but maybe a little more flavor without getting to sweet is in order.

For bonus points, it's kinda fun to chomp a little and lick the filling. Like an Oreo, only much more refined.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Creme brûlée tasted very good, a bit runny.  But a lot of filling, which I love.  Not too sweet.  I would like to try other varieties, but did not want to fill up on dessert.
author: Stella S.

description: I love their matcha dipped cream puffs! they're huge and they haven't changed since I was a kid. I'm so glad that i found one while i was on my trip here.
author: Deanelle M.

description: I came here for a cream puff after a classmate raved about them. Best decision EVER. The cream puffs were fresh and delicious. I had about three and enjoyed every one. The staff was nice and the service was fast. It was delicious and worth every penny.
author: Brianna L.

description: Great dessert and snack location if your in the area. We ordered the original and cookie crust with vanilla. Both delicious! You get that nice light pastry with creamy cool filling on the inside. I like how the puffs are pretty large and they put a heavy amount of filling into them. Seating can be tight inside, but there is a park about a block away. I'll be back to try their other puffs and desserts.
author: Khoi N.

description: We ordered the green tea, chocolate and original with vanilla cream. I really enjoyed the green tea. Hubby likes the chocolate and baby girl fav is the original. Perfect treat while downtown. Pretty pricey $3.20 + per each one . Buy 6-$1 , but 12 -$3.
author: Ka'Neki M.

description: Nothing to really mention. I went on a Saturday afternoon with a sweet tooth. They were out of all pastry shell options except for three: original, honey butter, and matcha. They tasted old and stale. The filling was flavorless in my opinion. Both me and the friend i went with felt that our favorite part was that the filling was cold. I was truly disappointed.
author: Madison M.

description:
THEIR CREAM PUFFS ARE AMMAAAZINNG!! 
Don't hesitate on getting one, two, or even a box! 
Always fresh and creamy. Huge puffs!
Flavors this week are chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry. Strawberry is delicious! It has little bits of strawberry in it too! 
Decent price, long lines, but it's worth it!
Not too sweet, but enough to keep you and your kids happy!
author: Lianne W.

description:
After getting into town I was looking forward to getting a sweet bite to eat. We walked over from our hotel. It was a little difficult to find since it was inside the mall and downstairs. 

The cream puffs seemed that they were made well but I thought they were just mediocre. They had a good crunch yet still light and puffy. The problem was they didn't have a taste. I ordered the vanilla and it pretty much tasted like air. 

The guy behind the counter was not very friendly. He was borderline rude. 

Overall it wasn't a bad experience but I don't think I would go back.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Ordered one eclair puff with vanilla filling and one cream puff with green tea filling. Received two plain cream puffs.

Since the eclair puff costed more, we went back to get it corrected. One of the kids gave us a free eclair puff with vanilla filling.

We cut our plain cream puffs and one had chocolate filling rather than green tea filling. 

Where is the manager? Three kids working with no supervision. Got 2/3 of our order wrong.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
I walked into this cafe by accident, I was looking for a bite to eat but found something even better!!

I never heard of this place until I came to the San Fran area and I wish we still had one of these here in Las Vegas! I recommend the original Vanilla Cream puff if this is your first time coming to the shop. 10/10 coming back to this place when I visit San Fran soon enough!!
author: Kimberly R.

description:
When you're on vacation you are allowed to eat a cream puff for breakfast :) And wow, it'll be probably be the best breakfast you've ever had. 

Cute place with a friendly staff. You pick out which puff you want (regular, chocolate or eclair) and then they fill it with the custard cream of your choice. I went with the eclair with vanilla filling and it was incredible. The pastry was light and crispy and the filling creamy and not too sweet. I also sampled the mango filling (flavor of the day) and guess what I'm having for dinner :) Definitely worth the extra gym time!!
author: Vaish P.

description:
I pretty much come to Beard Papa every time I'm shopping at Westfield.

I love cream puffs.  Beard Papa has pretty big ones that have light and airy cream filling that isn't overwhelmingly sweet.  They have vanilla and chocolate everyday, both are tasty.  They also have a weekly special as well.  I have tried: strawberry, green tea, and mango.  They are all yummy as well, strawberry and mango have tiny fruit bits (kinda like the ones on yogurt) as well.  I just wish they had a few more flavors at a time, and it would be so so good if the puffs were fresh and warm.  That would make beard papa literally irresistible!!!
author: Nina W.

description: I really like the bread here. I like the cream here the best out of the other ones. I really like the guys who works here, his really funny and nice.
author: Robert L.

description:
This Beard Papa is located in the Westfield Shopping Mall in the food court. When you see the cute old man logo, you'll know you've reached heaven. I make it a point to be sure to stop by Beard Papa whenever I'm around Westfield; I simply cannot let the opportunity pass.

~ Variety:

You have the classic vanilla and chocolate flavours, but they have plenty of seasonal flavours as well. To be honest, I still go with a classic vanilla because it was what I initially fell in love with. The cream inside is creepy, delicious, and not too sweet either.

The pastry is okay, but I mainly see the pastry more as the custard delivery system than anything else. Still, the puff complements the filling really well. Even my grandma likes it, and she's extremely picky when it comes to food.

---

Beard Papa is something anyone can enjoy, sweet tooth or not. Some say it's overpriced, but I don't mind given that I don't come here that often anyway. It's well worth the price to treat yourself to something delicious from Beard Papa every now and again.
author: Clarissa Y.

description: Yummy and giant cream puffs!! Felt like a little girl in a candy store!! Best cream puffs!!
author: Gaby M.

description: Pretty great vanilla cream puff. Worth stopping by if you're at the mall. Definitely better quality and taste than your average food court stand, so don't be confused by the setting!
author: Ana M.

description: These creme puffs are mighty delicious and not overly sweet. I got the green tea with green tea. I wanted to order a half dozen but realized that it would be a mistake because I wouldn't be able to stop eating them.
author: W A.

description: A mandatory stop whenever I'm near this location inside San Francisco. I love getting the various styles of creampuffs here with different fillings and different icing and taking them to the movie theater over at the Metreon so I can eat creampuffs as I enjoy the film.
author: John S.

description:
Since when did Fisherman begin making and selling desserts?

Maybe it's because I work in Marketing, but the logo always trips me out. I feel like I should be buying smoked salmon and not dainty cream puffs.

Personally, I only like the cream puffs when they're fresh out of the oven, and the cream inside is cold. Most of the time what I get is a cold puff with lukewarm filling.

And the sugar dusting on the top always makes me cough. I feel like I'm inhaling cocaine or something every time I forget to tell them NOT to put that white powder stuff on the puff.

I've tried their green tea, chocolate, and coffee, but I still prefer the original.

I'm basically over the whole cream puff thing. I'd rather have ice-cream at Ghiradelli's, but since my friends like them, well, it's close to Valentine's day, so what the hell, I'll buy a box.

Somebody's going to be happy on cupid's holiday darn it. 

So the 4 stars is for the joy that it brings to others...I guess Beard Papa is like Santa.
Well, at least he looks like a Fisherman Santa Claus anyways....
author: Jack R.

description: Here at Beard Papa's at 8:36pm and they're closing. If you're advertised to 9pm, you should stay open until then. My friend also called 15 mins before this and they said they're closing. We didn't believe it because who the heck closes at 8:15pm when their public hours state 9pm. And the girl was rude. Never coming here again.
author: Nancy L.

description: You don't see these in the Midwest. Light fluffy pastry with super creamy custard filling. The trick is that they fill the pastry just before serving. A Japanese dessert chain that is primarily on the West Coast (California). It's pretty much all they do, so they have to do it right. Some of the locations will have a flavor of the day. Try the puffs filled with mango custard, if they have it!
author: Rick L.

description: What should I say??? Damn the  cashier !!!! If you dont welcome your customers why you have to open your business here!!!! Will that be better if you just give me a welcoming smiling face ???? Tooo bad!!!!  You did not have that on your face when I came!!!! Disappointing :(  Give you 3 stars just because I like your bread!!!! Obviously your service does not worth any of my stars :)))
author: Chiem E.

description:
Actual rating 4.5, will update as I try more flavors.

Their claim to fame (if it wasn't obvious from 800+ reviews each from here and the other location) are their world-famous cream puffs. The cream puffs have 2 layers: outer layer of crisp pie crust and inner layer of soft French choux (typical cream puff pastry). This is why a puff pastry the size of a typical donut can hold its shape. The origin of this chain is in Osaka, Japan and there are a bunch of locations all around Japan but upon inquiring the No1DP never heard of this chain. He now knows another place to take me when I visit him in Japan.

As I already ate I only had an opportunity to try one flavor. I tried their cookie crunch puff, which adds a third outer layer of crunchy cookie dough. Fillings available were vanilla or chocolate, I chose vanilla.

-You can see your cream puff put together. There's a machine that inserts filling inside the cream puff. There was a small hole you can see where the insertion took place.
-Cream puff had a slightly crunchy top yet soft bottom and for how big it was cream puff was stable.
-Good portion of filling and cream puff.
-Filling tasted excellent, vanilla custard done right. More dominant flavor was custard but there was quite a bit of vanilla flavor.

Only con is that there used to be a branch in SD but it closed. This will soon be a moot point because I'll be moving to the Bay Area in a couple of weeks, which means I'll have an excuse to BART to SF and try more.
author: Isabella B.

description:
4 stars since it's conveniently located in the Food Emporium of Westfield. Not the freshest cream puffs, but pretty good for $2.50!

Service was prompt, but friendly enough. Order and pay on one end of the counter, and move down the counter to receive your order. A great snack to grab if you're shopping around the area!
author: Kristi T.

description: We finally found this place... the verdict?  I liked the pastry and while the filling was not too sweet (we got coffee) it was runny and pretty bland.  We should have gotten chocolate on top and perhaps a different filling.  Did I woof the thing down? You bet.
author: Katherine F.

description:
I've never been to the one closer to my home base. Today as we were crossing the street I spied one right across! 

To make the story short my Bead Papa noob status was changed to first timer today!

The puffs that we ordered in a set of six were little heavens in a box! Oh my! What on earth?! Chocolate, mango, etc! Can't make up my mind! So two of each please! 

Light, puffy and oh so to die for! 

Fast order. Courteous customer service and we're off to fill our belly! Two tables, a few chairs and a long bench to share and that's it! Most people take their guilty pleasures to go.
author: Janet D.

description:
Small little shop, many locations in the city.  I had the Cookie Crunch Puff with Caramel. Highly recommended.  It's all described in the name  Nicely crunchy from the cookie on the outside, still retains the puff pastry shell texture underneath, and the caramel filling wasn't too sweet.  Also tried the regular puff and that was also quite good.  I wouldn't hesitate to go.

Oh yeah, we really wanted the Green Tea, but there's only one flavor of the day.  Luck of the draw it was caramel that day.
author: Duy N.

description:
A very good cream puff and the price is good.

I shared the vanilla and some other flavor.

Cant really go wrong here.
author: Steven W.

description: Today I come to the Westfield Mall with my bf, we have a long time not being shopping together, I was so happy for that! Later on , I feel hungry, and decided to eat the Bread Papa's , when we was ordering, I wanted to eat the green tea puff, and the vanilla ,but then the cashier was yelling to explaining about which favorite would like us to pick ! Even though was the first words she said ! Loud and like didn't want to service us ! I just want to eat a puff ! That is ! PEACE AND QUIET! But her service was really really bad! Yelling to the customers! I was so disappointed about this service!
author: Vivian W.

description: Says they're closed at nine and came by at 830. They told my friend that they were done and we rushed all the way through traffic from Sonoma County for nothing.
author: Oscar L.

description: This Beard Papa's is located in the food court at Westfield Centre. Creams puffs are one of my favorite desserts. I decided to check out this dessert spot while shopping at the mall. I ordered a cookie crunch cream puff with vanilla cream and a cheesecake stick. Beard Papa's cream puff was tasty. The vanilla cream filling was very flavorful. I thought the cookie crunch shell could have been softer on the bottom. I did like the crunch on top. There are different flavors each day. Mango was the special flavor during my visit but it wasn't available. Popular flavors sell out very fast. Beard Papa's cheesecake sticks are delicious. It's the perfect dessert snack. The cheesecake filling and crust was a perfect blend. I could have eaten cheesecake sticks all day. The employees were polite. Prices were reasonable. Beard Papa's is good choice for cream puffs and cheesecake sticks.
author: Dominic B.

description:
When I was in high school, my mom used to bring me here as a treat for special occasions because we both loved BP so much. 

The cream is always cool, fresh, and delicious, and the puff is always the perfect crispness. Both vanilla and chocolate are great, and I've never tried a rotating flavor that I didn't like.

After a 2-year hiatus from BP, I brought my friend here to share one for his first visit, and he had to buy another one afterwards!
author: Emily C.

description:
After lunch, we decided to go for some sweets! Beard Papa is an international Japanese bakery known for their delicious cream puffs. As simple as they may seem, they are bursting in delicious, flavorful cream within...

The delicious cream just oozes with goodness...On first bite, you get this cookie crunch on the outside, then the cold, sweet vanilla cream explodes in your mouth. It really is that delicious!

I want to try the Green Tea and Honey Cream Puff, but it wasn't available that day. Don't worry Beard Papa. I'll be back for those clouds of heavenliness!
author: Leslie L.

description:
I'm giving this place 5 stars because it's the only choux puff pastry with cream place I know of (specially a place that specializes in only that). The name is whimsical which quite honestly is important to me. Something about their bearded papa mascot that makes the idea of a cute little puff pastry more "awwww." 

They offer vanilla, mango and chocolate cream in their puff pastries and they give you cute to go boxes that remind me of the build a bear box. The pastries itself can get messy to eat but that doesn't take away from their yumminess. The pastry and cream both aren't too sweet or heavy thereby making it easy to eat more than one.
author: Brenda L.

description: I decided to try this today since I heard so many talks about their pastries here and there. My friend recommended the cream puffs and you get to pick the filling you want inside. I went with the strawberry filling and for one cream puff was $2.90 which wasn't bad. I got mines in under a minute and right off the bat I noticed it was very thin layered. Like the pastry itself didn't have much dough but the filling was way too much. Every bite/pinch I took, the filling was over flowing and the filling itself wasn't very good. It wasn't the strawberry cream filling I was expecting but overall I'd prefer a plain cream puff or maybe I'd try other flavors. Just way too much filling for a small pastry. Definitely would get it again though whenever.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Not right how good this was. Had Beard Papa in Vancouver and this beat Van's ass!
Super good, eclair with vanilla filling. All FRESH, super Gooey AND do not try walking and eating this mountain of delish, you'll probably drop it and cry or get it all over yourself and wish you had 10 more.
author: Mira T.

description:
Best choux à la crème I've had in the states.  

I recommend you try the the mango puffs because it's the best mango flavor I've had, from any Asian mango desserts I've ever tried, beside an authentic Thai mango sticky rice.

Give this place a try, you won't regret it.
author: Amine M.

description: For some reason with all the hype of this place, I didn't find the puffs very different or very good. It's just a pastry with a filling  resembling of whip cream. I didn't like the taste due to it being too greasy in my mouth. I certainly wouldn't get it again for the price they were selling them.
author: Alice S.

description:
LOCATION
inside the Westfield shopping center, is on the bottom floor in the Emporium , right under the escalators. This is a small location and I just come when I want to get a box of cream puffs. 

CREAM PUFFS
BEST cream puffs I've ever had. The vanilla and chocolate are constant and always delicious. They also have a featured flavor and I got a mango filling to try. The mango is also incredible but it won't stay. 

ECLAIR with VANILLA FILLING
This was just OK compared to the fluffy cream puffs.
author: Debby L.

description: Sooooooooo good and so fast! My favorite is the original puff with chocolate filling. The service is very fast too and friendly. Definitely a must try!
author: Olivia S.

description:
Cream puffs here are always consistently good. If you're a student at SFSU, then always mention that and you'll get a discount.

Keep in mind that eclairs (chocolate covered puffs) and cookie crusted puffs cost more than the regular puff.
author: Sofia R.

description:
A moment on your lips is forever on your hips!


I had the chocolate eclair and he had the strawberry cream puff. Just under $6, these two played beautifully in tandem with light, flaky and sweet flavors and textures. I am happy and scared that this place is down the street where I work.
author: Ryan K.

description: Really nice cream puff. Cushier is nice and fast. No waiting time. Definitely need to try.
author: Josh Y.

description: I love Beard Papa's regardless of where it is. This one is located in the Westfield Mall on the basement level where some of the food is. It's actually situated under the escalators. They have a lot of different filling flavors. Love the vanilla. The puff itself is large and soft. It's kind of messy to eat and your fingers will get sticky, but it's worth it. It's a perfect late afternoon snack!
author: James W.

description:
I've been to a Beard Papa's in Seattle before, so I was really happy to see one here in San Francisco as well!  This is located in the lower level in the Westfield Mall. 

Their cream puffs are delicious.  They make for a nice snack especially since the custard inside is cold.  You can get vanilla, chocolate, or strawberry filling depending on availability.  I think they have other flavors too like green tea but I'm not too sure.  Each puff by itself is $2.50 but if you buy more they are a bit cheaper by the unit.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Haven't had these creamy lovelies in a couple years, so I decided this was going to be our first stop for our mini Sunday food tour :) I didn't realize the Yerba Buena location was on the way to the mall, or we would have went to that location. The mall guys were nice, but pretty much mute the rest of the time. They looked bored and wanted to be somewhere else. Well, guess I can't blame them. Who wants to work on a Sunday right? But...I digress. Back to the cream puffs.

I ordered a six pack (2 vanilla, 2 chocolate, 1 strawberry, 1 cookie crunch w/vanilla). Sister and I shared a vanilla puff while sitting outside the Metreon. The pastry was nice and light, the cream plentiful and not too sweet. I love that they don't fill the puff until you order it. 
 
We only sampled one while we were there, and we took the rest of them home. They felt a little soggy, but they were still delicious after the long 2 hour drive home. The chocolate puff had a nice light chocolate taste, and the strawberry puff tasted like whipped strawberry cream. All SO good.

Wish we had a BP in Sac. Maybe it's good that we don't....I would be in danger of becoming a VIP there. Ha.
author: Mel L.

description: I cannot resist cream puffs, or cheesecakes, or macarons. I admit it. I have a sweet tooth. So when I saw Beard Papa's at SF Centre, could I resist the lure of a good cream puff? Nope, not at all. After contemplating what I wanted, I decided to order the cookie crunch with green tea filling. I was actually a little disappointed with the cookie crunch because I felt that they over baked the pastry. I know the cookie crunch is supposed to be crispy on the outside, but I felt that it was harder and drier than it should be. However, I loved the green tea filling. I felt that it was slightly sweet and creamy and the green tea flavor was strong. So if you're a green tea fan, this is the filling that you want to get. I'll come back for cream puffs another day, only because I've had cream puffs here before and I know they're good. Today might have just been an off day.
author: Andrea G.

description: Completely stuffed with vanilla scented cream, the Beard Papa cream puff will not disappoint. I was expecting a little corner of cream, but that's not how they roll. You will be hard pressed to avoid getting it on your fingers and the table. Magnificent. Well done Beard Papa. Your cheap light flaky crust holding a sea of cream is as great as their name.
author: Marc M.

description:
I had 2 friends visiting me from San Fran and of course I had to ask them to bring me some of these amazing cream puffs everyone in SF talks about. I didn't know what flavors to ask for so I just asked them to bring me vanilla. Luckily they brought me vanilla and strawberry.

vanilla cream puff- it was kind of ok. The cream inside was on the thinner side and I prefer it thicker. And the the pastry part was little bit more dry than I like. It was good, but I've definitely had better. If this was the only flavor they brought me, I would be very disappointed! 

strawberry cream puff- this was definitely the business! I'm so glad they brought me this flavor because if I only tried the vanilla, beard papa would definitely be getting a 2 star rating from me! I love the consistency of the strawberry cream. Everything about it was like Breyer's strawberry ice cream- the texture, the taste, and even the little bits of strawberry mixed in. The only difference is it can sruvive being in room temperature! I like this but I don't know if I liked it enough to crave it.
author: Ramil B.

description:
Great vanilla bean cream puff. Nice texture and the pastry cream was not too sweet.  Perfect treat for a bad day. The only complaint is that they had one employee working and she wasn't listenning. Told her that I wanted the vanilla bean COCO puff twice but she still gave me the regular puff. 

Over all, if you're looking for good cream puff at the mall then choose this over Pacific Puffs. I don't like Pacific Puffs in the least bit.
author: Tien H.

description: The food is great, the service is not.  I have ordered from Beard Papa on several occasions for corporate events and I have to say I have never had such a difficult time with a vendor.  On numerous occasions the staff has been so rude that I have had to contact the corporate office to place my order on behalf of the store.  If this was not a company favorite, I would not have wasted my time.  Now that they have discontinued delivery service I will be taking my business elsewhere.
author: Jessica M.

description:
The perfect place for a quick chocolate/sugar/pastry fix while shopping inside Westfield. I've been a fan of Beard Papa's since they first opened up 4 years ago. 

My favorites are the chocolate and strawberry cream puffs and the greenbean is pretty good as well. I've just never been a Vanilla person... Get the CheeseCake Sticks as well !! 

There's a short wait to order and get your treats if it's a busy busy day (like Christmas Season) but usually by the time you're done paying, your order will be ready. You can watch them fill the cream puffs so you know its fresh!

- jenn
author: Jenn Y.

description: It is located near Union Square. A friend highly recommended the restaurant. The environment is nice and the waiters are so kind. We ordered classic vanilla puffs and chocolate puffs. The classic vanilla puffs are not too sweet. I love them. But the chocolate puffs are too sweet.
author: Nancy S.

description: Enjoyed the cream puffs and cheese sticks. Everything is made fresh and in front of you. The staff was wonderful and gave us the history on the Japanese origin.  The coffee was very strong but the flavor was bold and rich. We put some of the cream puff filler inside and it tasted amazing.
author: Anne J.

description: Our family had the biggest craving for cheesecake sticks and we were saddened to find out beard papa's no longer offers them.  If you are a cheesecake stick lover please let them know.  Everyone I tell is so disappointed and plans to not visit again as this was their only reason to go.
author: Kevin P.

description: The cream puffs are so light and fluffy but I can only eat one!  I'm not much for sweets but since we were at the San Francisco Centre food court, we had to stop by and have some!
author: Karen W.

description: This review is solely based on time. Yelp said that this Beard Papa's doesn't close till 10PM. We got there around 8:30PM and they were already closing up!
author: Carlin T.

description: YUM!!!! amazing pastries and they were HUGE!! The line isn't too bad and they have flavors such as chocolate, vanilla, and MANGO!!! Okay, the mango was sorta weird as a flavor with the creme puffs, but worth trying. I think the pastries there are worth trying and as good as pacific puffs.
author: Lily P.

description: Best. Cream. Puff. Period.
author: Julie C.

description: I love their vanilla cream puffs :) this place is always on my list when I come out to the bay because it's so good !
author: Maybeline C.

description:
In the true slow-on-the-uptake fashion where I tend to dwell, finally got around to trying out Beard Papa's

Verdict?  Meh - it's a crunchy profiterole that spills powdered sugar all over you & dribbles creamy gloops, as it squishes the custard everywhere upon each bite.  Tasted okay but not something I'd crave

I chose 2 to get a nice overview & as I'm a now n' later kind of girl, 2 was the only appropriate choice

Vanilla - this was like a nice, slightly sweet custard filling & I imagine it would be better in their "eclair" puff

Chocolate - light & whipped.  Didn't care for it as much as the vanilla

Best tip:  Be sure to eat this while leaning over something, away from yourself.  Totally got chocolate powder ALL over my black raincoat.  Completely embarrassing as I'm standing there in the Caltrain lobby looking like the total glutton I am.....'cause that stuff doesn't brush off, it SMEARS
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I found out my grandfather had passed away and was lying in my bedroom trying to make sense of it all. 

My husband came in and said: "Ive brought you home a treat". 

He had gone to Beard Papa's and picked out an assortment of cream puffs. I wasn't really hungry but he had me try one. For a moment I was able to enjoy something and smile. 

These are amazing treats and needless to say I am a fan. 

Thank you for bringing a little comfort in a dark time.
author: D. S.

description: I was so looking forward to trying these cream puffs as I've heard rave reviews. However, they were just ok. Not at all what I had hoped they would be. Not horrible, but certainly not worth the hype. Maybe it differs by location? They just didn't seem very fresh. The vanilla cream filling was good but not at all outstanding. Oh well, I'm still glad I got to try them.
author: S. S.

description: Most amazing cream puffs and eclairs! And how awesome is it that you can choose your own fillings. One is just not enough. Service is great, and quick.
author: Jenn K.

description: Good but disappointing. I like their cream puffs but they are consistently out of vanilla cream filling. The last 5 times I've visited, they've either had only cookies and cream or chocolate filling. Seems like they need to plan better...
author: Russ G.

description:
Delicious cream puffs. Go for the chocolate with crunch puff or eclair chocolate puff with vanilla. Their eclairs are really fresh here compared to another location in the southbay. 

If your lucky they have special flavors such as green tea which is the best!
author: Darryl S.

description: My first time trying Beard Papa's! I was super excited when I approached the counter to order my first cream puff, and the guy working the cashier recommended the vanilla one. By the time I paid him, the other guy working handed me the cream puff. WOW talk about efficient and stellar service! Oh and the cream puff was freaking fresh and delicious. Glad I finally got to try it.
author: Stefanie C.

description: So, still trying to figure out where the name came from but I suppose that doesn't really matter because the cream puffs were delicious! We got 3: an eclair (cream puff topped with chocolate) filled with vanilla custard, eclair filled with caramel custard, and chocopuff filled with chocolate custard. My favorite was the eclair with vanilla. So simple yet delicately perfect.
author: Ashley P.

description:
Ok, now I see where there are sooo many reviews for The Bearded Papa.  I'm not a huge fan of custard, but once I saw the line for these little puff pastries I figured I'd give it a try. 

We shared an original cream puff with vanilla filling. These are incredibly fresh that they don't even fill them until your order is placed.

I have to say the warm cream puff with the cool center made for an incredibly flavorful event in my mouth.  

I'm just glad we don't have The Bearded Papa in Tampa because I'm sure I'd gain a few extra pounds.
author: Kelleigh M.

description:
VANILLA CREAM PUFF!  

I love everything about it.  The custard is perfectly sweet.  I love the powdered sugar.  The flakiness of the puff is just right.  Put all of that together and get ready for your first bite of heaven on Earth.  

Not gonna lie, $2.50 for A cream puff....that's kind of steep.. but it's so good...

NOM  NOM  NOM  NOM  NOM  NOMMMMMMM!!

Service kind of sucks... oh well, just ignore them, get your cream puff, and GO!
author: Cecilia S.

description:
I heart Beard Papa's!!!! Cream puff's are my favorite dessert. I remember my friend introducing me to this spot in San Jose a couple of years ago and they finally opened up a store in SF!! I come here a lot when I go downtown to shop, it is a must. LOL 

They also come in different flavors on the inside, ie: vanilla, strawberry, coffee, earl grey tea, green tea, pumpkin and chocolate oooohhhh yes! Take one bite and your in heaven!! LOVE IT!
author: Kathy V.

description:
YUMMM!! ^___^ MY FAVORITE CREAM PUFF PLACE IN THE CITY!! 

Overall a 4.5 stars, rounded to a 5 cuz the guy who served me that day was cute hehe xD 

Their puffs are always very fresh. with perfect texture! -- the cookie dough thingy is never too crunchy or too soggy. AND THE CREAM IS DA SH*T! OMGGG SO.GOOD. When you take a bite, the cream melts in your mouth and instantly brightens your day!! It's super creamy and doesn't have that heavy buttery feelings. It doesn't taste too sweet either, which I love. Their daily flavors are chocolate and vanilla. And they also have weekly special flavors. My fav are green tea and coffee! They also serve other pastries such as tiramisu and cheesecakes, which are also pleasing. But the cream puffs are the highlights of the shop :) Definitely a must-try!! 

A tip for girls: these cream puffs are surprisingly filling even though they're not very big... I don't recommend eating more than 1 puff at one sitting o_o
author: Ying Y.

description:
I absolutely adore Beard Papa's Cream Puffs. So much so that this was the first thing I did during my recent San Francisco trip. Well, it helps that there is one right near the Powell St BART station.

It's definitely a tradition for me now. Virgin America flight from LAS to SFO (you just can't fly anyone else once you've gone VA). BART into the city. Beard Papa's Cream Puffs.

At the end of the trip, do it all in reverse. That's exactly what I did. I smuggled three friends back to Vegas with me - chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.
author: Paolo D.

description: Picked up an order of 16 assorted cream puffs for an office birthday party. The first one I tried was the green tea filled. I thought it was just already. The green tea filling was a lot heavier than I was expecting and not as sweet as I'd like. The chocolate filled eclair was amazing though! Very messy to eat but super fresh and the perfect amount of sweetness. Overall my whole office loved them!
author: Allison D.

description: Delicious!!! You can actually see the bits of vanilla beans in the vanilla filling.
author: Lexter C.

description: MmmMm bread papa's never seem to fail my cravings for something light, fluffy and not to sweet. These cream puff will not put you into a sugar shock like some cream puffs. I love bread papas!! And I'm sure you would too. Go visit your nearest papas people lol
author: Marcy L.

description:
Hm.

Reading other Yelpers' reviews, I realized that most of them discuss how delicious and awesome the WARM cream puff is. I must have come at a weird time (Wednesday lunch?), because when I arrived at Beard Papa's, there was no line and I was handed a cold cream puff.

And my reaction? 

Victor G., another Yelper, very wisely wrote, "the warm cream puff was almost melt in your mouth-heavenly. wouldn't advise taking it home. taste wouldn't be the name. taste would be like chewing on paper. well, not exactly, would be like chewing on cold dough, stick in your teeth kind."

He was right.

I was impressed by the quality of the cream -- obviously fresh, not too sweet -- but less so with the actual pastry itself. It was too airy or something. I felt like I was just eating quality custard and cardboard that just kept crumbling in my mouth! The cream puff also made a gigantic mess (try looking dignified while cream is dripping down your face and pants) and the Beard Papa guy had not adequately prepared me -- he'd handed me two napkins with my puff! And they don't offer any utensils! Lame.

All in all though, I'm willing to give this place another chance -- because it is pretty neat to have a store that just sells cream puffs and eclairs. I have a sneaking feeling that their eclairs are better than their cream puffs. I'm also willing to believe the Yelpers who say that their strawberry puffs are better than the original. While definitely a good experience, the vanilla cream puff left more to be desired. Yeah, I think that's a good summary of Beard Papa's in general.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Custard lover seeking custard to satiate custard craving.

Oh herro, Beard Papas!
::agnawnomnomgnamommm::
::mmmmmmm::
-silence-
*custard coma*
Yatta! Craving satiated! 

^^^^^ so yeah, that's how I feel every time I have some of these
Beard Papas custard deliciousness wrapped in pastry casing.
author: Jade T.

description:
I visited Beard Papa out of convenience and curiosity as I'm staying at the Marriott right next to it. I am a sweets kind of gal and needed something quick to satisfy my sweet tooth. I was expecting just another subpar bakery but my oh my was I pleasantly surprised.

The employees were extremely friendly, which I greatly appreciated. My cousin enjoyed a cup of coffee and a strawberry mouse cheesecake while I devoured several cream puffs. The eclair and cookie crunch are my favorite cream puffs. I found that the caramel cream complimented both well but good ol' vanilla was just as tasty. 

Once I bit into the cream puff it was crispy, light, and the slightly sweet cream generously oozed out. Every bite was equal with pastry and cream but of course, there was an excess of cream towards the end. No complaints about that!

The specialty cream puffs like the eclair and cookie crunch are $2.95 and the regular cream puff is $2.50. Those prices are very reasonable considering the deliciousness of the treats. 

Definitely treat yo'self and give Beard Papa a try if you're in the Soma district!
author: Michelle D.

description: I recently got some cheesecake and tiramisu slices they were horrible!!! Dry and disgusting you can't even swollow it! The tiramisu DID NOT taste like a typical tiramisu whatsoever!!! The only thing I would recommend is the cream puffs vanilla flavor that's the only thing I actually tried and liked. But my mom makes them a million times better so I won't bother returning cause I'd rather have home made!! Oh and my home made tiramisu is BOMB compared to theirs aswell! Lol lesson learnt!
author: Rita A.

description: Yes I sure did! I stopped here to indulge in one of their famous chocolate covered cream puffs. You have your choice of chocolate or vanilla filling for the price of $2.25. Wow soooooo good. They had other delectable items on the menu, but I just wanted a good ole cream puff that was to die for. So stop by and get one of these puffs quickly!!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Better than the original store.

The cream puffs are of course, excellent.
author: Patrick T.

description: Eclairs that will blow your mind.  I honestly can't believe they could be this good.  Best thing I've eaten in San Francisco!
author: Jim G.

description:
These little puffballs of crispy, creamy goodness should be one of the seven deadly sins. I guess it is already represented by gluttony. We were in SF for a quick day trip for my birthday and I wanted to take some of these amazing cream puffs home. We ended up with a half dozen, two of each flavor - vanilla, chocolate and, the flavor of the day, coffee. They held up really well on the drive back to Sacramento and made a decadent before bedtime snack. 

We gave one each to my mom for watching our boys and sent one home to my 98 year old grandmother. They both raved about them the next day. It was a little hard to figure out which flavor we were giving to them, so my mom asked my grandmother which one she had and she replied "I don't know, but it was delicious!" 

The coffee and chocolate were both yummy, but I have to say that I think the classic vanilla is still my favorite. They now have a Beard Papa's closer to where I live in the Roseville Galleria, which is dangerous. I think I will just pretend it is still only a "when in SF" treat. This particular location in the mall, downstairs in the food court, stays open later than the stand alone stores, so it works for an after dinner goody.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I always loved it..but their service is never good

I felt like I'm nit here to spend money, instead I'm here to pay them back their money. .lol
author: Constance H.

description:
Probably won't go back unless you like rude service. Is it not permissible to ask what's the difference between an eclair and cream puff when unfilled. You'd think I was asking the guy for his first born.  He could not be any more rude!
Cream puffs were good, but will definitely not return due to the poorest customer service this am.
author: Tina Q.

description:
I love Beard Papa's cream puffs!

If you're in Westfield San Francisco, you should definitely stop by Beard Papa's to grab a snack during your shopping. I always go for the usual vanilla cream puff. So delicious and made quickly.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Tiramisu Cheesecake Stick, how I love you!

Yes, I know, you're bad for my diet goal. 
Yes, I know that you wont be kind to my wallet. 
And, I very much know that you will leave chocolate powder and cream all over my lips, face, and clothes, engendering me to look like a sticky 5 year old.

But, oh! You are too damn good--for your own good.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Went to Beard Papa's in Westfield Mall for the second time today. For my first visit, I wasn't all that impressed: tastes good, but it's expensive and there's very little selection. 

This time around, the service was terrible. I went solely for the caramel cream puffs, which are advertised both on the regular screen and a special full-screen: "Flavor of the Week: Caramel!" They didn't have caramel. It wouldn't have been a big deal except that the servers were completely unapologetic about the false advertising. They actually looked really confused when I pointed it out to them on the screen, which makes me wonder whether they can read English.

The other major issue: They only let us pick two flavors for our box of six cream puffs. It made no sense, especially because during my first visit, I picked three types without a problem.
author: C. C.

description:
Definitely one of the best creampuff I've ever had. This cream puff is definitely creamy, tasty, and crispy. The first creampuff that I ever had that wasn't saggy at all. The filling inside was just right. The vanilla was definitely flavorful. I wish I ordered two instead of one. But will definitely be checking this place out again. 

Anyone craving mouth watering, crispy, and creamy creampuff definitely needs to check Beard Papa.
author: Julie C.

description:
Oh my word! 

Light, creamy, delicious goodness. I have been hearing about this place for years and being told I must try. Being that it's a hop and a skip (no jump) away from my office + my love for dessert I would have been here thousands of times... however, this way my first (of many) visits.

They have 3 flavors everyday (vanilla bean and chocolate plus whatever the special is). I was hoping it was strawberry but it was coffee today. I went with 3 vanilla bean and 3 chocolate to share with others. They fill them in front of you, so fresh! Yeah, after the first vanilla one, I had to have a chocolate. Both were so huge but so light it made it all right - didn't feel AS guilty =)  The vanilla bean was my favorite but the chocolate was a very, very close second. 

I can't wait to try another flavor!

YUM!
author: Colleen B.

description:
Mehhhhhh. Everyone raves about the cream puffs at Beard Papa's, so after hearing all this puffed up hype, I finally ventured over to try one.

People, people, people...make the trek to Cow Hollow/Marina and eat an amazing puff from Pacific Puffs! Only then will you know what a stellar cream puff should taste like. Those boys create some orgasmic puffs -- in mini and full-size versions.

I tried a traditional puff here, but the cream within and the exterior was nearly flavorless. Not my cup of tea. I'll save the calories for when I go back to Pacific Puffs, where not only do I get an amazing puff but also satisfying and friendly customer service.
author: Mansi A.

description:
I know there's a Beard Papa's in NY but I haven't been able to get there yet.  So when we passed by the one in San Fran, I screamed for us to stop by.  

We got the cream puff with vanilla cream and mango.  They didn't have green tea so I was kinda disappointed.  

The vanilla was so good, light and delicate.  The mango was...interesting.  I wouldn't go out of my way to get it again though.
author: Nancy P.

description: Didn't get to try because they closed early than website hours stated.  It's Wednesday and they are supposed t be open until 9pm. At 8:45pm they closed and we're counting cash.  Mall was still open til 9pm.  Could be because it was young kids running the joint during the holidays- but still not right!  We walked 10 blocks to make it well before 9pm!  We skipped dessert at a nice restaurant to get beard papas!  Not good!
author: Sandra H.

description:
Yum yum gimmie some! Best creampuffs on the planet. When they're fresh its crispy and light on the outside, nice, soft and all gooey on the inside. The puff part is so light, its like a really, really light, freshly baked bagette - an ultra thin shell of crispiness on the outside, and soft airy bread on the inside. And then there's the cream filling. OMG its like the best sex you've ever had, but for your mouth. Ok, not the best analogy to picture but you'll understand once you have it.

Chocolate is my favorite, but the vanilla is also very good. They have a flavor of the week and I've tried mango, coffee, strawberry , green tea, and pumpkin so far. Of the specials, my favorite is the strawberry sofar.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Had the regular and the mango cream puffs.

The good:
the cream was super light 
The regular one was nice especially because it wasn't overly sweet
The pastries weren't stale like some other places.

The not so good:
the mango one was a bit strange for my tastes 

For some quick cheap snackage, this isn't a bad place to stop by for a coffee and pastry on the go.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Worst service I had ever had!

This morning (09/15 around 10:30AM), I came to this place and order 2 and a half dozens of cream puff. The Indian guy who doesn't speak English well charged me 22$ (which is the price of 1 dozen). I said no, I want 2 dozens and a half. He then charged me $24 (wtf???). Ok, I then told him again clearly that I wanted 2 dozens and a half which means 30. He seemed like rude and called another girl to help him with the money. She then first charged me 24$, I said wtf I wanted 2 dozens and a half which is 30. She at least tried to calculate and charged me the right amount of money.

That is not enough with the Indian guy, he threw me 2 bags of cream buffs and I asked again "is it 30 puffs?". HE answered with without any respects to the customer "Yes". 

I was in a hurry because I need to rush to work which is half and hour away. Then when I'm here, there is just only 24 puffs which is 2 dozens, and they charged me for 2 dozens and a half.

I will escalate this to the owner and I deserve an apology from that Indian guy. Otherwise, I will escalate more to the customer consume board.
author: Sara N.

description:
Very good cream puffs. I wouldn't go so far as to say, it was the best cream puff I ever had only because I don't remember the last time I had a cream puff. We tried the green tea and the green tea flavor really came through. The filling was really nice and light and the whole thing was not too sweet. 

The cream puff was good enough that we wished we'd bought another flavor just to try. I am giving it only three stars because they really don't have much else to sell and if you are only going to sell cream puffs, you should sell more flavors than just three at a time. Even at a small mall location.
author: Nora S.

description:
3.5 stars.

I think cream puffs in general are one of those things I don't crave...but if it's there, why not?  My absolute favorite flavors are the green tea and coffee.  The crust is usually soft and flaky but sometimes it can be hard because they try to keep the puffs cool.  Everything else here (such as the eclairs or even the plain custard cream puff) is just okay.  Simply put, it's good, but not good enough that I would travel out of my way just to eat.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I just like dough... and cream... so dough with cream inside... just stay away from the "extras" like the chocolate cream or cheesecake sticks or whatever. just get the regular with vanilla filling; a good sweet kick. (i'll allow the chocolate covered puff: it's decent)
author: Zou Z.

description: I loooove Beard Papa's!! Crunchy and flaky meets creamy and sweet. YUM!!
author: Sherry L.

description: The Asian woman who worked there in the evening on Saturday(12/5/2015, to be exact) between 6-7pm obviously doesn't like her job making cream puffs. She was rude and unpleasant.
author: Bayarea K.

description:
The boyfriend and I got an eclair with vanilla filling and cream puff with strawberry filling. I was surprised by how fresh the cream tasted- seemed like it was made with real strawberries. Both were delicate, light, and delicious. Be careful of that first bite as the center oozes everywhere!

Eclair & cream puff: $5.45
author: Eric C.

description:
Great cream puffs and certainly unique and worth a stop when in the area. 

Strange name however. 

This food court tends to be very crowded during lunch time so you may not even be able to find a place to sit.
author: John D.

description:
Service: 5
Cream puff: 5
Wait time: 5
Price: 5
Cleanliness of bathroom: n/a

I. love. Beard. Papa.
I. love. Beard. Papa.

That's pretty much all I walked around saying after I visited SF. And I don't even really like cream puffs! Damn you, Bay area citizens, with your delicious cream puffs.

A franchise that originated from Japan, the cream puff suits my tastes perfectly. The puff is crispy and a perfect counter to the just-sweet-enough and just-heavy-enough custard. It's to die for.

My favorite flavor: the vanilla bean. I can eat that custard all day. Honest. Who cares if it's like five hundred thousand calories? You wouldn't know it.

I love you, Vanilla Cream Puff.
author: Alice K.

description:
Best cheesecake ! Portioned just right for a snack.
The cream puffs are so good and always consistent. What a treat!!
author: Alison W.

description:
I can never resist stopping by here on my lunch break! Hands down, the best cream puffs ever!!!!!!

This is located on the foodcourt concourse level of the sf centre mall. For 2.50$ a cream puff you can't beat that! & for all you working in the mall, you can get a 10% discount :-)

The filling is fluffy that's extremely satisfying while the bread is crunchy yet soft with powdered sugar on top. You can never go wrong with the classic vanilla filling. I also love how they have weekly flavors as well! They range from strawberry, coffee, mango, & green tea!
author: Jessica S.

description:
THEE  best cream puffs ever!

my favorite flavor is vanilla but my second flavor is their green tea. 

according to the day of the week, they will serve different filling flavors.
they have freshly baked cream puff pastry along with different flavors of filling. 

you know it's fresh when the cream puff is not filled until you purchase it.
thats right, they fill the puff pastry right when you get there!!
author: Jae C.

description:
I've always heard about Beard Papa's and I actually got to try it for the first time in SF!

Ordered the chocolate cream puff. Too much pastry for me and HUGE. Just give me the creme and I'm happy.

I also tried the cheesecake stick, which was surprisingly good. 

The sticks over the creme puff... For sure...
author: Maria C.

description:
My buddy took me here.

- Located in the SF shopping center.
- Plenty of customers.

Come up: 2 Cream Puffs - Strawberry and vanilla fillings.

The cream puffs are a nice little treat - fresh and delicious.  Really - What's not to like?

I say check it out.
author: Matthew A.

description: Love the cream puffs here.  It's not too sweet and fresh and fluffy.  I love the vanilla flavor more than the chocolate.  But you should always get their flavor of the week.  Of all the special flavors the green tea and the pumpkin flavors are the best!  Highly advise to eat the puffs on the spot.  The flavors might compromise a bit when you get them to go and eat later!
author: Rose L.

description: Was visiting SF and I had to have this. I wish they had the green tea flavor but their flavor of the week was mango. The only regret was not getting enough napkins cause I made a mess out of it! It was so amazing - the mango cream was so light and the actual puff was flakey and tasty.. The location is also good cause I took it to the park across the street to eat. Yay for beard papa!!!
author: Racquel P.

description: I love cream puffs so much so I know how to bake them at home. Beard papa has the home baked taste as mine. Because of my busy schedule, whenever I eager to have some cream puff I go here although I don't like their customer service in this location.
author: Erica K.

description:
Amazing Eclair! Amazing.

So we came in here on a whim. I was craving something sweet and we had some hours to spare while we waited to take the BART to the airport. Well, i'm very happy I stumbled into Beard Papas.

The chocolate eclair with vanilla filling was stupendous. Fresh chocolate, cool vanilla filling, all gushing in my mouth made me a very happy consumer.

Do it.
author: Dante M.

description: I had a vanilla cream puff, which was delicious. My colleagues had a chocolate and vanilla cream puff and they said the chocolate was so much better than vanilla.
author: Christine M.

description: I would like to give a 0 star if it allow me. I would like to make a complaint to Ronnel. He is totally meant, unprofessional and I really don't know why he is hired. I order 3 puff with 2 vanilla and 1 chocolate. They put it all in one bag.  They impatiently tell me the one with coco powder is chocolate. When my mom come back from the restroom, and take one bit and we realized that we got 2 chocolate and 1 vanilla. So I bring back one chocolate to them and told them they give me the wrong order. I have to tell Ronnel 3 times that I ordered 2 vanilla and 1 chocolate and I got 2 chocolate 1 instead. For something under $3, you won't believe how much hard time they gave us. I already told most people I know about this matter. They said they will not go there.
author: Kay L.

description: maybe it's just me but i really do not understand the hype over this. these cream puffs aren't even that good.
author: Penny L.

description:
!!!  !!!  !!!  !!!  !!! 
LOVE: I love this place! Best cream puffs ever! 

YOU HAVE TO TRY: I don't care about éclairs or annoying French pastries, but let me tell you, these guys are different - a must try! The puff offers just a slight crunch, and contrasts perfectly with the creamy filling! And they taste great!

FRESH: They inject the puff right when you buy it so it is really fresh and not soggy! 

RECOMMENDATIONS: Chocolate's not bad, but I strongly recommend vanilla filling! Also, the cookie crunch topping is the way to go! 

EXCLAMATION POINTS: I'm sorry but I just couldn't stop from using exclamation points! You have to check this place out!
!!!  !!!  !!!  !!!  !!!
author: James W.

description:
Finally finally finally!! I was able to sink my teeth into a light & flaky beard papa vanilla cream puff. I was so excited!!! 

Q: Was it good? 
A: It suuuuure was.

Ok. 

The excitement is gone now.
author: Joy A.

description:
I really like Beard Papa's. 

The special for this week was Mango! There were actually bits of mango in the custard. :)
author: Jeanette S.

description: Every time I Bart to the city, I always have to stop by and get me a cream puff! My favorite flavor is green tea, but since they didn't have it, I just got the vanilla one. It's a great snack and a cheap one too! I only wished that my puff part of the cream puff was more fresh. You could tell it's been out for a while =[. But, anywho, happy eatting!
author: Amanda T.

description:
In the stock market of desserts, Beard Papa's is a sector leader.  In less than 90 seconds, I was able to get 3 warm, freshly baked vanilla custard-laden cream puffs.

They were also consumed in an equally rapid fashion.

Fast, friendly, fresh, and truly a delight.  Beard Papa's is world famous for their cream puffs, and deservedly so.  This is a great ultra-fast quick-fix for the sweet tooth inside you.
author: Ravi M.

description: The only good thing about the place were the pastries. They were really delicious. However, the girl behind the counter seemed more interested in telling her coworker about the guy with the $500 shirt than tending to customers. And the guy behind the counter gave me some vague, somewhat rude answer when I asked them if there were any outlets where I could charge my phone. Also, it sucks the coffee didn't come with any cream or milk and I had to walk down the street to another joint (green logo) in order to get it. Not impressed by this, and I think I wasted my money.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Fantastic cream puffs. Not too sweet. Delicate too and they need to be kept chilled in case you made the mistake I did and buy a few extra for the following day. You can mix and match the filling and the puff itself. I tend to go for vanilla cream inside a chocolate puff. 

And being in the Westfield Centre, it can be either a nice side to a cup of coffee or a nice dessert after your meal.
author: Paul F.

description:
If I could post a picture of Homer Simpson doing his signature drool I would, because that`s how I feel about these custards.

Cold, creamy, and delicious! Occasionally once in a while the menu will change so they might have something different.

I always say to my friends "There`s ALWAYS room for dessert" and this is the dessert that I will go to!
author: Johanah I.

description: Meet you at Beard Papa's?  Ok!  This is where my bf and I meet at the mall whenever we are meeting in the middle from wherever we are coming from: work, gym, home, running errands.  And it's perfect because we grab dinner in the foodcourt and have some yummy, creamy dessert at Beard Papa's!  Who can resist those crispy but yet soft poofs of pastry with chocolate or vanilla or their daily special treat filling for the day - and it's just the right size at the right price.  Love it!  Friends love it to too and buy it by the half dozen to take home to enjoy.
author: Maile N.

description:
The boyfriend needed some singles to ride the Muni so I decided to kill 2 birds with 1 stone - break my larger bill & satisfy my persistent sweet tooth.

I got a Mango cream puff which was not too sweet, didn't taste artificial, & actually had little pieces of mango flesh; a very pleasant surprise.

While the cream puff was good, the service was ugh.  The girl who was working was not together at all & she kept getting things wrong.  On top of that, she was rude too.  I said "...and a bottle of green tea please;" to which she scoffed "we don't have a green tea filling."  Then I said "no, I want A BOTTLE of green tea please;" to which she brought me peach tea.  Really girl?  Don't get sassy with me when you are the one with the hearing & the eye sigh problems...please.
author: Karen S.

description:
It is an ethereal experience every time I eat one of these puffs.  Seriously, Beard Papa's cream puff is absolutely the best dessert ever. ever. ever. They have the lightest and fluffiest choux pastry (the dough used for the cream puffs) that isn't deflated and overly soft like other cream puffs I've tried. The cream is amazing. Not just some silly foamy cream but a cool, slightly sweet, whipped custard - like really smooth pudding. Then to top it off, you can either choose a puff with powered sugar, cookie crumbles, or chocolate glaze on top your already mouth-watering masterpiece.  Their vanilla is the best and always available but I'm also a fan of the strawberry and green tea flavors when they're available, but really, all of the flavors are just magic in my mouth. Magic I tell you.

Also, their 'eclair cream puffs' taste just like a delicious authentic eclair I tasted while in Paris. Look, you don't even have to buy a plane ticket to France to try an awesome equivalent of eclairs. Maybe that will ditch the idea that the $2.25 price tag is too much for you. And for the record, I've tried the Beard Papa's in Japan where it all started and it wasn't even as good as the Beard Papa's in SF and NYC (it was too soggy). How can that be?! I don't know. It baffles me but I don't question magic and I'm glad the better Beard Papa is in this side of the world..where I am. *obsessed
author: Allie Y.

description: One of my favorite desserts but this place tends to run out eclairs before 6pm! I don't know who is the brain behind the numbers but no business should run out its product hours before it closes. This is happening daily!!! Do the math!
author: mario k.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star:  You better be taking the bus here.
_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star:  Fast Food style
_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars:  The cream puff is a Must Try!  It's all about the filling.  The filling is so tasty.
_____


Overall Experience
3/5 Stars 

_____

author: Elliott N.

description:
Beard Papa is in the food court on the lst floor of the westfield centre. the powell bart station connects directly to it.

saw pastries but focused mostly on cream puffs(2.25) and eclairs(2.75)
there were stacks of the cream puffs and they seem to be made constantly.
went with the vanilla.  other choices were chocolate, caramel, strawberry. and ?

filling was so so. the warm cream puff was almost melt in your mouth-heavenly. wouldn't advise taking it home. taste wouldn't be the name. taste would be like chewing on paper. well, not exactly, would be like chewing on cold dough, stick in your teeth kind.

service efficient, helpful, and friendly. pay at cashiers, pick up pastry at end of counter. then eat....yummy!
author: Victor G.

description:
I was so soo happy when I found a bread papa in San Francisco! I couldn't believe my eyes!! 
I've been to bread papa numerous times in Taiwan and I've missed it so much! 
I want to say it tastes exactly the same! I bought a dozen to share with family and they were all of a consistent quality. 
They have different puffs and fillings you can chose from. I always liked the original the best! They fill it to a point where the cream bursts out when you take a bite! As you're eating you can smell the fresh puffs being baked in the oven..Mmmm!!One of the best cream puff places ever!
author: Evelyn S.

description: Great desserts. The staff are not very personable. The location is difficult to find if you are not from SF. It's in the mall downstairs in the food court.
author: Letter W.

description:
I'm from Dallas, Texas and we dont have stuff like this here...The only cream puffs we get is from the Asian bakeries who sells them 3 for a $1. 
I heard about Beard Papa before so I had to drop by on my trip to san fran. Got a vanilla and a strawberry mouse like one. They were so delicious!!!! they were so big and fluffy!!! I like the vanilla one the best!!! 

I had beard papas for three days straight because I wanted to get it all in before I fly back to Dallas and dream about it lol
author: Cat N.

description:
Perhaps buying cream puffs at 7pm means you don't get the freshest puffs but these little buggers are still yummy!  I bought 3 green tea and 3 regular vanilla for $11.  

The unfilled cream puffs are all in basket and waiting to be filled per your order.  I saw them filling each puff after I ordered them.  Each are in its own paper pouch and lined up a box like soldiers.

I took them home on BART for a get together with friends and these were a hit!  Both flavors were great!  Green tea filling is very light and mildly flavored - perfectly assembled.  I think there was a green dusting on top...  couldn't really tell because we ate them so fast.  The regular vanilla did have powdered sugar on top.  Can't tell what they fill with - not straight whipped cream.  I think they add something else to it but I can't figure out what that ingredient is!

I've been here a few times as well as their Mission St location.  Both are great!
author: Susan C.

description:
I don't know what it is about this location but their cream puffs are supreme! I've visited other locations in SF, in Southern CA, and even the one in Redwood City before it closed. For some reason, only this location has the best well blended cream. I've had some poor excuses for BP cream puffs which sadly had streaks of chocolate in their chocolate cream.  Supposedly the one at Yerba Buena is the same owner, but somehow, the consistency is not the same.

Anyway, I heart this location and love their rotation of flavors. My favorite tip: Chocolate Eclair with Green Tea filling!
author: Anna R.

description:
Just had these again this last weekend and realized I haven't written a review yet!

Love their cream puffs. Just plain with powdered sugar and the cream  inside!

I love the fact that they always have a flavor of the month. This month is Mango. We enjoyed this one very much.

One of our favorites is chocolate. All the other flavors are good too. We usually like getting a variety pack and splitting them so we can taste them all.
author: Aimee R.

description:
BEST cream puffs I ever did have!!!!!

Thank you Beard Papa. . .
author: Criselle O.

description: Oh Beard Papa how I love you. Still the best cream puffs I've ever had in the city - the vanilla custard filling is so decadent, but not overly sweet. The danger is that these are light enough to warrant wanting to eat two or three! I love that they have special flavors of the week like green tea, strawberry and mango. I still order my go-to vanilla éclair the majority of the time. I like their cheesecake sticks too!
author: Elaine W.

description:
I first discovered Beard Papa when I was in middle school. My cousin had brought home one of those heavenly cream puffs from the very first CA location that opened in Los Angeles. One bite and the vanilla bean filling oozed out; I instantly was sold! I've had my share of Beard Papa cream puffs over the years, and they've remained on a pedestal for me ever since that first time I had them.

The chocolate eclair cream puff is my absolute favorite item here. The chocolate adds a nice contrast to the vanilla center, and it's a wonderful sensation when you can get a bite where the chocolate is a bit melted mixed into the filling. 

Not every Beard Papa is consistent, so be aware of that, but this location is pretty good. Cream puffs--so freaking delicious.
author: Shira C.

description:
Eclair with vanilla custard = WINNING.

It's sweet but subtle. It's a savory and delicious dessert. It's also very quick and easy.

If you haven't tried this place, YOU NEED TO. And visit their website and watch the story, it's cute haha.
author: Daniel D.

description: Mmmmmmmmmm if you like sugar, and I do, you will like Beard Papa's
author: Greg F.

description: The cream puff was amazing but the care seemed a bit dirty. Despite that, I would recommend trying one.
author: Kathy D.

description:
nom nom nom It's so good once it hits your mouth... it's so good...

Light airy, flaky and most important Delicious!!!
author: Derick F.

description: My very first bite of a beard Papa's cream puff was in Osaka Japan.  It was warm, crisp, creamy gooey goodness! I thought that was the last I would see of it until I ran into it again in San Francisco! I love the creme diplomat filling. So yummy. My favorite are the vanilla filled eclairs!
author: Cookee L.

description:
Beard papas is pricey but it's good. However, I do this weird thing where I can't finish all the cream so I swipe it out to the side and throw it away. Beard papa here tastes the same as beard papa in Asia - amazing! This particular store is super fast with their service so don't be too scared if you see a line.

Sit down to eat it. It gets a little messy. Also, if they have it try the strawberry - so yum!! Chocolate gets a little heavy.
author: Jennie C.

description:
Not some place I go often , BUT when in the area of the Moscone Center its a really nice option when you want something sweet and light. My favorites being the Vanilla Bean, and the Green Tea, but being freshly baked and filled its pretty hard to go wrong.
