Prices are okay and for me a bit of a splurge so not something I do often, but can easily recommend if in the area Shopping, Attending a Convention, or Hitting a Museum.
author: Joseph A.

description:
Searching for a pre-movie snack, I made a beeline for the Beard Papa and tried their seasonal caramel cream puff. It was tasty, but actually didn't taste too different from the vanilla. Don't get me wrong, I love the vanilla, but I figured for their specialty flavor it should be a little different. 

I originally intended to buy one to sneak into the theater and eat during my movie, but I'm glad I couldn't wait because I always forget how messy those suckers are! It's nearly impossible to eat it without dripping some of that yummy gooey inside...I think I've done it about twice in my life (and I've eaten a lot of beard papas).

Oh, and hot tip: If you go with someone who works for any company related to the mall I think you get a discount! I was with my friend who works for Macy's corporate and she somehow got a discount, and they don't even have a store in the building!
author: Christina P.

description:
Amazing little treat I get myself whenever I'm downtown. I always grab it when I want to eat but not that hungry, haha.

I've tried a few flavors and they're all good, but I always go back to vanilla, because the classic flavor is always my favorite. :3 I have yet to try the green tea flavor, but I can't wait to see it as the daily special.
author: Harriet W.

description:
I had never heard of Beard Papa. I lived in Vancouver for years and have now been told there is one there also. Didn't know. It is probably a good thing though. Lol, too many of these and I might be in trouble.

A friend from work bought a mixed dozen for my birthday. OMG - so good. I had a chocolate covered one first. Heaven! I ate it. I wore it. I enjoyed it. Oh, and the one with strawberry filling, it is like a cloud filled with pure strawberries.

I am glad it is a bit of a walk to get there or I would be eating them everyday. That reminds me. I have one left in the fridge. I think I will eat it now.
author: Mark D.

description: What can I say I love my sweets and whenever I go downtown- it's not starbuck's that I get, it beard papa I love the flaky creamy confection with vanilla cream that oozes out. Be prepared that it can get messy when you bite it and napkins are not there to look pretty. I've only tried the mango and vanilla flavor, but hope to try the green tea cream puff soon. Definitely must try for tourists and residents alike, at under $3 for a cream puff you will not regret it.
author: Desiree C.

description:
One bite and then, total silence... I've become speechless! The taste of Beard Papa's cream puffs sync so perfectly with my tastebuds that I completely zone out; they've successfully unlocked control of my consciousness. This has happened to me multiple times already that I even advised myself not to have a first date here; imagine how hard it'd be to get to know each other when I'm in a vegetable state, focusing on my little creme puff.

Maybe it's the price, but when I treat myself to a 3 dollar creme puff I feel so fancy. Conveniently, this place is located in the Westfield food court. So I help myself to a plate, fork, knife, and some comfortable seating. Oddly enough, I'll pretend that I'm the king of England having his casual mid-afternoon snack. *pinky's up*

I'm in love with the classic vanilla filling and recently discovered the cookie creme puff. Simply exquisite, hur hur.
author: Tina O.

description: I had a Beard Papa's cream puff today at the Westfield Mall. PERFECTION!   It was filled before my eyes so that means very fresh.  I got vanilla custard and my boyfriend got 1 vanilla custard and 1 strawberry filled.  He loved them.  This has the weirdest name in the world, but it's a great place for a sweet tooth at the mall!!
author: Sandra P.

description:
I heard the cream puff was delicious - I wanted to get the ice cream one, but I was sharing with my friend so we just decided to get the standard cream puff to see what the big deal was about. It was delicious!! The outside was crispy but at the same time very fluffy and light. The powdered sugar gave me a cough attack, but I won't hold it against them :)

The cream inside was really delicious, too. Beard Papa's is definitely a pretty legit place to have some dessert after a heavy meal.
author: Yong L.

description:
As I dragged myself down the escalator into the food emporium, the aroma of freshly baked cream puff never failed to hypnotized me. No matter what mood I was in, I had to consider getting at least one puff. 

I usually go after their original cream puff with vanilla bean cream. It's all about the Vanilla-cream! I even learned to lick everything down to zero. Sometimes they have exotic seasonal flavors like mango. Seriously? Not sure if I want to go adventurous for this type of thing. Also not sure if anything else there is even worth a kick. Well, maybe the Chocolate Fondant cake. Ask if they can warm it up for you. Yes, so that the center melts!
author: Rika P.

description: Whoa Papa...come to momma!! I love em all, plain vanilla, chocolate eclair. Dusted with magic powder.  The profiteroles were light and delicate. Larger than most cream puffs but who's complaining. Now the filling - a tad more custard-y than I prefer but nevertheless worth buying 2, one for now and one for, now. These babies tend to become runny once taken out of the cooler - do eat em right away. I do like the process of filling in the hollow goodness with cream per Order. Keeps the choux pastry crisp and not  soggy.
author: Michelle B.

description: Oh Beard Papa's I was only recently introduced to you and I have fallen in love. Your cream puffs are so beautiful and delectable that my soul cries that we haven't met sooner. I love your vanilla custardy creaminess and your light and airy puffs. Together you guys are marriage made in heaven. I dream of the next time I get to see you again.
author: Lisa N.

description: Very clean and friendly customer service! I got the vanilla and chocolate creme puff. Pretty good! Just wish the creme was a bit more thicken so it doesn't drip easily and the vanilla can be a bit more flavor
author: Mimi L.

description:
I dream about these. I wish there was one by me. Im salivating just thinking of their creamy deliciousness. A little pricy. But well worth it. Just skip eating for a day afterwards ;-)

Excellant. Amazing. Love me some Beard Papas.
author: Matt S.

description:
They were closing already and running out of puffs and chocolate filling. We got whatever was leftoer chocolate filling (1), got a couple of vanilla fillings and tried out their caramel filling (1).

All three are awesome as always. 

What surprised me though is that the puffs were still amazingly flaky.

The cashier dude and the filler lady were awesome and still friendly even though it's quitting time already.
author: Kislev A.

description:
I can see the hype over Beard Papa's.  It's definitely one of the better cream puffs I've had from a bakery.  It's a plus that it specializes in only cream puffs.  This location doesn't seem to have much variety, they change the third flavor every other month and the main two flavors are vanilla and chocolate filling.  This month's was green tea.  My sisters and I stuck with vanilla filled cream puffs, but we tried different puffs!  We ordered the eclair (chocolate covered), cookie crumble (sugar cookie on top), and the original (with powdered sugar).  

Quite delectable and service was super fast.  Cream puffs vary from $3.25-3.75, depending on the filling and/or shell.  If you want an alternative to Sprinkles cupcakes, or a coffee from somewhere, this will do!
author: Anne N.

description:
I am a huge dessert fan but I am a bit disappointed with the cream puff here.

I tried the vanilla and green tea flavors and both are a bit plain. The custard is alright. I do like the fact that they are not too sweet. 
The shell of the puff is a bit too tough. A lot of people mentioned they are nice and soft so perhaps I had a not so good batch and had been sitting there for too long?
author: Mona W.

description:
What a treat! What a sugar rush!

Such interesting flavors, clearly not typical American fare, not with Green Tea and Pumpkin on the menu.

Good, nonetheless. Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
My brother has been telling me about these cream puffs for the longest time. We've attempted to go several times in the past at other locations but always get sidetracked. Walking around the San Francisco Centre food court, it caught my eye right away.

Just one cream puff filled with vanilla. They inject it after you place your order. I like creamy things. The vanilla cream is just savory and rich. Not too airy or overly sweet. It's good cream. The outside was flaky and sweet. It's a large cream puff, I'm used to bite sized ones that I pop in my mouth and ooze. Not used to eating it with a fork.

My cream puff cravings have subsided since then but have not vanished, because I'm craving it right this minute. Something about cream filled balls! *Licks lips*
author: Minh D.

description:
My oh my. What a delicious cream puff! The first time i came here i got the strawberry cheesecake thing.. I gobble it down way too fast. Its delicious! 

Today my bf was excited when he saw that they had beard papa here. So he jad to get one. He had the cookie crunch puff..... He ate it before i could take a bite. :( i tried the cream puff... It was gooood i love the cream!!!! Haha i want mooooreeeee
author: Emi K.

description:
People say that the hype of Beard Papa's will die down like it did for Krispy Kremes. NOT!  I can still eat me some puffs! Endulge people!  Try their puffs!  They come in variety of flavors - pumpkin, green tea, chocolate, strawberry, vanilla, and caramel  - depending on the week or month.

Oh! and if you adore me, you'll treat me to a chocolate cream puff! Thank you in advance! :)
author: Diana M.

description:
What a real creampuff should taste like..

I'm usually not a big fan of chain establishments.. but they manage to keep their quality and flavor in their product!  This place rotates their featured cream flavors.  I can hardly pass up their creamy goodness when I find out they're featuring Green Tea filling.  Pair that up with their regular "puff" (they offer 3 different kinds) and you're golden.

Try out their cheesecake and tiramisu sticks too! The small portion is good so that you can satisy a craving without feeling too guilty.  I only wish they had frequency cards...
author: Krystal Nina L.

description: I went to order some cream puffs after work and found no line so the visit was pretty fast.  They charge $0.25 for a bag other side you're just carrying your treats in the carrier box, I had two to take home on Bart. It's a very short walk to the station since its on the same floor and just through the glass doors. Their fillings have never disappointed me, they're creamy and the puff itself is light. You have your choices as to a powdered sugar topped or an eclair style.
author: Maribel C.

description:
I first learned of Beard Papa's in Hawaii in which there was always a line for cream puffs at Shirokiya in Honolulu. Soon the craze turned into actual storefronts in which you could find these treats daily, as opposed to occasionally like a McRib promotion. This Beard Papa location is actually a kiosk storefront in the Westfield food court.

Generally the menu at Beard Papa's consists of cream puffs in a few flavors and a few other items which makes your choice here simple. I got the original cream puff which is simply delicious. The cream is a bit custard pudding like and very smooth. It is rich, but totally worth eating. Have had the chocolate version on a previous occasion and it is good also. Still, the original vanilla is my favorite. Simply put, Beard Papa makes delicious cream puffs period end of story.
author: Jon L.

description:
Eclairs never fail me. Although it could be such a pain in the butt to walk downtown while trying to eat an eclair, be warned that the sweet life could get messy.

You get what you give, :)

Been loyal to Beard Papa's since highschool. Got introduced to this store in the Philippines, so glad to see them move on up here in the bay area a couple of years ago.

But i must say,
just go for their cream puffs and eclairs. It'll never fail your sweet tooth.
Just remember to keep those napkins around!
author: Ferricci R.

description: Beard Papa has some delicious cream puffs.  If you want some good dessert, Beard Papa won't let you down.  Light pastry with delicious filling in various flavors.  Very generous portion size as well.  The problem at this Westfield mall location is their lack of customer service.  If you don't mind waiting in plain site while 5 workers play on their phone, then by all means - try a cream puff.  Bad customer service ruins an experience for me personally.  I gave this place a shot 3 different times because I love their cream puffs that much and each time was the same. Workers distracted, more concerned talking to each other or playing on their phones to even acknowledge their customers.  Third time is not the charm here.  This time I walked away and will never return.  I'll also be warning anyone else to not visit this location. There's one right outside the mall if you really want some at Yerba Buena.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Probably terrible for your health, but I'll allow cream puffs into my life as guilty pleasures.

I'm a fan of the Green Tea and Coffee flavors, but they're in rotation only once a month or so. I really wish they'd put up a Twitter feed to announce what the flavor of the week is.
author: Anthony W.

description: We got cream puffs with both the vanilla and chocolate filling. The vanilla puff was delicious, but the chocolate one was so-so. They were light and fluffy. Just be careful when you bite into the cream puffs as the filling can create a bit of a mess.
author: George L.

description: Sampled the vanilla and chocolate puffs as well as the chocolate eclair. I think I prefer pacific puffs more even though it's a bit pricier. The vanilla and chocolate puffs were powdered lightly with sugar. The chocolate covered puffs at pacific puffs were better than the ones at beard papa's.
author: Virginia Y.

description: MUST TRY IT! MUST TRY IT!  you will love it!
author: William C.

description: I like their cream puff, especially coffee and mango flavor. But the cheesecake stick is not as good when I first tried it. But sometimes I hate waiting in line to order a cream puff and one thing I hate the most is when they ran out of something that the customers want to order.
author: Shirley H.

description:
Beard Papas Crack Puffs. 

I need

To Stay 

Away
author: Amanda L.

description:
A Japanese chain, started in 1999 or so. This chain is famous more so for the chou pastry ( which is more dry than the usual Japanese ones ) than the custard cream filling ( which is really tasty but not that much different than, say, Ginza Cozy Corner ). Plus, they fill it on the spot, which is great. 

The 4-star is for an odd reason: when I received an order some time ago, the guy/lady(?) who filled the pastries was telling a friend/customer(?) that a better cream puff can be had near the Umami Burger on Union St., and that he/she was heading over there later. Maybe that place is great, but it is disheartening to hear this after shelling out a lot of money........

Still, the pastries here are highly recommended!
author: George T.

description:
One of my favorites came to visit me today. I took her to Beard Papa because she has never been. I have never been to one in SF. I didn't know how to order so I just pointed at stuff and asked for chocolate and vanilla. The girl didn't understand and kept asking me what I wanted. =/ 

Finally I got a chocolate and vanilla of each the normal one and the chocolate covered ones. I like how it came out to a flat 10 dollars. We had to go all the way around to get our puff thing. I like how it comes in a cute box and they stick the napkins in the little slit.
author: Sarah C.

description: Not in the location that it is tagged on here. When I called to be sure they were open, they said no they close at 830 (it was 8:10) but this says they close at 9?! Update yelp!
author: Sam Y.

description:
Eating a Beard Papa is biting into a tiny little cloud... 

They have flavors of the week, such as Green Tea, Coffee, Strawberry, etc. To me, the original is the best.

3.5 stars. I wouldn't outrightly search for them, and they aren't exactly cheap, but you won't see me passing them up if the chance was given.
author: Jean L.

description:
This Beard Papa phenomenon is just beyond me...

You cram some light cold cream into a puff pastry, slap some chocolate, crumb topping or powdered sugar on it and call it a day. It's amazingly simple, yet messy and for some, quite addictive.

I've been a fan of their chocolate flavored chocolate dipped ones for a couple months now and when I come to work with the infamous yellow box of Beard Papa's, everyone's diets are suddenly forgotten.

They usually have chocolate and vanilla and then they switch it up with a special filling of the week. If you're lucky enough, get the green tea one with chocolate topping 'cause it's darn good. 

The cashier seems clueless most of the time but it's the people who are cramming my puffs with cream are what's important. I love those people and how they stuff it with magic. Mmmm...Beard Papa magic. 

Honestly, if you're having a bad day you should treat yourself to a Beard Papa and try to take yourself seriously while the cream filling is schmearing your face and falling in your lap.
author: Jessica K.

description: I think if i stuck with the normal vanilla creme puff... We'd have less disappointing results..... Tried the cookie crunch with vanilla and the cookie part on the outside tasted burnt... It ruined my whole experience... Took one bite and threw the rest out.... Disappointing...
author: Eunice F.

description:
I don't even like cream puffs and I love Beard Papa's. 

These are by far the smoothest and creamiest cream puffs I've ever had. They're pretty darn big too. 

I've tried the chocolate, vanilla and the pumpkin (seasonal special). Each one was delicious. The pastry was itself was perfectly baked. The cream filling was delightful. 

The lines were long but it went by pretty fast. The workers are nice but efficient. It's also in the food court of the mall so it makes either a great snack or a perfect dessert after eating dinner or lunch somewhere else. 

If you like cream puffs, or even if you don't...this is a great place for you to check out.
author: Eli Y.

description:
This review can easily go the way of filth... I mean think about it! Cream puff? Stuffed with filling? Exploding goo all over you face when it goes in your mouth? Yeah. I can see where your mind may sway into the gutter but all of the aforementioned only describes my experience at Beard Papa after having a delectable cream puff.

You pick your puff, they stuff it with your goo of choice, enjoy! It's really a simple concept and is done pretty well. I guess we got lucky and hit it at a time where NO ONE was there which I guess is an act of god within itself.

I went for the classic puff with vanilla bean goo. Dare I say, the goo was better than the puff but I am a cochina like that. I like em but then again I am relatively easy to please. 

Dear Beard Papa please do not ever extend the chain into San Diego cause if you were near me I would be doing some serious damage.

Go! Experience the creamy goo all over your face. I did. 

Oh and word to the wise, don't wear black when you go in there unless you want to look like you have been partying it up at Studio 54 with Lindsay Lohan. *sniff sniff*
author: Ivonne C.

description:
My gf wanted to get us both a couple of these bad boys for the road, (so a total of 4) but the guy behind the cash register said, "Buy 5, get 1 free"
So she was like, hehehe....sure
(So that's 6).

As soon as we got to the car, she finishes 1. I haven't touched any of mine yet. When we got to her place, she finished off another one and put the rest in her fridge. So now 4 left. She's got 1 more, I still got 3 more.

20 min later, she goes to the fridge back and forth, opens it, stares at it for a few MINUTES, closes it, goes back to the couch. She asks me, "Should I eat one? Should I eat one?"

I said, well.. you just had 2...do you really think you should eat another..?
So she decides she'll wait. But now she's bugging me to eat one of mine even though I don't feel like it, but I eat mine anyway so I don't have to deal with her asking me again. So 3 left (1 hers, 2 mine)

Next morning she wakes up super early (it's weekend). You know what happened? First thing she does after waking up is go straight to the fridge and secretly eat her last one in the living room. (2 left, both mine)

I was like, are you fucking kidding me? You haven't even had breakfast yet. 2 hrs later, we finished breakfast, and she says, "Ohhhh...I want another creampuff..." =(
So I say, "...what... you want one of mine?"
"Can I?"
"Sure.. go for it"

So she goes straight to the fridge and takes 1 of mine, so now I have one left.

Had to go home, but forgot to bring the last cream puff with me. When she comes back to her house after dropping me off, I texted her, "Yo what's up?"

She replies, "Oh not much, got home. Had another cream puff" 
[z.e.r.o   l e f t)
author: Frankie W.

description:
This is definitely a perfect way to end a busy day of Christmas shopping. We spent the better half of the day pushing, shoving, waiting in line, carrying shopping bags, and doing our part to stimulate the economy. After all is said and done, we head down to the food court to grab some delicious magical pastry puffs before we head back home to sort our shopping loot. 

It's not a matter of "Should we stop and buy one?" or "Is this fattening?" and definitely not "Isn't this just like any other cream puff?", but the real question one has to ask themselves is "How many should I order?"

We step in line waiting patiently for our turn to order the yummy gooeyness protected in light fluffy pastry. The special flavor of the day was Green Tea. We ended up ordering a few chocolates, regular ones, and some green tea's. We sat down to eat one before we bring the rest home to share with others. All I can say is.... YUM. 

The crunchy and spongy outer pastry shell gives way to the vanilla cream custard awaiting inside. The delightful fluffy gooey goodness blends perfectly with the pastry. Nutritional values are thrown out the door when eating these things. Just keep telling yourself the three miles you're gonna run to burn these bad boys off will be well worth it.

Enclosed its a picture of my Green Tea puff!
author: Leo C.

description:
Not sure if I'm writing a review for the correct location. I went to the one in westfield mall in union square. 

To my HUGE disappointment they didn't make the eclaires here :[ Pretty much a regular cream puff dipped in chocolate. Instead we ordered a regular old vanilla cream puff.

It didn't disappoint it was very tasty and a great pick me up after walking around SF all day. They fill the cream puff with a lot of cream so get ready for it to explode (add sex joke here) and to make a huge mess while eating it. 

A little pricey though... I think it was almost $4 for one cream puff. I'd still buy one but not regularly, has to be a special occasion :]
author: Gabby N.

description:
This place is just plain ol' awesome. My mom brought some home once, and I've been in love with it ever since. 
The puff pastry is a bit on the crunchy side, and it provides a perfect contrast to the BEST FILLING EVER. I'm a chocoholic, but I'm not too keen on the chocolate filling here. It's not as smooth as I'd like it to be. The strawberry filling is awesome also, and they make it with real strawberries! :) But you just HAVE to try the vanilla. They fill it up when you buy it so it's still cool when you eat it, and the shell doesn't get soggy.  like to get the eclair shell with vanilla filling.
I have to say, I'm addicted.
author: Edna H.

description:
Ladies and gentlemen, we are proud to announce Miss Britney Spears as our new company spokesperson...

"Hey y'all, I wanna dedicate this song to my Kaballah goddess...

Papa, I know you're going to be upset
'Cause I was always your little girl
But you should know by now
I ain't K-Fed's baby

You always taught me right from wrong
I need your help, daddy please be strong
I may be young at heart
But I know what I'm saying

The one you warned me all about
The one you said I could do without
I'm in an awful mess, and I don't mean maybe - pleeeeease

Papa don't belch, I'm in trouble deep
Papa don't belch, I've been losing sleep
But I made up my mind, I'm keeping your cream puff, ohhhh
I'm gonna keep your cream puff, mmm...
OK, y'all...I'm outta breath...Justin? Justin...where are you?"

Even if Britney made a comeback with this commercial, I'm not sure who would be worse for the wear...her or my ass? Like I said over a year ago when I tried one at their first SF outpost in Yerba Buena Lane, it's not decadent enough to feel guilty about and not tasty enough to take hold of your palate for very long.

The filling is custardy with a hint of vanilla unless of course, you get chocolate. The whole tasting experience is just generic not to mention a huge spillage disaster waiting to happen. I'm not sure if they are keeping up the momentum to be the next Krispy Kreme. In fact, I don't think Krispy Kreme is keeping up the momentum of Krispy Kreme. But as long as people buy them, I guess they'll be around. I've had a total of two cream puffs over fourteen months apart, and I think I can truly say I'm over them. 

"Daddy, daddy if you could only see
Just how good it is to be pimping these
You'd give me your blessing right now
'Cause I'm still a star, I'm still a star, so pleeeease...

Papa don't belch, I'm in trouble deep
Papa don't belch, I've been losing sleep
I made up my mind, I'm keeping your cream puff, ohhhh
Oh, I'm gonna keep your cream puff, ooh
Don't you stop loving me, Justin
I know, I'm keeping your cream puff..."

Oh yeah, here ya go....http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-fkCIUzTZlY

FOOD - 2 stars...still a yawn 
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...the little kiosk that could...chug-chug-chug
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...efficient for sure
OVERALL - 2 stars....oops, I did it again!
author: Ed U.

description: Awesome for a quick snack. Got the cream puffs. Really fresh. Definitely will come back.
author: Dan L.

description: I don't care for you Beard Papa's. But my partner loves you and that's all that's matters. I bring home Beard Papa and everything is good. The world is in a better place. He forgets about his weight and is in bliss. Beard papa I love your euphoria. I don't eat you, but you bring on good things.
author: Marck N.

description:
I'm Vietnamese, so frozen cream puffs, flan, Heineken's and che are a must for dessert. I've probably had a cream puff from every bakery I ever been to but Beard Papa's cream puff are the best I've ever had! 

They are soooooo creamy, it just melts in your mouth. The cream is chilled, creamy and not overly sweetened. It's not like other creams puffs where you feel like your eating synthetic cream. My favorite would have to be the original vanilla and the chocolate. I love how they fill the puff, right in front of you when you order it. 

While waiting in the long lines, I often imagine myself hopping over counter and putting my mouth on the cream machine and injecting as much vanilla cream into my mouth as possible. A girl can imagine can't she?
author: Ha N.

description:
cream puffs: 4/5
service: 5/5

Beard Papa's is a chain that planted itself everywhere in the bay area over the past several years. They specialized in cream puffs. They have some set cream filling flavours such as vanilla and chocolate but also some rotating ones as well. Always fluffy and yummy. They also have one with a crunch cookie topping.
author: Cecile S.

description:
Mmm... Beard Papa. I have a love-hate relationship with Beard Papa. I hate how the sweet smell of puff pastries wafts up and into my store and makes me drool just thinking about the creamy custard oozing out of its shell. I hate that I am forced to buy half a dozen. I hate the feeling of guilt and regret after eating all 6 in one sitting. 

But in the end, I love Beard Papa. I love that they opened a second store only a block away from the first one because they knew that I would be too lazy to leave the mall. I love that I can actually get a cream puff within my 15 minute break. I love that the cream puffs are filled with cold custard because it tastes so good that way. I love that once I eat a puff, I feel like a giddy little kid. Most of all, I love that Kristina R. can find so much amusement from mocking the way I eat these delectable desserts.
author: Connie C.

description: First time ever eating a vanilla cream puff at Beard Papa's. Apparently from all of the reviews this is something that you must try if you're in San Fran so what the heck. It was tasty!! I highly recommend pairing it with a cup of Peet's coffee which is right next door.
author: Mr. G.

description: Love the service I get every time I come. They always have a smile and their cream fillings are the best I've tried. After a long walk in the mall, I would go and stop by for a cream puff there! Usually prefer the cookie crumble and love all the flavors of filling (especially coffee).
author: Victoria L.

description:
I like profiteroles. I grew up with my mom occasionally baking cream puffs at home. She would either fill them with thick custard or scoop ice cream into them. I'm not fond of the filler custard/cream they use here. It tasted too flat and not very rich. The consistency and texture of the actual pastry was very good. Crisp on the outside, with a perfectly al dente chew to it. The "eclair" versions are dipped in chocolate. Beware of trying to eat and breathe at the same time. You'll end up with a lung full of powdered sugar!

And yes... I just gave away my identity. I'm the asian chick whose inhaling these little suckers with no shame... with the filling dripping down my chin and my boyfriend looking on in horror at the glutton he's dating.
author: Vicky L.

description: I've tried all the cream puff flavors and I still keep coming back for just the vanilla. Actually, I thought the chocolate and green tea was kind of unappetizing and very artificial. If I had to pick a second, I'd choose caramel. And stick with the cream puffs. The other pastries just aren't as good.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Ohhhh cream puffs! I remember falling in love with Beard Papa several years ago when they were all the rage in NYC. I've had them several times before in SF...this time I actually remembered to yelp it...

We tried the carmel, green tea, chocolate and vanilla. I especially liked the chocolate.  The carmel was a little disapointing but others raved about the green tea and vanilla.  My NYC memories of cream puffs were that there were small, lift and airy.  These are BIG, dense and heavy. Good for a treat,
author: Lea G.

description:
Vanilla cream puff with a cookie crumble crust.

Available for a limited time. Why are you still reading this? Go!
author: Jason B.

description:
BEARD PAPAS. I love the cream, sometimes it's not evenly distributed though (some have more than others)

Tip of the day - eat them fresh! The pastry gets a bit soggy after a while if you are bringing it to another location.
author: Jennifer J.

description: These cream puffs are fantastic.  I tried the plain with vanilla and it was great however my puff of choice is the sugar cookie topping with caramel filling.  It is the perfect way to satisfy my sweet tooth.
author: Cori R.

description:
You can smell their cream puffs baking the moment you walk into the shopping centre.

I was really impressed with their neato projector menu. I was also happy to see that they decided not to limit our choices here in the mall to just vanilla or chocolate cream puffs anymore -- they brought all of their goodies from the fabulous yerba buena location over to the mall.

I like everything except the cheesecake stick, the crust is a bit soggy and the cheesecake is bland.  And it's a measly little thing like a kit kat bar. 

The winners are the eclairs, strawberry cream puffs, pumpkin cream puffs, and the chocolate lava cake.
author: Stella C.

description:
Since already proclaiming I'm not a cream puffer, I decided to give Beard Papa's another go...this time with their Cheese Cake Sticks ($1.25) and their Fondant Au Chocolat ($2.25).  (I don't really like Eclairs either.)

I was excited...anticipating that I would finally find something at Beard Papa's that I would enjoy eating too.  When asking the cashier if there was a 'molten' center of the Fondant Au Chocolat, she confirmed there was.  I guess in my wishful thinking, I would hope they would have heated that baby up!  Well, the Fondant Au Chocolat had some soft chocolate in the middle, far from being molten though.  It was just there, some soft chocolate stuck in the middle.  It tasted average.  I was holding out on those Cheese Cake Sticks, begging them to be worthy.  And they were just not that great.  It fell apart almost immediately!  

Sad to say, I don't think I will ever be ordering another one of those Fondant Au Chocolat or Cheese Cake Sticks every again.  

So, why do I still bother with the two stars?  Because i know that I will continue to make visits to Beard Papa's just to fatten up my boyfriend!  He's looking too good these days!  Haha!
author: Teri C.

description:
Beard Papa is known for one thing, their fantabulous (is that a word?) Cream Puffs.

I think this company has completely sold me on coming back for more cream puffs until I one day become a cream puff.

I had the regular cream puff with a vanilla filling. My wife had the chocolate glazed puff with a vanilla filling. I found the chocolate puff a little too rich. I enjoyed the simplicity and subtlety of the plain puff. My puff also had some sprinkled powdered sugar on top for a little extra flavor. The cream was wonderful, it tasted fresh, with bits of vanilla bean in it. 

The great thing about Beard Papa is that the puffs are made fresh and once you order they fill them up with the creamy filling. They are pretty liberal with the filling also, so expect a lot of it when you get to the middle. You can also get a chocolate filling or other flavored fillings if you desire.

Beard Papa,  a 5-star joint that excels in its signature item. Can't wait to go back for more!
author: Sunny D.

description:
I won't lie, their plain cream puffs are pretty solid. Just the original one. I can't remember since it's bee so long, but either the chocolate eclair or chocolate cream puff here was disgustingly sweet and a little too decadent for me, and that's saying a lot.

Personally, I don't even consider this place when walking through the food court looking for a snack. I'd rather go upstairs for sweets at CocoaBella.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
This is a great place to stop by for a quick sweet snack. Its best to eat it fresh, but in case you need to bring it on the go, it is still worth it. 
My personal favorite is the strawberry. They change the flavors weekly be sure to try all of them! 
-SFCG
author: Mike H.

description:
Remember what the guy did with the fresh baked "apple-pie" in the movie "American Pie"? 

Well Matt bought one of those creamy puff pastry from the newest Beard Papa in the Westfield Mall; so he hurried home, locked the doors and injected his "YOU KNOW WHAT" inside the hole of the heavenly creamy pastry. It felt SO GOOD!
author: Matt G.

description:
Yesterday, an acquaintance surprised me with a vanilla Beard Papa cream puff.
 
He is now my new best friend. 
 
Behold the power of the Beard Papa cream puff.
author: Amy C.

description:
Oh how I love you.
You are so cold on the inside.  
And so moist.
So delicious and lightly sweet on the outside.
Slightly crisp too.
And yet when you are gone, I am sad.
Because I miss you already, and want more.

Hard to stop at one.  But, you gotta do it, or else it'll lose its appeal.  I've almost had three in one sitting...before I realized how much my heart would hate me...so I stopped at two.  

I love their vanilla creme!   Their green tea is okay... I'd stick with the original flavors--vanilla and chocolate.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Have you ever had a frozen creampuff? Take that experience, multiply it times about 10 and make it fresh. That's what's going on at beard papa. 

I stumbled in there not knowing a what a cream puff was and discovered their carnival of cream puffery. With four different flavors and at least three shells, I got lost in the majesty of all 12 combinations. Finally, I decided on one. Then got five more. To share of course. 

My friends dug into the cream puff pandemonium with the fervor of sharks and chum and within minutes, there were crumbs and lumps of cream everywhere. It was like a porn was shot on a dirty breakfast table.  Yes, I went there.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Stop it. Like now. These cream puffs? BOMBIES. 

Only get the Strawberry Cream Cookie Puffs. It is the biddddnesss. 
Light. Tasty. Gotta have it. Promise.
author: Monalisa M.

description: How do you not stop at a place called beard papa?  I got the standard cream puff with chocolate.  They fill your puff with whatever cream you want with a few squirts of their contraption and you're off.  Not going to lie, I wasn't crazy about it, but I let it sit until I got back to the hotel near SFO via Bart.  When I bit into it, it seemed a little less creamy than I would've liked but all in all, it was a new experience.
author: Jamarcus T.

description: Cream puffs are made freshly on-site. Hold on, let me rephrase, cream puffs are freshly stabbed on site... yes literally stabbed. There are three machines that you can use to poke a hole on the puff and puff in the cream. Cool. Don't know why it was the funniest thing ever when we saw cream puffs being stabbed.... lol still. So silly, but yes, fresh and delicious, eat it right after a lunch at the food court, or when you are hungry after extensive shopping at Westfields. Also try slim thin slice of tiramisu - an unique shape, and  yes the coco powder will spill everywhere and make you look bad in front of date, and yes it almost choked me a bit. There's also the wrapped-like-a-long-piece-of-candy cheese cake stick... also bizarre. For your safety and less adventurous soul, try the cream puff first, it is a really good one. Vanilla is a classic, also green tea ones with limited availability
author: Dilys S.

description:
I first had my beard papa experience 5 years ago in Hong Kong and I immediately fell in love with that scruffy old man in his yellow outfit. I didn't even have to taste the goodness to know it was going to be an oozy delicious episode in my life. Just walking within the vicinity got me hooked.

When I heard they opened their first store in NY, I was about to book a flight over. I emailed Beard Papa's US contact and begged them to open one in San Francisco. Years passed and I finally heard from a customer that they were opening on in SF! (One of the perks of working at the Department of Building Inspection ... you know what's going to open before anyone else!)

I took a day off from work when they first opened their store. Stood in line and bought 4 dozen of the original to share and spread the yumness with my friends. ... 

I gave 5 stars to the other SF store, but just 4 to this one in the mall. I think its because it is in the mall, the staff just isn't as friendly and the open air doesn't confine the fresh smell of creme puffs in the atmosphere....

but still MMMMMM good. :-)
author: Lauren Y.

description:
I discover this place while searching online for noodles the night before, and find many raves about their cream puffs. I also discover that there is one next door to the hotel, so it's a convenient treat.

I cannot imagine what anybody in the US sees in these.

Perhaps it's due to the Asian population in SF that this chain has flourished, but my first bite of the pumpkin cream puff is the most disappointing dessert moment since the time in Japan that I bought a big pastry and found it was filled with red bean paste. The filling has barely any flavor at all, and is not sweet. Hoping that we got a bad batch of pumpkin, I bit into the vanilla and it was similarly flavorless. I certainly get cultural differences when it comes to the preferences of seasoning, but these were ridiculously bad. So bad that, after having a bite and confirming that Loria wasn't really feeling adventurous, I threw the rest of them away.
author: Ryan C.

description: Like usual, I was craving for dessert. Since we were in the food court area of the Westfield Mall, I decided to get some Beard Papas. I actually never tried it before but I remember my cousin would bring Beard Papas to our family parties and by the time I would get one, they were all gone. Now every time I go to a family party, everyone would always ask if I could get some Beard Papas for them. Haha. Anyways, I got the special flavor of the week, which was mango, and vanilla. My friend kept telling me maybe mango would taste weird but honestly, I like anything that has to do with mango. First bite I took of that mango cream puff, I was in heaven. I seriously couldn't stop eating it LOL. It's really messy to eat but so nomz! I guess I'll be bringing some Beard Papas every time I go back to my hometown. Haha.
author: Janice V.

description:
I don't know why I am just now tasting these little poofs of heaven!  

Nevermind the fact that hubby and I inhaled the Mother's Day chocolates form Cocoa Bella I got for my Mom.  (She had plans with my brother and his family - so I get her next week, I can buy more!)  

I ordered 2 vanilla cream puff's.  One for my hubby and one for me.  
They didn't have a box so she put them into a double bag. 

I wasn't going to eat it until I got home (in Livermore) but a 10 Car train came and I lasted until West Oakland.  I had the whole train to myself.    

Gollum reared its ugly head "My precious!"  

It was still COLD! And so light! The pastry nearly melted in my mouth with the touch of sweetness of the little powdered sugar that was sprinkled on top and then the creamy, sweet custard was delicious!  Almost like creme brulee but without the hard sugar topping. 

It was perfect. And SO cheap!  
Next time I will order a box full!  maybe for a party or something!  

The other one is there for hubby...if I remember to tell him its there.  Otherwise, I'm having it for breakfast.
author: Erika G.

description:
Beard Papa needs to adopt me and then get me a personal trainer.

I never thought I'd find myself paying over $2 for a giant calorie-busting cream puff, but I've heard so many good things about this place.  I was skeptical; how could a plain old cream puff warrant so much praise?  I grew up baking with my cousin who is professionally trained in french pastries and we would make cream puffs by the dozens (so I'm a bit of a cream puff snob).

I went to Beard Papa with guarded, but high hopes.  I got  the classic vanilla cream.  It is an enormous, donut-sized cream puff.  The pastry is light and airy with a hint of crispness outside.  The filling is cool, creamy and has a wonderful vanilla bean flavor - smooth, yet light, not too heavy or egg-ey tasting.

As I ate the entire thing, my guilt and visions of running on the treadmill, slowly melted away and I gave into the sheer bliss.
author: Catherine W.

description:
Ewwww this one is no where close to being as good as the one in Hollywood!!!  I remember the bread at the Hollywood Beard Papa's to be soft and the cream puff practically melted in your mouth.  This one was very cold and chewy.

The line was super long because I went right after the mall had opened. Totally overrated!   I had the one of with the chocolate cream which is basically a cream puff with chocolate pudding.

On the bright side, this food court is pretty nice!  It has more gourmet fast food type places.
author: Shannon L.

description: I love beard papas! Their cream puffs are always delicious! I like to always try their special flavors, just because they're different and always changing. My only tip is to eat the creampuff immediately. If you wait too long, it gets soggy.
author: Steph U.

description:
$2.25 for a cream puff? Not another expensive item that I will have huge disappointment. 

Luckily I ordered the one vanilla cream puff half filled. There was as usual way too much cream but at least the cream was light and airy. I hate to see what happened if I ordered a cream puff regularly filled.

The puff was supposed to be lighter than the cream but it was dense and heavy, especially around the edges. Another day of food disappointment, lucky me.
author: Pete N.

description: Best cream puffs ever. Wish they had more flavors instead of flavors of the week where you just hope to get lucky.
author: Sophia K.

description:
Oh Beard Papa.

Here's a nice little treat yourself place after working out hard and eatting healthy for the past 2-3 weeks, you deserve at least 1 cream puff right? =)

The regular cream puff for vanilla or chocolate will do the trick, I tried the cookie crumble whatever, hmmmm, not so much.  Other than that, the standard cream puff, chocolate or vanilla is a winner.

Thanks Beard Papa.
author: Edrian D.

description:
Having just stepped off busy Grant street munching on a pineapple custard bun from my favorite dim sum shop and coerced into the new mall housing the flashy glitzed-up Bloomingdales, I made a stop at the Beard Papa because my friends were raving about the cream puffs.

Being cursed with a sweet tooth has its close rewards and retributions.  

a.   I know how to make the choux pastry
b.   Knowledge indeed is power, hence my hesitation

I was pleasantly surprised when the cream puff was a nice cross between buttery soft breading that revealed the secret filling of rich creamy custard.  Most cream puffs are too crunchy or too chewy, with the surprise contents being too thick or mediocre as cool whip.  Unfortunately, I was able to consume the entire puff on top of our Italian meal in North Beach as well as my bun from Chinatown.

French pastries usually make me incognizant of fullness  ;o)
author: Miika M.

description:
This one seems to carry the harder to find "green tea" flavor.  I don't care if it's ten thousand calorie per piece.  Or that the wait is longer than I spend in most of Westfield's stores.

These creme puffs are a like a tiny slice of heaven, but better because there is no judgment.  Also, for me....1 seems to do the trick.  Granted, I do inhale it.  The best way to eat a Beard Papa creme puff is to dive right into it  with no worry or care about the creme getting all over your face.
author: Helen F.

description:
I fell in love with Beard Papa's cream puffs while studying abroad in Japan during high school. I remember the soft vanilla dangling in my mouth while I was chasing after the next train home. I remember collecting cans along the way home to save for sweets that my host mother never packed in my lunch box. Yes, I was saving coins and counting yen, for cream puffs and candies. 

Beard Papa's classic vanilla cream puff is delicious. I love the freshness of the vanilla and the smoothness of the cream puffs. The shells are nice, gentle, and soft. 

When I saw Beard Papa's in Los Angeles, I was ecstatic. I bough an entire box home for my mother. Years later, I learned that Beard Papa's opened in the new Westfield Mall in SF. 

This location can get a bit crowded, but their cream puffs are just as great. They also sell other small pastry items and a few cafe type drinks here and there. Every week there is a new flavor of the week. Cream puffs are a bit pricey ($2.25 each), but the price point goes down when you buy half a dozen or a dozen. I wish I bought the Groupon recently even though it wasn't for this location (a 50% of the usual price for a dozen cream puffs). 

My favorite flavors are: classic vanilla, green tea, and chocolate. My favorite snack before going on the BART train.

Takes credit card.
author: Tina C.

description:
Holy Cream Puff Batman!! Sooooooooo good!

I saw these little puffy gems from a mile away at the Korean BBQ place. My boyfriend's mind was on BBQ chicken, me? I was already drooling over my future dessert!

The cream inside (no dirty jokes, please) was the perfect texture, vanilla flavored with a hint of actual vanilla bean. The cookie like dough surrounding the creaminess was crisp, light, and doughy all at the same time. Perfect combination.

If I wasn't eating with the bf's parentals, I probably would have scarfed down another dozen....and would not share. I only got one bite...that was NOT ENOUGH! Now I crave them.

Open in Sacramento - FOR THE LOVE OF JESUS!
author: Rachel Z.

description: Best cream puffs in the city--bar none--loaded with lots of creamy filling. My favourite is the vanilla but I am also a fan of their mango and strawberry filling when it's available. $2.25 for a regular puff. $2.50 for cookie crunch and $2.75 for chocolate dipped puffs.
author: Kwoky L.

description: The cream puffs were amazing to say the least. I make it a point to get some everytime I go to the city. The green tea cream puff is the most unique. All of their cream puffs taste fresh and are made with quality ingredients.THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!
author: Chai S.

description:
I love Beard Papas.  I have eaten these cream filled jems from coast to coast. 

The tiny Asians who fry, bake, toss Asian pixie dust love on them....they are ALL my people.  

East meets West...meet my belly.  NomNomNomNom...
author: Laura G.

description: I wouldn't call myself a cream puff conniseur but I think beard papas are pretty darn good.....so much so that I wouldn't mind driving 7 whole miles across town for them. We tried to be safe by going with the originals vanilla and chocolate and you cant go wrong with them. Who knows, maybe when I'm in the mood to be daring I will try the green tea one..
author: Zaynaf S.

description:
Not too crazy about it.  It's good, but not amazing.  I've had better cream puffs and eclairs before.  

Also - their cream puffs are too big!  Portion control wouldn't hurt.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Yummy cream puffs in a fast service environment.  Even if the line is a little long, it goes by fast so by the time you know what you want to order, you're up at the counter already.  

I ordered their original with vanilla and one with strawberry fillings.  The strawberry filling one had little bittie chunks of strawberries in them.  And both the vanilla and strawberry fillings were of a good consistency, not too sweet nor too bland.  The vanilla won over the strawberry one.  It was just right.  When you bite into it, theres tons of creme in it that it comes oozing out on the sides of your mouth so be careful.  It amazes me how with two pumps into the puff, they're able to fill it with so much creme.
author: Shong H.

description:
Yes, beard papa creampuffs for breakfast, i couldn't have spoiled myself any better! I was recommended by yours truly Deanna to stop by and let's just say that I am thankful. :)

I couldn't decide what flavor to get so I got the flavors of the day... Coffee and Vanilla. Both were very good but I heart the vanilla completely. The puff pastry was very light and airy and the vanilla custard has perfect sweetness. Although it was alot more custard than I wanted, but I didn't mind at all. i'm not sure if i'm a messy eater or if it's really messy to eat a huge cream puff with overloaded custard, but i made quite a mess.  

now with this new addiction, where am i going to find this in atlanta??
author: Karly G.

description:
ok...cross that one off the bucket list....I had my first Beard Papa cream puff today....omg...I so get what all the long lines are about!

I went for the classic eclair (chocolate topped) with the vanilla custard....YUM...eye balls rolling back YUM!

I was trying to be kind...and generous...and actually split my cream puff with my husband....then instantly regretted it! hahahaha!
author: Nina B.

description:
You've never had a better cream puff or eclair.  I personally guarantee it.  

I just returned from San Francisco, and I'm so glad they don't have one of these on the East Coast.  I'd gain 50 pounds instantly!  The cream puffs are heavenly.  The outer shell is a double layer crispy, flaky, powdered sugar-coated booby trap.  You're not going to eat this in the car.  Order up, grab some napkins, and take a seat.  

When you burst through the shell, you find it's thin and hollow.  Inside is the most delightfully fresh cream you have ever had.  It's not too light like pure whipped cream, and it's not heavy like a custard.  It's right there in the middle.  Personally, that's where I want it to be, and I didn't even know this until I visited Beard Papa's.  

The freshness of every ingredient is evident in that first bite.  The cream has been chilled to perfection, and I dare you to try and taste anything but all natural ingredients.  There are none.  It's pure heaven.

Go there.  Now.
author: Brandon R.

description: The concept of Beard Papa is SO GREAT, but I just felt like the taste wasn't up to par (I didn't even finish mine!) I love cream puffs, but these tasted a little stale and the filling wasn't sweet enough for me. Probably won't be back...
author: K. D.

description:
YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM!!!!!  Their cream puffs taste absolutely amazing!!!  The outside is slightly crunchy and the inside is SO smooth. I've tried just about every flavor they've got and I've never been disappointed.

Warning: They are EXTREMELY addicting.  I bought a dozen for my family, and ... they never got to try them =X.
author: Pia V.

description:
Having lived in SF now for three weeks, I'm still going through the honeymoon phase with food here, trying anything and everything I can get my hands on. Slowly but surely, my waistline and my wallet are showing for it. Food is expensive here, and it's disappointing to find things you think might be good but just aren't, or are OK, but you knew that back home you'd pay far less for it. 

I had seen all these raves about Miette's macarons, so I tried them, and yeah, they were good, but for $1.75 each, I could have drowned myself in a box of Little Debbie (insert your favorite here) for the price of one. Yeah yeah, artificial flavors and preservatives, blah blah.. I get that, but does anyone really eat ANY dessert because it's supposed to be good for them?

Just when I thought I'd given up on the idea of getting an awesome sweet treat for an affordable price here, I wandered off the BART at Westfield, and into the open arms of Beard Papa. I was a cream puff virgin, and baby, Beard Papa was about to rock my world. 

The cashier recommended the Vanilla Bean cream puff over all others, and when I took my first bite, I knew that I was whipped, and Beard Papa was going to make me its bitch. The slight crunch from the crust made way for the most amazing filling; light but still somewhat rich and creamy, super smooth with flecks of vanilla bean interspersed throughout. Sure, it was messy, but trust me when I say that all manner of decorum will go out the window and you'll be licking your fingers clean. I don't know what cream puffs are like anywhere else, and I don't want to. For my money, this is the best $2.25 I've spent since I've been here.

Miette has been blowing up my phone ever since our date at the Ferry Building, but I just can't go back. It'll never be the same again. We had our time. It's Beard Papa's name that's all over my Trapper Keeper now.
author: Josh J.

description:
The cookie crunch cream puffs are very good (see my photo), and extra crispy on the outside.  I don't recommend the regular cream puffs; they tend to be stale and soggy.

However, the cream puffs are still not as good as the ones at Satura Cakes in Palo Alto.
author: Scott F.

description: If you're shopping and just want a little treat, Beard Papa is the best. They serve these amazing cream puffs filled with chocolate, vanilla, or a featured flavor. When I was there the featured flavor was green tea. My mom, my sister and I all had a cream puff and we all had a different flavor. I had chocolate, my sister vanilla, and my mom had green tea. The chocolate was decadent. The vanilla was sweet, yet smooth and the green tea was refreshing. Its a small stand but these cream puffs pack a punch. Nom, Nom, Nommmh!!!
author: Reena R.

description:
Yup....sinfully good puff's. 

Always fresh & delish ..... their cream puff's are a treat, leave it to the Japanese to improve on a product or concept and make it global:  

http://www.muginohousa.com/index.php

A bakery in the Westfield Mall, with fresh puff's ! Who would have thunk?
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Damn, old man...you make a mean cream puff!! If you've never had a cream puff from Beard Papa's...sucks to be you!!

On a regular, they have vanilla bean and chocolate. On a weekly basis, they rotate between caramel, green tea, pumpkin, coffee and strawberry. My personal favorite is the vanilla bean. Kinda odd for me because I find vanilla to be, well, um, boring! Not these bad boys, my friend. But remember, they're vanilla bean, not vanilla...HUGE difference! So light, so airy, so yummy. I haven't tried any of the eclairs or the cheese cake stick. I don't really have any plans to either since my heart belongs to the cream puffs.

Whenever I'm in the shopping center, I always try to pay a visit to my bearded friend. I suggest you do the same :o)
author: Christine P.

description: Ah- mazing! Great cream puffs and cheesecake sticks, large sizes and reasonable pricing. You won't regret king here:
author: Zari Z.

description:
I don't know what was up with the cashier, but she was definitely an angry robot. No smile, no nice vibes...I'm sorry that you are having a bad day, but no need to treat your customers like your burdens. Just remember you are a representative for Beard Papa's. 

As for my cream puff, the green tea cream was okay. I could taste the green tea in it, but thought it would taste better less sweetened. I didn't like the puff pastry, so I ate the cream by itself.
author: Anisha G.

description:
I'm chewing on a strawberry cream puff as I type and it has decided for me that today is the day, Beard Papa must finally be yelped.

There's usually a line at the mall, but it moves quickly. I've only ever seen the same one guy at the register and he's a machine. 

$2.25 gets you a sloppy little fluff of heaven. Whatever flavor you choose, bite carefully, try not to squirt cream everywhere, and don't be afraid to lick your fingers clean if you do (you will). No one will blame you.
author: Dani A. C.

description:
Fabulous!  LIke a little bite of heaven!  I've had cream puffs before.....but NOT like these!  The out side has a delicate crunch of light as air puff pastry....and inside is delicious, smooth custard.  I always hated custard.  It was a yolky, jelloish mass of yellow junk that only old ladies would eat.  
I love it when a place does one thing.... perfectly!  And at only 228 calories per cream puff....... I don't feel so bad having two!
author: Bryan M.

description: To be honest, I didn't really like the place. I mean just a simple but large creme puff with some sprinkles. More dough than creme in my opinion.
author: Nikita K.

description: The Cream Puff here is pretty darn good! It's not the absolute best ice cream, but it's pretty darn tasty =)
author: Joe G.

description:
By far the best cream puffs I've ever had. They're HUGE!!! ...and definitely not like the cream puffs from Costco or Safeway (or any restaurant at that). 

They have different flavors; Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry, Coffee, Green Tea and a couple of others that I'd probably not try anyway (but that's just me). Ultimate fave cream puff there is the Original Vanilla. The Eclairs are also on hit. It's basically an original vanilla covered in chocolate. 

The Fondant Au Chocolate is good too! Basically, it's a single serving of a chocolate souffle. Much better when warm! 

The Cheesecake stix are pretty good too (if you eat it right away).
author: Resa N.

description: Not a great fan of the cream puffs but the chocolate fondant was pretty good.
author: Gopi V.

description:
I love these cream puffs. I generally don't like food that is too sweet, and cream puffs often are soggy, saccharine, and filled with a runny cream. So when my then-boyfriend told me I had to try these puffs a few years ago, I was a bit hesitant to try.

But these cream puffs are perfect! They are never soggy, because the puff shells are empty and fresh until ordered. When they are ordered, they are then filled with whatever delicious cream/custard you have chosen. 

The puff shell is a wonderful texture, flaky, not too dry, and not oily like a croissant but more like a puff pastry. It's the perfect non-sweet canvas for the delicious sweet cream that fills the puff. 

The sweet custard/cream is not at all saccharine or too sweet and is a delicious, light, fluffy consistence. I've only tried three flavors, because I always stick with my favorite, vanillla, but the chocolate and green tea are pretty good -- just not as good as the vanilla. The green tea powder on the green tea puffs, though, sometimes can be bitter. Just a small warning. 

Can't wait to try more flavors! The eclairs with vanilla cream are the best for an extravagant treat in between just eating the regular vanilla puffs. :)
author: Anh D.

description: Been coming here to get their cream puffs for awhile now. They change flavors every week but I believe it is just a rotation of 5 flavors. To this day, have yet to have one. It is nice having them right next to MUNI so one can purchase it and head home.
author: M C.

description:
For $4.37, I got one of their classic cream puffs with chocolate cream filling.  Mmmm it was really good!  The cream filling is gooey but not overly sweet.  They inject the puff with filling right in front of you.

The puff itself is pretty big, about the size of my fist.  I couldn't eat lunch after eating it.  

It's also pretty messy, so best savored while sitting down with a pile of napkins.  

The cafe itself is small, there's not much place to sit or park.  They offer a variety of pastries, in addition to cream puffs.
author: Bee M.

description: Beard Papa's is at the Emporium at the lower level of the SF Westfield Mall. I wasn't feeling all the other food choices - the choices are plentiful but they're all overpriced and still mall food nonetheless. I was craving something sweet, and I got a chocolate eclair with chocolate cream filling. It's kind of costly and dinky, at more than $2/eclair (it's cheaper to buy at least 6 for $11). The chocolate eclair part hit the spot. The chocolate cream wasn't impressive - I much prefer the regular cream filling. They get 3 stars because it's good, but not impressive for what you pay, and also for being a popular chain store. There's nothing particularly special to it. At least at the downtown LA location you can people watch and it's cool bc it's next to the Kodak Theatre. This one is just in a mall food court, albeit a humongous mall.
author: Phoebe C.

description:
Papa, 

You're a wily one. With your cute little beard and that bright raincoat yellow beanie that awakens the child inside of me. Your come hither look. That strategically placed pipe--you know about my oral fixations. Papa, you're everything I hoped you'd be: Delicious. You left me wanting more. But alas, I could not afford you for more than one night. One. Delicious. Night. 

One day, when I can justify spending $2.25 on something I can eat in 1-2 bites, I shall return for your cream-filled balls. 

Adieus, 
Kristine
author: Kristine W.

description: The puffs are simple but delicious.  The real secret is their fillings.  The cheese cake sticks are mediocre.  Worth a visit.
author: S R.

description:
BEARD PAPA'S MANAGEMENT PAY ATTENTION!

I am a fan of beard papa's cream puffs and I enjoy the light crisp and semi-sweetness of its filling.

So why the one star you may ask?

On this day, AUGUST 1ST at approximately 6:45pm, I was serviced by a rude, obnoxious, incompetent blonde haired employee who is not only ill-mannered but was by far the worst trained employee I have ever encountered.  

She took the order with the worst attention for customer service and looked frazzled at that.  She completed the order quickly and forgot to give a bag to hold the order or napkins to go with it or a thank you... (and mind you NO ONE was in line). 

 I mean come on?!?! I'm sure they teach you the basics in training and if this is honestly what your hiring standards are, then I question what employees you are churning out, because this representation is unacceptable. I have worked as a Barista and I know a thing or two about customer service.

Come on MANAGEMENT, do something!

I refuse to come back here.
author: Steph Q.

description:
Maybe the thought of cream injection led us right here after stopping in at the Good Vibrations.

Strawberry was the weekly special and we had that. The thing I really like about their cream is that it doesn't leave that teeth grinding sugariness in your mouth afterwards. It really just melts in your mouth with no guilty aftertaste.

It's a little hard to eat though. The form factor of the puff is such that everytime I dug my face into the miasma I kept emerging with cream on my cheeks and the tip of my nose. GF licked it off right then and there though, cos she's cantonese and cant let anything go to waste.
author: Henry Y.

description:
Chocolate puff with vanilla filling!! The best

My Nevada cousins loved it and became addicted so we came everyday while they were still in town
author: Veranna N.

description:
I love Beard Papa's cream puffs, but I was appalled that this location refused to give my friend a free sample to try.

I have to say the service is going downhill here...I've been here before and they were nicer about stuff like that. 

Really, I want to give them 1 star for the service and 4 stars for the cream puffs. I guess it kind of averages out at 3 stars.
author: Ted W.

description:
The long awaited strawberry flavored cream puff has made its rounds and it was back this week when I casually strolled by. (I always tend to make it a habit of just "passing by" to see if strawberry might be the flavor of the week.). 

5 stars for the strawberry flavored cream puff alone (fresh puree pieces of strawberry and ice creamy tasting goodness) 

After trying strawberry, I don't think i'll ever go back to the original vanilla flavored cream puffs anymore. (Okay, maybe only at Beard Papa's and it has to be vanilla Crunch)
author: Tracy T.

description: First time trying cream puffs and I LOVED it!!! Best place ever will so recommend it
author: Rosa A. F.

description:
It's been a while since we've interviewed the Asian Cajun, so let's see what she has to say about Beard Papa's!  

MH:  So, is it true that you've eaten a dozen cream puffs in the last two weeks?
AC:  Indignation...!
MH:  Well, here are two receipts, each for a half-dozen -
AC:  Exaggeration...!
MH: Oh, did you share these with other people?
AC:  Confirmation...!
MH:  Good - I was beginning to worry about your tendencies toward excess.
AC:  Cadet consumption!
MH:  Yes, he's quite the voracious eater.  He must have eaten the majority.
AC:  Incorrect information...!
MH:  What? You ate most of them?
AC:  Ele-von...!
MH:  I don't think human beings are supposed to eat that many cream puffs.  Ever.
AC:  Misconception...!
MH:  Aren't you worried about the health risks of eating rich food in that quantity?
AC:  Vascular constriction...
MH:  Exactly!
AC:  *shrug*  Taste bud satisfaction...!
MH:  You should have your cholesterol checked, young lady.
AC:  Mortification...!
MH:  Clearly, you're trying to comfort yourself with this recent binge.
AC:  Over compensation...!
MH:  Were you not loved enough as a child?
AC:  Ridiculous speculation...!
MH:  Then, what could it possibly be?  Look deep into your soul and be honest.
AC:  Pastry cream addiction...!
MH:  Really?  *smirk*  Theirs is mediocre at best.
AC:  No contestation...!
MH:  You cook, you bake - why not just make your own pastry cream?
AC:  Time and preparation...!
MH:  Don't take this the wrong way, but I think this habit is not productive -
AC:  Desperation.
MH:  If the crappy pastry cream is the draw, why buy the cream puffs?
AC:  Stable transportation...!
MH:  You mean, the pate a choux is just a way to eat the pastry cream???
AC:  Astute observation...!
MH:  Let's try some positive imagery and focus on not eating 6 cream puffs at a time.
AC:  Refuse cooperation...!
MH:  Are we going to have to get Dr. Drew  involved in this?
AC:  Intervention...?
MH:  He might say your rate of pastry cream consumption is unreasonable.
AC:  Not an addiction...!
MH:  Okay, so you're consenting to a second opinion by a professional?
AC:  Misquotation...!
MH:  I want to help you, Asian Cajun, but you're in a complete state of denial!
AC:  Okay, okay - cessation!
MH:  I'll be your sponsor.
AC:  Contractual obligation...?
MH:  No - you have to commit to change.
AC:  Confusion...!
MH:  Is that powdered sugar on your lips?  Are you rubbing your gums?
AC:  Gingival stimulation...!
MH:  Unbelievable.  You're stubborn, ridiculous, impulsive and illogical.
AC:  No argumentation...!
MH:  When is the last time you had your cholesterol level checked?!?
AC:  Vague recollection...!
MH:  You exasperate me to no end.
AC:  Complete reciprocation...!
author: Kim D.

description:
Yummy cream puffs! Sister was in SF shopping, so I had her pick up some.
- chocolate
- coffee
- vanilla

I wanna try their green tea & cheesecake sticks next time !
author: michelle h.

description:
My only regret was not trying Beard Papa's when I was in Hong Kong (that is where I first encountered the chain). The Hong Kong one definitely had a variety of flavors not made here but I digress. 

Where have you been all my life Beard Papa? Your flaky and delicate creme puff and creamy rich filling make my life complete. Now, one suggestion I have to make it better. If you could only toast it for a little bit so that it's a warm pastry with warm filling, I bet that would be an absolute delight to everyone that enjoy your tasty treats. Or maybe I'll just be a fatty, buy a dozen and stick them in the oven.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I never got the big deal over Beard Papa. When we would come to SF from Berkeley, and before the westfield location opened up, we'd always have to go to the one in Yerba Buena and pick up a dozen to bring home to various people who wanted them.

Fast forward 2 years later and I finally tried one. Wow, these things are HUGE and so much better than the ones my aunt claims to make (i know they are just the costco ones with a fancy sauce on top).

I like chocolate and am always hoping I pop in when green tea is on rotation, but I recently had my first vanilla bean puff and I gotta say...I think I like that better than chocolate!

A dozen of these also makes me instantly liked when I bring em to work.
author: Katies F.

description:
In college I'd stop here on the way home whenever I had a bad day because Beard Papa's is right next to the Powell BART station and these cute little profiteroles ALWAYS makes me feel better. Six of them, to be exact. That's how many I buy at a time.

The flakiness of the pastry is done just right. And the custard is Beard Papa's selling point. Sweet, but not too sweet. Thick, but not too thick. Eggy, but not too eggy. 

I'm a vanilla bean kinda gal on most days, but when it's Green Tea Week at Beard Papa's I'm totally a convert. I always make a mess inhaling these little puffs of perfection and end up with a suspicious powder mustache, so I have to eat them in private.
author: Trinity G.

description:
Their cream puffs are amazing! I try to make it a point to stop here whenever I'm shopping downtown. My favorite flavors are the strawberry and coffee. Sadly these 2 flavors, along with 3 other flavors (caramel, pumpkin, and green tea), are weekly specials. When these 2 flavors are unavailable, I opt for the chocolate cream puff. When you're eating these, watch out for the powder sprinkled on the top. It can make you have a coughing fest if you're not careful.

Individual cream puffs are $2.25 while a half dozen goes for $11 and a dozen is $22. You can mix and match the flavors to go crazy with it!
author: Justine O.

description: I purchased 1 plain cream puff with vanilla filling.  I intended to share half of it with my best friend, buuuut.... I kinda ate the whole thing.  And 3 days later I went back and bought a box of 6.  They're really good.
author: Amanda J.

description:
I love cream puffs! And walking through union square this is one of my little temptations. 

This is honestly too close to the bart station...i can't help myself.  There are seasonal flavors like strawberry and green tea, but i'm still a firm believer that vanilla bean is a classic. It a rather large cream puff, at least to compared to the asian version, but has a fresh pastry and a decadent filling.

always puts a smile on my face
author: Justin N.

description:
OMG, I love cream puff!
This store satisfied my obsession of cream puff.
author: Chow P.

description: This is by far, one of the best cream puffs I've ever had.  Suprisingly, the strawberry one is a lot better than the original.  Dont go for the chocolate. As much as I love chocolate, i hate to discourage people from getting it. I might have had a bad one but definately do strawberry!
author: Andy P.

description:
YUM YUM YUM YUM... how much I love you Beard Papa!  I have been known to say that I don't mind being a little fat if I could have a cream puff everyday for the rest of my life (obviously this wouldn't be a good idea health wise).

You just can't go wrong... a flaky, fluffy puff filled with the delicious filling our your choice in the middle.  YES it is messy, but it is fantastic!

The the only complaints I have is that the line can tend to be very long (during lunch and after work hours) and some of the servers seem unhappy to be working.
author: Monica W.

description:
I am well known by my friends and family for finding great places for a lot of different types of deserts. If you like light, airy, not too sweet cream puffs this place is for you. 
My fav is still the classic vanilla bean cream puff and I cannot pass one without picking up at least half a dozen. No, not just for me I share a few of them. LOL
I have introduced several of my friends and family members to Beard Papa's and they have all fallen hard for their cream puffs.
If you happen to find yourself near one try one I highly doubt you'll be disappointed.
author: Jewel R.

description:
Their cream puffs are always scrumptious. whenever I get one, I like how they're made not too sweet or soggy, it's a perfect delight!

Definitely recommend this one :) It's that awesome :)
author: Pierre B.

description: At 9am in the morning, eh. I ordered the original with the green tea cream. It was luke warm, but definitely not cold. Not a huge fan of warm cream.
author: Jess W.

description:
After chocking up a kazillion steps around Bloomies, I was in a deep need for sugar and coffee. But it's 9pm.

Perfect for some Beard Papa's cream puffs, right? Either I was weak or the sales girl was strong. But she did an upsell on me to get half a dozen.

Later, around midnight in the comfort of my sister's kitchen, I'm thinking, Sales Girl was right - I needed to do the half dozen ;p
author: Anne Q. T.

description: Went to Beard Papa's on a recommendation of a friend based on the fact that she knows I love everything sweet and savory. So I went and ordered my puff chocolate with vanilla custard paid my $2.50 and recieved my treat. Then upon eatting it I discovered that it was one of the best things I had ever eaten in my life. The cold filing with the pastry I was SOLD. If I lived in San Francisco I would weigh much more on account of this place and Cako. I wanted to take some home with me but I thought that they would not travel well or I would have. I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Enough said. Wait I wonder if they cross country deliver.
author: Cris F.

description:
For $1.75, you can eat cream puffs that are out of this world delicious!  I prefer milkier, lighter cream puffs that are more on the custard side of tecture as opposed to the lighter, puffier creams used in "cheap cream puffs."

These world famous creme puffs are the greatest I've ever eaten.  The service is amazingly fast and efficient.  Even with 8 people in front of me, the wait was minimal with the fast, efficient service here.

This is a great pastry place.  

Warning:  They offer 6 for $11 specials.  I advise against that because the friendly person at the counter indicated that with refrigeration, they only last a day.    This is because they use fresh products with minimal preservatives.  This means a fresh tasting non-processed puff that is heavenly.
author: Tony U.

description:
By far the better of the two Beard Papa stores in San Francisco.  Even though it is in the food court of a mall.  Peh.

Filled fresh, every time.  The shells still have crunch, and don't taste like they have been sitting out too long.

Still, I am waiting for that first Beard Papa experience of getting my cream puff when the shell is warm, and the cream is cold.  And the contrasting textures, flavors and temperatures all meld together in an otherworldly experience that makes me forget how many calories I just inhaled in 5 bites, and one lick.

Is that too much to ask?  Or maybe it's just like heroin, and it will NEVER be as good as the first time.
author: Daniel B.

description:
The vanilla creme puff is soooooooo good. Once you bite into one, your mouth is having one heck of a party. The creme is light and delicious.

Be sure to have an exercise regime as you consume 220 calories of goodness. @_@
author: Jackie S.

description:
AYE Papi!  Beard Papa has it going ON!  His cream puff has me coming back for more.  Slightly pricey, but hey the cream is freshly squirted into your vacant puff right after you order your flavored cream.  Tell me where can you get cream puffs that fresh? I love the Eclair with custard or vanilla cream.  

Can't wait for the Beard Papa's to open at Oakridge Mall!!!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Allow me to share an anecdote. Today I was at the mall, craving a Beard Papa cream puff because really, why not?, but I was stuffed. I did, however, notice their lamps are nothing but large creampuffs! Look up the next time you order.  My sis and I hiked it outside in the rain only to land in a yellow taxi cab driven by none other than...a bearded papa in raingear.

The puffs taste really good, and are a bit warm. I'd only had the frozen Costco cream puffs, so this is a new concept - room temp cream puffs! But anyplace that SPECIALIZES in cream puffs can't be bad. 

There are a variety of fillings, and you can get chocolate or sugar on top. Careful, this stuff can get messy.

Enjoy!
author: Em L.
