description:
Yumm Cream Puff villed with Vanilla.   

According to the cover has a 24 hour shelf life in the fridge.  So it must be consumed expediently if you decided to buy the 6 pack.  

Anyway it was good.   Olivia seems to just like the cream inside and calls it ice cream.  I'm not going to argue with her.   I'll probably have to point out eventually there is a lack of ice in this cream.    Just as long as she devours it without complaint is fine by me.
author: Homer S.

description:
Curse you beard papa for making the mall stink in the morning like old custard!

That aside, Beard Papa is a tasty treat, but it is just not as good as Japan. They are so much better there! What the heck?
author: Nikki M.

description:
What can I say about Beard Papa's?  I'm addicted PERIOD!

Just check it out for yourself!  You'll see!  You'll be addicted to Beard Papa's too!  I've been trying to take the weight off for months now!
author: Yvette O.

description:
GREEN TEA CREAM PUFFS. 

The absolute gem from this Japanese chain that's found its way to America. It's their special flavor of the week, around once every 5 weeks. And they're absolutely divine. Filled last-minute so the puffs aren't soggy, with a light airy creamy filling that's oh so delicious, and I can lie to myself that the antioxidants in the matcha powder are good for me! Be careful on holidays because they could be selling out faster than they can bake them.

Note that street parking is not easy to find near the Contemporary Jewish Museum and Metreon where this little shop is located, and there is very limited seating available. And if you're chomping lustfully with green cream ooze dribbling down your chin and green powder tinting your lips in front of the store, people are bound to look at you funny.
author: ChiYan T.

description:
If one day you decide to rebel and get a cheesecake bar (tiramisu flavored), make sure you aren't also wearing black.

Disaster in the making.  Imagine eating a cheesecake stick while walking around with a thin layer of cocoa powder all over your black top.  JUST NO.  

Taste-wise, stick with the cream puffs.  Deviation is not always a good thing.
author: Lydia W.

description: I went today and got a chocolate creampuff because i had heard so many good things about this place.  I made the mistake of taking a deep breath in as I took my first bite and then I almost choked on the powdered chocolate that covered the creampuff.  But that was my mistake.  The creampuff I got was$2.25 and it was totally worth it.  It wasn't quite as amazing as I expected it to be, but I would totally go back and I still think it deserves 5 stars.  I also liked that the employees spoke Tagalog.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
You go Beard Papas, you go!

I loved Beard Papa's and though this one is a bit out of the way from where I live, it's actually pretty nice.

1.) Amazing seating
2.) Friendly and efficient service
3.) Marks the difference between different creme puffs (but I'm sure most places do this)
4.) Clean! Nothing is a bigger turnoff than a dirty place that serves food.

5 stars for you Beard Papas. No questions asked! (Well, maybe just one question. How did you become so amazing?)
author: Jessica H.

description:
I heard stories about their great cream puffs... but did I dare try one of the Papa with the Beard's cream puffs? No... to me, it was too expensive. 

Luckily, as my cousin, my brother, and I walked around Westfield, a person doing surveys stopped me and asked if I wanted to fill out a form. When she told me about the $5 gift card I would receive I quickly said yes! 

After I got the gift card I spent it on 2 cream puffs for me and my cousin. Man... was that a day to remember. Taking a bite of their vanilla cream puff was like biting into a firm croissant that wasn't as flaky but was filled with cold cream erupting with vanilla flavor. Best of all, it was free, and free things always taste better. 

These aren't like the cream puffs you get at Costco. These are huge and fresh. They also are just filled to the max with thick cream. It doesn't get any better than this. 

Next time I stop by Westfield I'm gonna get another one except this time I'll probably have to whip out the dough. I want to try their other flavors. They all sounds so delicious! The bearded man for the win in the cream puff category!
author: robin w.

description:
The name is funny, but the cream puffs are oh-so-good.  As with In-N-Out Burger, the geniuses behind Beard Papa know to keep the menu short and simple.  This is the recipe for success.

My favorite is the chocolate dipped eclair, filled with vanilla custard.  It's light and not too sweet.  I hope to visit sometime when pumpkin is the featured flavor.  Does that mean I have to wait until next October?  Oh, the agony!
author: Raina S.

description: Definitely worth a trip to a busy mall food court for the best cream puffs anywhere.  The shell was crisp on the outside with tender pockets of air on the inside.  The vanilla pastry cream was simply amazing.  Thanks to Reggie M. for the recommend.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Um....this is as good as it gets when it comes to cream puffs. I mean, BP really nails the cream puff market with it's variety and selection. Now, I'm not a cream puff connoisseur...but I do know what I like and it's Beard Papa.

The nice thing about their cream puffs is that they are sweet, but not overpowering sweet, and I think that's the standard of what most dessert places are trying to emulate. Sure it's pricey, but:

a) You're in the mall...everything's pricey
b) There's a high demand, they can get away with charging more

If you've read this far and are still doubting the place....just look at the other ratings!
author: Alexander M.

description:
I am not a huge cream puff fan, believe it or not, but these little puffs of joy totally rock! I stopped in to get a bunch for my coworker's birthday & was happy to see that green tea was the special flavor this week. I ordered a few vanilla, a few chocolate, & a bunch of green tea cream puffs. I love how you can watch them being filled right there. Then they sit them upright in a box & they look so cute & yummy! I could hardly wait to get back to work for the birthday celebration. 

Everyone seemed to like them including the birthday girl who doesn't like things that are too sweet. Somehow these cream puffs are not overly sugary. They actually taste more like pudding inside rather than cream. I first tried the green tea which was awesome, then 10 minutes later I had to try the chocolate. I couldn't resist! 

Now I know why all those people are always gravitating towards Beard Papa in the mall!
author: Erin S.

description:
If you're in for cream puffs, this place will give them to ya.

If you're not, don't come in :).

Of the puff,s the chocolate dip is my personal fav, and I can't recommend the sugar cookie puffs.

Overall pretty good, but pricey.
author: Francis U.

description:
Everytime I'm in Union Square, I made a deliberate effort to see their flavor of the week! This place is so amazing, that it even makes my boyfriend sarcastically jealous that something as simple as a cream puff could be so euphoric [: Life's not fair, sorry men.

Be sure to check their website for their weekly flavors! I've only tried strawberry and mango, but the fillings are delectable. The pastry is light yet slightly crispy, the filling has bits of real fruit and is ridiculously creamy. The worker doesn't fill the pastry until you order it, so the pastry remains crispy and not soggy. A little pricey for what you get, but one is enough for the nightly dessert crave. 

I'll be trying the cheesecake bars next time!
author: Bonnie X.

description:
Beard Papa is such a cute name!

The vanilla cream puff was yummy! It can be a little messy to eat though.  I like how you can watch them fill the puff up with the cream.  Mmm Delicious!
author: Traci D.

description:
Ah, cream puffs!
Tried the vanilla, chocolate, and mango filled cream puffs and vanilla was definitely the best!
Even after I lugged these across town for an hour to where I was staying, they were nice and flaky with the generously overfilled, tasty custard inside.
Good for when I'm having a sweet tooth but don't want to sugar crash from something like macaroons.
author: Teena S.

description: The best cream puffs I've ever had! I usually get vanilla bean filling and it's sooo good. Their cheese cake sticks are delicious too!
author: Fallon P.

description:
Everytime I come to San Francisco to shop or visit relatives, I usually make a stop here just for the cream puffs! My favorite flavor is the vanilla, and I haven't tried green tea, but chocolate is pretty good as well. They have a special where it's buy 5 get 1 free :) A dozen cream puffs for under $10 is a great deal.

Tip: Get cream puffs and bring it over to Ajisen Ramen, Then eat the cream puff after finishing your bowl of ramen. Great combo :)
author: Karina C.

description:
BBEEAAARRD PAAAAPAAAASS! What would I do without you? I work in the mall, so lucky me, its right underneath me =D. 
Im giving this place 5 stars on their original with vanilla and their cheese cake sticks. I HAVENT EVEN TRIED ANYTHING ELSE YET AND I ALREADY LOVE THEM!!
Although i do have to warn you!! DO NOT INHALE WHILE TAKING A BITE INTO THE CREAM PUFFS! Lol (theres loose powered sugar on top)
author: Ellie W.

description:
Three small words for you:  Double Chocolate Eclair.

For those of you freaks/aliens who are horrified by the idea of chocolate, their regular vanilla cream puffs and their occasional seasonal flavored puffs are good as well.  Just.. not as good as the double chocolate eclair.
author: Tori S.

description:
A new transplant from the east coast, I'd never heard of Beard Papa's before.  But since it's quite nearby, read up on Yelp & had to give it a try.  After reading so many high reviews, I was starting to get a bit nervous... what if I was opening a Pandora's Box that'd result in me gaining 5 sizes?  And yet, I just couldn't resist trying!

Got a standard vanilla creampuff, figuring it best to start with the basic.  The employee was very friendly, & it is sorta cool watching them put the cream in the puff.  But I wasn't blown away at all; more like a combo of disappointed (in the creampuff's meh-ness) & relieved (that I wouldn't have to take up marathon running to balance a new addiction).

The pastry shell is ok.. flaky, but kinda bland, & lacking in the tender texture inherent to really luscious fresh pastry.  The filling was cool, smooth, & creamy, & had specks of vanilla.  But it didn't have much flavor; Handi-Pak puddings from the grocery store honestly have more.  

I don't get all the fuss.  If people think these are so amazing, my mom should totally open a bakery out here; she'd give Beard Papa's what-for!  ;)
author: Rebecca M.

description:
When I first came to San Francisco, I was advised to try out the cream puffs from this place. It took me sometime to find this place, but it's actually pretty accessible. Upon getting here around 5pm, there was a short line, but it moved pretty quick. I had never had cream puffs before so I was curious as to how they tasted. As for selection, there's a variety of flavors you can choose from but generally vanilla and chocolate are available, with others like coffee or green tea depending on the day of the week. 

I bought one of each of the ones available at the time- vanilla, chocolate and coffee, and watched as each of my cream puffs were filled up with the appropriate filling. The first time I bit into a cream puff, I felt like I was in puff pastry heaven. The outside was just the right texture- not too crunchy, but not too soggy. The filling was sweet, although a bit overbearing. I hungrily devoured the others and felt very satisfied. I ended up going back and buying half a dozen for the housemates I was staying with.

Needless to say, this was a very pleasant experience. The cream puffs are worth the money and the wait, cause this is located in a mall. The only qualm I have with them is that the cream filling can get a bit messy at times so you'll just have to use a couple of napkins just in case. This review is more for the food than location as I'm sure there are better locations around, but still, I was happy with the cream puffs here.
author: Justin H.

description:
First off, I would like to say "damn you!" to Beard Papa's for making such an awesome creampuff.  Unfortunately, I am watching what I eat these days so I can't overcome the guilt of eating one of your delicious treats.  

Yes, they are expensive but they sure do taste good :)
author: Patrick V.

description:
+ cream puff perfection!
+ creamy filling, flaky shell
+ it's gigantic!

- the original is the best -- much tastier than the chocolate-flavored one
author: Dana W.

description:
Best cream puffs I've had (aside from home-made ones)!!! 
They are delicious and fresh, and made perfectly, the filling isnt too sweet, and just perfect and the dough is super yummy!!! Everyone needs to try these!!!!

They arent cheap, but totally worth it. (about 10 bucks for 6 cream puffs)
author: Nika G.

description: I really like the food court at the Westfield mall and Beard Papa's is must have for me whenever I go there.  The cream puffs are to die for! Does not matter what filling they have. I really like the strawberry and chocolate myself. They are very light and fluffy. You can try out the other items that they have on their menu like the Fondat Au Chocolat and know that they are going to be very good. Keep in mind that they taste good when they are fresh. I have taken some to go a few times and they get soggy and not as good later.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I first saw Beard Papa's at the Americana in LA but for some reason I forgot to get some before I left. I was at Westfield shopping and remembered there was one downin the food court so I couldn't pass up this chance to finally try these famous cream puffs. 

I ordered half a dozen, three each of the cookie-crusted and original in the vanilla bean filling. When I think of cream puffs I think of overly sweet fillings but the filing in these cream puffs were not too sweet at all, they were just perfect! The cream puffs were flaky and the filling was so smooth and creamy I couldn't get enough it! Now that I've tried them, I will definitely be making stops here whenever I'm in downtown. Delicious!
author: Tracy Y.

description:
Five stars for the cream puff with vanilla.  I like the flakey texture, and the vanilla filling oozing out of all the sides.

One star for the cookie crunch with green tea.  Nothing was right about this.  NOTHING!

Three stars overall.  Next time, I'll know better on what to order.  Note that this can get very, very messy.  Do not try to eat this and walk down the street like I did...
author: Jenny L.

description:
Cheesecake that isn't so bad for you? Too good to be true! The Tiramisu Cheesecake is sooo heavenly delicious.  And it's on the lighter side as well so you won't have to run that extra mile after you eat one. I think I inhaled a piece in less than 0.5 seconds. If you are wearing a white or black shirt, be careful because the powder will get on you.

Their cookie crunch creme puff is delicious as well. I forgot how much I miss Beard Papa's and now will make an effort to buy a whole box each time I'm in the city.
author: Betty D.

description: YUMMY!  I love cream puffs and usually make my own.  Happened upon this place by accident and glad we did.  We tried the salted caramel cream puff.  I am still craving it.  Will be back when we return to SF.
author: Rae G.

description: SO. Freaken. GOOD. AHH! love this place!! can't wait to go back and buy myself a dozen..yes a dozen!! homegirl can eat! LOL
author: Soumary A.

description:
I don't even know what to say..just eat them. They're delicious and you'll want to eat as many as you can get your hands on. 

The basic flavor and basic puff is delicious, but they get seasonal ones (pumpkin/coffee) that are great too. 

Puffed up: quick, cheap and yummy. 
Deflated: Can't be healthy for you..so stick to one.
author: Sarah K.

description: Pretty damn good. Anytime I am in the area, I get myself a cream puff and I'm on my way.
author: Armina A.

description:
I can't end a day of intense shopping without one (though I usually promise myself I would lay off sweets for the new outfits--forget that!) I'm in love with the cookie crunch puff with strawberry filling. I wish they were more generous with the filling though...
My friend and I couldn't stop thinking about the opening scene in Modern Family..."honey, look at the baby with those cream puffs." haha
author: Hana J.

description:
Nothing spectacular.  I guess I went in with high expectations since everyone was raving about it.  I bought a box of the vanilla cream. Its light and airy but the crust tasted premade.  Everything was just ok.

I'll give the other flavors a shot the next time around.
author: Sun T.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE
ever since I saw them open on the news, i've been hooked.
It's great during anytime of the day and always fulfills my cravings for sweets.   

Ive tried every flavor, and im pretty sure the chocolate filling is my favorite :)
author: Acilegna T.

description:
If I had to choose between Beard Papa (I almost typed "Big Poppa" haha!), and Liliha Bakery, I would choose Beard Papa. Beard Papa's are light, fresh, and airy. It's cleaner, too. 

Their cookie crumble crust with chocolate is super good. Also, every week they have a special flavor--try them all!
author: K. E.

description:
Best cream puff ever!  I enjoyed all three flavors; green tea, chocolate, vanilla.  I wish they were in my town in michigan!
Mango madness is also awesome --- lot of mangoes with milk plus ice! It's perfect for summer.
I will stop by at Bread Papa's whenever I'm in town (again)!
author: Jay A.

description: God this shit is addictive. From the delicate puff pastry to the filling inside, I'm pretty sure they've laced these damn things with meth or cocaine. All I wanna do is a zoom zoom, just shake your puff!! - Thats what is going through my mind when I walk by a Beard Papa. I don't know why but it makes me want to rub that cream all over and end it with a happy ending.
author: Henry W.

description:
Karl: I ate some Triscuit crackers in the car, you should have had some.

Eric: Well, maybe if you told me they were delicious Triscuit crackers I could have enjoyed them with you.

Karl: I'm sorry.

Eric: Well, "sorry" doesn't put the Triscuit crackers in my stomach now, does it Karl?

Having low blood sugar will make you do strange things, like starting off your reviews with more Billy Madison quotes. 

It will also make you think that it's absolutely fine to eat more than one cream puff per sitting. You must try the vanilla and the chocolate - in that order - to have a full Beard Papa experience. 

The fact that this location can be accessed right off Powell St Station makes this place entirely too convenient and an unavoidable part of my daily commute. A cream puff for the road, please!
author: Michelle B.

description:
It could've been 4 stars, but WTF NO COFFEE SERVED THERE?

Beard Papa in Japan is very different - first off the pasty is super hot and the filling is nice and cold. Here everything's a bit regulated so it's more on the cold side. Plus, back in Japan they're almost always near a train station. :D So it can be consumed super fast before boarding that train.

I usually just get a plain one with the regular custard filling. I'm not a fan of cream puffs and I'm still not, but if I want a sugar hit I won't be saying no to one.

I like the location of this particular BP because it's in the basement of the Nordstrom Center...and you really get to choose what kind of food you want. I'm always amazed at the turnover there.

Good and consistent cream puffs all around the bay. :)
author: Carina M.

description:
Strawberry.

That's it.  If they don't have the strawberry, I'm not getting one.  

Not that the others aren't good.  In fact, I really like the vanilla.  It's just that the strawberry is so good, the others simply can't compare.  I know I'll be brushing the powered sugar off my lap, thinking about how much better my cream puff would be if it were strawberry.  I've also tried the green tea.  Definitely sticking to strawberry.

Make strawberry a standard flavor instead of a "maybe" flavor and it's five stars, no question about it.  

Actually please don't do that.  My waistline will suffer.
author: Krystal K.

description:
My sister introduced me to this place and ever since then, I got hooked. The only thing I secretly laugh at in a good way is the little Beard Papa with a yellow beanie hat and his pipe. Shouldn't he have a cream puff in his face? 

Well anyways, I do enjoy this little place.  I really like the size of the cream puffs because it fits in the palm of my little hand. It's not over-dosed with too much powdered sugar, meaning it doesn't look like a powdered donut and the custard filling isn't too sweet for me.  It really pleases the cream filling feeling when I'm feeling creamy sweet...such a really great treat!!!  There are other choices than the original, which I prefer to buy.  They have chocolate filling and éclair type cream puffs with chocolate on top and custard filling. 

I'm really glad you've expanded to LA.  I've been to the one in Hollywood and recently they opened one by my place.  Goodness, this makes me want to go get a cream fill for the tummy =)
author: Pilar B.

description:
Simply irresistible!
Its sugary and eggy aroma that spreads throughout the food court never fail to lure me every single time!
I have tried them all: chocolate, strawberry, vanilla (original), green tea, caramel.  But Green tea and strawberry flavor will always be my fav~
So, Why are they so addicting,  you may ask? 
The strawberry filling gives a hint of tartness to offset the fattiness of the sweet cream.  You can also see tiny specks of fruit throughout.  Ohh no no no no!!,  it is not the evil imitation/ artificial stuff... 
Also, the overflowing sweet creamy filling that encased in the slightly crunchy Pâte à choux shell, messy to eat (for me), and the carb-filled guilty pleasure......the ULTIMATE food porn! lol
author: Cathy C.

description:
All I have to say is, Green tea cream puffs...

Make sure to schedule an appointment to your local dentist right after
author: Jason N.

description:
I can see why they have made such a big fuss - the giant puffs are not so common here in the states. Taiwan is way too influenced by Japan and therefore folks at my generation pretty much grew up with these puffs - you can easily get them in any super market. 

Chocolate Eclair is over-rated, too. I think it loses the original French vibe into the taste. I had better in some authentic French restaurants/dessert stores.
author: Penfan S.

description:
I think I'm physically incapable of passing by a Beard Papa store without suddenly veering over and buying one and stuffing it in my face. This past Monday, we were at Bristol Farms and Peet's buying afternoon drinks -- caffinated for the adults, carbonated for the kids. While my husband was buying us some coffee at the Peet's, I asked my family if any of them wanted a creme puff -- NO ONE else wanted one. 

??!?!? 

Still undeterred, I bought one for myself. Luckily, one of my sons had pity on his mommy and shared it with me, so that I wouldn't feel like such a porker all on my own. 

Creme puffs go VERY well with black Peet's coffee, incidentally. And I should be thankful that there isn't a Beard Papa close to where I live or work.
author: Patty W.

description:
I love Beard Papa's because these aren't technically CREAM puffs: they're filled with custard.  Lovely vanilla custard surrounded by a light and fluffy pastry shell and dusted with powdered sugar.  Really, they're delicious.  I also like the chocolate-filled ones.  Their eclairs are topped with actual chocolate rather than ganache, so the topping shatters when you take a bite.  

I first had a Bear Papa cream puff when the location opened in San Francisco, before they offered anything besides the original vanilla cream puff and I loved it.

I still visit these stores down in Los Angeles because most dessert places down here are ice-cream related or donut shops, and sometimes I just want that custard!!
author: Katharine H.

description: Website said they closed at 8, got to the store where they had a sign posted saying they closed at 6...it was 5:00 and they were closed. Lame.
author: Leah T.

description: I came here and got the chocolate lava cake with a cup of hot green tea. The cake was delicious. The chocolate filling was wrong and delicious. The bread was soft and tasty. The tea I got was way too hot though. But either way I would definitely come back for more yum!
author: Tanya C.

description:
clean establishment.  fast & friendly service.  delicious puffs.

deliciousness!  this is much better than any cream puff you can buy in the frozen section at Sam's Club.  the ability the choose your filling is DIVINE!  if you have a chance to try BP, please do!  if coffee filling is available, don't pass it up!
author: Jan M.

description:
How could a store that exclusively sells cream puffs get anything less than 4 stars from me?  

I'm glad I don't live closer to Beard Papa's, because things could get ugly for me.  With Yerba Buena right across the street, it's easy to stroll in and get a cream puff for yourself (or two, or three...) and waddle across to the park to lay down and have a blissful cream puff-gasm there.

I take away one star because Green Tea cream puff is much, much better in theory than it is in practice.  Aside from that, though, Beard Papa is a kind and gentle man who will lead you delicately into a state of sugar-soaked serenity.
author: Lauren S.

description: Hands down, the best remedy for an aching sweet tooth.
author: Arianne N.

description: Ive been buying from this location for 2 yrs and ive always been happy with the service until today. There used to be filipinos who worked there but today it was a different crew. I asked for 4 chocolate cream puffs but realized that i meant eclairs and changed it right away. The girl with long hair and glasses said "but i already rang you up" and i was like ok. Then i said "cant you just charge me the difference?" And she said "you wanna pay for the difference?" And i said yes. Does she think im just asking it for free?! Then she said after charging the difference, next time say eclair instead of cream puff so we dont get confused. It's not my problem if you're confused or just lazy to charge me the difference. Great customer service would be to see what you can do to make the customer happy instead of nit caring because it would inconvenience you! Then when the guy was giving me my order he gave me vanilla and i said i ordered chocolate. Then he said "so you want chocolate?" I think wanna be like what's wrong with you people?! You cant understand simple request or instruction? Worst service ive evr had in this location! So freakin' rude! Before telling me what to do the next time maybe you should learn some good customer service first!
author: Yankee T.

description:
I really love cream puffs, and it seems that Beard Papa is always a safe bet.

I was pleasantly surprised that the ones I bought here tasted very similar to (only _slightly_ worse than) the ones I used to get in Shibuya.  I still think vanilla (original) is the best one of the three flavours they offer.

The cream is kept cool and has a consistency closer to pudding than cream.  It has a strong aroma and vanilla, but does not taste sweet.  The shell is crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  It's amazing.
author: Bill T.

description:
I've been here a couple times in the past few weeks and maybe once or twice before.

Pretty good cream puffs. From best to worst, including some of the weekly flavors:

Caramel, vanilla, chocolate, green tea.

I challenged my friend to eat 10 of them and I would pay if she finished. She politely declined.

They're messy to share, so get your own. ;P
author: Kenny J.

description:
Consider the following by-no-means-exhaustive list:

author: d s.

description:
I decided to kick off my summer training program at Beard Papa.  

Stop it!  It's MY training program.  You can design your own if you want.  

Course 1:  Vanilla cream puff.  I knew from experience the cream was gooey and would try to sneak out the cracks on all sides.  I forgot that the cream puff would crumble in my hand.  Keeping alert, and watching for cream, I forgot and took a breath through my mouth.  Full of powdered sugar.  Trying not to turn blue, I managed to keep from choking and blowing powdered sugar all over the table.  At the end, less than a teaspoon of cream in the paper wrapping.  No powdered sugar on my face, hands, or jacket.  Score!  

Advanced Challenge:  Double chocolate eclair.  "Ha!" I thought.  Hard dark chocolate cap, no problem!  Slightly larger than a cream puff, it started crumbling in two places at once.  Holding it together, I watched as the dark chocolate cap melted in my hands.  At the end, there was chocolate all over my fingers, and it wasn't coming off with the napkin.  

I felt so naughty.  This was like playing with sex toys in public.  I had to get that chocolate off, so I headed straight for the restroom, trying to hold my briefcase without touching it.  The joke was on me.  

Vanilla cream puff:   $1.75
Double chocolate eclair:  $2.25 
Wash up in the restroom afterward:  free

Somewhere, someday, there will be a Beard Papa pastry eating contest.  I must practice more, to build my technical advantage.
author: David D.

description:
I just don't care the Totally Immitation Euro lookin' FXXXin' JAPO Crap!
I just don't care that Mediocre-Japo-Shit.
Japanese Immitation of French Classic!
Making immitation has been one of the Japanese tradition and Japanese are supposed to be good at it.
Immitaion thing must be better than the real thing!
But this cream puff screwed-up badly.

I still like French Classic kind.
I would rather eat Man-Ju, Dango and An-Pan.

So, who did FXXX the Beard Papa?
Hairy Mama? Or Mister Clean?.... Shit......

The cream puff wasn't great, it's OK, So So.
So, What makes this place so special?
Nothing special!
Maybe my expectation was too big.
I don't know.
Maybe I was disapointed badly.
I don't know.
But,
I have to Thank the Beard Papa for one thing.
It is true that I was a bit excited like a kid when I was in the line to get the thing called cream puff.
In Japan, this whole dessert is called "Shu~KuRe~Mu (shu~cream)."
My gf said, " That sounds like cream for shoes!"....Kata-kana always makes the English-sound very strange.

Yes, I was a small Nobu-Chan for 5 minutes in the line.
I was thinking and waiting in the line to get a "Shu~KuRe~Mu" that I had when I was kid.
 
But, the cream poff SUCKS!

2 star for brought back my SWEET memory.
The logo reminds me a bit of Miyazaki's "KiKi's Delivery Service."
author: Nobu K.

description:
Close friends and acquaintances of Lulu P know NOT to mess with me when it comes to my food.

On my first visit to Beard Papa's, I found myself frought with indecision as to what to get.  And I was distinctly miffed when my shopping partner said,

"OH I DON'T WANT ANY, JUST A BITE OF YOURS WILL DO."

So, I ordered up TWO of those heavenly creations (ALL FOR ME).  One chocolate cream puff and one pristine vanilla, less ONE BITE for a distinct non-believer in Beard Papa.

Outside on Market Street I started with the chocolate and gave my companion the promised ONE BITE.

To which he wrinkled up his nose and said, "Oh.  I don't care for that much."

So then I said "Ok, here.  Try the Vanilla.  They're supposed to be unmentionably good."

And then we started walking . . . 

And then I realized . . . He wasn't giving the vanilla back anytime soon.

Me:  HEY!  WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!!!! YOU SAID ONE BITE!

Ahole: SOOOO?  What are YOU gonna do about it?  
*holding vanilla cream puff over his head*

Me:  YOU SAID ONE BITE!  YOU'D BETTER GIVE IT BACK!

Ahole:  *gives look of defiance*

My eyes narrowed and I launched a smattering of cream all over said offender's face.

JUST ONE BITE, MY ASS.
author: lulu p.

description:
Vanilla bean puff.

Cream in my mouth...

(so good)

and now in my pants...
author: Keane L.

description:
Everyone in my office is on a diet. It's actually pretty annoying, mostly because everyone is going to the gym after work instead of driving me home. Fucking assholes. I'll give them another month and then I'm MUNI-free again because they'll have given up on their New Years resolutions and be skipping the gym in order to drive me home, stopping for a martini on the way.

Soooo... Beard Papa. Our assistant has decided that these cream puffs make the best birthday cakes, so we got more of them today. I'm usually a chocolate fan, but I like the vanilla cream puffs from here better. They're tasty. Sweet, but not too sweet. The pastry could be a bit better, but it's pretty good. 

But with all these fat fuckers on diets, they're not eating what they should be eating. And so there are 4 cream puffs sitting across the floor from me, just taunting me. And Lord knows I have no self control. So I'm going to wrap this up now and go throw them in the trash can of the mens room. And try not to go back in there to fish them out.

By the way, the manager told our assistant that they are going to start DELIVERING!
author: Suge K.

description:
I have a well documented fetish for Vincent D'Onofrio, the tall drink of water most  known for playing The fake NYPD's hottest (and most well read) cop, Det. Bobby Goren. But, it wasn't always this way. I used to find Det. Goren's know it all ness and odd way of communicating to be incredibly annoying and I would always skip CI's long, convoluted plots in favor of lighter fare, like say, SVU, which is basically written by monkeys. 

Until this one episode, in which Bobby has some verbal sparring with a hot FBI agent (don't you know? there is a lot of animosity between federal and local law enforcement) and I caught a glimmer in his eye and saw a completely different side.  The side of Bobby that was completely smokin' hot. You know he's the kind of guy who would drop off the face of the earth for a few months (working on a case!) but then he would call  you randomly at 8pm, ask you out to dinner at some hole in the wall Italian restaurant in Long Island and no matter what bullshit you have been telling your friends for the past six months about how much you hate him, you will drop everything and GO.  He will look at you with his twitchy eyes over bottles of red wine and veal parmesan (his favorite) and you may as well take off your clothes right there. He's got you.  

I had a similar moment at Beard Papa's yesterday. I always found people' s obsession with them to be tedious and was spewing hate about how omg it was so overrated but last night, while watching Law and Order: CI, I bit into the cream puff I bought home from the mall and knew. I saw it. I understood. I am yours, Beard Papa. Forever your girl. In the mall, across from the Metreon, in your locations around the country and around the world, my heart (and my pants size) belongs to YOU.
author: Maria D.

description: If you've never had a cream puff, go nowhere else but Beard Papa's. I tell you, their french vanilla creme puff is amazing. Oh my goodness. I can't even review this. You just.. have to try their creme puffs. I mean look at all the other great reviews. Yum. That's all I could say. Every time I go down town, I muuuust go to beard papa's!
author: Kai S.

description:
On a Saturday morning I woke to the bellows of a middle-aged Asian man, here to enjoy a BBQ. After him followed many more Asians, each loud in enthusiasm. And with them came boxes of Beard Papa's. 

When they all disappeared, I went to the fridge, and found to my delight, a box of these goodies still leftover. I'd never tried Beard Papa's, but had heard of their legendary cream puffs. 

The vanilla cream puff was delicious, bursting with creamy, not-too-sweet custard. My mother, a cream puff connoisseur, declared it the best cream puff she's ever had. 

I also tried a few bites of a tiramisu stick and a cheesecake stick--yum!

Yesterday i found myself next to a Beard Papa's store, and decided to buy myself a puff and a stick. I went with the seasonal pumpkin cream puff and the strawberry cheesecake stick, intending to save the stick for later, but instead eating them both at immediately. Instant gratification, yay!

The pumpkin puff tasted like pumpkin pie balled into a crispy, light pastry. Must-try for the pumpkin lover! And the strawberry cheesecake was good, but small, lined with fresh strawberries and pistachios.  

I never really liked cream puffs *that* much, but green tea and earl gray are calling my name...
author: K W.

description:
These taste bad.  -5 stars

The beard papa logo creeps me out.  -100 stars

-100 stars is my official rating
author: Chi L.

description:
After all the rave reviews that I heard and read about, I was anxious to try BP after getting my lunch from Wichcraft.  

I did not know that there was one located in the food court at the Westfield Mall in Union Square until recently.  Shopping and BP...gonna kill 2 birds with one stone...woohoo.

Unfortunately, BP didn't make yummy in my tummy :(  

Not that their cream puffs weren't delicious, it just wasn't delicious enough for me to salivate for them and go back possibly because 1) it is located inside a mall and 2) selection was rather limited...
author: Kevin C.

description:
We like most of their special flavors. Today happens to be "coffee". It is very good as it  does not taste too sweet and just right. We had it with cream puff. We also have vanilla with eclairs, chocolate with cookie puff. They are all good. 

They offers weekly special flavor. Vanilla and chocolate are regulars. I've tried their weekly ones like green tea, coffee, strawberry, pumpkin. Not a real fan with pumpkin. We like strawberry the most
author: Chun L.

description:
I would like to know why an anime fisherman is selling cream puffs and other bakery desserts. Fishing and baking are very different occupantions. Does he fish for chocolate in some magical sea? Is his boat a bakery boat? Wouldn't that be a fire hazard? Isn't a ship burning down in the middle of the ocean a little ironic? How can a fisherman make such good pasterties? HOW?

I don't get it, and the look on my friends' faces when I told them I had never had  Beard Papa seemed to express the same thought. It may not be healthy, but I don't think that is the purpose of dessert food. A hot tasty cream puff is meant to placate, not invigorate. Leave it to the Japanese business conglomorates to find ways to slowly take over the world.
 
I, for one, welcome our new food coma overlords.
author: Keith M.

description:
"Beard, Beard Papa"

To the tune of "Ice, Ice Baby" by the whitest rapper ever.

Beard, Beard Papa (dum dum dum dum da da dum dum)
Beard, Beard Papa (dum dum dum dum da da dum dum)
Alright stop, collaborate and savor,
Papa's back with a weekly flavor,
Strawberry, grabs a hold of me tightly,
Real berry bits and cream so lightly,
Will they ever stop? Yo, don't kid me bro,
Just rappin bout it makes my cravings grow.
To the extreme they rock the puffs like a vandal, 
Two fresh pumps of cream with their handle
Dang, bite too hard the puffs will go boom, 
Eat em lightly so you won't need a spoon, 
Deadly, your BMI through the roof,
Stop reading now and go get some proof,

Don't like puffs? Grab a cheesecake stick,

Beard, Beard Papa (too good)
Beard, Beard Papa (too good, too good)

author: Jeff C.

description:
Simple and sweet review - just like a chocolate filled cream puff!!  

Obviously it's convienent when you are in the mall, just stop over while you are shopping and walk off some calories . . ..

The line moves quickly, the cashier was speedly and the bakers were quick and smiled as I was given my goodie.

It's flakey, fresh, sweet but not too sweet and it's a great amount of sweetness.

MMMmmmm I'll be back for another!
author: Sabrina A.

description:
hmm I guess I am not a cream puff person.

Since I was hungry after my lameass soup from Bistro Burger I decided to finally try Beard Papa. I had never had it and heard sooo many people talk about it. 

Well for $2.25 I got a huge chocolate cream puff - the same size, if not a bit bigger than my fist and bigger than my soup earlier for SURE. 

My cream puff thoughts:
- Tastes good but I would never crave it
- Is it supposed to be warm on the outside and cool inside?
- The massive amount of cream inside was good but a bit overwhelming
- The cocoa dust on top kept choking my throat and drying out my mouth
author: Jessica L.

description:
Beard Papa....has anyone noticed the logo is that of an old man, and possibly wearing a yellow raincoat? He's obviously not Popeye's dad. Isn't there some nasty dirty old man oyaji (weird older guy) or sukabeh kind of vibe to it that creeps you out? Clam shell with cream injected inside? Doesn't that sound kinda nasty and wrong?

Let's see, first time I had Beard Papa in Hong Kong 7 years ago, I suffered long lines, aching waits (it was THE hottest thing in the world at the Sogo department store), and by the time I got it, the first few bites were excellent, then towards the end I felt like I was the dirtiest man-ho on cel block E (or Britters Hilton with a different flavor of sausage every week), riddled with calorific guilt and an uneasy feeling.

2nd time was the then newly opened location in Redwood City. Runny soggy cream filling and cold pre-made clam shell puffs. Powdered sugar that easily went down the wrong pipe, causing me to bark like a seal non stop.

I was hoping 3rd time was a charm. And lucky for me it was. No green tea flavor, but just in time for Halloween, pumpkin flavor cream filling!
The vanilla was a bit ubersweet and oozy in this location but luckily not as runny as my encounter at Redwood City's. Pumpkin was nice and light, and probably the highlight.

The puff itself was a bit more enjoyable this time round, and luckily bare minimal powdered sugar, in case that fell down the wrong hole again ....oh sorry I meant pipe. This is not prison talk :-)

But Beard Papa is a bit of an oddity and seems out of place in the basement of Downtown Westfield SF. Definitely a better alternative that the watered down gelateria nearby.

My faith in Beard Papa cream puffs is slightly restored. I still prefer Satura Cakes's version that's a bit more solid and of course more substance.

Hopefully Cupertino does a better job.
author: Ken K.

description:
Oh, GROSS~!!!

This IS NOT a cream puff, but a cream puff shaped eclair!!!

Everyone giving this place rave reviews, LOVE eclairs!

I LOVE cream puffs!!!  Tasty little puff pastry with cream filling!  YUM!

My sister lives in LA and was visiting when we went over to the SF Center.  She practically went nuts with excitement when she saw Bear Papa.  "OH MY GOD!  THESE ARE SOOOOOO F'N GOOD! YOU HAVE TO TRY IT~! I BUY THESE BY THE BOXES!!!!!!!!"

So, we wait in line for a good 20 minutes.  I see the menu, they have cream puffs and eclairs.  I LOVE CREAM PUFFS, so I order six!  

We finally sit down and I bite into it.  OH, EEEEW!!  WTF?  Did they F'K up my order?  Did they give me an eclair?  I sit there with this not-so-tasty custard filled crap in my mouth.  I AM NOT A FAN of CUSTARD.  The pastry is not the best either.  Oh, all this for a line 30 people deep and a 20 minute wait?  YOU'VE GOT TO BE KIDDING ME!!!

IF you LOVE custard and/or eclairs, you'll probably like the stuff.  Now, if you LOVE cream puffs...you'll wonder if the person who came up with this chain even knows what a cream puff is!!  *HUMPH!* =(
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
If there was a food heaven, I'd like to be reincarnated as one of those delightful, plump Beard Papa's cream puffs. They are delish! At Beard Papa's, they serve an assortment of flavors, but not all are available the same day of visit. 

The puff itself is so light and airy, pie crusty exterior with a doughy interior. The sweetness is so mild that one of these bad boys will entice even the most skeptical dessert deserters.  It pleases me that the cream puffs are marked and separated neatly with parchment paper in a cute yellow box, insuring the product won't get squished and messed up by the time you enjoy them at home. 

Beware inhaling them too quickly. The cocoa powder sprinkled on the puffs will make you cough hella.
author: Dee L.

description:
Yummy cream puffs!! Glad that my old coworker introduced me to BP when they first opened in SF years ago. 
My favorite is the chocolate cream puff, vanilla is okay. I keep telling myself to try their flavor of the week but I keep sticking to the chocolate. I have however tried their cheesecake and tiramisu sticks and those are equally good as well. 
Customer service varies but one time someone messed up my order of half a dozen cream puffs. They gave me all vanilla instead of chocolate, eeh, and didn't realize this until I was back at work (a couple of Bart stops away). I called them and the guy said to just come back and he'll give me a new set. I told him that I will be back sometime the next week since it was Friday and I wasn't planning to go back there that day. Anyway, I forgot and didn't make it back there until a few weeks later and since it was the same guy that messed up my order, I told him about it again (since it couldn't hurt to ask) and he gave me a my correct order. So yeah, I'm usually a happy customer whenever I walk away from BP!
Make sure not to inhale while you're about to take a bite cause sure enough you'll be coughing from the powder toppings. LOL. Seriously you've been warned.
author: Anna P.

description:
It's puffalicious.
So delicious.
Makes you wanna 
Slap your motha and scream out Holy Shhhh.....

Go to Beard Papa and get yourself some
Feels so good in your mouth that it makes you wanna c...scrum...
Like they do in rugby in the dirty dirty mud
Take another bite and scream holy mother fu...


Well, you get what I am trying to say without having to actually spell it out. Seriously, if you can't seem to grasp the words, then you must have lived under a rock the last 40 years. Go! RUN, don't walk! Get yourself some cream puffs! Comes in chocolate and vanilla and they have special flavors like pumpkin, strawberry and green tea. Just check out the menu and see what special flavor is there at the time.

They also have eclairs but they're just cream puffs with a coating ot dark chocolate on the top. And they have a sorta new cookie puff that has this cookie like texture on the top. They also sell chocolate fondant but they kinda cheat because you can see the bottom was but open so they can fill it up with the oozing goodness of a soft center that is expected of a chocolate fondant. Minus a star for that.

And they have two flavors of cheesecake stick...Regular and some other that I will never try because cheesecake sticks are a rip off. Tiny ass sticks...

So go go go!!! Get your puff on! And soon you shall be saying it's puffalicious! Or not. I make no guarantees that you will act the same way I did when I had a puffalicious puff.  But then again, it might mean you are dead inside and hate humanity as a whole...Just saying...


PUFFALICIOUS!!!!!!
author: Anthony L.

description:
I LOVE CREAM PUFFS.  I first went in without any expectations so I thoroughly enjoyed my fresh cream puff filled with vanilla cream pudding (I think that's what it is).  

I've never tried anything else here; I stick with what I like!  I do think it's a tad overpriced given how small it is, but give it a try!
author: Jenny W.

description:
I need something sensual and sweet.
Badly!
I'm craving a Beard Papa's chocolate filled cream puff.
This jetlag combined with the usual post-Spain overwhelming melancholic hangover is really hitting me bad.

Beard Papa, mmmm! 
I have been there just once. The memories are giving me shivers. Unbeatable company. Laughing. Licking. Laughing; a challenge with a full mouth. Licking; complicated while laughing hard...

Sensual and sweet combos are the perfect remedy for sadness/jetlag.
author: Rosa L.

description:
Love them!! everytime I go to the city it is a must have one.  The only bad thing is sometimes they don t fill them correctly, but you can go and tell them and they fill them up for you!!

I want one now hahaha
author: Jam M.

description:
OMG, the pumpkin cream puff is probably my new favorite :) Its delicious! You might not like it if you don't like pumpkin pie or chai-y flavors tho...

The quality of the puffs is the still the same, puffy and crunchy with plenty of cream on the inside. But the staff didn't seem as friendly/nice as before but still speedy.
author: Sam L.

description:
Last night.

THE SET UP:

15 Close/old friends (1 of the friends is 4 years old and was not drinking the wine although he ate quite a few of the shrimp)
1 Million dollar view of the bay (GG Bridge)
1 Chocolate Lab waiting for morsels to fall
1 Cozy fireplace
5+ hours of great music 

Beard Papa is a crowd pleaser.  Everyone's eyes open wide with excitement when I mention I brought a dozen cream puffs for dessert.  I can look into their pupils to see cream puffs floating around as if in a trance from some crazy cult.  The cult of the cream puff has hit the San Francisco Bay Area hard.

Then, food and drink is ingested . . .could it be these cream puffs are not strong enough to compete with the following?

EAT & DRINK:

1 Cheese plate with crackers and pate
1 Foot long section of salmon cut that day, barbequed on a wood plank
1 Huge bowl of homemade white fish ceviche with avocado and tortilla chips for dipping like salsa
2 Dozen Kumamoto's shucked right before our eyes (professional DJ's are great at shucking oysters!)
4 Dozen large peel and eat shrimp barbequed
5 Pounds mussels barbequed served in white wine, herbs etc. for dipping the. . . .
3 Loaves of fresh crusty French bread
1 Large casserole of the old school broccoli, cheese, cream of mushroom soup, cheese, fried onions combo (yeah Southern boy!)
15 Bottles of wine?  Something like that. . .maybe more
2 Bottles of champagne (only because we were trying to get rid of all the white wine)

Tyler, Mary, and I are lounging on the couch in a food and wine coma.  We're basking in the cozy warmth of the fireplace, and the fullness in our bellies.  The others are in the kitchen popping another champagne cork.  Everyone is full and happy, and relaxed. . .

My favorite Dutch gal walks towards us with a huge platter of the Beard Papa's. . .

Me:  There is no way I have room for any of those cream puffs I'm afraid.
Tyler:  I'm not interested (something like that)
Mary:  Oh I'll have one!
Me:  Oh okay just a half.
Tyler:  I can't eat a whole one.
Fave Dutch Gal:  Take half vanilla, and half chocolate then you only have a half. (those sneaky Dutch!)
Tyler:  How does two halves equal to a half?
Me:  Oh heck with it I'll try one of each.
Mary:  Yum.

Beard Papa is so good that you can think there is not possibly any room for another bite of food, your jeans are at their capacity, you're about to fall into a food coma yet, you make room.   Sure you suffer, but it was worth it for the not too sweet creamy custard that oozes out over that freshly baked shell.  Good stuff!

BRING IT ON BEARD PAPA!
author: James M.

description:
What is a spirit? It is the principle of conscious life, the essence of our Being, the spark of divinity in our souls.

Beard Papa is a very good representative of the spirit of San Francisco and is a good metaphor for SF for the following reasons:

1. Tasty: The cream puffs are delicious. Now ranks as one of my favorite dessert places in SF along with Citizen Cake and Tartine's.

2.Tolerant: The $ 1 dollar 70 cent cream puffs ensure that even a homeless can have an occasional dessert here.

3.Central: Its location in the Westfield Mall which claims to be the epicenter of SF.

4.Asian/International flavor: Beard Papa is a japanese chain and hence its Asian flavor mirrors the strong Asian flavor of SF.

5.Sweet: I bite into another cream puff and my taste buds are overpowered by the sweetness of the cream puffs.

6.Cloy: I bite into yet another cream puff and all the vanilla spills over my hands and pants. I need to get a tandoori chicken now to counteract the Extreme Sweetness of the puffs.

7.Transgender: This Papa  doubts his masculinity and needs to reaffirm himself with a Beard. Maybe he is going to come out of the closet or go all the way and TRANSform into herself.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
So, where do I go when I want to overpay for creampuffs that have the texture of cardboard, and are filled with cloying sweet custard based fillings?

Beard Papa.

Oh Beard Papa, go back to Beard Baking School.

They are great for portability but damn... they taste like dried mummy wrappings.
author: Dave M.

description:
The only thing I tried at Beard Papa's was the standard vanilla cream puff.  Let me tell you, I was quite surprised.  I was a little hesitant with that price in the beginning.  When I think of cream puffs, the first thing that comes in my mind is a small ball of pastry with a little vanilla filling, like the one's that they sell in Costco.  

However, when I got the cream puff...well, I'm still hesitant with the price (Yes, I am cheap.).  On the other hand, that first bite was simply divine!  The pastry shell had a crisp flakiness that caught me off guard.  Apparently, they fill their cream puffs to order, which is smart.  That vanilla cream was spectacular and had a pleasant chill to it.  It's a little messy to eat, or probably I don't know how to properly eat one.  If you want a pretty awesome but quick dessert in the city, do try Beard Papa's.
author: Derrick D.

description:
Beard Papa's is THE place for a cream puff! Well known in Japan, it has finally made its way here to the U.S. Once again, another place that makes me forget about this so called girlish figure. I will shove cream puffs down my throat all day.

Beard Papa's offers the normal vanilla and chocolate flavors, but they always have special flavors of the week that rotate. Being a green tea lover, I enjoy the green tea flavored puff! A little pricey, but well worth the money. 

Trust me, just try it. My mom loves em, and she reminisces about how it reminds her of the cream puffs in Japan. Not too sweet, light, and creamy! 

The motion of me eating it should burn off some calories from it right?
author: Catherine O.

description:
If you take the escalator that descends into the  Food Emporium at the new San Francisco Centre monstrosity, the aroma emanating from Beard Papa's immediately engulfs you and draws you in... Sure it's got a funny name, but it's a Japanese franchise, so I never ask questions about that stuff. The line at Beard Papa's is really long but moves quickly, and I found it fascinating that most of the people in the line were Asian. 

I'm not a big fan of "normal" cream puffs because the pastry is usually soggy. This is why I like Beard Papa so much, the pastry is fresh and crispy, and the cream is inserted when ordered. The traditional cream puff seems to be the most popular, but I really love the eclair, a chocolate covered cream puff with the same subtley sweet custard filling. The interplay with the chocolate and custard gets me every time. The chocolate filled cream puff is also nice as is the uber rich Fondant Au Chocolate.

One thing I  noticed is that the cream puffs are much larger than the Beard Papa's in Hollywood...and in this case, bigger is better. They don't have the cheesecake sticks either, but as long as the eclair is around, I don't really miss it.
author: Arnold G.

description:
I honestly did not know that I liked cream puffs until my friend force fed me one at a function from Beard Papa's.  Now whenever we venture into the Westfield Mall, we join the long que of folks jonesing for a cream puff.

All we want is one chocolate filled with powdered sugar on top.  We hold signs that read "will dance for cream puff."  

I digress.  Join the masses and drink the kool-aid.  Wait, wrong speech, join the crowd and enjoy a cream puff.  What harm could it possibly do?
author: Richard R.

description:
ULTIMATE INDULGENCE.

Everything is fucking amazing. And I.Mean.Everything.
author: Y K.

description:
*knock, knock*

Me: Um yeah, excuse me can I ask you a question?

Every other yelper below me: Sure, what's up?

Me:  Can I have some of the Kool-Aid you drank?

EOYBM:  Excuse me?

Me:  Yeah can I have some of the Kool-Aid you've been drinking, because there must be something in it that I ain't gettin.

EOYBM:  What are you talking about?

Me:  Your Reviews of Beard Papa cream puffs, I mean WTF? at almost 2 bucks a pop  you must be drinking the Kool-Aid, cause I don't get the hype!

Head down to the Mission an get a crispy pastry tube filled with cream for like 65 cents.  now that's the bomb diggity!

disclaimer:  I plagiarized this from my review on the other location, I figured I should try them again.  Still not impressed.
author: A P.

description:
Uh, sorry, I didn't get it either. 

My friend "warned" me that the vanilla was good and the chocolate bad.. but being the chocoholic I am, I compromised and got the vanilla-injected "eclair." (For a place that only offers four main items, shouldn't they all be, uh, good?) Well, I guess my friend was right: the chocolate was totally overpowering, rendering the vanilla flavorless. And I don't know when that puff was actually made, but it was totally tough and chewy. I actually had to walk over to Peet's to get some tea to wash down the bitter chocolate taste that wouldn't go away on its own. Ick. I know my arteries didn't need this stuff, but now my taste buds were rebelling, too.

All this and a 20-minute wait as I watched the cashier make endless small talk with each customer ahead of me. Next time I'll just head up the escalator to the patisserie on the fourth floor when I need a pastry rush. Twice as expensive, but four times as good... easily.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Fighting over abortion rights? Fighting over oil? Fighting over creme puffs? Yes that's what I had to do at the Beard Papa line on Sunday. I physically had to get people from cutting in front of me in line. That's right.. no one is winning here.  

I know creme puffs are tasty but these aren't the 5 star quality that deserves to be fought over. They are good and I do get a few if there's no line. I'm not a creme puff expert but these are good desserts and should be tried at least once in your lifetime. And if you see me in line..lets not start a Jihad and try out peace instead of war.
author: Dan T.

description:
Me Likey Cream Puff!

The Japanese are famous for Godzilla, Pokemon, Sushi, Nintendo, Hentai, and now for cream puffs.  Those Japanese people think about everything, even how to make a place that stays busy just selling delicious "All Natural Cream Puffs".

I recommend staying with what made them famous, the regular vanilla cream puff.  No going wrong there.  Make sure you eat it fresh or it won't be as good.  Beard Papa uses no preservatives and all natural ingredients, so it loses its freshness quick.

Careful when you try one for the first time.  It's harder to kick than smoking.
author: Ed C.

description: I tried a cheesecake stick and it had to be one of the blandest deserr I have ever had. The cheesecake had no flavor and the crust was too sweet. I'm not a big fan of cream puffs either but I have to say when I went they didn't look very fresh.
author: Nava N.

description:
I have been rejected twice by BP: once when I showed up thinking it was open (on the Mission site) and that bastard was closed. And another time when I went to Westfield for the first time and the line was enough for me to not want to deal, but oh boy did I drool.

Like a pavlov's slut: I must have one of these. i have no freakin idea what it is, but my god, I must do it.

Fucking A. that's all i'm going to say about this. Let me pause for a moment here and compose myself. These things make me crazy.

I was at the mall at the ungodly hour of 10:15 before a spa appointment, and you know what, there was no line. I was scared at first, asking Husbandido what I should do. He said, go already, and rolled his eyes. I went up to the counter and plunked down my 3.50 and bought one for me and my cousin. Holy flaky goodness, sweet loving custard. Orgasmic, people. I don't know how to describe it, but I will never, ever stand in line that long for them. But I probably will sneak out of bed on a hungover Sunday to get there by 10 when they open and order a 10 pack and eat those bastards right then and there.

I hate BP. I love BP. God, what have I become?!?!
author: Charlene L.

description:
Hello, my name is Anastasia, and I'm an addict...a cream puff addict.

I've been to both SF Beard Papa locations a total of three times in a week and a half...and I don't live or work in the city!

I've spent $9 on cream puffs...$17.70 on BART...I've consumed 880 calories...need I say more?

It's not like cream puffs are the most orgasmically satisfying dessert or pastry in the world, but I have no self control when it comes to their vanilla bean cream puffs.

P.S. Beard Papa is creepy! He looks like he should be selling fish and chips or something...not cream puffs.
author: Anastasia B.

description:
600+ calories for one vanilla cream puff? HELL YEAH!! 

I've tried all three of their shells: plain, chocolate eclair, and cookie crumb. My FAVORITE is the cookie crumb shell because its crunchiness pairs perfectly with the silky cream goodness. 

Now onto the creamy goodness...
VANILLA - Awesome for the unadventurous plain folk
CHOCOLATE - Not too chocolately; just right
STRAWBERRY - Tastes like the Asian snacks, Pocky or Yan Yans
GREEN TEA - By far, MY FAVORITE. Hands down!!
PUMPKIN - Have yet to try...
EARL GREY TEA - Have yet to try...
COFFEE - Have yet to try...

They offer vanilla and choc everyday along with one "flavor of the week" which is either strawberry, green tea, pumpkin, earl grey tea, or coffee.

Apparently Beard Papa's makes their cream puff in a mini sized puff but the location here (in Bloomies) and the one on Mission Street don't. I'm somewhat disappointed in that because i would prefer 15 small cream puffs of all different flavors than one huge honking one. Oh well. 

A little over $2 for 600 calories of goodness and awesome service. Mmm...
author: Heidi C.

description:
So far, I have not cared for the flavored custards in my Beard Papa's.  I like my custard pure and simple and tasting of, well, custard!

That all changed when i tried the MILK TEA flavor.  What a delight!  Still custardy, but with the subtle flavor of MILK TEA.  Delicious, like a Milk Tea candy with a pastry shell.

I like how the lights surrounding the Beard Papa station look like big cream puffs.  Subliminal advertising?

This location has never been crowded when i have been there - another plus.  Or a danger, which ever way you look at it.
author: Liz S.

description:
I absolutely LOVE the cream puffs here. The last time I came here was actually a few months ago, unfortunately, and I've been craving for some delicious cream puffs ever since.

The flavor that definitely sticks in my mind the most was GREEN TEA. Delicious!! It was the special for that week, and I had to try it. Besides green tea, I also recommend vanilla!

I choke on the powder sometimes, but the delicious cream puff makes up for it.
author: Jeannie W.

description:
Plain vanilla bean - Simply the BEST
Strawberry - Simply the BEST also, why you ask... that's because it has actual pieces of strawberry in the creme.
Vanilla bean eclair - yummy
Coffee - not bad, in a good way
Carmel - ehh it's OK
Green Tea - ehh it's OK
Pumpkin - umm, not my fav

Hope this answer your questions about Beard Papa's
author: Fried Rice B.

description:
With the help of beard papa, I transformed into a cream puff fairy and brought some magical sweet goodness to a hurt friend's door.

Translation: a friend of mine fell down the stairs and hurt herself. So I brought some cream puffs to her door. Then she called me cream puff fairy on facebook.

Sweet, yummy goodness always makes the day better.
author: Ari C.

description: Flaky, crispy and tender puffs filled with perfectly sweetened vanilla creme filling... polka-dotted with vanilla bean... no chocolate coating, no need for it... enjoy it in it's "natural state".
author: amy m.

description:
Not quite what I expected, but still pretty good for cream puffs. I liked cream puffs better when I didn't know how they put the cream in it. The mystery made it yummier. 

Liliha Bakery is still way better.
author: Kevo M.

description:
What's soft, moist done in 2 minutes (maybe less) and when you put it in your mouth white cream comes out? 

A Beard Papa Vanilla Cream Puff!! Of course! Gosh, what were you thinking? Ewww...

There are some fabulous bakeries that make a mean cream puff. This place just seems to cater to those that are in dire need of a something sweet and willing to spend the money for that craving.  Trust me. Go there once and see for yourself.
author: Dorothy S.

description:
This place gets mixed reviews so when I came here today I had no expectations.  I tried a chocolate filled creme puff.  It was good but it wasn't OMG spectacular.  It wasn't as sweet as I thought it would be but it's cool I still liked it.

I like the vanilla creme puff better. They're my favorite!
author: Mel P.

description: Strawberry Cream puff was extremely satisfying with bits of strawberry to tickle the taste buds
author: Michelle C.

description:
best cream puff that i've ever had in my life. ever. life. cream puff.

get the one with the cookie crust.

go.
author: Le E.

description:
Always wanted to try them but found them closed on so many occasions at the other locale. Anyhow when I tried their dessert here yesterday, I was convinced they re really good at what they do. 

 I had the Tiramisu slice and RP tried the decadent chocolate cake. Both were SINFUL. Very decadent indeed. Cant wait to try the other stuff!

I have a sneaky dreaded feeling I might get hooked to this place real bad.
author: Natasha I.

description:
Have you seen that Simpson's episode, when Homer develops an obsession with the McRibwich? His eyes dilating, scarfing down McRibwich after McRibwich, standing in a pool of his own drool, moaning in a pile of McRibwich wrappers. That was me this afternoon at Beard Papa's. Scarfing. Drooling. Moaning.Groaning. 
Minus one star for the long freakin' line!!!
author: Caroline C.

description:
Beard Papa's Cream Puffs really didn't do much for me. They didn't float my boat, nor did they sooth my soul.  They didn't chunkay my dahl and they certainly didn't tickle my fancy.

I waited in line far too long and they were out of chocolate.  No really, they were out of chocolate!

I don't know why but I was also expecting this thing to be warm, gooey and melt in your mouth delicious. The goo was cold and nothing special. Whoever described these cream puffs as manilla envelopes filled with vanilla Jello pudding was spot on.

My opinion: nothing special!
author: Derek B.

description: The first time I tried a cream puff from Beard Papa's I fell in love. It blows that this location is Downtown because there is no parking anywhere! Other than that, the cream puffs I've had at this location was very good. I love the green tea cream puff and of course the original.
author: Edgar G.

description:
I first introduced this place to my husband down in LA. HE IS OBSESSED!
So we had to make a special trip to this location to pick up puffs.
Its kind of weird that this is the first location I've been too that didnt have Japanese staff but its cool...
The cheesecake sticks are good too!
author: J A M.

description:
Though the cream puffs here still do not match the ones from NYC, I have to say that they are slightly better than what I had over at the Mission Street location, which doesn't make all that much sense because they pretty much share the same ingredients.  But I do feel there is a bit of skill involved so that you don't overload on the cream filling, and so to me, the people at Westfield are just seemingly better at this job.  And trust me, you think that having a whole bunch of cream is great for a cream puff, but its not ... especially when you're down to last quarter or so and the whole thing looks more like cream with pastry than pastry with cream and its exploding all over your hands and onto your shirt.

Overall, I'd recommend the original, vanilla flavor.  I tried green tea the last time I was there but I just didn't like the flavor.  I like green tea ice cream, but green tea cream filling just wasn't my cup of tea.  I also like the strawberry flavor but I just can't seem to get my timing right so I can pick one of those up.
author: Angela H.

description:
ADDICTIVE CREAM PUFFS FROM JAPAN

The lines have died down and the prices have crept up since they first opened but I still find myself pulled toward their door like a magnet if I get too close.  The cream puffs are actually filled with vanilla custard but that doesn't stop me from eating them.

Chocolate Éclair
Today I tried one of their chocolate éclairs.  It had the same vanilla filling as the cream puff and a delicious chocolate topping. Absolutely sinful.

I am glad I don't live too close because I might start looking like a cream puff.
author: Rob L.

description:
Oh god, AWESOME--but if you get them to go, handle with care!  I got a couple and placed them GINGERLY into my manbag, but the little buggers were still a soggy mess by the time I got home.  But that's my fault, not BP's.  And an excuse to go back and get more!

Krispy who?
author: Eric E.

description:
THEE best custard filled cream puffs ever made.  this stuff tastes so good, it has to be bad for you.  i bet it's heart attack city...but hey, you only live once!

just make sure you eat them right away...they don't taste the same after a couple of hours.
author: Ray R.

description:
Each vanilla cream puff is about 250 calories. 

For me that equals 30 minutes of jogging or running the Lyon St. steps or about an hour of brisk walking. 

So worth it.
author: Pamela B.

description:
These things are hands down the best cream puffs I have ever had (also the largest).  The puffs are honestly about the size of a fist.  They are delicious. 

I plan to go back tomorrow and buy another one.  

This is a good place to buy some nice dessert for friends and family. 

P.S.  Also try the molten like cake confection ~~~ yummy, warm, and better than your grandma's brownies!
author: K. R.

description:
It took a few hours for me to get the name of this place right. I was like ... Bear Papa or Build a Bear Papa ... but it's actually Beard Papa (the logo is this santa claus/fisherman looking guy).

I had the vanilla cream puff and the chocolate cream puff. They were the same shell, just filled with different fillings. The shell was light and played a good supporting role to the cream. The original vanilla cream was awesome though. Sweet but not overly sweet, light but rich at the same time. Yum!
author: Kevin C.

description: YUM!  These are probably some of the best cream puffs ever.  The pastry was soft and flaky, and the vanilla cream filling was perfect.  It wasn't overly sweet, so it worked perfectly for me.  I know that these are a little pricy, but you're really paying for quality, so it's worth it.
author: Veronica C.

description: Introduced to me by another fellow Yelper I had no idea what to expect. We were on our way to a movie and this was going to be the dessert  to our pre movie meal. I kept hearing "milk tea" and I thought I was getting a beverage until my slow mind came around to the fact that it was actually a flavor. Nice delicate pastry surrounding a creamy center. Not too sweet, which is how I like my desserts. Definitely messy too, so get some napkins. When I think about it I realized their logo had appeared to me weeks earlier somewhere in downtown Redwood City, so I'll have to check it out there too.
author: Kim N.

description:
I love the Vanilla Puff!! I can't stop think of it since I have tried it once. Therefore, every time I go to SF, I buy 6 Vanilla Puffs. 

I don't like their Cheesecake. it's too light for me.
author: Clarya C.

description:
So I was trapped in the ginormous bastion of commercialism that is the new westfield mall, and I thought...Hey, what about a cream puff?  I like the one nearby so I figured this would be much of the same. 

Alas I was mistaken.  Two big problems with this location.  The pastry was super dry, I don't know why, but it was no where near the consistency of the regular location, and secondly they don't have the weekly specials!  That's right, no pumpkin, no green tea, just the chocolate or vanilla.

Overall I was not impressed.  At the end of the day I would have been much happier with a well crafted donut, or a few good profiterols.

If you're stuck in the mall it's worth trying, but I wouldn't go out of your way for it when there's a one to two star higer location within a couple blocks
author: Harsh K.

description:
After dinner at Out the Door, we picked up some cream puffs to smuggle into the movie. Not that I've ever had a cream puff I didn't like, but these were amazing - the puff part was fresh and soft with just the thinnest shell of crispiness on the exterior, and the cream part was perfect - not too sweet or rich.  

Unfortunately, we meant to get the chocolate covered ones but got the powdered sugar covered ones instead - they were still delicious, but I bet the chocolate covered vanilla custard ones are to die for. Needless to say, I managed to inhale some powdered sugar during the movie, and tried not to disturb my fellow movie-goers whilst aspirating.
author: rachel m.

description: Fast service (don't let the long lines scare you), flavor specials, entertaining to see the cream puffs being made and great dessert!  I like the little togo boxes so I can take some home back to Cupertino!  Caramel is my favorite.  YUM!  I love sweets~
author: Chris L.

description:
Please see my profile, under "My Last Meal On Earth". 

Tips for people who give this place anything less than five stars:
- Don't take it home. Eat it right away.
- Get the original vanilla cream puff. Nothing else is as good.
- Get your taste buds checked out.
author: Amy H.

description:
What more can I say that I haven't said about the SoMa one..... I would have to say the Pumpkin (one of their weekly flavors which you can check online www.beardpapasf.com) and Vanilla flavors are my favorite at this moment.  I am not much of a fan of the chocolate as it's flavor, well what flavor, could either be more chocolaty or more dark chocolate.  Definitely a nice treat, but be warned they are like Frit-o-lays, you can't just have one.

Me - I'll take a half dozen please. (Pick up my order)
To myself - I think I'll have just one.- SO GOOD, I want another
To myself - Ok I'll have one more - Ok this one was good too, but maybe I over did it.
To myself - I still want another one - That was a mistake.

My friend - You only got three?  Wow, you showed real restraint..... (as I wipe evidence of powder sugar off my face)
To myself - Little do they know....  I have NONE!
author: Po L.

description: Oh.my.gawd! I cannot believe I forgot to yelp about this place! Best cream puffs ever...ok, they are almost as good as my grandma's...and that is saying A LOT. I got my co-workers hooked on these while we were in town for a meeting we were having at the convention center. I read about BP and stopped in over the weekend...sweet heaven! Some of us even tried to get some to bring home - we enjoyed them that much. I could go for some of these cream puffs right now. Can someone please send me a dozen chocolate cream puffs? I'll send you a chicago deep dish pizza in exchange?
author: Joanne W.

description: It was just ok for me. I had the vanilla.  The filling was creamy but bland. The puff pastry was light and blah. Sorry not a fan.
author: Isabella L.

description:
i was in san francisco for one week and consumed beard papa cream puffs three times.  THREE TIMES in one week.  that is a sickness.  

stick with vanilla.  pure.  true.  right.
author: Kirsten F.

description:
Beard Papa is okay.  Technically nothing is off the mark here.  But But.... a cream puff is a light and delicate flower that when opened is an invitation for one more.  I had one and I was done.  No desiring or dreaming for another.   For me a cream puff is about cream that is light, fresh, cool with a hint of vanilla sugar.  My mother's Chez Mamma is the most incedible cream puffs of all time.  I can't just have one and I would rather have this than dinner.  My mother made a butterscotch frosting that would make me take out a mortgage for a lifetime supply.

I would most likely not go back Beard Papas are not my dream of a cream.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
I'm glad to see that Beard Papa found its way to the Bay Area.

I remember how crazy the lines were when they first opened one in NYC.  I often detoured there to get a cream puff and would savor it on my way home.  I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, green tea and pumpkin.  My favorite is still the original vanilla...especially when the puff pastry is still warm.  Good stuff.

My family and friends love it when I bring them a box.
author: Lis A.

description:
Honestly the first time I tried Beard Papa's I thought it wasn't that great. The chocolate stuffed cream puff didn't compare to the ones my mom makes. But years later I gave them another try and I think the difference is that I went with vanilla. Now I'm a firm believer in their cream puffs!

Granted I only get the vanilla ones and I don't dare to try the others since I don't want to be disappointed. Yum! Light and fluffy. Good for my fat days.
author: Vanessa T.

description: Cheesecake sticks! I got a plain one and it was actually ok, kind of dry for cheesecake. The service was okay, but it definitely could have been more inviting and less scary to be honest. Might come back for a cream puff because those look better.
author: Idk A.

description:
Mad Monster Choux on ROIDS!
*  Supa Sized (only some things should be handled with both hands-y'all)
*  Pudding heavy innards - think J-E-L-L-O 
*  Trapped in a crusty shell 

Some of you are salivating and that's just wrong -
author: sHoo o.

description:
The first time i ever saw Beard Papa's was at the Westfield Mall in SF.   It is this obscure food stand thing with some LCD screens that played some funky cartoon and these crumpled Japanese lanterns glowing..  I watched the looooong line of happy people make their way to pay, and then end up with this yellow box.  They all seemed so happy, but i still couldn't figure out what the hell they were selling.

When i found out it was cream puffs, I was tempted to try.  It took me almost year to get in line only because i was always so distracted by the other great food stops in the mall.  But i went there on Sunday with my boyfriend who swore by the Beard Papa.  We ordered a half dozen.  A mix between eclairs, vanilla filling and chocolate filling.
