and oh my word.  I think these things changed my life.  I wasn't sure if i was ready for a life changing experience, but Beard Papa Gods don't wait for you to be ready.  They just sock it to you.  These were phenomenal. Not too sweet, but not too filling.  It was definitely a great treat!


The only downfall i would say is the price.  $13.00 for 6 of those suckers.  However, like i always say, you get what you paid for.
author: Angela C.

description: I've heard a lot about this place and since I'm interning in SF for the summer and close to a Beard Papa, I rubbed my hands together and to myself, I whispered, "Oh, yeah...come this Friday, I'm going to eat you, you delicious cream puff."  It was a beautiful experience.  That tasty cream puff is light and fluffy with a whole lot of custardy goodness!  $1.75 is the cost for 1 cream puff.
author: Jen S.

description:
Beard Papas cream puffs are awesome. They're so fresh and tasty. The people working there already have the pastry shells ready and they squirt in the cream when you order. It's soo silky and good! I bought some for my grandma a while ago and she loved them! 
I think they make a great and affordable thank you gift for anyone who loves sweet treats. :)
author: A. L.

description:
In theory these little puffs are perfect, flaky crust, creamy filling and a big bang for the buck.  But after I eat one I always leave wishing I hadn't had one.  

The filling might be a little too creamy or maybe not cold enough?  I can't quite place it.  Don't get me wrong, they are still really good and every time I come to this mall I have to get one but then I always regret it.

But don't try the cheese cake sticks.  Horrible.  It has the texture of a cheese stick with the after taste of old cheese cake.  Yuck.
author: Dani N.

description:
A MUST!! Personally, I think the vanilla puffs are the best because they're really sweet and made from really good vanilla beans! The chocolate ones are OK... nothing really special. The eclairs are pretty good but I still say go for the vanilla puffs. 

Do NOT get the cheese cake sticks or the chocolate fondant thing. They are a total rip-off and they don't even taste that good!

Be prepared for long lines when you're waiting, because EVEYRONE wants to eat here. Make sure you eat there right away (or at least within 24 hours) or they won't taste as good...
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I tried the cookie crunch puff....It was different. A bit crunchy..but something didnt seem right...

I didnt get taht same urge to eat more..I think they stopped adding the crack...
author: phillip w.

description:
Just an update on Beard papa, haven't been here for over a year and still two sticky thumbs up. Things hasn't changed, the cream puffs are still the best i have ever had. Not too sweet just perfect. The pastry was excellent, nice and soft but has that nice crunch to it. The original vanilla cream was just right, and I love how they fill the puffs up to the max. With every bite the cream flows and runs. Gotta love it.

5 Stars for the best Cream puff spot ever Beard Papa
author: Lux K.

description: I love beard papa. I love their eclairs with vanilla filling.  I also like how they have bottled green tea, which seems to pair well with the cream puffs.
author: dublin a.

description:
My first time tasting Beard Papa's was at the food court in Westfield. 

My friend Donna was telling me how amazing these cream puffs were: and got me intrigued on these cream puffs.  

I never expected a line while waiting to order for it: but that's a good sign.  

And watching the staff prepare it, it was very cool; similar to the prep of krispy kreme donuts.

I bought the vanilla and chocoate puff: and had strong will power to wait till I got home to the south bay to eat it. 

It was delicious and they've found a fan in me.   The next time i saw Beard Papas was in Hong Kong; i was super excited since they had more variety there (creme brulee, tiramisu) and around 5 or 10 more choices; I have the tiramisu as a profile pic.   

I wished that they had more variety of puffs here in the US.

Also noticed that they had silverware available at the food court: very fancy.
author: Evelyn K.

description:
I think I first fell in love with the concept and the novelty of what Beard Papas represented. Sort of like the cupcake fad, except in a cream puff form. And with a cute old bearded man as a logo. What more could you ask for?

I love the vanilla cream puffs. And the caramel ones are pretty good. But I have to say... I like the cream more than I like the puff. The innards are better than the outards.  Well, in this girl's humble opinion. I could just drink the insides and call it a day. Yummy!
author: Angela C.

description:
u want a puff, this would be the place.  I don't see what's the big deal is.  I do like how they have the showing how it come to be, kind of like behind the scene.  

Perhaps if they lessen the CREAM, it may PUFFs my enjoyment of it.
author: Xiu L.

description:
Puff Puff Give.

Papa will probably make you say, "oh this is how a c. puff is supposed to be", but I found myself not nearly as awe struck after the second time.
author: Andrew M.

description:
When I think of great pastry, I think of rich buttery, flaky pastry with creamy fillings.  Beard Papa didn't come close to delivering that on either of my visits.

Instead, I got a dry crumbling pastry shell and a goopy custard interior.   It was hard to eat, and failing to satisfy my craving for butter and whipped cream, I felt like this was a wasted dessert.
author: Aran J.

description: Just as good as the original in Osaka!  Perfect cream puffs.  One tip - they sell out of the eclairs almost every night, so get there earlier if you want your goodness covered in chocolate.
author: Dave H.

description: Okay seriously, these cream puffs aren't that great.  I like the crust but there is way too much cream filling.  For a lot of people I know that's the best part, so if you like tons of cream, you'll like these.  I'm still going to try the green tea cream puff though.  I can always just wipe off the excess filling.  At a dollar something a piece, it's not that much of a loss if it turns out super nasty.
author: Vivian H.

description: The vanilla bean cream puffs are fucking goooood! I absolutely MUST have one of those suckers everytime my cellulite-decorated ass is roaming around downtown. They're kind of messy, as the custard-y innards start to drip out of the flaky pastry shell as soon as you take your first bite. I much prefer this creamy goodness all over my face to the less superior semen.
author: Suany W.

description:
mmmmmmm vanilla bean! i wish there was one in az... however, that would make it less good. so, if anyone from beard papa corporate is reading this, don't franchise any more!!!!!!

the eclairs are incredible - the only caveat is how ridiculous you look with chocolate adhered to your lips and copious amounts of delectable vanilla bean cream are plastered to your face, while you consume bite after bite in bliss. seriously, this place is not only cheap (esp in comparison with other dessert shops- cupcakes, anyone?) and affordable, but it is MORE than worth the money. 

like my cousin says, one is NOT enough. and you definitely cannot share them.
author: Aletheia W.

description:
What better way to start off the day than with a giant mug of joe and and big, fatty...cream puff?

But wait!  Before you doubt the good captain and his magical cream puffs, take into consideration that this place serves not just one, but TWO choices of cream puff flavors.  One of these flavors rotates on a weekly basis.

I'd give it a five if there were any way to offer more flavors than just two.  But man...pumpkin cream puffs?  Kill me now.  Drown me in a bucket of pumpkin cream deliciousness.  I can think of no better way to go.
author: Erynne J.

description:
Meh.  I wasn't that impressed.  If I want my kitschy Asian franchise empty calorie fix I'd rather hit up Quickly.  In all fairness I only tried the weekly special (milk tea this week), so I might give it another go to try the vanilla that most folks here seem to like.
Hey, I said "might"!
author: Brenna M.

description:
Okay, so I know most normal people would give this place 5 stars right off the bat, but I don't like things that could potentially become soggy (don't ask it is just as weird as it sounds) and I am not a fan of chocolate, SO the fact that I am giving this place 4 stars speaks loads about how tasty the creme puffs are. 

I never had any desire to try a cream puff, kind of like Krispy Cream, if I don't try it then I don't know what I am missing and there is one less food in the world that I love and crave and feel the need to eat (trust me there are TONS that I can't say no too)... Anyway, back to the point. My girlfriends were in the city visiting and all of them are normal people, so they wanted to try the cream puffs and the eclair's that people were lining up in the food court to get. So, I tried one out of peer pressure. 

It was delicious. It was neither soggy nor chocolate! They offer vanilla ones for us non-chocolate peeps! SOLD! 

Now, because of my weirdness I don't feel the need to stop here every time I am in the mall like I would if this were say Orange Julius, BUT they are damn tasty and I will eat here when my friends come visit again! :)
author: Jessica R.

description:
Me:  Honey, I'm home!

Hubby:  Oh, good, I'm so hungry, let's go eat.

Me:  I brought home a six-pack, let's have a little happy hour first.

Hubby:  You did? Oh, that's a fine idea.  

Me:  The problem is that I already had a couple.

Hubby:  You mean you were drinking and driving?  Babe, you know how dangerous that is.

Me:  I know, but I couldn't help it.  The creamy vanilla, the chocolate...and that was before I left the parking lot!  

Hubby:  Huh? 

Me:  (Stuffing vanilla puff into said hubby's mouth).

Hubby:  (mouthful) "oh my gosh, that is the best tasting thing since...."  Sugar induced coma.  Hubby on floor.  O-dog licks the vanilla cream that dribbled onto the goatee...
author: Anne O.

description:
I mean........... the cream puff was AIGHT. And yes, I said "cream puff" (singular) because that's all I could afford at the moment. I mean c'mon, $2.25 for 1 cream puff is a little pricey. 

And from experience: don't think you can eat 'em standing up/ walking to the BART station because it's not possible to do so without looking like a sloppy heifer.
author: kat a.

description:
While J and I were having lunch at Westfield, we both agreed that a Beard Papa's cream puff would be a perfect way to have a dessert, especially since I've never had a cream puff in my life!  Ever!

So we go up to the counter and order just one to share since we were both stuffed already.  J holds the bag holding the cream puff, away from me, and heads forward to find a table so that we can enjoy it.  We finally sit down, and I settle in to take the first bite.

Wow!  Talk about it's-all-about-the-texture-in-your-mouth's dream!  As you bite into the puff's crusty but soft shell giving way to the creamy, dreamy stuff inside, you forget your surroundings as you savor its sweet goodness.

J and I are taking turns having bites, and I chastize him for taking a bite out of turn.  

I've learned my lesson.  Next time, I'm ordering my own cream puff!
author: Rhoda A.

description:
Take a piece of choux pastry (made in Japan apparently) pump it full of fresh vanilla pastry cream and sell it for $2.  What could go wrong?

Nothing.

Beard Papas are delicious, not too sweet, not too rich, the perfect crisp to the pastry and it is hard *not* to buy 12 and gorge yourself with them.  Oh and they are only 240 calories each, so a treat that you can eat without feeling *too* guilty.

Hooray!

The only thing that doesn't sit well with me is the need to warm up the planet a little more by shipping the choux in from Japan.  There are plenty of BPs in the country now, surely there is justification for the ingredients to be made locally?  Do little hockey pucks of frozen dough have to travel 6000 miles to feed us?
author: Tony S.

description: I was surprised by my friend with a cream puff from Beard Papas.  I was like, what is it?  It's really huge and had these burned looking craters on it.  He said it was all the rage right now, I ate it and wowzers, that's a really yummy cream puff.  Good to the last bite!  I was craving one all week while I was in SF, but never was able to get back there...I still think about you cream puff...
author: Soo K.

description:
I love cream puffs and this place did not disappoint. 

These things are huge. The first one I had was their weekly special -- caramel cream puff. The caramel cream was very light and absolutely delicious. The pastry itself was light and flaky. I think I would have enjoyed it even more if the pastry was warm, but it was scrumptious nevertheless. 

I bought two vanilla eclairs to bring home and was constantly harassed by homeless people while walking around downtown. The yellow box was like a beacon to them and they kept asking if I could spare a cream puff.  Too bad - I wasn't going to share with them!!! (umm... Does that make me a bad person???) Anyway, I had a taste of the eclair the next day -- it wasn't as good as the caramel puff I had the day before, but it was still yummy. I recommend eating them as soon as you buy them (FYI - the to go box says to eat within 24hours).
author: Andrea G.

description: The only thing I have tried here are the cream puffs and the molten chocolate brownie bites and they are amazing! Good service and quick casual atmosphere. I don't know if the coffee is any good since I took my order to go.
author: Faisal L.

description:
Facial hair really wasn't my thing until now!  

Beard Papa has their business model down well....Focus on one flagship product, and do it so well that Damon Z will give you a 5 star review.  I have the most major sweet tooth in the world, and I can swim in dairy for days, so a cream puff is impossible for me to resist.  The most recent time I went, they had coffee flavored cream available, and my mouth was percolating when I bit into it!  The cream had a nice hint of coffee, without being overwhelming, allowing you to enjoy the taste of the pastry, and the sweetness was well tamed.  Before I could even leave the food court area, it was all gone, and I was back in line to get a couple of their classics, vanilla and chocolate, to take home.  The cream is so fresh, that taking it home turned out not to be a good idea.  These need to be consumed within a few minutes, to enjoy their full integrity.  Those of us who make fresh whipping cream know that once exposed to room temperature, the consistency starts to revert back to liquid. All evidence of a quality cream puff!  By the way, of the two classic flavors, I preferred the vanilla.  

On your next shopping trip at Westfield, grab one on the fly.  It won't leave you with that weighed down feeling that some dessert can do to you.  I think I'll head on down there for one as soon as I hit the post button on this review!
author: Damon Z.

description:
A co-worker just returned from the mall and gave me a vanilla cream puff.  

I'll be sure to file this as further evidence that there is a secret conspiracy to make me fat.

Thanks, co-worker, for introducing me to the flaky, airy, not-too-sweet, yet sweetly delicious treat!  Are you going to pay for my plus-sized office apparel?
author: Marcus C.

description:
I love all things custardy: creme brulee, flan, panna cotta, gelato, you name it.  But sometimes eating these desserts can leave me the tiniest bit unfulfilled.  Sure, the light, rich creaminess makes me forget that the sugar rush will give way to a crash 30 minutes later; but I often  want just a little something to sink my teeth into with a dessert.  Enter Beard Pappa's cream puffs.  

I tried the vanilla.  I was in heaven.  And I don't even believe in heaven! The outer 'puff' couldn't have been any lighter and still been satisfying.  And the cream-- oh the cream.  Beautifully colored with flecks of tasty vanilla, light and luscious.  And all of this for a measly $1.90.
author: Emily N.

description:
I never expected myself to be a fan of Beard Papa's. I'm not into custardy items and further, I'm not that interested in sweets. However, I was still feeling a little peckish after my bowl of soup and decided that I needed to fortify myself for more shopping. 

The choux pastry/pie shell combo held up well to the custard and I didn't find the puff to be overly sweet. I can't say that I would consume an entire puff myself, but it's a perfect treat for splitting with someone. They also get points for filling each shell upon order which indicates that they care about their product. I'm looking forward to trying some of the special flavors in the future.
author: Candice L.

description:
I used to like this place until they opened up a branch in the San Francisco Centre and I could smell them when I walked in.  It smells like scrambled eggs.  I like the cute logo of the bearded guy and one guy at the Mission St. branch gave me a sticker which was totally cool.  However, my most recent experience at the mall outpost provided a lesson in inter racial relationships.

I agreed to meet a friend for a movie here and almost husband wanted to come along.

Apple.  Okay that will be nice.

Apple experienced a Beard Papas once before and had a craving.  Due to the relative novelty of the mall, the smell of eggs had not yet gotten gross.  My friend was getting a coffee at Borders and agreed to meet downstairs.

Waiting in line at Beard Papas.  Tick tock.  The line is wrapping around and promises to be very time consuming.  Man is behaving quite patiently but Apple can sense that he is getting very crazy on the inside.

Apple, moving in for the preemptive strike:  Would you like to get a coffee and come and meet me later?

Man:  No that is ok.

Apple, feeling guilty:  Ok.

Twenty minutes later.

Man: Tap tap.

Apple:  White men hate to wait.

Man, sipping his bottle of Perrier:  Men hate to wait.
Ok, the Perrier was an embellishment but it makes the story better.

Apple:  There are plenty of men in this line but none of them are white.

Man:  Ah that is true.

After finally getting to the counter and feeling very guilty for making Man wait in line, I decided to order two cream puffs and give one to my friend.  Friend came and did not want one.  Ok I will eat both.

We were waiting to grab some sushi before the movie and I am chomping my puff ball.  Geebers this thing is sweet and there is filling everywhere.  Don't want to spoil my appletite, I will eat it later.

After the yummy sushi the half eaten puff is oozing mushy cream onto the bag and Man is telling me to throw the darn thing out.

Apple, not one to waste food:  No way.  I waited in line for an hour and paid six whole dollars for this thing.  There are starving children in Ethiopia.  I will get a paper bag and eat them during the movie.
Drops puff bag into paper bag.

After the movie, Apple swipes the bag.

Man:  Baby, please throw those things out.

Apple:  No way muffin cakes.  They will be marvelous in the microwave tomorrow.  And you know, think if the starving children.

Admittedly, I don't think a homeless person would even want these things by this time.

Next morning Apple opens the fridge. 

Pushing aside the eighty bottles of Perrier, she hits the jackpot.  Day old cream puffs.  Opens bag.  There is cream puff goo everywhere.  Yuck.  What was I thinking?  Another landfill is overflowing.  Another starving baby is crying.

Apple:  Ok I should've listened to the white man for once.  This is gross.
Drops puffs into the trash.

Beard Papas will never be the same for me.
author: apple r.

description:
Here are cream puffs the size of, well, let's say half the size of, one's head. Surprisingly (refreshingly) cold creamy filling, and a croissant-like texture on the outside. 

Two small criticisms: 
1) I could do without the powdered sugar, or rather, my shirt could do without the powdered sugar all down the front.

2) I'd be able to eat a puff approximately one-quarter the size of my head and be happy, so size varieties would be nice.

All in all, though, if I need a cream puff stat, I can't see why I would go somewhere else.
author: Katrina W.

description:
Beard Papa had gotten so much hype on Yelp that it was on my to do list. A trip to the new Westfield shppping center led me to the food court... and to their newest kiosk.

I tried an eclair. The chocolate wasn't too sweet. the custard was gooey; in fact the whole thing was rather messy. Oddly, it was the pastry itself that was kind of a letdown.

An eclair cost $2.10 or something like that. For the same money, I could get one of those black and white cupcakes at the Sweet Delights bakery counter in Laurel Village.
author: Timothy O.

description:
Because its March Madness: OVER-RATED.  Duh, Duh, Duh-duh-duh.  OVER-RATED.  Duh, Duh, Duh-duh-duh.  

Its just a cream puff.  Is it a good cream puff?  Yes.  Is it better than say, a rasberry jelly donut or a molten chocolate pie or a double chocolate Specialties cookie or any one of dozens of other delictables available in our fair city?  No.  

Its ok.  Its decent.  But it is definitely OVER-RATED.  Duh, Duh, Duh-duh-duh.  OVER-RATED.  Duh, Duh, Duh-duh-duh.
author: Jason S.

description:
best cream puffs evah!!!

best flavors = green tea, chocolate and of course...vanilla.
author: Flix N.

description:
For some reason, Beard Papa was just alright for me.  I do like the original vanilla flavor, but I preferred the ones from Italian bakeries in North Beach.  Maybe not flaky enough?  or not buttery enough?  or not creamy enough?  I don't know.  The different flavors Beard Papa offers make them special, however.  I do like the Green Tea flavor one.

The bf likes it, but if I were to just bring home ONE dessert, I bet Beard Papa wouldn't make it to his list, nor my list.
author: Gigi T.

description:
I'm so glad they opened one up in the Westfield food court. So easily accessible from the Powell St Bart station. Walk down the halls, through the doors, and BAM! Beats goin out to Yerba Buena. 

I've honestly never tried anything else they serve, other than the cream puffs. YUMMY! Slaps a smile on my face every single time. Once you bite into the sugary sweet flakey puff ball and the ooey-gooey richness of the filling melts in your mouth, you'll know exactly what I mean when I say it's a euphoric moment.

I've enjoyed the special flavors of the week (strawberry, green tea, caramel, etc), but nothing beats the traditional cream puff. =)
author: Michelle W.

description:
OH BEARD PAPA.. You make me LICK my lips. You're DELICIOUSLY PLEASING. And oh-so-SATISFYING. And you make an ordinary day just THAT MUCH better. I don't care if you're old, creepy-looking, and you have a beard...I JUST CAN'T GET ENOUGH OF YOU! ...Now why can't there be more men like you??!

But seriously, the ECLAIRS. OHHH THE ECLAIRS! Basically the same thing as their regular vanilla creme puff, but dipped in chocolate on top. The vanilla creme and the chocolate on top of the eclair are a heavenly duo. *licks lips* ..Don't get confused and ask for a chocolate eclair, because then it'll come with chocolate creme...  Be sure to devour the entire thing right away (although I don't see how anyone could possibly hold back)...It's not quite as delish after sitting in the fridge for a day.
author: Felicia C.

description:
I'm always tempted to buy a cream puff every time I walk by.  My favorite is actually one of the specialty flavors--strawberry.  It's especially good in an eclair =)

I also tried the tiramisu and the green tea specialty flavors as well, but  my favorite is still strawberry.
author: Jen L.

description:
Y U M M O H ! ! 5 Stars Baby!! 

You got to try their Chocolate Cream Puff.  As you bite into your cream puff...the chocolate cream surprises you with the YUMMOH factor! OMG its really good!! Just imagine your favorite chocolate milkshake inside a light and flakey bread with a sprinkle of powder sugar on top.  Who cares if that chocolate cream oozes out of the side of your mouth...just use your finger and put it back into your mouth...cant miss any part of this cream puff!!
author: Darlene F.

description:
A vanilla cream puff is $1.75, and the chocolate and other flavored kinds (in a weekly rotation) are $1.95 each.  

Bottom Line:  Sure, it's an enjoyable treat, and their logo is cute.
author: David L.

description:
I heart this place. It's soooo good! I love the cream puff pastry. It's so light and fluffy. The filling is great! Not to sweet, so you can savor what you picked.
I really like the basic vanilla and chocolate flavors. The strawberry and pumpkin is good too! 
They also have one at the westfield mall... but this one is better cuz they offer more. 
You must stop here when you are near the Metreon!
author: Joanne C.

description: Beard Papa's always hits the spot with a creamy confection. Unfortunately, I always manage to drop cream on my foot awkwardly. The cream puff shell is not too crispy or soft. The cream is airy and not too thick. The cheese sticks are delicious too. Beard Papa's is the best place to buy a quick dessert at the eatery downtown.
author: Denise C.

description: Bf took me here for Valentine's Day and I finally found out the name a few data ago ( I never looked up to see where I was eating at hehe he just made me close my eyes and pick out a bunch of these). And they were all good and gooey. Every bite I took had to consist of me dodging the falling cream :(( they had a really big selection compared to other baked goods place eventhough it was inside the mall. I definitely wanna go back and get more
author: Tammy M.

description:
1. OMG, these cream puffs are so good that I might have to add them to the Last Meal On Earth part of my Yelp profile.  

2. If you have any idea how many calories and grams of fat are in each cream puff, please do not tell me.

3. They should change the name of the store to Bliss in Your Mouth which makes much more sense than Beard Papa.
author: Missy D.

description:
worth every penny.

Its like a delicacy to me. I'll let the rich have their caviar as long as long as I can have my cream puffs.
author: Patrick B.

description:
are you kidding me? this stuff has no flavor. its like cardboard. its chalky and AWFUL. even whole foods has better cream puffs. heck the eclairs from safeway taste better than this.

but their logo is nice.
author: Julia K.

description:
These large cream puffs are airy and not overly sweet. You'll eventually try the other flavors, but vanilla is, by far, the best. 

It is best not to question the longshore fisherman logo or the name but to accept Mr. Beard Papa as the guardian of ever so delicious puffs of happiness.
author: T T.

description:
As Oprah would say, "I GET IT! I FINALLY GET IT!" 

My friends and I have had the plain and green tea cream puffs. I actually like the plain best and my friends agreed. Make sure you don't wear black because they're a mess to eat. You'll get powered sugar everywhere no matter how careful you are. 

What makes these puffs stand out from the standard puff, aside from how humongous they are, is the whipped cream folded into the pastry cream. It makes the product light and airy. Yumm! I also wanted to try the cheesecake stick but they were out. In hindsight i'm glad.
author: San J.

description: Although not perfect, it's nice to have Beard Papa in SF, and especially at the San Francisco Center, which makes for a nice shopping break.  The pastry is a little weak, but the the home made cream is very flavorful and rich.  Other reviewers have commented on how dense the cream is.  But Shu Cream is more akin to pastry cream, which is basically custard except for thr flour, so it stays true to the recipe.  It's not perfect, but I wouldn't mind if they opened a few more stores in the US.
author: Peter L.

description: My first cream puff and eclair ever and it was like a little taste from heaven.. deeeeelicious a great sweet treat, not too heavy... I am sure it's calorie heavy though ;D
author: Denise A.

description:
OH good lawd.

the best way to add some junk in my trunk.
this weeks special? Strawberry, LUCKY FREAKIN' ME!
amazing filling in the cream puff with real strawberries. no way? Yes way!  Flavorful yet light, like a chunk plucked off from cloud nine. Definately took some stresses off from my week. 
Must try the cool irresistable cheese cake sticks too.  
Foreal though, the only place that wouldnt make me look at the calories and say "crap, i shouldnt have ate that". So worth it!
author: Kelly S.

description: Staple hit everytime I make it to the West coast. I love the classic vanilla cream puff! Beard Papa I fear the day you ever make it to the Washington, D.C. area. I'm going to have to invest in a personal trainer.
author: Tina T.

description:
A co-worker tried Beard Papa for the first time last weekend and informed me that she was unimpressed.  I didn't take her word for it and decided to try it for myself this evening...

If you're a fan of creme brulee, or any dessert with fresh cream for that matter, you will love Beard Papa (BP) cream puffs!  Unlike most places that serve eclairs and cream puffs, the cream puffs at BP do not have a custard base and do not taste like lard.  The pastry is very light and the cream is not uber sweet, like other bakeries.  In fact, it is perfect.  The cream puffs come in two flavors, vanilla and chocolate, and they also serve eclairs.

Though the line was long, it moved rather quickly.  I had my cream puffs in tow in less than 5 minutes.  BP's puffs are slightly more expensive than what you would find at your local bakery, but it's well worth it.

My sweet tooth felt even sweeter after devouring their cream puffs.
author: Annalynn C.

description:
My encounter with Beard Papa was brief, but memorable.  I didn't even have to think about which cream puff I was going to order.  CHOCOLATE, of course!!  

I begrudgingly shared one cream puff with my husband and enjoyed every morsel (it was a light snack before dinner).  A crispy and light pastry filled with creamy cool chocolate.  

Delicious.  And normally, I am not a huge fan of pate-a-choux, but I am realizing that it is probably because I haven't had the opportunity to eat a really good one until the visit to Beard Papa's.
author: Amy T.

description:
holy moly, can we get one of these in SD?

They're huge and all kinds of delicious.

I'll stick with the cream puffs, the eclair was too chocolatey and hard to consume.

Best if eaten right away, don't walk to the Starbucks on Powell and O'Farrell, back to the hotel and then eat it.

I WANT A BEARD PAPA IN SAN DIEGO. :(
author: Melissa S.

description:
After hearing all the hype about this place for months now, I broke down and finally tried one while I was at the mall on my lunch break the other day.  The chocolate cream puff seemed to be the hit item, the four people in front of my all ordered it, as did I.  I didn't have to wait long, which was nice as I was in a bit of a hurry to get back to the office.  

The puff pastry on the outside was room temperature, which didn't turn me off but it would have been much yummier had it been warm.  It tasted fresh and wasn't too sweet, a main complaint of mine with some of the dessert places downtown (that shall remain nameless, in this review anyway).  The chocolate cream on the inside was cool and creamy, and also not too sweet.  

Overall, it was good, but not amazing.  And like some of the other reviewers, after all I'd heard I was not blown away by the deliciousness of the Beard Papa cream puff.  It will probably be a while before I go back to get another one, as the size was a bit much for me, and at $1.95 (with tax) per cream puff, they're a bit pricy in my book.  If they came out with half size (and half price) cream puffs, I'd probably come back more frequently.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
Whatever you do,  I don't care if you CANNOT MAKE IT HOME IN TIME, do not,  I repeat, do not try to eat one of these on a crowded bus.

I stood in the middle of the crowded 21, basically being held upright by the 50 people squished in around me.  I had purchased a chocolate beard papa in the Crapfield Center and was clutching my white bag with my right hand, wishing I was just home already.

I was going to eat my cream puff waiting for the bus, but as I got to the stop, my bus pulled up and I hearded myself in with the rest of the 9-5ers on their way home.

I should have not gotten on that bus.

We lurched forward and I found my footing.  I'm pretty good at bus surfing.  I felt cocky.  Confident.  Whatever.  Who cares if I'm wearing all black?  Who cares that this low hanging Jansport backpack in front of me is punching me in the womb with each lurch forward?

I couldn't wait.  One should never have to wait to consume the greatness that is beard papa.

So i managed to take out the cream puff.  I took a bite and was quickly inhaling powdered sugar and choking on the creamy middle.  Lurch.  Jansport backpack has rendered be sterile, for sure. 

No one seemed to notice I was covered in powdered sugar with chocolate cream in the corners of my mouth...until 1/2 the bus got off at fillmore.
author: Jen I.

description: I'm not a huge cream puff fan, but these were pretty tasty. I got the eclair with vanilla cream. The chocolate was extremely good tasting. The puff pastry was good, but not as flaky as I would have liked and also I felt like it could be thicker to better match the ratio of the cream filling. The vanilla cream was cold and creamy, which I loved. You can see the vanilla bean flecks in it which is great, but I didn't feel like the vanilla flavor was as pronounced as I would have liked.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
They taste fine. People talk like these are insanely, wonderfully decadent and indulgent. Small, fluffy air puffs indulgent? I don't think so. 

These simply aren't satisfying (aka sweet and fatty) enough for me. They're the not-quite-fulfilling diet food of the sweets world. Give me donuts or cookies or cupcakes anytime, but on Beard Papa, I will pass.
author: Shannon E.

description:
The cream is a bit heavy for my taste, and I can't decide what I like better choco or vanilla. Chocolate one seemed to me to have just a bit of cocao added to the vanilla to give it some color and if that's what they call chocolate puffs --- no thanks! 

Overall, a nice place to get something sweet, though I am not crazy about it. I would probably have to go traditional with a quality piece of Tiramisu.
author: Katja S.

description:
"I love it when they buy me Beard Papa....throw your hands in the air..if you're a true playa"

First had these in NY...dayam, the strawberry was hella good.  This place is dangerous!  I'm not big on desserts or sweets, but these creamepuffs are frickin' good!
author: Craig I.

description:
OMG!11 CREAM PUFFS1!!

I -luv- their Green Tea and Chocolate creme puffs the most.  

If they had the green tea available everyday, I would give them five stars.
author: Shea G.

description: Fabulous cream puffs that will have you floating on cloud 9. Absolutely delicious. Yes, breaking your diet to eat this is worth it!
author: linh d.

description: I love Beard Papas. And I love that they have  cream puffs in vanilla bean! My fave... yum!
author: Mariyeth C.

description:
We interrupt this review for this special announcement:  This is NOT a bakery.  It's a well-disguised lab to demonstrate laws and theories of science and economics.  Supply and demand?  The supply of puffs the oven can turn out each time is limited and demand is high, so people line up for, like, too long (+/- 3 min. margin of error) because if people are queueing, it must be worth it.  Pavlovian conditioning?  Combine the smell of baking choux, the mysteriously ungrammatical phrase "beard papa", and a lovable cartoon logo and people start drooling.  There is no maze, but at the end of the line, you get a cream puff.  There, there, a reward.  It's definitely better than a food pellet, but I don't think the hype is justified.

If I didn't have to wait, I'd get a cream puff and get on my way.  Hell, I'll get several cream puffs because the flavor of the week always sounds delish.  But there's almost always a line here, I'm not a rat in a cage so I'm free to get my tasty reward elsewhere.
author: maiko h.

description: Simple, light, and fluffy vanilla cream puffs...try to just eat one!
author: MTBer I.

description:
One word = deLISH!!!!!
I went home with a dozen, yes 12, pasteries. Don't ask me how long they lasted in the box.... =| Shame on me...
The cheese cake stick were yummy, but not as rich and cream cheesy as your typical cheese cake would be (which I liked more, actually - not a big fan of cheese cake myself)
The cream puffs were the best part - not too sweet, perfect with a dark, rich cup o' Jo.
The chocolate was the same, the flavor was more of a malted chocolate than an artificial tasting (i.e. McDonalds milkshake)
I wasn't lucky enough to have been there on "Pumpkin Cream" or "Green Tea Cream" puff day, but will definitely be back to revisit next time I'm in the area.
author: Ali L.

description:
Mmmmm. The vanilla bean cream puff is so good. Only thing I've had here.

Funny thing though - I had forced myself to like this place. What does that mean?

First visit: ok I should try it, everyone loves it. =taste= Hmm, not that good.
Second visit: I should really go back...why don't I like it? Everyone else LOVES it. =taste= Hmm...I guess it's ok but I'm still not convinced.
Third visit: Ok, I'm going to try again. =taste= Hmm...actually, it's pretty yummy.
Fourth visit: Hey guys, can we make a stop by beard papa?? the cream puffs are SO GOOD!

Really strange, I know. Same thing happened to me and olives.
author: serena l.

description:
i saw Beard Papa's all over Tokyo a couple of years ago, and wondered why the US (er, SF Bay) doesn't have a decent bakery chain that makes you drool like this (really, there is nothing.  we don't even have Dunkin Donuts here.  KrispyKreme?  ha.  and Mrs. Fields is no suitor for Beard Papa).

alas, two years later, Beard Papa immigrates to the City at the new Westfield.

i actually don't really like "traditional" cream puffs.  i'm not a fan of that thick, heavy, cake-frosting, tastes-like-pure-sugar-when-it's-supposed-to-be-vanilla-flavored cream.  Beard Papa's is a little more gooey and pudding-like (you will need a napkin), and the shell is light and airy-- perfect for my palate.  oh yea, and make sure to try the flavors of the day.

welcome to the City, Beard Papa.
author: stefanie h.

description:
I love love beard papa! 5 STARS for the puffs! I like eclair better - I'm a chocoholic! but always the vanilla flavor inside. Somehow, vanilla ones taste the best. 

4 stars for this location because it's always sooo crowded. I don't like to wait in line for too long.
author: Sunny K.

description:
I had a vanilla bean filling and it was delicious!!!
Not a bad size for the price. Around $2.25
NOM NOM NOM want more! but I am afraid to look at the fat content.
Definitely not oversweet though. Could eat 10 but I would need 100 napkins:)
author: Emy B.

description:
Yay. Cream Puff.

My stars are not aligned with the rest of the hype on this one. Cream Puffs, Cheesecake sticks and lil' choclate cakes ain't gonna get my blood pumping anything but a mild sugar rush.

Granted, the craftsmanship is good: the custard's surprisingly tuned to the right hint of vanilla and a not-over-the-top sweetness. The shell was boring - it is only the vehicle, I understand - but despite being fresh it brought cardboard to mind. The whole puff experience was just messy enough not to undo me, and it did do great work next to a chocolate milk...

Still, I was underwhelmed. Cream puff. yippee. I'd prefer a real pastry.
author: Matty K.

description:
I was first introduced to this awesome delight in LA and I'm glad there's one close to home. Hands down... the best cream puffs ever. They're nice, big, and tasty.. just like I take my wimmenzz. 

I'm still waiting to try the strawberry filling puff in Cupertino.
author: Terrance M.

description:
The chocolate puffs are really, really good. They have a hint of cinammon, almost like Mexican chocolate. And as usual, the vanilla ones cannot be beat either.

You must try!!!
author: Andrew L.

description: Did you say cream puffs? Ah yes you did. So did I. Chocolate cream puff. Mmmmmm. *runs back to gym to do cardio to burn off guilty pleasure*
author: Gerard Y.

description: I almost got the Groupon that gave you like 20 of these for $10 bucks but I declined because I knew I would eat them all while watching my favorite tranny tv show, Real Housewives.
author: Victoria G.

description:
Ok so today I spent the day walking around Chinatown with a friend which left me tired and hungry.  I told her before we did anything else I needed a cream puff.

She saw the line and told me "Oh no we're not waiting in that line."

Well be proud of me, because I battled for my right to eat a cream puff, cause I was a starving.  I waited in that long ass line for my chocolate cream puff and fondant.  Both of which I ate in one sitting.  Yeah that's kind of gross, but hey don't keep me from my cream puffs.  

Cream puff=good.  Warm chocolate fondant that spills out chocolate with you cut into it?  Damn good.  Long line?  Sucks, but you gotta suffer for the good stuff.
author: Ke-Bear Z.

description: I love their vanilla cream puffs.  The pastry is nice, airy, light.  The filling not too sweet.  I've tried chocolate and caramel flavors, but vanilla is still my favorite.
author: marcie v.

description:
Who's your Daddy?!

Or shall I say, Who's your Papa?!  

Beard Papas is sooooooooooooo good!  I mean, there's not much to say in this review.  It's a great dessert shop.  The cream puffs are perfect!  I had their chocolate and vanilla flavors and both are MOUTH WATERING!  *drool*  

I never spend much time in Union Square due to the amount of annoying tourists, but whenever I'm in the area, I make sure I grab a box of Beard Papas.  Check this place out . . . you will thank me for this recommendation.  Don't message me to complain that you gained 5 lbs from eating too many though.  =)
author: Manton R.

description:
I've never been a huge dessert person. Yup, you can slap me now. I don't know what's wrong with me but I never cared too much about sweets. Instead, I'm a girl with a "salt tooth". And that's why after only a mere 460 reviews, I'm just reviewing Beard Papa now. Where the hell have I been???? 

The other day, my senses were awakened. I FINALLY had the PLEASURE of sinking my teeth into one of these heavenly pastries with sweet ooey-gooey cream inside and immediately fell in love. "OH MY GOD".....seriously, i don't know what else to say.
author: Anne E.

description:
There's something creepy about the name.  I think it's the "beard" and "cream" combination I don't like.  Clearly, something got lost in translation.  

Regardless, these are obscenely tasty treats.  Just the thing to perk you up while shopping at the Westfield Centre.  Like Pavlov's dog, I'm sure I'll be salivating every time I hit the mall now.
author: Julie C.

description:
Sometimes you really just crave a long flesh colored thing filled with cream of your choice, light and dark.

Damn they have great eclairs.  The fitness man in me says "STOP IT!"
While the fat kid in me says, "EAT EAT EAT EAT EAT!"
author: David M.

description:
This is definitely a one-time use kind of situation. You try it, only because you're really curious and you can't help yourself. But disappointment inevitably follows.

I had the vanilla, only because I heard the chocolate was too much. Well, the vanilla was too little. It had no flavor! Plus, it was so difficult to eat, I didn't salvage any joy in eating it, at all.

Waste of daily calorie intake and money.
author: Brock H.

description:
Chocolate puff is simply ok, maybe I'm missing the filling of the Gods but I think that every 5 star here never tried a real bigne'.
Have a look!
http://images.google.it/images?hl=it&q=bigne%27&btnG=Cerca+immagini&gbv=2
author: Dario B.

description:
I rarely go near here without buying one.

If you build a better cream puff, people will line up at your door. And they do here at Westfield Mall. There are about five people working at any given time making and selling cream puffs. And about twice that number waiting in line to buy and pick up their freshly made confections.

I agree with Anastasia. Beard Papa looks like the Hello Kitty version of the Gortons icon for frozen fish packages. Maybe this was the logo for a fast food sushi joint (think boat sushi). Actually, the pastries might not be bad with a fresh crab or shrimp salad type filling.
author: YearOf M.

description:
Pricey cream puffs, but yet oh so delicious!

Be boring.  Go with the Vanilla (it really is the best), and enjoy every morsel!
author: Daniel M.

description:
Simply Amazing!!!!!!!!

First time indulging in a tasty cream puff at Beard Papa's last night in the city! I am totally in love now.....and so happy they have one in RWC!!! I can't wait to taste another delicious vanilla bean or strawberry cream puff! MmMmMmmMMM!!!! It's so addicting!!!!!!!!

p.s. After tasting half of one...i just had to get back in line and order the 1/2 dozen!!!!! And split that with my friend, but it wasn't enough since they are all gone now :(
author: Cheryl S.

description:
This is why Krispy Kreme's founder stepped down as CEO.

There's a line longer than the queue at Space Mountain for these things.
author: choad x.

description: Original Vanilla Cream Puffs = the bane of my existence. If I could just sit around and eat these all day, I would. Smooth vanilla cream in a perfectly crispy shell *droooools* The only downside is that I'm so messy-- the end result doesn't look very PG ;)
author: Vinh N.

description: Best cream puffs I've ever had! This is located in the foot court of the Westfield San Francisco shopping center. I go to school nearby and I can't help to stop by whenever I'm having lunch at the food court. I've tried both vanilla and chocolate flavors and they are both delicious. OK, maybe I prefer the chocolate one a little bit more because I like everything chocolate. But you can't go wrong with any of their cream puffs or éclairs, so good!!!
author: Elena C.

description: Before trying this place, I was under the false impression that cream puffs were supposed to be like the small, dainty, refrigerated ones they sell at Costco in the huge tubs. My sister introduced me to this place years ago and it completely changed my perspective. Now I expect my cream puffs to be as big as my hand, dusted with powdered sugar and messy enough for me to use multiple napkins. These are the best cream puffs I have ever had. As soon as you take a bite, the cream just oozes out and gets all over the place. I usually don't like to eat messy foods when I have the choice but these are so worth it.
author: Deborah Y.

description:
After months of hearing how wonderful these cream puffs are, I decided to finally brave the long line and try them.  I got an original vanilla and a chocolate.

The chocolate one was very good.  But then again, if you screw up chocolate - then you really shouldn't be in business.   Rich and creamy.  Very good.

The vanilla one, I was disappointed,  The pastry part of it tasted stale - amazing since they make them right there.  I guess I was unlucky and got one that was sitting in the display for a while.  Not good.  I had the pastry from the chocolate one to compare, and they were completely different.  Ah well...  at least I wasn't in line for too long that day.
author: Denise M.

description: I don't care which Beard Papa it is, they ALL TASTE AMAZING! A bit of heaven in your mouth. Although I like the one in front of the Metreon better since they have outdoor seating (the one in the mall is always crowded), based on the pasteries, there's no judgement. I suggest you eat it right away b/c after 24hrs, the cream puffs become soggy....still good though...just...soggy.
author: Lily W.

description:
Although Beard Papa doesn't quite live up to the hype, it's still pretty damn good. I'm always up for some cream-injected goodness.

I like the plain cream puffs the best, but sometimes the daily specials are awesome.

Today we tried the tiramisu cream filled eclair -- a perfect end to a day of shopping.
author: Vandana M.

description:
YUM!

My goodness! I didn't know that cream puffs could be THIS good! I'm not a huge fan of cream pumps, but these were just right for me. The only thing that I don't fancy about cream puffs is the cream, but this place makes the cream puff more like pudding (but not thick or sweet!). I did have to remove some of the cream because it was too much for the puff to me.

My sister and I ordered a dozen of the chocolate w/ vanilla cream and vanilla cream puffs, and they were ALL SO DELICIOUS! My sister told me that they have special flavors every week (would love to have tried the green tea!), and the week I was there was the cookie crumb puff. I had that with vanilla cream, and it was just heavenly! 

I have to say that the cream puffs are pretty big! One was enough for me at the time, but I think I could have had one more...
author: Rachel C.

description:
The selections have expanded since my first Beard Papa experience. I started with the original cream puff, which was as delicious as the one I had years ago in NYC. The cream filling is so light and fluffy that by the third one you've completely forgotten about counting calories. The pastry was the right level of flaky and firm yet soft. 

I also tried the green tea flavor-it has a real green tea flavor vs. the artificial faint green tea taste in many pseudo-Japanese establishments. I attribute the authentic taste to the fact that Beard Papa is an actual chain that started in Japan.

I would advice not saving them for the next day. Putting them in the fridge makes the cream less tasty and the pastry tastes a bit stale.

Will definitely be back to try the strawberry flavor.
author: Katie G.

description: I love the fact that the choices here are simple and all of them tastey. Good stop for a quick treat as service is fast and there isn't ever a line (at least not when I've been there). Price is reasonable for the size and the fillingness of the cream puffs. Thank goodness these guys haven't hit the far east bay or my waistline would be doomed! :)
author: Marissa C.

description:
I tried both the chocolate and vanilla cream puffs there on Friday.  I loved the soft, fluffy texture of them and especially loved the vanilla bean filling....the chocolate was good, but not as good.  I was ready to give them 4.5 stars, but then the unthinkable happened.......

I guess that the cream was just so rich that it affected my stomach and I was worshipping the porcelain god all Friday night.  So, I had to knock their score down, as although I loved the taste, it just is too rich for my stomach.  I'm sorry Beard Papa, but I won't be able to try your cream puffs again.
author: Aaron M.

description:
One day my brother's friend was talking about house his girlfriend worked at the one in Bloomingdale's... and I replied with "Bearded wha?!?!" He and my brother looked at me like I've been in outerspace for the last 20 years since I didn't know what Beard Papa was...  They're reaction couldn't have been any truer... What in the world was I doing that I had never tried their cream puffs before...

3 WORDS: GREEN TEA PUFF!!!
author: Chrysantha C.

description:
$2.25 for one cream puff.  I had one when it was warm, but recently it was cold.  C'mon I'm paying over 2 bucks for something that costs less than $1 to make.

I'll pass next time.
author: Elliot Y.

description:
The cream puffs are a bit overrated if you ask me...but then again, I am not a cream puff kind of girl.  

I tried their cheesecake sticks today and it was pretty good...just the way I like it- half cheese, and half crispy flaky crust.  It comes just like it says- cut like a little stick, then wrapped with the ends twisted, like a piece of candy.  They are small, so perfect if you are looking for a little guilt free snack.
author: Judy K.

description:
Go for the pumpkin cream puff!  You'll love it.

Be careful though, if you're too eager to devour your cream puff it will stun you with its secret defense mechanism: powdered sugar up your nose.  I've been attacked on multiple occasions.
author: Krystle S.

description:
Who ordered the fat ass and 10 million calories?  

O you did?  You must have got the number 1?  Good tasting cream puffs, can't say I've eaten a ton.  Its like eating air.
author: patrick o.

description:
Came here today after dinner and shared a vanilla and chocolate cream puff with my friend.
They were cheap, only $1.75 each!
The puffs were good, the filling kinda reminded me of pudding! They were good for a light dessert.
Id return here....I hope they come out with fruit filled puffs!
author: Miss H K.

description:
I think their cream puffs are a bit overrated, but if you put one in front of me I will definitely eat it.

It's not you, Beard Papa.  It's me.
author: Andrew P.

description:
To me, this is the perfect way to end to a long day of shopping (as long as the line isn't too long).  If you didn't find what you were looking for, a delicious cream puff will cheer you up.  If you found exactly what you were looking for and it happened to be 50% off,  a delicious cream puff is there to reward you!

I prefer the vanilla cream puffs over the chocolate, as the chocolate just isn't chocolately enough for me.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Hmm...what is the hype?  It is just an oversized cream puff for almost $2.  

Try vietnamese durian cream puff.  Now, that's a 5-star worthy cream puff.
author: Linh L.

description:
I love pastries and let me tell you, I eat a lot of pastries.  When Beard Papa first opened at the Westfield Shopping Center in SF, I was told to expect huge lines of eager pastry eaters.  So I stopped by one day and, sure enough, there was a huge line.  I am not one to stand in a line for anything unless (a) someone is handing out gobs of free money or (2) someone is handing out free Harry Winston diamonds.  OK, maybe not just two things I would stand in line for but standing in line for something to eat, unless I live in Cold War Russia, is something I just don't do. I though everyone was crazy for standing in line for cream puff -- I mean what the heck could be so good about something as basic as a cream puff, right?

Someone brought a box of the vanilla bean puffs to work one day.  I ate one and it was so delicious that if I was fired from my job that day, I would have raced over to Beard Papa and bought as many of the puffs as possible with my severance check to console myself.   

I am addicted to the plain vanilla bean puff -- I haven't even tried any of the flavor of the week puffs.  The plain vanilla bean puffs are so light and so creamy and tasty.  Not too sweet, not too subtle, not too watery and not too dense -- just PERFECT.  Novices should be careful not to choke on the light dusted sugar on top, but if you're a puff-pro like me, this is never a problem.  Like a stellar black hole, this place has a gravitational pull so powerful that not even light or my taste buds can escape it.  When I succumb to its gravitational pull, I always end up buying a dozen -- 6 plain vanilla bean for me and 6 chocolate eclairs for my bff.  When I get them home (assuming I haven't consumed them on the ride home on Muni) I don't share mine and my bff doesn't share his.  My justification for such gluttony is that they are cheaper by the dozen.  We eat them all at one sitting,  My arteries are probably clogged with vanilla bean cream and cholesterol but I don't care 'cos these pastries are TO DIE FOR.  My cardiologist probably has a booming medical practice thanks to Bearded Papa junkies like me.

I'm a pig when it comes to dessert. And OK, so maybe I sound a little crazy and obsessive compulsive about it.  But that's why psychotherapy was invented....
author: Paul N.

description:
I don't see the hype. I've been to plenty of pastry shops and bakeries to know a good cream puff when I taste one, and as someone else said, Beard Papa cream puffs ARE way better looking than they taste.

I'd much rather support a local bakery and get quality for the price.
author: Mace M.

description: Never had a bad cream puff.  If you eat them the day of, the puff is still crunchy and the cream is so delicious.  My favorite flavors are mango and strawberry.  The main flavors are vanilla and chocolate (available every day) and they have their special weekly flavors.  They're posted on the web so you can make sure you get there the week they have the special flavor you're craving.
author: Jay S.

description: Been a fan since I first tried them in Honolulu several years ago. The cream puffs are the best. And huge! Have not tried their green tea flavored one as I am partial to the original and chocolate flavored ones. They cost aboutt $5, but, I'd still go back for more.
author: Shall P.

description:
This is seriously da bomb!! Holy cow, I was expecting one of those teeny cream puffs you get at the Japanese grocery stores. No..these are huge..rock size huge..that I still manage to inhale within seconds.  And they are pricy..close to $2 for one..they sell them by a half dozen that's too hard to resist.  

On another note..a half a star off for the puffs to taste like pudding (like another yelper had noted. But this, my friends, hasn't made stop eating the cream puffs!
author: Littleone P.

description:
Can we say YUM! This place is filled with creamy goodness. Ok it's not like to die for, there was this place called Christines that has really great Cream Puffs. Everytime I go to SF I need, need to have one :D. 

I recall standing in line, not at this one but the one that's down the street by the Metreon and this guy goes, excuse me are they that good?! 

I'm like umm so I've heard, apparently since the line is winding all the way down to the sidewalk.  I had never had it myself, but once I had it I enjoyed it!
author: K T.

description:
I will keep this short...

Too much cream [must be an American-audience thing].  Mediocre pastry texture.  Sweet in a truly remorseful kind of way.  If I were sporadically bulimic, I'd throw these cream puffs up.

And: bad chocolate cake.
author: Catherine H.

description:
I wanted to try this place because where I use to work a coworker suggested it, but I never ended up going until just recently. The workers were pretty patient with me because I was asking about a zillion questions ... LOL 

The cheesecake sticks (original and strawberry) were pretty good. Not too sweet and it's individually wrapped so you can eat it as your walking =) 

The cream puffs were too over stuffed for me. It was oozing out a small hole, which got bigger as I kept eating =( Eventually I just took out the filling and had the crust with the tiny bit that was left on it.
author: Jenny M.

description:
First pick a day of the week... favors vary daily with strawberry,  green tea, pumpkin, coffee, earl gray tea and of course they have vanilla and coffee every day.

Next pick a crust if the location offers a choice.  In Japan there are 6 different crust flavor ranging from cookie to chocolate chip.  I believe there are only two choices at this location.

Lastly, devour your cream puff before it goes bad.  Order a half dozen and save some for later.. but I guarantee they maybe all gone before you reach home.
author: Cathy L.

description:
After reading all the reviews on the place, I was so excited, I kid you not, I ran into this place.............

And I was severely let down.

First off the pastry part didn't taste fresh, it was kinda like a stale croissant.

And the puffy creamy part had no flavor.  

The Beard Papa in Cupertino or wherever I had my other experience I think was alot better.  This one was a huge let down.  It actually put a damper on my Valentine's Day.
author: Denise B.

description:
I have always enjoy creamy treats, but the accidental discovery of Beard Papa's Cream Puffs in NYC, almost four years ago, was an life changing delight, RE-defining perfection for all future sweets.  

The creamy fillings is rich but still refreshing; it is sweet but not excessively so. The crunch of the puff is a great compliment to the smooth and mouth watering custard cream filling. 

Eating them right away is the best. However, I have I sat them over night in a fridge, then brought on a 3 hour plane ride to the mid west in order to deliver them to loved ones. The shell go softer, but they were still very popular!

I had these cream puffs in Beijing, NYC and in SF. The ones in SF are convenient (close to parking and bart) , the ones in Beijing were bigger, the ones in NYC will always be my first love.
author: Linda X.

description:
The creme puffs are wayyy too addictive for my own good.  I always order them in pairs... in case someone wants to share one, I still have an entire one left for myself.  Greedy, I know, but they are just sooo good.  

The classic plain vanilla is the way to go.  I've tried the chocolate and the cookie crunch puff, but still prefer the plain vanilla the most.  They're not cheap, but those calories have to cost something right?
author: Wendy L.

description:
I got off class early so of course I wandered off to Westfield's.  I was actually thinking of going to Cocoa Bella's until I remembered that there is a Papa Beard's in the mall as well.  Even as I was going down the stairs, I was still debating whether to get a cream puff or chocolates.  That is, until I saw the sign: "Flavor of the Week: Green Tea".  Green tea?!  SOLD!  (I've always wanted to try the green tea one.)

Time spent in line: 2 minutes
Time spent waiting for the guy to pump cream into my puffs: 1 minute
Time spent eating cream puffs: 30 seconds each

Yup...I got one green tea and one vanilla and devoured them =)

So which location tastes better?  Westfield's pastry was better...it was crispier and fluffier than the other one.  The puffs here also packed a lot more cream, which I liked.  However, I thought the other location had more vanilla flavor in their vanilla custard.  So, the final verdict?...I'm undecided.  I think I need to go back and buy one of each flavor from each location and compare them side by side.  Can't wait! ;)
author: Katelynn L.

description: as Yelp says A-ok. The cream in the middle is nice and moist and girls seem to like when guys have sweet teeth. I prefer strawberry insides but give me any and I'll give it a whirl.
author: Merland S.

description:
Beard Papa seems like the Auntie Anne's of Pretzels for Cream Puffs...

Which means, Beard Papa is one of the few places to get a cream puff or an eclair, therefore by default, it is pretty good if you are craving a cream puff or an eclair.

The eclair I had was good, but was not great...the frozen cream puffs from trader joe's or Costco seem just as good! Why would you have an old bearded guy for your logo? It seems weird to me, but hey, maybe bearded papa was some kind of hero although he doesn't know how to make amazing cream puffs or eclair's!
author: Elaine S.

description:
So here's how my visit went today:

Me: Hi. Can I have two cream puffs? One chocolate and one vanilla, please.

Cashier: Okay. Do you mumblemumble gibberishsomething?

Me: Huh?

Cashier: Mumblemumble giberishsomething

Me: Uh...sure?

So I paid for my cream puffs and waited for my goodies on the other side of the counter. When I opened my bag, I saw that I got two of those cookie crunch cream puff something or others, so I had to go back to the cashier and ask for the regular cream puffs. Doing that made me feel bad.. and kinda like a jerk. But they exchanged it, no problem. My bad. 

The cream puffs here are really good but not LYKEOMGINEEDTOEAT20OFTHESEMINDBLOWINGLYFREAKINAMAZING. Though, I really like the chocolate one even though the filling tastes suspiciously like chocolate pudding. Oh well. I would give it 4 stars, but I'm taking 1 star off for the price.
author: Lindsey A.

description:
Damn good, and addicting!  Can't believe they are only a buck or two each.  Plain vanilla or chocolate are my favorite.

Don't order too many to save.  You will just 1) eat it all until you pop, or 2) put it in the fridge and try and it it the next day and it won't taste as good.

Just don't watch the video on how they make it!  

Need to go work out now....
author: Jacob J.

description:
MMm-Azing. Crisp yet fluffy outter shell housing and a creamy yet not grossly rich or syrupy filling. Now I know what angels taste like. =)

I appologize to all you cupcake fans, these are better!
author: Claireesa R.

description:
OMG AMAZING!  Get the original vanilla creme puff.  That's all you need and that's all I need to say.

AMAZING!
author: Noneya B.

description: This is the best cream puff ever.  The have different flavors of which all are very good.  But, the green tea one is the best.
author: Sidney W.

description: I squealed in delight when I came across this location by chance! I had a vanilla cream puff, which sadly wasn't the best Beard Papa's cream puff I've had. It seemed to be almost.. stale? But it still curbed my craving. I wish there was one in Portland, OR.
author: Angie Q.

description: Thank you to my friend who introduced me to bear papa's....the green tea was fabulous!  I am still looking for an excuse to make a trip to downtown just to get one! Maybe this will be my excuse!
author: Joanne H.

description:
I never had cream puffs, as fresh as there. the soft,moist and flavorful  puffs just melt in your mouth. I like to go there with poeple as i think it is a unique concept
Personally, I am more of an eclairs person  with Bavarian cream in them so this cream puff doesn't hit the spot.
author: Hasham Y.

description:
Nearly orgasmic...definitely on the same level as the beignets at Café Du Monde and the malasadas @ Leonard's. Except you have multiple locations to purchase from. 

C'mon, now. If they're selling cream puffs during a recession, you know they've got to be pretty darn good. At only 220 calories each (120 fat calories, 80mg cholesterol, 6g saturated fat), you can splurge and go for two if you watch what you eat the rest of the day. Rather than buy one, taste it, and get back in line again...
author: J C.

description: Awesome place if your in the mood for creme puffs. The mini cheesecake slices are to die for as well. This is a great dessert place to finish off a meal. Definitely a winner.
author: Maxwell M.

description: The cream puffs are a decent size for what you pay for them.  The filling isn't overly sweet which is what I liked about them.  If they're overflowing with the custard like mine was, make sure you have a lot of napkins or you'll end up with it on your face (or eat it slowly with caution).  That's not a great way to impress your date.  I'd patronize this place again, especially if I'm feeling like dessert but I don't want to pay more than a few bucks for something.
author: Amy J.

description: Love, love, love the vanilla cream puffs!!  When I make a trip to SF, I have to stop here!  The shell is light and fluffy and the vanilla bean cream custard is good because it's not too sweet.  It is a little messy as the custard tends to ooze out after a bite.  I always have to take some extras home.
author: Erica S.

description: The green tea variety of cream puff was SUPER DUPER. NY had a full storefront and I think that could work in SF as well
author: Andrew K.

description: Yummy! it was great, but almost 3 bucks for a puff, but it is definitely worth a try, it's not too sweet (like i thought it'd be) but a good mixture of the cream and the puff, I tried the chocolate one so I can only speak for that one, but my gf tried the vanilla bean and liked it as well :). Give it a shot if you're in the area!
author: Jon T.

description: I love  cream puffs and Beard Papa when it's piping hot in Japan, but this corner shop serves them cold.  It's still worth a visit given the limited locations in the US, but it may not make your mouth water for those with a sweet tooth.
author: Jenny L.

description: I tried this place a few times while on my way to work as I have a big sweet tooth and loving trying new places. They have more calorie friendly desserts such as the cheesecake sticks if you want something sweet without all the fat or portion. But I really just come here for the matcha filled cream puffs. I mean, where else can you find cream puffs with green tea filling, let alone a bunch of others?? *yum*
author: Petra S.

description:
It's like i'm floating on lil bits of cream puffs!  hahaha It's so corny, but it's just that yummy.  The cream puffs are made really well-fresh, light, and airy.  Not cakey, bland, and chunky like other fake shit out there...or, dare I say it, the frozen stuff....

If custard in pastry has never been your thing, then obviously, you're not going to like this...because, well, cream puffs are custard in pastries.........

I enjoy it...hope you do too!
author: Jac T.

description: Once in a while I stop by at Beard Papa's just to break my cravings for eclairs or cream puffs. The very first time I was there, my experience was not really bad but not also great. The cashier was not friendly at all. So, in my mind, maybe he was the only one there who is not really friendly...or maybe he is shy. But today, when stopped by there, It was the same cashier and same face..same not friendly face! Looks like he hates his job. The only word  you will hear  is -"nexts!" no smile, no charm or whatever..after you paid for your cream puffs ..no thank you or "would that be all?" question. I don't know what's wrong with these people.  SMILE!
author: joy d.

description:
What's with the white beard Papa?  At first, I thought you to be Gorton's Fisherman's (the frozen packaged fish) twin.  You sure had me fooled.  GIGANTIC cream puffs in flavors galore; vanilla, chocolate, coffee, green tea, earl grey tea, pumpkin, strawberry & eclair.  I've always eaten and made them half the size.  This is a real bargain at $1.75 for the basic cream puff.  There's nothing like biting into a cream puff with cream oozing out 270 degrees around your mouth.  Good concept with creating most popular flavors of cream.  I've always gone back for the double chocolate which is the puff with chocolate cream inside and coated with chocolate shell on top. 

Mmmmm.... excuse me while I wash my face.
author: Nanette L.

description:
Great cream puffs! My favorite is the vanilla cream puff. I like seeing all the specks of vanilla bean in the cream. Plus its not too sweet. My husband's favorite is the strawberry cream puff with real pieces of strawberry in them. They do a different flavor of the week, you can go to their website and see what the flavor is for each day.

They don't seem to taste as good after a couple of days. If you end up buying a box of them, probably best to make sure they're all consumed within 24 hours.
author: Francine S.

description:
So much hype... I saw the famous sign and I just had to try one... The long ass line had me convinced as well...

BUT... I guess I'm just not a cream puff kind of girl. I GOTTA ADMIT THOUGH, it was the best cream puff I've ever had. However, I expected some kind of flavor explosion that just did not happen. 

Tasty, but not my type of sweet.
author: kate r.

description:
Remember when you were a kid, and you couldn't wait to open your presents on Christmas morning?  You reach for this big box with a big bow, you tear it open and . . . what do you find?  A bright red and green sweater with a giant Rudolph on it, and yes, his nose does light up!  All the other reindeer are there too: Dasher, Dancer, Donner ...  Bummer!

That's pretty much how I felt the first time I tried Beard Papa.  Having heard stories of my suburban friends driving 30 miles into the City just to taste these epic cream puffs, I expected much, much more.

Don't get me wrong, they're good.  What's not to love?  Puff pastry?  Good.  Custard?  Good.  Powdered Sugar?  Good.  A thousand calories you probably don't need?  Not good, but OK every once in a while.

The Beard Papa eclairs are OK.  Chocolate and Vanilla eclairs are fresh and tasty.  They're nothing special, and I definitely wouldn't drive 30 miles to get one.  What is special, however, is Flavor of The Day.  It puzzles me why one could only get a strawberry eclair on a Tuesday and a green tea Claire on a Thursday (please consult your local Beard Papa for days and flavors).  

I really want to know: what happens to strawberry flavored custard on Wednesdays or Sundays?  Why does it disappear and where does it go?  Sounds like a conspiracy theory.  Actually, I believe I have heard of an underground strawberry flavored custard storage facility outside of Ely, Nevada . . .

Word to the wise: cream puffs have CREAM inside, so they are pretty messy.  Remember, Ms. Fork and Mr. Napkin are your friends - invite them to the party.
author: Yan G.

description:
Why did you have to come to SF? Without you, I would be able to refrain from cream puffs. But now you flank my gym on either side. And nothing is more irresistable. The basic vanilla is still the best, though the cheesecake sticks are actually pretty good too. 

My friend introduced me to the cream puffs in NY... after all, everything comes there first. I thought we were safe, but we weren't. I can't say I'm entirely devestated. This place makes for the best emotional eating ever... take one bad mood, add Beard Papa cream puff, walk out high on life again. Then head to the gym to work it off and get some healthy endorphins going too ;-)
author: Shoshana D.

description: Tried my first beard papa's cream puff in san francisco even though they have one down in los angeles as well.  I havent had it in awhile so I decided to get one since we were in the area.  They had a green tea special so I tried that.  It was actually pretty good b/c it tasted very green tea-ish but I think I prefer the classic vanilla.
author: Di L.

description:
Of course, I'd been hearing about this place for freaking ages now (well, not this particular location, but anyway) and since I was engaging in a teeeny bit of retail therapy, I thought I'd try one.  (Because mall walking and trying on clothes clearly burns enough calories to justify it, right?)  I've never really been a custard fan, but you know, gotta see what people are talking about.  I got an eclair filled with vanilla custard.  I was happy to have the chocolate on top 'cause that's what really made my experience.  The chocolate is sweet, but not too sweet, and somewhat firm so as to provide a bite (not at all like a chocolate donut, for example).  The custard is very creamy, but I thought it would maybe be a little sweeter -- paired with the chocolate, however, it's perfect.    

bonus star for having about a 3 minute line, as opposed to a 20 or 30 minute one.
author: Nat K.

description:
Update:
Anonymous Beard Papa Addicts (ABPA)

Kekeke. I'm addicted. I stop by here every Friday after work now. Screw the latte effect. Deserve it or not, I have a $3.00 allowance for this weekly habit.

---

The vanilla bean puff was a splendid treat after a long day at work. Beard Papa has nothing on those I-Mei plastic smelling cream puffs. Cold or warm. The thick looking carb is deceivingly light, crisp, and airy.

Most importantly, no MSG or preservatives. Fresh rocks!
author: Cathy H.

description:
I usually don't like cream puffs because I dislike whipped cream, but Beard Papa's cream puffs are to die for -- instead of a whipped cream filling, they use a rich (yet seemingly light) custard filling, in a variety of flavors. The green tea cream puffs are my favorite! The chocolate, vanilla, and cookie ones are scrumptious as well.

I've been wanting to try their cheesecake on a stick for a while, but I always end up just getting a bunch of cream puffs because they are just so good. Maybe next time...

The lines are always really long, though, but I suppose they go through the orders pretty quickly....
author: Misono A.

description: Cream puff galore. They have regular vanilla or chocolate. Eclare and a crunch puff... $2.25 a puff but it's so good. Decided to get a 6 pack. Not good for the 6 pack. :)
author: Gordon J.

description:
A store that only sells cream puffs? I was intrigued. They must be super-amazing-orgasm good, right? Not really.

I went to the Bloomingdale's Bear Papa first--where they only sell vanilla, chocolate, and chocolate eclair flavors. There's another location on Mission that has specialty flavors they rotate each week. The ones I can remember off the top of my head are pumpkin and green tea. Pumpkin flavor BTW was bleh. I'd rather have a pumpkin pie. If you don't want the specialty flavors then the Bloomingdale's location will do just fine. I also like that the Bloomingdale's location is in the basement of the mall because it's more convenient.

As far as cream puffs go, I like that they are fresh but they are so big that eating them is a HUGE MESS. I guess this would be ok if you have that fetish where you like to be covered in food. I don't. The chocolate eclairs are even messier. I practically needed to take a shower after eating one of those.

In summary, good cream puffs but not good enough to crave. They're comparable to the frozen cream puffs that Trader Joe's sells.
author: Cindy P.

description:
So, it was 8:30 when we were there, I assume they close at 9 along with the rest of the mall?  My friend was talking to the staff asking them about the flavors and what they had left.  In the middle of her talking to them, they shut off their lights.  She wanted to order 6 and they told her they only had 6 left.  So someone comes in a different area of the line and they help them... so she gets behind him and a bunch of ppl get in line.  She decides to just get 3, and the other staff keeps saying oh we have 3 left, oh we have 4 left... the number keeps changing and so does the flavors even though they weren't making any more for the night.  

The sign they have for the menu is cool.  It's also cool that they have a location inside the mall.  They just need a location closer to me now :)
author: Kymberli C.

description: My aunt just came back from a long day of shopping and she stopped by at Beard Papa.  She brought me a vanilla cream puff.  She told me the story of how this chain has come from Japan and they are known for there cream puffs.  If anyone knows me they know I love any pastry thats cream or jelly filled.  The pastry was flaky and light.  The cream not to sweet and you can see the specks of vanilla bean in the cream.  You know its made fresh every day.  It had enough powdered sugar on top and with one bite globs of cream spilled from every angle.  Messy but good this cream puff was.
author: David P.

description:
I'm hesitant to write this review, because I feel like the novelty will have worn off and Beard Papa will be out of business by the time I'm done writing. And then I will have wasted my precious time reviewing a business that no longer exists.

Regardless, I need to weigh in: These things are really boring. I was expecting sweetness outside, chocolatey goodness inside.
