Instead, it was bland, chewy, and I happened to choke on the cloud of powdered sugar I inhaled as I held the mushy puff. The chocolate filling could've easily been vanilla that was colored brown. No flavor whatsoever.

And, it fell apart into a pile of crap before I took two bites. Where's the magic? Not worth the time, money or calories.

Beard Papa is French for cotton candy. Which I'd much prefer to these cream-dumps.
author: Emily D.

description:
Sometimes, I'm slow to jump on a bandwagon.  If I were a lemming, I'd be the one left behind scrambling around trying to figure out which cliff to jump off of.  This can be good (aka. not purchasing the iPhone), but sometimes this can be bad (aka. not investing in google stock in my mid twenties).  

In this case...eh...I don't really think it did me any harm.  

The bf and I were "wandering" aimlessly yesterday and happened upon Beard Papa.  I almost forgot this place existed.  I always MEANT to try it, but there are so many other places that I want to try for dessert, that it just fell off my radar.

Yesterday, we took the plunge.  What did I think?

Well...

it's ok

the filling  - good
the pastry shell - decent
the price - eh.

I think that the consensus between the bf and I was that we enjoyed it, but for a puff, $2.25  is steep and $2.75 for an eclair that really is miniscule is eh...

So, there you go...
author: Hiromi N.

description:
I forgot to go to Choux Factory in New York to compare.  I like that they Beard Papa has different shells.  I love biting into a creamy strawberry eclair.  The original shell isn't flaky and vanilla custard is light.  When it warms after the summer you can have an ice cream sandwich now.

I like the chocolate fondants more than the cream puffs.  I read from Heidi C.'s review that one is 600 kcal but Ivy W schooled me that its only up to 220.  In the middle of the food court, cluttered with chairs they were friendly, organized, and quick.  The cream puffs are consistent and good.  There are usually only two flavors of the week.
author: Ai M.

description: I don't know how to drive in he city and often take the BART when I need to do business.  My sister asked me to buy her half a dozen of these a few weeks ago and told me it will not inconvenience me since it is inside Westfield mall and I can exit right into the BART Powell station.  (I hated the thought of carrying pastries in the train).  I ate one piece when I got to her house along with some coffee and felt like I had died and gone to sweet heaven!!!  The next time I went to the city I made it a point to buy a dozen before I went home!  The pastries are good to eat right at the counter but I personally prefer to refrigerate them for an hour so that the filling is also slightly chilled.  Great with coffee or tea!!  The filling tend to ooze out when you bite into it so it will be helpful if you help kids when they eat this puff otherwise you will get the filling everywhere!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Beard Papa was my introduction to cream puffs. I actually feel weird writing that, because I think it's still the only "real" cream puff I've ever had, but it was absolutely perfect! I have a new favorite type of chocolate treat. (Definitely planning to try the green tea flavor on a friend's recommendation.)
author: Sharon W.

description: I LOVE BEARD PAPA'S.  This airy, light, heavenly creamy pastry is to die for. Sadly, they have weekly flavors. It's not one of those places where u can order whatever. They have the usual chocolate, vanilla, and their flavor of the week for the filling. they chocolate cover cream puffs and they have eclairs. their vanilla flavor is very rich and yummy, it just melts in your mouth. however, i LOVE the green tea flavor. I always look for it whenever I'm in downtown but its never that week. Very disappointing but i still get the vanilla bean. star deducted for only having one flavor a week ):
author: Kristina L.

description:
4.0 Stars

cream puff (noun) - a hollow pastry made with Choux paste and filled with pastry cream.

My first experience with Beard Papa's was when my sister brought it home for me to try.  She told me she picked it up from within the Westfield Shopping Center eatery.   To my foolishness, I had this weird thought in my head that cream puffs were supposed to be served warm with the sauce oozing out. I decided to stick the cream puff in the microwave.  That lead to a disaster because the cream puff instantly became super flat.  I managed to get the oozing filling I was looking for though!

I digress.  Overtime I decided to try Beard Papa's again.  I've been to a couple different Beard Papa's locations across the Bay Area and visited this establishment this past weekend.  

Beard Papa's has Vanilla Bean and Chocolate in stock all the time and tends to rotate its other flavors between Caramel, Green Tea, Pumpkin, Coffee, and Strawberry.  Flavors for 2010 in SF can be found here: http://bit.ly/9jR6Tw.  At this location I saw you have an option for what type of cream puff you want to be filled.  Amongst the selections were the normal cream puff shell, a cookie crunch puff shell, and a chocolate covered puff shell.

I was in luck this week since Strawberry was the flavor on rotation.  I immediately knew I wanted Strawberry with the cookie crunch puff shell.  The cookie crunch puff shell is a little more expensive, but it is so worth it!  The Strawberry filling is also very scrumptious.  It's super smooth and has actual Strawberries bits in it. The cookie crust also gives the cream puff a good contrast in texture, similar to dutch crunch bread, but of course this falls apart a lot faster in your mouth.

I didn't have to fight with much of a line since it was a little before noon on a Sunday.  The staff was helpful, friendly, and quickly completed my order.  I would come back for sure.

== A MUST TRY! ==
author: Jason H.

description:
I don't eat cream puffs very often because every cream puff i had either was too thick (the cream felt more like eating butter) or the pastry wasn't flaky/crispy enough to my liking.  

One day I went to meet up my cousin to do some damage to our wallets and she bought me a cream puff.  She started to rant about how great it was and this and that.  So, I bit into the cream puff and it was like heaven.  The cream is so light and so vanilla-ey.  i love it!  i ended up buying another one to divulge in before we left downtown.
author: JUDY L.

description:
I love cream puffs!  They are a memory of my childhood when my mom used to make them all the time, so I have high standards.

The vanilla is the only flavor I like as a cream puff and the cream has a wonderful taste of vanilla bean.  I just wished these things were warm.  They would be so much more 'melt in your mouth' if the pastries were not cold.

Not really worth all the calories and fat.  And kind of expensive ($1.75) for such treat.
author: Julie R.

description:
This Beard Papa is much smaller than the one across from Metreon, but this little outpost is a fine-tuned machine. The service is faster and even if I'm not seeing them make these cream puffs in front of my eyes, I'll take their word for it and order half a dozen anyway.

Then I follow their instructions and eat all six cream puffs within 24 hours.
author: Wella L.

description:
The very first time I found out and tried the Beard Papa's cream puffs was when I was visiting the Kodak Theater in Hollywood last year. After the first bite, i fell in luv with their cream puffs. The puffs are crispy & filled with a creamy filling.. It's best when you eat them freshly-made, but they're still good the next day. I was so happy when they opened their first shop here in SF Bay Area. 

So far, i have tried their vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate flavours. I still have to try their green tea puffs next time. Still wishing somebody open a Pinkberry store here in the Bay Area!!!
author: Jenny K.

description:
I love eclairs and a good eclair is really hard to find. I make my own but don't always have the time these days. The pastry at Bear Papa is really light but I am not crazy about the filling. It's too runny for my liking and I wish it were more custardy and less milky. 

The rice paper lanterns shaped like cream puffs really crack me up!
author: E. M.

description:
Eeh. 

That's pretty much all I can say. Im not a huge fan of the cream puff, but yeah. I felt like the ice-cream part of the puff wasn't very ice-creamy. It was creamy, but not icy. I dunno, I dont especially care for it... :|
author: Dustin H.

description:
I ate my vanilla bean cream puff as I walked down the busy, windy streets of Sanf'csco with my silly company laughing out her lungs as she saw how messy I was with the oozing custard pastry. Crazily took shots of the moment while we were making our way out of the people-packed pavement... (Need to hide all those funny pics!!!) I just luvd it and I didnt care-- how many times a week do you enjoy such a sweet delight? My hair all messed with the creamy filling, as the wind kept it sticking to my puff, the flakes and powder all over my shirt--

i just didnt care-- and thats how I knew I so liked my creamy creamy cream puff.....
author: Athens r.

description:
Date visited: 2008-06-05

Yum! Yum! Yum! I tried a Beard Papa's cream puff by chance for the first time last year leaving a filipino festival near the Mission Street location.

Delicious! They must put crack in that custard! haha

My favorite flavor is vanilla. Although I have yet to try the green tea.

Anyway, nothing special about this location. Other than that it is Beard Papa's and it is in a mall! Wahoo!
author: Lily L.

description:
After starting classes at SF State CEL, I've been visiting Beard Papa more often.

I got a chance to try their Strawberry creampuff in an eclair (chocolate dipped on top). Oh my goodness, this is a lil bit of heaven.  It was really good.  Too bad they only do strawberry once a month or something.Now I hv to wait.  If I could give it extra stars, i woulld for the 10% discount SF State students get! woohoo!

Also, their strawberry cheese sticks are good too! Just the right amount of cheesecake to fill you! yum!
author: AhLin C.

description: Why 3 stars? I had it in London for the 1st time at Oxford Street and the puffs was so fresh I was spoiled. Beard Papa in general is good.
author: Elaine S.

description:
stilll love the strawberry one!

but the green tea? BLEH not a favorite, the flavor is too conservative for a cream puff..

chocolate one was ok not that great
author: Christine M.

description: Who doesn't love cream puffs? And now they've got the the cookie crunch that makes it all that much better... in two words, it's "yummy goodness"
author: Heidi L.

description:
Best treat on Market Street
Beard Papa's is the place to go
The chocolate eclair with vanilla filling 
Makes me smile and keeps me chillin!
author: Mani R.

description: Perfect cream puff - just like the ones I had in Japan (Beard Papa's is from Japan I learned). Not overly sweet and reasonably priced.
author: Jess C.

description:
Ok.. yeah.. they were pretty good...  5 stars good as in the best cream puff or pastry or dessert I've ever had?  Not quite.

My brother brought over 3 flavors.... one I guess was the regular, one was green tea, and chocolate.

Green tea - ehhhh  not so much...  maybe I reacted to it like I react to butter popcorn jelly belly's ... shrug... didn't like it

Chocolate - shrug...  no opinion here...  

Regular cream filling - yeah.. pretty good...  not so good as say Leonard's Malasadas... but... sure.. pretty good.  

Overall.. I don't think they were good enough for me to crave... if I was killing 15 minutes on the same block that they were on.. I might stop in...
author: Eric K.

description:
They have stopped making the milk tea flavor cream puff and have replaced it with tiramisu. This makes me very sad. They accept credit cards with a purchase of at least $5.

Onto better news.....they have the best cream puffs I've ever eaten. When I'm feeling down, I go here for a quick pick me up.

Ooooohhhh, Aaaaahhhh...

After reading my yelper friend's review (shout out to Tiffany W.) I decided I had to try a Beard Papa cream puff before I left San Francisco today. Thankfully, my sister's and I have all inherited the same sweet tooth so it was not a problem to convince them to have one with me. Damn, those things are perfectly cooked and the cream (I had a vanilla and tried the chocolate one) was absolutely delicious. They also have a very efficient assembly line pumping those little suckers out. This was a happy treat for the three of us.
author: Carly M.

description:
I just tried this place for the first time yesterday after a co-worker recommended it. OMG sooooooooooooooooo good. I got the vanilla creme puff. Holy shit...f****** AMAZING! 

Anyone want to come next time? YUM
author: Anne A.

description:
When I first tried these cream puffs, I was in heaven. I don't particularly like cream puffs but these are different.  The cream is more like a custard and the vanilla flavor is robust and just delicious.

Vanilla is my favorite and the only flavor I get. I can probably eat a whole dozen in one sitting! They are so addicting!
author: Karen K.

description:
I was excited to try this place here in SF as I've had it before in NYC.  

Bah, I was disappointed that they didn't the green tea-flavored cream puffs when I went.  (I have a weakness for green tea-flavored anything!) The sign said they were available, but it turns out they rotate particular flavors depending on the day of the week.  

I settled for caramel--it was pleasant enough, but I didn't even finish it if that means anything.
author: Manny P.

description:
I love it. Some people think it should be whipped cream but I like the filling thick with a strong vanilla taste. Crust is light & without the buttery taste. It is always fresh and they have special flavor of the month!! 

$2.5 each is a bit much but definitely worth it in my book.
author: Maggie C.

description:
Why is it called Beard Papa? 
I...I really wanna know... 

Anyways, the first time I had Beard Papas was a year ago when my roommate brought a box to the room. Because she's such a lovely person, she bought me some. I loved  them! They were do delicious! Mind you, at the time I was only able to eat USF Cafeteria foods. 

1 year later I'm living on my own, buying my own groceries, and cooking my own food (I know, I'm so proud of myself). I go back with my boyfriend after job hunting and...Well the cream puffs aren't quite the same. Same flavors, same menu. The taste: Decent. For something you specialize in, it better be more than decent. Especially since it's the only thing on your menu. Not the mention the powder on my cream puff made me choke :[
author: Allie W.

description:
Oh yes, this was possibly one of the finest fried puff balls i have ever had!!  Light airy and filled w/ chocolate and or vanilla custard.  Had I not been such a lady, i would have horked down mine and my dates!!  Instead I shared and offered up the rest to my gentleman caller as only a lady would;)

I think the chocolate was better, yet the vanilla was also mighty tasty.  For sure make sure you go here at least once and savor the gooey DELICIOUSNESS!!!!
author: Nicole F.

description:
When I see this place... I need to walk fast past it.  Otherwise, I'm inhaling these things and before I know I'm savoring every last bite (in my case maybe two bites tops).  These lovely puffs with that custardy, sweet, vanilla crack inside it... gooey, addictive, and just plain bad for you, but god they are so hard to resist.

To those of you who bring these puffy lovelies to potluck parties, you inhabit the realm of deities.
author: Alex D.

description:
You know...not everything can be creampuffs at Satura Cakes in Palo Alto or the Valrhona chocolate covered eclairs at Tartine.

Sometimes you want near, now, & cheap. 

BP's cream puffs are pretty good. I like how they keep changing the flavors up & I like how I can get an "eclair" (a chocolate covered cream puff) at a pretty reasonable price. 

Also, BP's will always have a special place in my heart because its the first creampuffery/pastry place I went to in SF. Maybe not the best, but good enough.
author: Diana H.

description: They have the best cream puffs. Not too heavy and not too light. I just wish that they didn't screw up on half my order... very disappointing to come home with three chocolate instead of green tea when I've been salivating all the way home thinking about the green tea.. =(
author: M W.

description:
Luv the cream puffs.  It is the only place I know where you can ge fresh chocolate, vanilla and strawberry cream puffs daily.

Japanese culture is always cool...
author: Raider J.

description: This was my first encounter with Beard Papa even though I live next to several of them here in SoCal. The puffs were great; flaky and not too sweet. I really like the strawberry puffs. Yummy.
author: Yvette B.

description:
When the Westfield Mall first opened, I knew that I had to try a Beard Papa cream puff.  After hearing so many friends rave about it and always walking by the longs lines at their store on 4th Street, I thought, "Hey, why not?"

I waited in line for almost fifteen minutes to buy half a dozen cream puffs (3 vanilla, 3 chocolate).  Upon first tasting one, I was underwhelmed, but after the second or third, I started to really enjoy them.  The puff is very light and airy and the cream is subtly sweet.  I'm not a fan of super sweet cream puffs or a thick custard filling, so these were perfect.  These go down fast and easy.  Perhaps its their airiness that makes them so easily digested.

I would definitely recommend the vanilla over the chocolate, even though I LOVE chocolate.  To me, it seems like they just add some cocoa to the vanilla cream, and it tastes a bit too grainy.  Not smooth at all, which is not what you want in a cream puff.

So, if you haven't had one, I would recommend one.  They're delicious, not too sweet, and all natural or organic (I forget which).  Hey, if you're gonna eat a cream puff, it might as well be a quality one.
author: Vicente G.

description:
Beard Papa, your store and your rather odd mascot fill me with deliciousness. Yes, I will most definently pay 1.75 for a massive cream puff that is warm and flaky, hand made on the spot, without preservatives. I'm a plain vanilla lover, but I'm curious as to the green tea and strawberry. 


Mmm,, puffs. Not the healthiest, but more filling than other pastries I think.
author: Carly S.

description:
The SF Theatre Fest gave us an excuse to try the infamous Beard Papa for the first time.  (Beard Papa [the mascot] actually made an appearance!)  

Unfortunately, these sweets live up to the hype.  Vanilla bean cream is piped into the light, flaky puffs before your very eyes.  Chocolate fondant, nuked for 15 seconds before serving, is a fast, guilty, little pleasure.  

The bottom line:  The fast food of sweets -- it's tasty and I like it! 

ERF
author: Emily F.

description:
Mmm.. once you pop, you just can't stop. Okok so that's pringles but you get the point. 

I've never actually bought a creme puff, but who needs to when you have co-workers.  If I only indulge in the fluffy goodness when it's free, it can't be that bad for me. 

Papa Beards did good! Light, fluffy and whipped to perfection.
author: Sara D.

description:
OMG this place is soooo good. My bf is obsessed with BP and EVERY time we go to the mall we end up picking up a puff. 
I usually get the eclair one (chocolate on the ouside and classic vanilla on the inside.

This place was almost ruined for me this past summer when a coworker of mine bought a dozen of these (on a day I didnt work) and being the sweetheart she is, saved one for me. But she didnt refridgerate it. She insisted I eat it...against my better judgement (dairy+non refridgeration=curdling in tummy)
I bit into the still crispy shell and into a gooey rottom glop of cream. 
Seriously almost puked.

Thankfully, that memory was a million miles away when my bf were cruisin through the mall and he said "We have to get a beard papa!"
I decided to expand my horizons and get a STRAWBERRY cream puff. AND MAN O MAN my love affair with BP was re-kindled. I could have eaten 10 of them. But im a cheapass and just happily devored one.
yum.
author: Keila E.

description:
Beard Papa...why such a strange name? Should it no be Bearded Papa? Or Weird Papa? Well, it was named by someone in Japan. 

Cream puffs (or "shoe kureemu"  if pronounced properly in Japanese - choux in French, of course) is a French invention, perfected in Japan, and now being imported to the United States. 

Kind of like a Citroen with a Toyota engine being sold on Steven's Creek Auto Mall. 

Choux Creme has been available in Japan for decades and has taken on a branch of its own, like curry rice. I'm sure it is not how the French intended it to be, but who cares? This stuff is good.

It is also addictive. I think it has crack in it. Come to think of it, the crack dealer on my street was an old guy with a beard. 

 I can eat at least 6 of these in 10 minutes; almost as many as the custard tarts from the Golden Gate Bakery.

By mixing cultures sometimes you get great results; Beard Papa Cream Puffs is definitely one of the great examples. Ninja Turtles is the downside.
author: Pachirisu P.

description:
2 friends and I had visited the Art museum to enjoy the Frida Kahlo exhibit, and decided to toast to Frida with a few margaritas at Chevys! HA!!!! That was a great idea!! We left there giggling and roaming the streets in the neighborhood, and came across this place called Beard Papa's. Naturally in our state of mind we thought it was quite hillarious, so we decided to walk in and see what it was all about. BEST DECISION EVER!!!

Since I had never had cream puffs, I didn't know what exactly to expect.....so I figured my safest bet was to order a chocolate flavored whatever-it-was....because what could really taste bad thats chocolate?!?! I was amazed!!!! So tasty!!! My mouth is watering now just thinking of them! Cold and creamy, like pudding but better, tucked inside a light, flaky ball of dough....a puff! 

We walked away so glad we had had those margaritas....because without them, we wouldnt have stumbled (literally) into the tastiest bakery in the area!!!
author: Amorous A.

description:
Good but not as good as Hawaii (which is not as good as Japan). The Choux pastry was just as good but they skimped on the filling!

For those who are wondering - the filling is richer and tastier in Japan.
author: Alan N.

description: Maybe I'm just not a cream puff person but I've had their cream puffs on two separate occasions and they just weren't doing it for me. I got the strawberry the first time which I thought was ok. The second time I got vanilla. I think strawberry tastes better than vanilla. I gave the place a second chance but it just was not appealing to my taste buds. I feel they were overall pretty bland and I did not find the shell tasty either. I have not been to any other cream puff place so I have nothing to compare to. If this is what cream puffs are like everywhere then cream puffs just aren't for me.
author: Helen L.

description:
Got the Pumpkin filled creme puff, $1.95+tx=2.12.

It was good, light, sort of crispy, the pumpkin filling was yummy.

Now, if only the puff wasn't 'dry' and it was warmed up... might be even better?
author: qirk z.

description:
How can I resist these edible clouds of delight? I can't and I don't. I give in every time. My favorite is the chocolate cream puff. I only discovered these cream puffs when Westfield mall first opened. I had no idea they had already opened a location by Sony Metreon. I could have been enjoying cream puffs long before the Westfield location. Oh boo!

I've also tried the clair and the cheesecake but I always go back to the regular cream puffs. I like to watch them pump the cream into the puff shell as I wait to get my order. That's how I know each one is made fresh. The packaging is cute too - a box holds a half a dozen to a dozen. My family goes crazy when I bring this tasty treat home for dessert. These tasty treats are affordable and is a must have on my list.
author: Candace F.

description:
Me love me some creme puffs!!!!! So delicious.  I love both the eclairs and creme puffs both in vanilla bean flavor.  I have had the chocolate filled creme puff, but that was just ok.

Whenever I go I can't just get 1 I have to get like 6 haha, but luckily I have willpower and will only eat one a day.  They actually last like a whole week in the fridge which is awesome, especially since I live like an hour and a half away. I can't be having beard papas every day, sad I know. Since the introduction to this place  I have found that I will find any excuse to go into SF whether it be shopping, to get my hair did, or to go out to dinner with friends just for Beard papas (pathetic ehh ).  I can't help it!!!!!

The only thing I really don't like is their display of the actual creme puffs prior to being filled, things that run through my mind are: Why are they all just sitting in a bucket in one big pile? It disturbs me.  I wonder how long have they been sitting there, are they fresh? And not to mention it looks sorta cheap.
author: eeerleni d.

description:
My sister will ride out to SF on BART just for Beard Papa's.

My whole family is crazy for the cream puffs.  Our favorites are the plain vanilla, eclair-style, and cookie crunch.  So far, I only really like the vanilla bean cream filling.  I've tried chocolate cream and was a little disappointed with it.  I do want to try strawberry sometime though. 

My mom will probably kill me for saying this, but she actually will run her finger over the plate and lick her fingers to get every last drop of cream.  She doesn't do this with anything else.
author: Dana I.

description: Can't go wrong with Beard Papa's, but if you want to avoid the crowd and congestions, swing by the Yerba Buena one.
author: Eric A.

description:
Its like cocaine. Highly addictive.

Green Tea & Pumpkin are by far the best flavors! 

We even mark our calenders and have count downs at work until the Green Tea Flavor week. Oh, & get the Sugar Cookie Crunch puff pastry.. phenomenal.
author: Francesca L.

description: Beard Papa's cream puffs are the BEST. I usually settle with an original cream puff, or an eclair. Sometimes ill go for the chocolate cream puff, but they are ALL amazing. Decently priced and delicious!
author: Daniel S.

description: It's so upsetting that I would have to fly all the way to SF to eat from here again. These deserts were amazing. Who would have thought a little dessert place in the food court would turn out so well for us visitors. I had the mouse strawberry cheesecake and could have eaten a whole cake. The portions were not to big either so I felt like my sweet tooth got enough. This is a must try! Come to San Diego Beard Papa's!!!
author: Misty B.

description:
Where have I been?  Obviously not hanging out at Metreon or Westfield Center.  I saw this place at the Santa Anita Mall but didn't stop.  I should've.

If you like eclairs and cream puffs, Beard Papa's has really tasty ones. 

I had the caramel.  The puff was light, flaky and buttery - as a puff should be.  The cream was also light and had a pudding-like texture, not at all heavy.

A must try if you are in the neighborhood.
author: J H.

description:
Oh my God. These cream puffs are so good, I don't even care that they are like 400 calories each. 

They've got rotating seasonal flavors, and right now at the Westfield food court, the are rocking Tiramisu and Pumpkin. You can get them in "cream puff" or "eclair." Of course I got the eclair (same as puff, just with chocolate ganache drizzled on pastry). 

Cheese cake sticks are brilliant, who ever thought you could eat cheese cake to go, and the portion is perfect. 

Not something I eat all the time, but definitely for secret trips to the mall.
author: Nadine S.

description:
YUM YUM.
Thanks to my sister(a fellow yelper) I was introduced to this place. They have the most delicious cream puffs I ever tasted and the price was reasonable. It was a perfect way to end our day of shopping in San Francisco.
author: Lupita M.

description: Can you say yum?! I had the pumpkin, chocolate, and vanilla bean cream puffs and they were all scrumptious! My fave was the vanilla bean. I can't wait to try their eclairs next time.
author: Jenny K.

description: Everyone was in a cranky mood this morning at the office.  How do you fix that attitude?  Beard Papa!  Bought six of the Vanilla Bean and six of the Chocolate cream puffs.  As always, they were delicious.  The boss broke in to a smile and joked for a bit.  The German intern smiled.  All is well with Beard Papa cream puffs.  You cannot go wrong with great treats like Beard Papa.
author: Tony L.

description:
I have died and gone to heaven.  This is crazy good people.  Who came up with this stuff?  My sister-in-law just recently introduced me to this light and scrumptous cream puff.  I'm ashamed to say that I can eat so much of this in one sitting. I'm a bad girl...shame on me.

Honestly though, the light and puffy pastry and the caramel filling is the best, you can't have just one. Try it and you will LOVE IT.
author: Betsy N.

description: I love, love, love , love this place. These bad boys are so fresh, light and slightly messy. I could eat these forever and never get sick of it. If you are ever feeling down, or sad or in a hateful mood, go to Beard Papa, your mood will change for sure.
author: Trisha C.

description:
pretty sad that the pastry portion of the cream puff was not as fresh, but it was still good!!

they have coffee flavor (this week) at this location.  i'd have to say vanilla still takes the win.
author: Lisa T.

description: Love the chocolate and vanilla filled puffs! Vanilla bean wins over the two... Perfect pick me up in between shopping at Westfield. Can't wait to try them freshly JUST made though.......as well as Mocha.
author: Kelley N.

description:
These puffs are simply divine.  I like to go here even though there are alot of teeny bopper skank hooches and $luts parading the infamous San Francisco streets... I just ignore them because im on a venture for a cream puff at beard papas.  Not only is everything fresh but you can taste the freshness and it doesnt leave the icky residue on the top of your mouth.  Absolutely wonderful.  If I were getting married, these hot puppies would definitely be the belle of the ball for finger linkin goodness... Imagine a towering "cake" of beard papa's puffs... mMMmmMMMmmmm.  

Beard Papa, why do you make me a victim of your deliciousness?
author: Diana T.

description: If I compare with beard papa's cream puff in Japan,  the amount of cream is smaller than that in Japan. But still it is Yummy!!
author: Kozy T.

description: My hunny works near, and he brought some home.  Mmmmmmmmm the strawberry cream and the vanilla hit the spot!  The fisherman did look a little pervy though...hmmm.
author: Sandra H.

description:
So, here I am - completely unsure of how to --exactly-- pop my own Yelp cherry. You see, I'm a Yelp virgin... and though I may be inexperienced in these regions, I come prepared. I bring along with me, a protective Asian flavored Mary "de sade" F.  She's my yellow fever homie and I, the cream puff. 

Now try to imagine: this situation for a minute: (The food review I swear will happen, eventually) Mary & I met in class (A) and later found each other in another class (B) at the beginning of last semester. She walked in late (class A) and I'm sitting there staring blankly at the professor and she smiles and sits down somewhere in front of my seat. 

My first impression was, "Oh that's cool someone actually smiled at me" and didn't give me the - "OMG YOU WEAR BLACK YOUR THE DEVIL OMG OMG LOLZZ" - Look. 

Right, so break time came along and I'm heading for the proper smoke section when I see that Mary chick again & she's already out there smoking away in the NON-designated smoking area. I ask her politely "do you know where I can smoke?" (even though I see her smoking right where she pleases) & she says "Uh, somewhere over there but you can just smoke here security won't notice" so second impression of Mary is: "Ah, spiffy she doesn't seem like a tart" So I light up, & we make small talk. She lends some academic advice toward my interest in science and later tells me a quick story about her trips to Africa. third impression: "THIS bitch is whack... No I'm kidding ;-) I thought this girl probably has a lot going on under the surface than expected.." we return to (class A.) day ends.

Next day I come to (class B) late, mid-class girl with tightly pinned up doll-like hair turns around and I see it's that Mary chick again...I felt reassured as she smiled at me and said "Oh hey you" as we recognized each other from (class A). 
  It's always nice when you don't feel alien. So we head out to smoke during a break I believe - and conversations are had, followed by many more, and many many more.
...Followed by both mutually agreed lame field trips, gentle hang outs and lots of going to class late from picking each other up and carpooling to school and from school while each time getting side-tracked or chatting it up, too much. Yes, that's Mary - the proverbial chatter box with late tendencies - whom still always seems to manage to get everything done right. One astute little bugger ain't she? Needless to say? a fond and, unconventional friendship was created. This was nothing unfamiliar in my personality either - both open wounds - infectiously inviting anything interesting and flowing into our lives. Fancy that. I had never met anyone so unlike & like me all at once. Mary has the ability to provoke you - in ways you'd only imagined. I am a dreamer and to me Mary's life was the dream I'd only thought of  - meeting her made my thoughts and travel hopes and goals in life seem much less sterile, and more real. 

Yes right so. You may be asking yourself what the hell this has to do with food, aye? Well it does ! Because I'm a vegan. No I lied. I'm a vegetarian whose too addicted to cheese, wheat and butter to become a full vegan. Hey, I haven't eaten meat since I was 11 1/2 years old. I'll be twenty-two = AUG 3RD. So do the math, that's epic shit right there. 

Now then. It's last Wednesday Mary & I have some other lame ass field trip. We go, we fool around get the Professor all kinds of miffed at us. Then we part ways with (class A) and head to this cream puff shin-dig that Mary mentioned in passing - during the pointless field trip meandering. I hadn't had anything creamy in so long since I'm sensitive to milk (borderline lactose intolerant) - I was craving something with a milky kick. 

I swear I must have poked Mary and yelled the word 'Cream Puff' to her about twenty effin times on our way to the shop because I was -that- excited. By the time we get there I think she was just so annoyed with my dire NEED for this blasted cream puff she just bought me the damn thing so I'd shut the fluff up. Well it worked. My pallet hasn't experienced anything so lush in the dairy department in so long, it was like I had an mouth-gasm. 

Only my reactions to said cream puff were thwarted because I had to contain my excite:  we were walking around with a dude from our class who probably would have had too much delight in my reaction to that. So, I just privately enjoyed the sweet creamy, flakey, lush puff of yum. And amazingly I didn't get a lactose reaction from it. No my intestinal lining didn't coat itself with mucus + I seemed to only want more of said puff. 

It was a really warm afternoon in SF, the cream puff hit the spot... in more ways than one. Mary stuffed her chocolate flavored cream puff in my face to sample, and I was overall delighted. 

As you may or may not learn. I can be long-winded, off-track, confusing, and erratic. Moral of story? My Meeting Mary + Cream Puff = love.
author: Hilary K.

description:
out with the wife having a typical walk her home from work and we end hungry and at the food court in the mall. well this mall has some good enough food. normally we fill up on dinner and never need desert.

well this time there was room and she suggested maybe we should have cream puff. i'm thinking why the hell not. we have shared one before, but this was going to be the first time i get one for myself. 

let me tell you it is so much better to bite the calorie bullet and get your own. i got a vanilla and it was so good. and i was thinking all i ever had to watch was my beer intake. now i'm might add to my beer belly with a beard papa belly too ; ) damn you san francisco and your cream puff
author: roger b.

description: Chocolate dipped eclair + vanilla/green tea cream puff = heavenly melt in your mouth deliciousness. I love that the cream inside the puffs aren't so heavy - less of a guilt trip for me! Try it, you for sure won't be disappointed.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Light, fluffy, creamy.... soooooo good.

I dream about beard papa's...... it's that good.

I always keep it classic, orignal flavor.
author: S A.

description:
well, it took me about six months, but i finally had my first beard papa's vanilla cream puff........and wow!........holy moly mackeroly! i feel the magic. i hear the music. i see the light. i believe! i believe!!! yes, it is the real mccoy. no, beard papa is the new black. no, beard papa is the new kool aid. yup, so drink the kool aid, kids. drink the kool aid. it's good for you.

um, sir, i would like a dozen more, please. thank you, beard papa!

ahem, if you're the type that counts calories, that's 230 x 12 = 2760 empty but delicious calories. now that's a meal!
author: frisco j.

description: Fondant au chocolate.  You're small but sinful.  It's like having pudding in a cake with just enough sweet goodness.  My hips say thanks for the carbohydrate memories.
author: Jen L.

description:
Cliffnote version of my review:  Big WASTE of Calories, get your A** Fat on something better.

I'm from Vietnam and if you've ever been to Vietnam you'll notice that a lot of restuarants there serve one dish or a few variations of essentially the same dish so I was pleased to see Beard Papa stick to pretty much one item that they've hoped to perfect.  Although I try to keep the hating to a minimal online I must say that the people who opened Beard Papa have no clue, that's right, absolutely clueless about what you put in a cream puff.  Hmmm.. it's called a CREAM puff for a reason, duh.  If you heart custard and think that viscous, yellow goop should go into anything and everything than you will love Beard Papa's overstuffed, disgraceful pastry shells filled with all the goop you'll ever want.  Aside from the goop, the pastry shells suck donkey balls as well.  If you want to save your $$ and have cream puffs that actually contain cream get the bucket at Costco in the frozen aisle as that stuff  bears a closer resemblence to a true religiuese than Beard Papa's.
author: Amber L.

description:
ehhh...

i got the vanilla & pumpkin cream puffs. 
it tasted like what I was expecting and I like the vanilla better. 
they put so much cream though...i think thats what killed it for me. I got really thirsty too! weird. 

the pastry was light and pretty good! 

2.25 per cream puff.

I dont think I would ever come back here..I feel like I have had better..
(Although, I did go in with HIGH expectations.)
author: Jen T.

description: *Tip: it's still good after a couple days, once reheated in the toaster at 200 degrees for 10min.
author: CINDY K.

description: I remember all the rave about these little cream puffs.  I still remember going to San Fran and waiting in the long ass line just to buy some.  I remember one time I ate a whole dozen myself.  Crazy! They were the best puffy, soft, cream pillow goodness I have ever tasted.  The cream is the best part, all you want to do is either lick or suck out the filling.  I am a vanilla girl and always will be but I remember making a trip up to the city just to satisfy my cravings.  Now that we had them in the South Bay, my cravings are not as much.  I still buy them occasionally or for someone Bday.  Anyone who needs a cream puff fixed should go to Beard Papa.
author: Donna Y.

description: You know, the way people have been talking about these cream puffs, upon eating one, I was kind of expecting to see the face of God or maybe Charlton Heston. Joan Rivers? SOMETHING! But you know what, they're just cream puffs. They're good and I do appreciate that they fill them to order so the pate choux doesn't get soggy.
author: Josua P.

description:
the regular was to die for, but the flavored filled shit was so gross it made me want to barf!!!!


do visit this overly sized creme puff!!!!
author: Nina M.

description: I am not a big fan of dessert but Beard papa and all the cream puffs are awesome. The vanilla cream puffs are great, Try it yourself.
author: Sasitorn O.

description: Delicious! All different flavors and they're so big! :) yay for giant cream puffs!
author: Tiff W.

description: Trust me, I have always hated cream puffs.  But these are like those footsie machines at the end of a day at the fairgrounds...so refreshing and wonderful.  People had built up my expectations and I was still completely floored.  Japanese people know their desserts!  Don't mess!  (ps try the milk tea ones, you won't be disappointed!)
author: Allison K.

description:
You probably think I'm crazy, but when I had my first Beard Papa's cream puff @ this place, I fall in love w/ it!! When I came back to OC, I search crazily for Beard Papa here..and found the one in Marukai...  =)  Oh, and even when I was in HK, I took my friend to look for Beard papa too, and now I got her addicted to Beard papa now.  

Back to the subject, the location for this Beard Papa's is consider a prime location.  It's inside the upscale shopping mall, inside the food court next to all the delicious foods..and everything was over-priced, hehe.. so a $1.75 puff is nothing consider other place are charging $10 and over for an entree. I tried the fondant au chocolate, cheese cake and the coffee cream puff.. I want to say I like them all but cream puff wise, I would just stick to the original.. if you look closely, you will see vanilla beans in the cream.. so it's a gourmet cream puff, not some ordinary puff.  *I'm craving for one now.. *  The Fondant au chocolate is really good when it's freshly out from the oven, it's like a souffle, it's warm, moist and w/ cream center.. cheese cake is really good too, and not very sweet and the shape make it easy to eat.. I can just eat my cheese cake while shopping in the mall.  ;)
author: Kate T.

description: This rating isn't actually fair. I love Beard Papas. I'd give it a 4 star. However, this location somehow makes inferior ones compared to the one on Yerba Buena a few blocks away. Not sure why - and might be just this one time, but the cream puff i got was not filled all the way with custard. That's my only complaint. The custard is the best part, and this one had a noticeable air gap of emptiness! That is all.
author: Carol L.

description: I came here about a year ago and really liked it. Not so impressed today. The chocolate filling seemed to sweet, and pastry too crispy. There's better puffs and eclairs out there.
author: Susan R.

description: I remember that my aunt had to wait in line for over an hour to buy cream puffs when Beard Papa's first opened, but it was definitely worth the wait. The cream puffs are so delicious. I also love the fondant au chocolate. Unfortunately, there are no Beard Papa's where I live now, but whenever I go back to California, cream puffs are on the itinerary.
author: Herman B.

description: OMG chocolate eclair with caramel. Delicious and not too sweet
author: Dave B.

description: Is there anything more heavenly than these creampuffs? They are fresh, fluffy, and filled with cream that is flavorful but not too sweet. I've tried caramel, chocolate, and vanilla and I have to say vanilla is my favorite. They have vanilla beans in it so it is more fragrant and it has just the right amount of sweetness. I first tasted these when my sister brought some home and I fell in love. Now whenever I go downtown to hang out with my friends, I always buy a box of 6 to bring home and gobble down with my family =) They are pretty pricey for me but they're still worth it and if you buy 6 they are cheaper.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Is it obvious yet that I'm cheap and have the refined tongue of a pebble? Ok then: I don't see the big deal over Beard Papa. I understand, oo they "make" it in front of you (I'd be more impressed if I saw the puff come out of the oven and the filling mixed right in front of me rather than being in giant metal containers) and oo delicious. Please don't strike down my unrefined butt, but really, it's just a cream puff. $2.25 for a single one? Not bad, but not awesome either.
author: Yan E.

description: I finally tried the original cream puff as well as the crunchy one.  My first experience was not a very good one. I tried the chocolate (clairesque) type of puff. The chocolate was too hard and the cream wouldn't make it into my mouth to save my life. I did however have a nice coating of cream all over my hand. This time around I finally experienced the original cream puff with regular filling, chocolate filling, and the green tea filling. The puff themselves are not all too spectacular, but the filling is just heaven in your mouth. The creams (all of them) are not sickenly sweet or bland.  I found the filling to be just the right flavor at just the right consistency.  The green tea and chocolate just had enough of the chocolate and green tea flavors without it being to overpowering.  For those of you who are texture eaters will find the crunchy puffs more to your liking. I would not recommend taking them home or refrigerating them as they will not be quite the same, but I guess that is expected. I found myself back in the East Bay wishing I had brought more home though.
author: Steven T.

description: Strawberry Cream puff was extremely satisfying with bits of strawberry to tickle the taste buds
author: Michelle C.

description:
Good god I was drunk.  At 4pm on Saturday. Of course, that really means nothing in of itself because I've often been drunk and I will probably still have drunken times in my future and there will be some during daylight hours no doubt.  However, it does explain why I thought it a good idea to see the movie Sicko at Westfield AFTER the Yelp Elite event at XYZ Lounge and grab a couple of cream puffs for my viewing pleasure.  I can only imagine the fumes I was giving off and how I swayed gently like a weeping willow in a hurricane whilst standing in line amongst the tourists and children.  
I ordered one chocolate cream puff and one vanilla cream puff.  I'm pretty sure I slurred my words because I recall having to repeat my order.  I took my cream puffs with me into the movie theater and restrained myself from eating them until the movie itself was underway.  Do you know how hard it is to keep oneself from eating pastries during a set of previews?  I started getting the alcohol sweats from the effort!  I persevered though and didn't eat them until the movie started; at which point I inhaled both cream puffs within the first 10 minutes.  Mmmmmm....yummy.  
I think the vanilla is definitely the superior of the two but they both managed to soak up the alcohol nicely and leave me a lot more sober than when I arrived.  This was particularly helpful as I had a Bastille Day party to go to next and needed to have the energy necessary to retox.
author: Jill D.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE their cream puffs!! Their vanilla cream puff is so good!! I've tried their chocolate and strawberry cream puffs. I have still yet to try their other flavors. Best cream puffs hands down!!
author: Kristine D.

description: Meh, I don't really care for creampuffs. But my dad does, and so does my mom and my siblings. And I like to keep them happy even if it means that it's a pain in the ass to get cuz I have to park the car and walk. And then I have to drop them off at their place... sigh,  the things you do for love.
author: Chum L.

description: Oh oui oui! The vanilla bean creme puff is absolutely divine with its perfect amount of sweetness and creaminess tucked into the lightly golden, buttery poof. Ooh la la...
author: Donna A.

description: The Beard Papa cream puffs look way better then they taste...They are sweet and not very exciting....like some people.
author: Bleep S.

description: Indulging a Beard Papa habit is probably worth the year of your life that you'd lose.
author: Ben A.

description: Oh sweet vanilla bean specks. Why are you so tasty? I could gobble down 2 Beard Papa's cream puffs no problem. Probably 3, but then major guilt and self-loathing would ensue, and who needs that? Hubby's favorite is the clair (which is, from what I can see, a cream puff covered in chocolate, and just something to get in the way between me and the delicious custard). I usually try the special flavor of the day if they have it. So far,  I have tried the pumpkin, strawberry and caramel. The best so far is strawberry (Mmmm).  I have eaten the ones from the BP's in NYC as well as Redwood City, but for some reason the ones here are the tastiest. * sigh *
author: Mashi M.

description:
this stuff is the shiz. good for u? hells no. tasty? u betcha. 

i could eat like six puffs (more into the traditional vs the crazy flavors). just cream puffs and coffee & i'm in my own universe.
author: Jeremy D.

description: I came here after I have my first Beard Papa's experience in Hawaii. The employees were nice, happy, and helpful. There was little or no line! We practically lived off these puffs while vacationing. When returned home, we were excited to find that Beard Papa's finally made it here! Eh it was OK. First of all there was a long line and the employees were just herding the customers to move along. Unhappy puff maker, assembly person, and grumpy cashier. After that really positive experience in Hawaii, I think I was expecting too much. Puffs were the same but the the employee here do not capture the Aloha spirit. As I bit into my puff, I was disappointed and missed Hawaii.
author: Nikki N.

description:
saw the store at the mall, 

stood in line curiously,

paid for 2 chocolate, 2 vanilla,

watched as they stuffed those pastries with the cream,

ate one and didn't understand all the hype....

until i got to the addicting filling.

*and i love the yellow boxes!
author: Rinne R.

description: Originally found this chain in Hawaii, I was surprised to find it in the states as well. They had this new cookie crunch top which was incredibly good. I also enjoy the original puff here....these things are like 2.25-2.50 a piece, but are well worth it!
author: Eugene H.

description: this sh*t is f*ing with my girlish figure. NOT COOL. crack pastries like this are the perfect follow-up to a "healthy" meal at out the door, right next door. walk it off, dusty...walk it off.
author: dusty d.

description:
I've never had a cream puff before so this was my first time trying one out.  I tried the chocolate one and it was OK. It didn't give me a 'jump out of my seat delicious' type experience or anything, it just tasted like a pastry with .. cream.  Maybe it's just me.  

The only thing that bothered me was the smell of the pastry. It smelled like floor cleaner.
author: Dong Q.

description: Great for a snack. Had one minor hickup here when they put to much cream it felt like 90% cream 10% puff. Good problem to have for some I guess.
author: Sean T.

description:
i love these guys.

i could eat four in one sitting and hardly blink. the puffy, creamy, sweet and deliciousness is hard to resist. you know it.

i bought two to bring home to the bf after i went shopping with my uncle on friday and you know what, he found them unable to resist as well.
author: Irene S.

description: It's funny because I've been here so many times, yet still find myself circling around and around to look for it! Delicious, as always. However, this location has less flavors of the week compared to the one down the block behind Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf. The customer service has always been nicer at this one though.
author: Elaine H.

description: Only ok. Usually when I eat something that fattening I prefer it to be more decadent than a limp piece of pastry enveloping something reminiscent of Jello vanilla pudding. Dunking it in chocolate doesn't make it tasty enough to merit the caloric intake. I might as well just tape two of them to my ass and call it a day. That's where they'll end up if my thighs reject them. Blast those fat cells- they are like elephants. They never forget.
author: Stacy T.

description: I havent been into the store yet, but a friend (a very  very good friend now) brought these over and I was able to taste the most delicious cream puff my tongue has ever tasted.  It had a vanilla center and it was pure perfection. Not too sweet and not too heavy. Pure heaven. This makes me want to trek across town just to pick up a few...or 20.
author: Veronica P.

description: Damn the green tea cream puff. Those things are evil.  I am so afraid of ballooning up......I am ever thankful that I am a runner and can eat as many as I want without gaining an ounce....but then again I might turn diabetic.....got to stay away from these luscious things....let me go get some tomorrow!!!
author: Chris C.

description: I'm usually not one to make waves, but wow, I really dislike Beard Papa's. I have a total sweet tooth and I love dairy, but their cream puffs really make my stomach turn.
author: Matt N.

description: I embarass myself (or more like I embarassed my sister).  After having a great lunch in the shopping center I passed by Beard Papa and noticed these delectable softball size puffs behind the glass.   Could this be that great that this shop can survive on the sales of cream puffs??? Yes! Yes! Yes! I had my (Meg ryan) When Harry Met Sally  moment at the first bite.  I chose the vanilla which they fill on the spot and dusted with powder sugar.  I chowed on this thing so fast that i had a face full of powder sugar and vanilla custard. Never mind that there were two good looking guys on the escalator behind me and I was licking all the custard off my fingers.  It was  worth it!!!!
author: shirley m.

description: I absolutely love the TV show "How It's Made", so watching my cream puffs get prepared is always a treat in itself. As you know, cream puffs are delightful when you moderate how you eat them. Don't think four stars is encouraging you to eat these by the dozen, they are delicious but quite fattening. Proceed with caution, try one of their vanilla cream puffs, but remember - one is probably more than enough.
author: Taylor S.

description:
everytime i come here, i just buy anything and everything that looks good to eat.

cashier: "hi. how can i help you?"

me: "can i get one of those cheesecake sticks and one of those strawberry cheesecake sticks?"

(cashier puts cheesecake sticks in bag)

me: "what kind of cream puffs do you have?""

cashier: "vanilla, chocolate, and pumpkin."

me: "can i get one chocolate and one vanilla, please?"

cashier: "it'll be $8.20."

i thought to myself "holy shit.  the fuck did i just buy?" 

yes, their pastries are expensive. but they are SoOoO good! i seldom come here and  i havent had beard papa's in a while! so its okay for me to splurge on sweets every once in a while! 

thank you beard papa's for making me such a fatass! XOXO
author: B B.

description: I always their their puffs are too sweet.  But of all the flavors I do like the vanilla the most.  Very creamy inside and the puffs aren't soggy at all.  They do have a new item now which is their tiramisu.  I say it's ok.  It comes in a shape of a biscotti.  A OK
author: Crystal L.

description: I was brought here for one of their signature cream puffs.  A pretty good snack.  Nice crusty pastry filled with gooey pudding-like cream.  I went with the vanilla, a good call.  And managed to eat it without losing too much of that filling, although that's probably something of an acquired skill...
author: Dano W.

description: Okay, Beard Papa sounds a lot cuter in Japanese (bee-ah-do papa) but this place is great! It's not a fluffy whipped cream, its a very dense and rich filling.  Next I will try the chocolate. Be careful not to inhale the powdered sugar when you're about to take a bite! (i choked on it..)
author: Emiko M.

description: All I can say is mmm beard papas I love your messy, creamy goodness.
author: Falyn J.

description: Very good tasting cream puffs.  We got six of them--two in Strawberry, Chocolate, and Vanilla.  Yum!
author: Paul L.

description: Can't go wrong with Beard Papa's! I first tried it out in LA then was excited to learn they were opening one at Oakridge Mall (when I used to live near it--sadly I heard it closed down).  Anyway, the cream puffs are a decent size with LOTS of cream inside.  I've tried all the regular flavors, plus a few of the Flavors of the Week.  The eclairs are pretty much cream puffs with chocolate on top.  All of which are good.  Then again, I'm partial to anything sweet =)
author: Tess E.

description: Damn you for being soooooo delicious! I hate that I love you so my dear Beard Papa! Oh why do you have to be in San Francisco. I'm not a long distance kind of girl! If you weren't so warm and sweet and tender... I would have left you long ago. Although I've gone to Hello Desserts in San Jose a few times, they just don't compare to you. Don't worry, they're nothing to be jealous over, I'll be back soon!!!~
author: Beverly T.

description: The classic vanilla and chocolate flavors are great, but when caramel is available, watch out. I will run you over in order to get them.
author: Noelle Q.

description:
dear beard papa,

you used to be my favorite cream puff joint. then i discovered pacific puff. i still love you, but now you're second on my list.

please don't take this personally.

love,

tb
author: T. B.

description:
the secret to eating these bits of heaven is to first

1. create an entry way.
start with a small nibble that won't break open the pastry out the sides.  
2.  work your way into the puff by licking the stuff inside.  
3. repeat nibble and step 2 
if you reach the middle, you are on your way to success.

i always mean to just buy a couple but somehow when i get to the cashier, "i'll take a dozen please" seems to spit out of my mouth. 

i have an aunt who used to make these for me as a kid. (yes, i was chuberella but a happy kid!) and she used to have a glaze of hardened sugar on top - i guess like a creme brulee top. ack, probably the only thing to improve these yummy puffs.
i'm just glad that i don't live next door to them.
author: Anh V.

description:
imagine this, a puff pastry tactfully injected with cold succulent cream. topped off with powdered sugar, wrapped in a soft tissue. its quite blissful. the smell of a beard papa pastry is undeniably infatuating. while i eat one, i look out the window at all the poor souls out there.. i think to myself.. "look at all these people, they must be so sad... smelling these puffy creations, but not being able to gather the courage to indulge on a few hundred calories of fluffy heaven". 

Definitely buy one. quick. fast. tasty. satisfying.
author: Tony W.

description:
I was kind of underwhelmed by these cream puffs.

You see, the ones you get in Japan are so fresh and so tasty that for some reason, these just didn't compare. I was expecting some kind of nostalgia to overcome me, but it didn't happen. I guess some things are just better where they're made. Does that make me a snob???
I mean cream puffs are good, but they're not THAT good. Especially not here. Go to Japan! hehe.
author: Aiko L.

description: Wow! They offered pumpkin cream puffs in April. I indulged here one night and bought a pumpkin filled cream puff. The filling was very light and everything aside from ease-of-eating was heavenly.
author: Chrissy Q.

description: Huge, soft, powdery, flaky cream puffs oozing with creamy vanilla goodness delightfully tickling your taste buds creating mouth watering urges for more.   Beard Papa's summed up in one word = YUM
author: Christine D.

description:
love this place. there is often a line but only 2-3 people in front and they are fast. and the puffs are fresh UNLIKE the redwood city location!

eclairs, yum!  double chocolate.  Yum!
author: Sophia Y.

description: In a word, DIVINE!!! The most airy, fluffy, creamy, deliouciouuuusyyyyy (not a word, I know) cream puffs ever. I prefer vanilla, but the green tea is SO yummy too. Good thing I have to go out of my way to get these, otherwise i'd weigh 400 pounds. Drooling as I type this....mmmmm
author: Nicole L.

description: I've tried both the coffee and chocolate puffs and I must say it was divine decadence!! not super sweet but just right.
author: Erica Z.

description: The puffs here are tasty although I prefer my cream to be a bit more thicker than how they do theirs. The hubby had chocolate filled and I have regular cream filled. Don't get me wrong they are really good, i was just expecting a thicker middle.
author: Brianne G.

description: I love Beard Papa cream puffs....and every location I've ever had them from has been utterly delectable. However, I'm afraid that cream puffs at the Westfield location aren't as good as I remember from the other locales, but they do hit the spot!  Maybe it's just a new store thing. I will however, return.
author: Suepattra M.

description: I don't even like sweets and I liked the vanilla cream puff here.  That says something... I'm not sure what though.
author: Bryan K.

description: I had tried their creme puffs several times and thought they were just OK. I had tried to vanilla, chocolate, and milk tea. I also tried their cheesecake sticks and they weren't that great. I finally went during a week that they had the strawberry filled ones and those were divine!
author: Diane M.

description: I am not addicted to sugar. I don't eat desserts for the sake of eating, well, sugar. These huge, messy blobs of artificial tasting goo are not worth all the hub-bub. They are the Krispy Kreme of the next 18 months.
author: Rene D.

description: I like their vanilla cream puff.  Grab one with a cup of coffee and you have a nice afternoon break from all the mad shopping in the mall.
author: Lynnie P.

description: You have to try it to believe it.  But be warned: once you've tried one, you'll be hooked for life.
author: Corey C.

description: Not really a cream puff fan, but I must admit, this was really good. My co-worker who I lovingly call "Big white man" got some Beard Papa for everyone and I almost choked on the cream puff because I inhaled the powdered sugar on the puff. After I took a smaller bite, I realized that I am eating liquid heart-attack and I love it! You can't just eat one and stop.. this  magical cream puff will make you become an addict and want to eat more and more....
author: Annie L.

description: I'm so glad there isn't a Beard Papa in San Jose - otherwise I would be their often. You only need one of these if you are craving for something sweet. I got the vanilla one. The filling is not too sweet and the puff is moist. I want one now just thinking about them. They're not dinky little cream puffs so seriously one will do. They're pricey but they're worth it.
author: Carmen L.

description: Yummmmmmmmm....   These cream puffs are hella good.  When I first heard about this place i was like yeah yeah cream puffs whutever.  In my head all I thought were those ones you buy in bulk in the white plastic tub at Costco.  Nothing special.  Anyway my sister really insisted that i go try one.  So me and the gf go and get some and what do we see.  Cream Puffs as big as your head...no jk.  Cream Puffs as big as donuts.  Boy do we get pretty excited.  Anyway we order some and.....wow they taste like heaven.  They are so fresh and tasty.  My faves are the vanilla, chocolate, and caramel.  Yum yum yum!
author: Adrian D.

description: These cream puffs are good but the way San Francisco has become addicted to them so quickly and with such abandon makes me think of the Futurama episode in which Earth develops an insatiable appetitie for Fishy Joe's Popplers, right up until the people of Earth learn that they've been eating the eggs of a horrible and warlike alien species. Think about it.
author: David Y.

description: i didnT know if i should eat it, but after trying a half of a piece, i found out that it was so tasty!!! So my friend wenT back and ordered a half dozen of those puffs, and we split it. This is a very tastY treat and you won't be sorry!!!! Make sure to trY all of them, the VANILLA, CHOCALATE and the STRAWBERRY.
author: herm p.

description: When I ate my first bite I swear I could hear angels singing...This place so so good. Flaky, light crust and then a cream but not overly sweet cream. Must try. It's wonderful this "beard papa".
author: Kat F.

description: The Japanese have indeed created a superior cream puff.  You'll be tempted to bring some home for the next day or freeze for later, but your better off just coming back regularly.  These cream puffs are assembled to order and should be enjoyed immediately before the custard begins to separate and the shell becomes soggy.  (There's even a disclaimer on the box that says they must be eaten within 24 hours!)  There's a rotating flavor of the week, but nothing beats vanilla.  The cheesecake sticks and chocolate fondant cake are also worth a try.  They don't call him "Beard Papa" for nothing.  Check out this video about the genius behind it all:  http://www.muginohousa.com/main.php?nav=the_beard_papas_story
author: Kevin G.

description: It's a god damn cream puff factory. Best eaten while you are standing there big-eyed.
author: J. R.

description: Excellent cream puffs!  The first time I had them was a few years back in NYC.  I remember them tasting slightly better there but these are still very good.  I ordered a few green tea and vanilla puffs to bring back to the family (my grandpa even loves them!).  The green tea tasted a little strange - just didn't go right in a cream puff.  The vanilla ones are the best!  It's best to scarf these down asap as they get stale if you eat them the next day.
author: Cynthia H.

description:
ok stop!!!

you've gotta have the cream puffs from this place.

if you see me licking my fingers, it's probably bec. i just came from this place !!! 

scrumptious!!!
author: monica s.

description:
the cream puffs here are like the one-night stands of the dessert world.

they hit the spot, require the least amount of commitment, and never quite fill the void of the real deal-- the almighty formal croquembouche (caramel or chocolate drizzled, pleasethankyouverymuch). BP's cream puffs warm the bed, but leave you lonelier when it's over. still, the taste is well worth the long walk of shame into bloomingdale's. :T
author: Vanessa D.

description: actually, 3.5 stars for this BP.  4 stars for the concept, cutesy packaging, friendly p'noy staff and yummy strawberry gourmet creme puffs.  the chocolate and vanilla are  ok.  the green tea is blahhhh!  -.5 stars for the madness hell that is westfield food court and lack of seats and tables.
author: Kris H.

description:
mmmmm. i just can't get enough. i was just coming down on the escalators to the emporium and the sweet, intoxicating smell of freshly baked beard papas is already drifting into my nostrils and beckoning me to come by and just "see what the special flavor of this week is...."

and before long it's "okok let me just take some quarters from this weeks muni fund to buy one...."

and eventually i turn mr. hyde on your ass and it's  "BACK OFF BIATCHES THIS PUFF IS MIIIIINE."

i bought half a dozen for a coworker of mine who just finished taking her lsats (god knows that deserves a big treat) and the special flavor of the week was tiramisu so i had two of those, two of chocolates, and two vanillas. 

I must admit, the cream puffs I'm used to arent quite this big and cream doesn't explode into your mouth as you bite into it. and everyone likes explosion of cream in mouth, no?

....

BUT. I suppose Beard Papas is just catering to us American fatty fat fats by supersizing it to giganormous portions. although it irks me that i get sticky fingers after finishing one of these puppies (not to mention feeling like a tub of lard as well) i still give beard papas five stars because it's one of the few places i can get japanese style cream puffs that i so often crave at a convenient location.  i have to pry myself away from the entrance to the mall everytime i pass by to go to the BART.....

good bye no-sweets diet. you and i had a wonderful 32 hours together.  on my way to beard papas now.
author: Peggy W.

description: Lynn and I stopped by here because I've never had them before. She went with another friend and they each had three or something, so she said I HAD to try them! I didn't care for the chocolate one, but the vanilla was pretty tasty. The girl who filled them for us didn't do such a good job because I always think you should have more of the cream than the puff. She didn't hook us up at all. But I will give it another shot because I have such a sweet tooth!
author: Mary T.

description:
After BFF raved about Beard Papa, I was excited and anxious to finally try these morsels of heaven! We went with a Chocolate Puff filled with Vanilla and also tried a Tiramisu Cheesecake Stick. The cream puff was not only beautifully large, it tasted great! The chocolate tasted as if it was dark or semisweet, which went perfectly with the sweet vanilla custard inside. The puff was slightly crisp with the perfect airy lightness you'd expect from a cream puff. The filling  was fresh and creamy and was the perfect custard like consistency. It had a lovely and prominent vanilla taste which nicely counteracted the richness of the chocolate. I wish I could've brought a whole dozen home, but that would be setting myself up for disaster.
The Tiramisu Cheesecake Stick was just that- a stick, about an inch wide and 5 inches long, of tiramisu cheesecake. The crust was dense and the cheesecake layer was nice, but it just seemed like a normal cheesecake. The top cream layer, however, was the only tiramisu part of it- it was light and creamy and had a slight espresso flavor to it. This was the best part of the stick. The top was heavily, and I mean heavily, dusted with cocoa powder which made the initial bite of the cheesecake stick really dry and unpleasant. I noticed BFF and I were shaking it off before each bite. 
However, Beard Papa is famous for their Cream Puffs, which is what they do best. I look forward to returning to this gem, but only for their lovely clouds of happiness.
author: Anabelle S.

description: Good ol' vanilla wins again! I have now tried strawberry, chocolate, green tea, pumpkin, and coffee. None of them come close to the vanilla flavored one. Delicious! Wish I could buy just the cream filling.
author: Wendy L.

description: I specialize in being late to the party...  I read the news stories of the long lines of folks waiting for cream puffs.  How good could they be?  I finally got my mitts on them at the Westfield food court.  Custardy goodness oozing out of the pastry shell.  Especially good when waiting for a movie to start up on the 5th floor.  Skip the chocolate and 'special' flavors.  Their vanilla signature puff is the best.  Instead of Beard Papa's, they should rename their joint "Puff Daddy."
author: Esther R.

description: This place does it right.  The cream puffs here are PERFECTION. I tried the pumpkin flavor and it was delish. It was a lighter version of pumpkin pie. Gobble Gobble ;)
author: Katherine W.

description: The cream puffs here are not sugary sweet that's why I like them. Between the regular puffs and chocolate dipped puffs (half dipped), get the regular kind. It's easier to eat without the chocolate cause it makes the pastry hard. You'll need several napkins to eat the cream puffs cause they're oozing with cream once you bite into it. I should have tried their pumpkin flavor but maybe next holiday season. By the way, I got vanilla bean too.
author: Stella S.

description: All I've got to say is wow...These cream puffs are crazy delicious! I really like the strawberry flavor and the green tea one the best! The original vanilla is also very good as well. I like it when they just make the puffs and you buy them when it's still hot and moist. Indulging in these cream puffs are a real treat. The strawberry one is real fresh and the green tea one is amazing and off the hook good! Totally good for green tea fiends like me :D
author: Hannah L.

description: I had the cream puffs for the first time for dessert on Friday nght, and they were delicious!  I wouldn't have thought I'd like them (as I run more to profiteroles with ice cream than with cream), but I was tres wrong.  They were a perfect finish to our fancy Chinese banquet, and a good pre-filler to the vodka rocks that followed.  (It was that kind of night.  With me, straight off the plane from Hong Kong.  Nary a nap in sight.  Just fancy food, Beard Papa, and vodka.)
author: Laurel B.

description: The cream filling is so fluffy and light--I love the vanilla bean flavor (you can actually see the vanilla bean).  The pastry flaky and buttery.  Beard Papa's cream puffs are unlike any other, especially those frozen cream puffs...
author: Elaine Z.

description: The chocolate cream puffs taste like heaven! Well... more like chocolate ice cream that doesn't melt, wrapped in light fluffy bread. I haven't tried the other flavors which gives me a good excuse to come here more often.
author: John L.

description: mmm, this place is sooo goood. i never liked cream puffs before but I thought I'd try this place and I am sooooo glad I tried it. the filling inside is so delicious....sorta creamy, sorta runny, so so good. and it goes perfectly with the outside cream puff layer, which is crispy, warm, soft...all at the same time. also, not too sweet! definitely coming back here for more!
author: Liwei Y.

description: oh my gawd, anorexic and bullimic eaters should check out this place. It will make your stomach cringe and you won't even have a problem eating ever again. I got that green tea and vanilla cream puffs (healthest choice i think). I got not 1 but 2 not 2 but 3. Oh yeah, they were so damn good and I just couldnt stop eating them. I'm thinking about my next beard papa's visit. It might have to be lunch time today. Is it lunch yet???
author: Michael K.

description: I was in San Fran for a conference recently.  Beard Papa was the absolute best thing about my trip.  A friend who lives locally brought me one when he met me.  The vanilla Beard Papa creme puff is oozing pure pleasure into your mouth.  I tried a few other flavors and none of them came close to the Vanilla.  When I got back to Seattle I noticed that they were opening one here too.  The one in Seattle never tastes as good as the one in Cali.  You are lucky if you happen by this place or if you are lucky enough to frequent it.  Enjoy the happiness!
author: Kiran C.

description: Legal Crack! You don't see lines this big in Oakland, Hunters Point or the Tenderloin, waiting for the real deal. Nuff said.
author: Mike C.

description: I enjoyed the chocolate flavored cream puff that I had, but I am not sure that these live up to the hype.  Still, it was tasty and a fun treat for only $2 and the line wasn't too long.
author: Michael E.

description: Until now I thought cream puffs were dry, bland, crusty blobs filled with weird vanilla pudding stuff.  That is until today someone at work brought in a few boxes from Bearded Papa's to celebrate some  misc work achievement and - oh my - I have been so wrong!  A delicate almost breadlike shell filled with chocolate mousse.  I swear to god I almost spilled it all over myself due to the shock of how delicious it was.  Chocolate mousse?  In a cream puff?? Who knew?  For the first time ever I am actually glad I decided to eat work treats because I was bored and looking for a little bit of happy.
author: Valerie D.

description: God I love this place.  I don't like sweets -- always skip the dessert.  But these cream puffs is better than sex.
author: Tinou B.

description: The cream puffs and Eclairs are good, but I love the chocolate molten cake! Definitely will cure any chocolate craving. I get a few go to ever time i stop by the west field. 30 seconds in the microwave and you'll be in heaven!
author: Samantha S.

description: This place has become a must go place for me whenever I visit the city.  I've never heard of beard papa until they open one up in the bloomingdale/westfield food court!  I later came to find out that Beard Papa is quite popular in New York and countries in Asia!  The cream puff is really fresh and delicious!  My favorite is the Eclair with vanilla filling.  Try the cheesesticks too, it's very light and delicious, and inexpensive!  I think the puffs are a bit pricy, but it's worth it since I don't eat it often. I've tried the chocolate filling, strawberry filling, vanilla filling, and green tea filling. i'm not too crazy about the strawberry and green tea, but chocolate is pretty good and vanilla is my favorite! Yum yum!
author: Mina T.

description:
i expected much more from this place.  my sweet tooth is usually easily satisfied by any kind of cheap dessert, but this little cream puff - which wasn't all that cheap for its size - wasn't all that great.  

the cheese stick was good, but not worth a revisit.
author: Immer E.

description: I've never been to one, but I've had one thanks to my crazy just-smear-it-on-my-ass friends ;) Awesome stuff. Just light & fluffy enough and not too flakey. Perfection.
author: Maricel B.

description: Delicious invention by our Japanese friends. Their vanilla bean cream puffs are ah-mah-zing! I'm curious to try the chocolate cream puff, with chocolate flavored puff. And the special flavors that rotate every week. I'll switch my medium flavored coffee for this any day (240 cal, $2 a pop).
author: Mahreen H.

description: Great Fast cream puffs...in caramel and vanilla flavor which I tried was yummy, the outside was crunchy and the filling was more liquidity then your french pastry.  It's delicious!!! I love it... check out the web address will give your all the locations that are in the USA..
author: Tulie L.

description: For some reason I couldn't shake the feeling that I was eating a cream puff filled with warm strawberry yogurt. Eww. Perhaps the other flavors are better but I'd rather waste the 48902 calories on something more worthwhile...like a hamburger.
author: Nathalie L.

description: This place has the second best cream puffs I've ever had.  Consistently delicious with a really creamy fresh taste.  They're quite large and impossible to eat without making a mess.  My favorite discovery upon moving back to SF was that Beard Papa had opened locations here.  I was also glad to discover that the quality is great at all locations.
author: Molly R.
