description: I saved my lunch calories for this?!?!  Did I order the wrong flavor??  Umm..the vanilla cream puff is just okay.  Not mind blowing, but then again I was never a big fan of cream puffs.  The cream puff was kinda dry and the custard filling was cold...very jello pudding like.  I will go back to try the other flavors, but I'll take a chocolate brownie or a cookie over that any day.
author: hello k.

description:
jesus freaking christ dude, each bite of a cream puff is like a piece of heaven. i LOVE the cream fillings.. and they come in all kinds of flavors.. can't go wrong with good ol' strawberry, green tea is pretty bomb if you're into that.. and of course classic vanilla bean is always good too. 

its kind of a love and hate relationship with this place.. as much as i love treating myself to these near-orgasm-for-my-taste-buds delicacies, they're totally ambushing my attempted healthy lifestyle and "diet." 

hmmph, that's why it didn't get 5 stars from me.
author: Jennie L.

description: OK cream puffs, but just OK is not what I want when I'm probably packing 800 calories in my mouth.  I miss the Choux Factory in New York:/
author: Mary C.

description: This place is so good that I'd walk the whole nine blocks to go through the crowds. One time I made my friend buy a half dozen for me (except I had him bring it to this dessert pot-luck birthday party for my roommate, so I had to cram a bunch into my mouth before feeling ok with sharing the  remaining two puffs with 20 other people. they're much better fresh, right in the mall, btw). Five stars for the vanilla cream puffs. Crunchy on the outside, not too sweet, and so so good. I never tried any of the other stuff because I usually gorge on the vanilla cream puff before thinking.
author: Teresa Y.

description: I love Beard Papa, just like EVERYONE ELSE. Everyone else that's in line ahead of me at closing time (which is WAY too early to be at the entrance to Bart, in my opinion) and who snaps up all the puffs (traditional vanilla bean is still the best) before I can get to the register. The last time this happened, they were nice enough to send round a guy to COUNT the leftover puffs and let us losers at the back know that they'd scientifically determined that we were S. O. L. Thanks for rubbing it in. So yes, I love their "shu creme" but I'd love even more if they were open weird hours, like the one near the Hiroshima train station I used to stumble to after a long night of fun.
author: Spratt M.

description: My $1.75 was well spent for a vanilla bean creamy goodness
author: Grace C.

description:
if i could never have sex again i would be very very depressed. i would resort to eating beard papa for every meal and become one of those sex addicts that likes to molest food. ***i will molest you, you little cream puff!!!*** and it would be very very sad. see that girl over there? the one poking her fingers into the vanilla center of that puff? she's never ever going to have sex again. 

oh well. at least i'd have beard papa. he's everything a girl needs to be happy.
author: diana m.

description: First time eating this may be confused by the fact that I was totally drunk and it was sitting there waiting for me... and it was absolutely delicious! I think I should try one when I'm sober... I will review it after I do that. :)
author: Nannie D.

description: Really Yelpers, Really.........what is it, I wanted to love this place but my taste buds would not allow me too.
author: Rossi C.

description:
some say...vanilla is boring
but this dessert will knock your socks off
author: Kristal S.

description: Never really liked cream puffs until I had one from Beard papas.  The original vanilla flavor is what I usually get but they rotate a special flavor here and there.  The puffs are crunchy on the outside and filled with all creamy goodness on the inside.  I love em.
author: gareth l.

description: Finger lickin' gooood! Great location... perfect for munchies on the go! I can't pass by without getting one OR a dozen!
author: Anne T.

description:
oh my little puffs of heaven. there is not much on the menu here, their specialty being the cream puffs of course but boy o boy what joy... 
i love beard papa, have now for a long time, the hubby used to bring them home all the time when he worked next door, i had totally forgot about them but today we reconnected! the plain ole vanilla bean is my favorite but when the flavor of the week is pumpkin or green tea i must waiver, sadly today it was caramel, too sweet for my taste buds.
author: La C.

description:
don't let the reality distortion field of beard papa fool you.  yes, you'll be in heaven after you eat but let the sense of euphoria wear off and you'll come to realize that there are tons of other pastries/bakeries out there producing a very similar puff.  the pastry shell itself is standard and the cream portion is just alright.  they have other stuff like cheesecake sticks but there all very gimmicky.

one extra star for the magic shell enduced eclair version just because it tickles my chocolate bone.
author: Swarup B.

description:
these little pastries are amazing!  it is a must-have everytime i go to westfield!  good thing i don't go there very often.

my favorite is the green tea filling. i like the caramel one too. but the original is always a nice classic.

the creamy filling is not too sweet. that's what I love about it. the flaky outside gives a perfect contrast.  i always end up with powdered sugar all over my face and clothes though. but it's worth it.

In hawaii they also make sandwiches at beard papa's.  I didn't try one because I needed a sugary fix at the time, but it was interesting.  If they made sandwiches at the westfield beard papa I would totally try it!
author: RACHELLE T.

description: Today, Black Friday, I was willing to brave the line to get some Beard Papa puffs and I was not disappointed.  They had coffee as special of the day, just delicious.  They've posted on the counter their schedule of the weekly specials thru December.  I'm waiting for the green tea for the week of 12/21.  But, it means making a special trip Downtown just for cream puffs?  Absolutely!
author: Ry T.

description:
wow. could you possibly create a better cream puff. usually they are chunky, too thick, too sugary and the pastry is too... chewy.... but wow. i was blown away. caught off guard. reminded me of sex. 

the pastry is perfectly flaky and not too sweet. and the filling........ wow. perfect. they had milk tea flavor when i was there. i love sex. i mean.... beard papa's cream puffs.
author: Lillian P.

description: Excellent pastry crust, nice selection of fillings, great size, and the perfect dusting of powdered sugar..  However, the cream filling tasted more like pudding to me than cream filling.  Otherwise good and well priced!
author: Wendy T.

description:
i FINALLY tried the famous beard papa's vanilla cream puffs!!!!!!! that is the sh*t for me right now !!!   it is an OMG experience!!! pretty heavenly, divine, mmm--mm--mmmmm experience -- quite crackish right now, cause i've been jonesing  for 'em since i took my first bite at home 2 days ago --  (damn i only got 3 which i had to share with my husband).
 ............so worth the wait in that long a** line!!!!!
next time (very soon, like this weekend) will try the fondant & the eclairs plus a 1/2 dozen of those vanilla cream puffs!!!!!

update:  the vanilla eclairs are DAMN GOOD too!!!!  ....next fondant
author: Cindi N.

description: The cream puffs taste like dookie. I don't understand the appeal
author: Issa K.

description: Who the hell brought this Japanese treat to the Bay Area?  All of their cream-puff treats are delicious.  This kiosk is conveniently located in the downstairs foodcourt, so you can't NOT think about grabbing dessert after eating.  Bastards.  I love the plain vanilla custard filled and chocolate ones.  Don't forget to grab an Aloe drink too.  What sucks, however is that they only tease you with specials like "Green Tea Custard" or "Strawberry" which are available for a limited time at this location.  Just up the street,  at their Mission St store, they have them ALL.  I never knew the god of gluttony wore a beard.
author: Michael B.

description: Love grabbing a vanilla cream puff after a massage at Burke Williams.  Wearing the powdered sugar on my chin on the Bart ride home is an honor.
author: brewgirl b.

description: Great, fresh cream puffs. Love it when they have diff flavors like green tea, strawberry etc.. LOVE the cheese sticks
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Beard Papa is like my own personal Mecca.  Each time I visit the Food Emporium, I must indulge repeatedly.  Nothing goes better before and after a nice tri-tip sandwich with roadhouse onions from Buckhorn, then a vanilla custard surrounded by flaky pastry delight.  My god this shit is awesome.  I've converted four non-believers.  As soon as I marry some filthy rich old man, take out a bunch of life insurance policies, hire a hitman and watch the riches pour in, I will build franchises on every corner and live out my destiny.
author: Katie H.

description: The BEST thing that has ever happened to me!!!! I love them love them love them. I could eat them all day - everyday. MHHHMMMMMMHHH
author: Maddie N.

description: I had the chocolate filled eclair and a bite of my husbands regular cream filled eclair. They were very good but nothing that I'd have cravings for which is a blessing as I have enough of those! :)
author: Carolyn P.

description: it wasn't nearly as sweet as i thought it was going to be, which can be a good or bad thing depending on who you are, but i loved it nonetheless. i think vanilla is my favorite. i definitely would not order any out of the case, definitely get the fresh ones!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Yum!  I love Beard's Papa.  They serve giant cream puffs filled with different fillings.  I have tried the chocolate, vanilla, and pumpkin (seasonal) and unfortunately, my favorite is the pumpkin.  I guess I'll have to wait until autumn to get my pumpkin fix again...
author: Jennifer D.

description: i really dont get it.  better than in hollywood, but still---these are not creme puffs.  these are pudding puffs.  i brought home two---one for me, one for the kiddie.  2.75 a pop?  puhhleeeze.  extra star granted for the chocolate eclair version with chocolate pudding inside tho.
author: Virgo M.

description: Best cream puff ever had!  and the most unusual flavor in a cream puff -- MANGO!  Yum.  The crust is out of this world when it's fresh so eat it on the same day. We had a few leftover till the next morning and the crust became a little soft, but still good.  I rarely write a review but this one is so good that I have to rave about.
author: Y. W.

description: take the fondant au chocolat (lava cake) home, heat it up in the toaster oven.  then serve w/ ice cream.  yum!
author: Miss K.

description: One can't go wrong ordering either an eclair or creampuff from Beard Papa's. Especially if you're fan of custard based desserts. I recommend the vanilla bean custard creampuff with the chocolate icing. I also ordered the vanilla bean eclair and it was scrumptious. Of course I ate both on separate occasions. Maybe soon they will open a location in the East Bay.
author: Carguy S.

description: Yum, cream puffs like the ones my mom made when I was a kid.  Yikes, long line!  But it did move pretty quickly (I think, maybe because my friend got in line while I made a quick bathroom trip).  Reminds me of why I avoid the mall (any mall) on the weekend, if I can help it.  Well, I was there on a weekend, because it was a convenient location to meet a friend after my conference had finished & she was going to work afterwards.  The food court (in the basement of Westfield Mall) was packed!  From what I could tell, they only offer vanilla & chocolate flavors at this location.  Oh yeah, & I was being high-maintenance & asked that they put 2 in a bag (for me), & the rest in a box (for relatives I was meeting up with afterwards), & they did, with the correct flavor distribution!
author: Linda T.

description: So GOOD! Especially when you get that late afternoon sweet craving. I could probably eat 4 or 5 in one sitting if I knew I wouldn't have to go to the gym afterward to work it off. I wish we had one in San Diego! We had the Vanilla Bean, Chocolate and a couple of clairs.  My favorite was the chocolate...not too sweet but so satisfying.
author: Kari S.

description: once i was third in a growing line at beard papa. the three ladies who were together were hemming and hawing trying to decide what to get, like how many of the vanilla or chocolate, should they get cookie crunch or what, and so on and so forth. the cashier is extremely patient with them. people are starting to get annoyed and the lady right behind them starts angrily shouting at them, 'you're taking forever, hurry up!" there is bitching back and forth, lots of swearing and shouting. it's kind of sad to the point of being funny that so much fuss is over cream puffs. despite the awkward situation, the guy working at the counter is patient, isn't rude to any of the customers and just did a nice job overall. overall my favorite flavor is strawberry, then its green tea and vanilla is my general stand by flavor when none of the weekly flavors appeal to me.
author: annie y.

description: Really great cream puffs!!! Where else are you going to get a fresh baked puff with the cream injected as you order?
author: Jay T.

description: this one only gets 4 stars since it only carries choco and vanilla puffs.... I WANT THE GREEN TEA ONE DAMMIT! BUT...... on the up side... you can eat like 3 of these and walk around this ginormous shopping center and around union square and easily burn it off... guiltless cream puff consumption.... it's the best :-D
author: Marina K.

description: I am so very thrilled to have found a Beard Papa in San Francisco!  I had the green tea cream puff on my last visit.  The cream itself tastes smooth and sweet, but not overtly so.  I believe this flavor is one of Beard Papa's daily or weekly specials.  They seem to rotate the third flavor regularly, or at least that's what they did at the Los Angeles location.  The regular flavors are chocolate and vanilla.  Yum!
author: Camille K.

description: The best part about this Beard Papa location is the convenience!  Everytime I'm shopping in Union Square, I just can't resist making a quick stop and getting my fix of delicious cream puff heaven.  I typically go to the Redwood City location, but this one has much faster service and their process is much more streamlined.  If you want to see my full review on Beard Papa cream puffs, please see my Redwood City review!
author: Mai S.

description: One of my new vices, after one of the MD's I work with brought some in, I just can't resist getting one or six whenever I'm downtown.  I've only had the cream puffs, but they also have eclairs there too. I like and hate that they  rotate a flavor of the week. I like it cause it gives you a chance to try a new flavor but I hate it because if you like the flavor you might have to wait weeks to taste it again.  Other wise good dessert food, eating one won't make you feel guilty, and most of all tasty...
author: Charles M.

description: Orgasmic good. BYOM (bring your own milk) and enjoy in private. :)
author: Lucas M.

description: HELLA GOOD. Great for summer days because the cream is so refreshing. Vanilla is the best. And the contrast between the crispiness of the puff and the cream is just OMG. I can't even describe it! A perfect pairing. I love Beard Papas!! Open more stores, preferably in the Sunset!
author: Audrey T.

description:
I didn't plan on coming here, but walking by the scent of vanilla and dough drew me in. I love sweets that are filled with a creamy/custurdy center of any sort. 
This place does just that. They fill a harder-powdered sugar-covered shell with filling of your choice. Chocolate and vanilla are always avaliable, but I saw that depending on the day of the week they offer a special flavor filling- green tea, pumpkin. Pumpkin sounded festive, but I went for the original vanilla and was not disappointed. 
The filling is thicker and not as runny as some cream puffs can be. The vanilla is amazing- it is not just any plain vanilla, but it is vanilla bean. It has the strong bean flavor to it that makes it that much more delicious. 
People walking by most likely were staring at me as I had powdered sugar all over my face and custard running down my fingers. But it was well worth the mess. 
The cannoli of the West Coast.
author: Melissa C.

description: Well I'm not sure what to compare this place to but I've certainly never had a better cream puff... get vanilla and a coffee.
author: Aaron W.

description: After seeing the drones waiting in line for these little creme filled pastries,  I had to see what all the hype was about.  They are a couple bucks a piece for a good sized cream puff.  I had the vanilla bean, it was good, but  I don't really quite know what all the commotion is.  It's fun to see the cream puff masters making them as you wait in line, but man, I kinda feel sorry for them.  They work hard for their money!
author: jen n.

description:
This place is insane. Mr. Beard Papa, you have created insanity in Westfield Shopping Center SF. The line was at least 18 people long at any given time when I sat and ate lunch for an hour. Finally when the line hit 15 people I just gave up and joined it, because that was as short as it was going to get. So I look at the yummy menu and decide that I will get one of each, even tho these things are like ridiculously priced. But when I get to the register. OMG. They ran out of most of the stuff I wanted. No sign saying that they ran out. Nada! So I had to settle for a chocolate cream puff. And my friend got a vanilla one and then we split them. The vanilla one was delicious, soft pastry with smooth vanilla cream, so light and fluffy... and then I was less angry, but still annoyed that after this crazy line I couldn't get all of what I wanted. What food court place runs out of stuff when it is only 2pm!?!?!

But I do think that this is the next big thing. Crispy Kreme part deux but more expensive. Hopefully it'll fair better in long term success.
author: Jessica C.

description: I was practically dragged to Beard Papa's.  This location was much better than one I tried out in SoCal.  It's good, but it is just a cream puff.  There isn't anything memorable about it aside from watching people get so excited over them.  The cream puff was still good.
author: Vy A.

description:
I do not like any of their puffs...I LOVE the chocolate filling
Im not a fan of the carmel, strawberries, regular...etc.
author: Clara W.

description: I've had the chocolate and vanilla versions several times.  The puffs are pretty good, but I don't get how they inspire such a cult following.  The Beard Papa locations I've been to also always have long lines and I can't figure out why they move so slowly cuz it only takes a few seconds to stab a puff onto the filling machine and fill it up.  The puffs are tasty and all, but not worth waiting in line for.  They're also pretty messy so make sure to eat carefully.
author: Saw T.

description: Finding myself waiting over 15 minutes to score some puffs on multiple occasions is saying something about Beard Papa's.  These puff are daym good!  I recommend trying the vanilla puffs at least once.  I'm sure you'll be hooked if you bite into one as soon as it reaches your hand.  This way you get to experience a fresh puff with a nice crispy shell and cool vanilla bean filling.
author: Steve D.

description: What's the fuss for their cream puffs?  I couldn't make it to their store, but received some from family who took some home to me.  Ok, I'll have to revise this and absorb the whole store feeling some day.  But do they have cream puffs with custard instead of frosting consistency of filling.  That can convert me, to make a journey for cream puffs.
author: Jeff L.

description: Sweet mother of God... CREAM PUFFS.  I LOVE cream puffs, and by association, I have to love Beard Papa's because they make me some kick ass freaking cream puffs.  Get one, get a dozen, get however many you can put down, and go stuff your face.
author: Dietrich H.

description: It's the custard filling that just makes this cream puff so good. Well, that and the fact that you can eat it without the guilt factor (the hindsight one that leaves you going - why did I eat that?!). The outside shell is light and the inside filling is so creamy without being overly sweet. It makes you feel like you can just eat more of it, but oh...
author: Lorraine D.

description: I've never heard of Beard Papa until I went to Hawaii.  I only tried one Cream puff and after that one cream puff I had to go back for more.  I'm not crazy about cream puffs but this one is good.  It's crunchy on the outside creamy vanilla on the inside.  I wanna go back for more!
author: Emma R.

description: I would say more like a 2.5 for this place.  I like the cream filling and the pastry, but it was hard to eat without making a mess.  My suggestion, eat this while sitting!
author: Somala A.

description: Not bad. $2-3 a piece (which is more filling than one donut), with a long wait line to boot.  It took maybe 15 minutes to wait in line and 2 minutes for them to box them. A bit too sweet inside, but the outside crust is great.
author: Fotos C.

description: Awesome cream puffs.  I haven't found a way to devour one of these things without making total mess, licking the bag, and/or inhaling powdered sugar.  A metaphor for life I say.
author: Leon R.

description:
Ohmygollygoshdarnit was the first thing I thought when I first saw the cream puff. IT IS HUGE! not like those puny little costco one with frozen cream in the middle, (not that i don't like costco. their samples are awesome) it is like the size of your palm. They have eclairs, and chocolate and vanilla cream puffs, with a changing flavor. its either pumpkin, caramel, coffee, green tea, strawberry, or chestnut during the xmas time. The cheesecake sticks and molten chocolate cake thing isnt that good though. but that's only compared to the AMAZING creampuffs. They are crunchy on the outside, and they taste sooo fresh. and the filling is almost pudding like. The even dusted a little powdered sugar on top. I stuffed myself super full with like 3 cream puffs. Tidbit. bite where the pipe the filling in, or it goes flying all over the place, becoming super messy. I think the best flavors are chocolate, caramel, and grn tea, vanilla's a little too bland, and I haven't had pumpkin yet. I'm trying to time my beard papa trips now. :]
Another really cool thing is they pump the cream in front of you, when you order, so it is TOTALLY fresh in that sense too. Another tidbit. No preservatives in your cream puff. so it only lasts 24 hours. but seriously. you would not need 24 hours to eat the AWESOMEST FRESHEST PUDDINGEST YUMMIEST CREAM PUFF ALIVE!
author: Katie T.

description: When Beard Paper first opened my sister and I came to try every flavor. So far my favorite is green tea, chocolate, and vanilla. It's cheap, and great for sharing. =]
author: Jen P.

description: DELICIOUS!!!!  You'll go to treat yourself with one and end up buying a box of six... or maybe that's just me... :-P
author: F K.

description: I'm not a cream puff connoisseur but last time I was at the mall it was a blazing hot day and bulging crowds of European tourists were screaming in my ear. To save myself from going postal on some innocent bystander, I treated myself to an original vanilla cream puff and it took to me away into my happy place. After years of walking past Beard Papa and never indulging, I'm so glad I did.
author: Allison B.

description: ADDICTIVE. Can't keep my self away from this place. 6 for $11 I DON"T CARE! plus a bottle of OCHA green tea yumm yumm yummmmmm!
author: Katarina V.

description: I spent many vacations in Japan as a child and developed a taste for vanilla custard and french pastry shells.  Believe it or not, there's no place to get a European pastry like in Japan.  And now, Beard Papas offers me Japanese cream puffs at home in the states . . .  Globalization at its finest.
author: Leah M.

description: My husband and I recently sampled all of the dessert at Beard Papa's and the Vanilla Cream Puff is simply divine. LOVE this place! We cant wait to come back!
author: Heather J.

description:
Another place that deserves million star. Awesome! 
(My film class teacher said never say awesome when describing film, well it's not film. So there you go! ) 

Best thing on earth. This comes from sugar and sweet addict who tried every bakery and sweet in town. 

I used to be in queue of Yokohama station to get this whenever i'm in Japan. Now it's here! Awesome!
author: E B.

description:
Not too many choices, Vanilla or Chocolate.  Simplicity!
One of the best tasting puffs I ever had.  That 20 minutes wait was well worth it.  It was light and fluffy and the filling was not sweet.

****UPDATE*****
Instead of having different prices for flavors ($1.75 for Vanilla; $1.95 for Chocolate; and $2.25 for daily special).  They just went "SCREW IT...just charge $2.25 for EVERYTHING!  

Fortunately, the one in Cupertino still offers cheaper price for the same thing.
author: Gary Y.

description: These cream puffs are great as a mid-afternoon snack or a quick "bite" before the movies at Westfield or the Metreon.  The chocolate ones are good, but the vanilla creme ones are great.  Yes, good cream puffs can be easily made at home, but nothing beats instant gratification.
author: Uimuim B.

description: I had a chocolate cream puff and it was good!  This is an excellent place for me to franchise...hmmmm...if only I had $$$, I'd be my own best customer :-)
author: Kit E.

description:
i could smell something so comforting as I approached..I whisked my boyfriend in and ordered and ate all within 2 min...hahahah it was GREAT!

He like ate it in 2 bits...then started sniffing the paper...and later on that day he said he smelt the receipt to see if it still lingered.. HAHAHAA

*vanilla Bean cream puff =)
author: JK K.

description: I love their cream puffs! Definetely delicious mouth water cream puffs in the Bay Area.. I am chocolate lover, so the chocolate ones fancied me.. There is more than one Beard Papa's but the cream puffs are generally the same and are very yummmy!!
author: Rochelle F.

description:
Oh wow. 

I've walked by this place a million times and thought "I am not going to fall into the mall trap of the Beard Papa." I'd read many reviews saying it wasn't all that, and how there are always lines and it's a complicated buying process like in the former Soviet Union.

I have to say it was pretty good, really good. For $2.10, which is like what a cookie costs at most coffee shops these days, it was a delicious slightly crispy puff crust with vanilla cream inside...it wasn't too sweet or rich and was flecked with vanilla bean bits. And then the whole thing was dipped on the top in dark bittersweet chocolate of a pretty decent quality.

And the buying process was not complicated...I had my puff in hand before I had gotten the change back into my purse.

One star off for the mythical lines, (it was 2:30pm when I went, so I can believe that at lunch time it's mobbed) and because now that I know it's good, I will be tempted more than I should be.

All in all, a very enjoyable and decadent treat with my coffee. It lost
author: Darien W.

description: I am sucker when it comes to long line.  It must be good if there is a line and so I waited  Of course, it was worth it.  I bought a dozen of eclair to take to a party.  They were a hit.  I shouldn't of share them and kept them to myself :-(
author: Anna S.

description: Freakin TO DIE FOR! At only $1.75-2.50 for a giant freshly made cream puff, you've got to try one. It's located in the really nice and new food court, "The Emporium". The cream puffs taste like heaven, thanks to the REAL and fresh whipped cream, freshly baked pate-a-choux, and thick, rich chocolate glaze on the Eclair Cream Puff. Gotta have at least one or two, or take one to-go in a cute yellow and blue Beard Papa box&bag!
author: Jessica h.

description: Five stars for one primary reason: The giant, delicious, creamy vanilla cream puff is only 220 calories (according to the Beard Papa web site). What a frickin' caloric deal! As I inhaled my cream puff, I was certain it was at least a thousand tasty calories of creamy, fatty, buttery perfection. I was prepared for the inevitable guilt that would set in as I finished my treat....but lo and behold, the web site gave me some justification. I can burn this baby off on the treadmill and go back for more!
author: Beth T.

description: Best cream puffs ever, even just the vanilla ones. The chocolate ones aren't too bad either. Lots of cream filling, rich and creamy, the way it should always be.
author: Maximillian M.

description: The two stars are only for the green tea puff and maybe a bit for the vanilla puff. Specifically, only for the cream. The pastry dough itself is awful. I can't finish all of the cream in one puff because it's too sweet. Annoying to wait in this long line for something so simple! Do not get the chocolate-covered ones.
author: Marina N.

description: chocolate eclair cream puff with filling completes a long day walking around union square.  Don't know about the chocolate filling, tho...questionable texture.
author: Roy N.

description: I am an absolute lover of desserts, so I'll drive anywhere to try something.  I was pretty disappointed with these cream puffs.  So many people rave about them, but honestly the puffs taste flavorless and dry, like cardboard.  I've been here twice to try more than one flavor.  The vanilla and chocolate flavors taste artificial, kinda like the flavors from soft serve ice cream.  It's nice that the filling isn't too sweet, but I know my Mom can make cream puffs 100 times better.  The puff is missing the yeasty flavor you get from dough rising.  The price is not a problem if you're in the mood for something sweet, but I wouldn't call these great.
author: Steph G.

description: I heart Beard Papa!!! No need to say more...
author: Carrie W.

description: Too tempting to order two. One is enough! I wish I could fly these to my family, but they'd probably wilt after 5 hours on a plane. Not as gooey as the godzilla-sized chocolate eclairs from the Pine Cone restaurant (near the Tiki Inn) around Peru, Illinois.
author: elsa m.

description:
mmmmmmmm!!!!

love the cream puffs & souffles!!!
does not hurt my budget either.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description: Oh yum.  Oh oh oh oh yummmmmmmm.  Psssh.  So damn great.  Their cream puffs are one of those things you bite into, then just smile, nod, and go "mm hmm" over and over again until they're all gone.  The perfect profiterole.  The choux pastry is perfect, the filling is perfect.  Its bigger than your typical profiterole too.  PERFECT.  The filling can also be used interchangably as eye cream, shaving cream, personal lubricant, hair conditioner, burn relief, mouthwash, lotion....you get the picture.
author: Barry A.

description: Today was my first Beard Papa experience.  My first cream puff experience as well.  While I did enjoy the vanilla cream puff, it's definitely not something I could eat all the time.
author: Jenna M.

description: This cream puff is near perfect. Very japanese style to it. The fillings are not cloyingly sweet, a trait which many americans seem to associate with lack of flavor. They are a little less sweet than you would expect so that the vanilla or chocolate flavor doesn't get drowned out. The pastry is always perfectly crisp on the outside and has a slight chew on the inside. It all combines into a textural triple play that will leave you perfectly satisfied. The puffs are also the perfect size to not leave you bloated if you have one after lunch. One of the few chain stores i will even consider having something dessert-y at. Make sure to ask what the mystery third filling is that day, sometimes they have some unique flavors. Highly recommended!
author: Gavin M.

description: As a diabetic in training, both the Vanilla and Strawberry flavored cream puffs hit the spot.  A good friend of mine couldn't stop talking about the place and I didn't understand what the big deal was.  I mean, it's just cream puffs...you could get a giant box of that crap from Costco...right?  Man-o- man my fatass was wrong.  There is always a long line but it's totally worth the wait.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: I love Beard Papa.  The first time I had them I had the vanilla bean one which was just ok in my book.  Then I stole a bite of the boyfriends chocolate one and OMG!  It was like they put a chocolate milkshake in a cream puff because it was that good.  I usually try to stop and get one whenever I'm shopping at SF Centre but it's one of those things that you need to sit down and eat.  You'll find that the majority of it lands all over the place rather than in your mouth if you try.
author: Anna H.

description: Holy delicious creampuffs batman! Seriously ... these things are addictive and delicious.... eat with caution!
author: Jeremy R.

description: I first tried these delicious, heavenly cream puffs over a year ago around Thanksgiving. It was absolutely amazing to eat. I like the vanilla cream puffs best! You must try!!
author: Steph C.

description: Delicious cream puffs. My mom can make incredible puffs, but there is something about this filling that beats jello pudding or icecream we use at home.  I've only had the vanilla and chocolate, both which are yummy. Wonder about the other flavors, since I"m prob reviewing the wrong store (I went to the one at Union square mall, near the Muni).  Coffee? Pumpkin?  Gosh, glad there were only 2 options or I'd have to have one of each!
author: Giggly C.

description: mmmm... yummy.  Their original flavor is delicious.  The pumpkin and chocolate are fabulous too.  They never disappoint.  It's a little on the pricey side but worth it.
author: Blu n.

description: Best cream puffs.  I tried the vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry.  Hey, it was my birthday damn-it and I was on vacation!  I was amazed at how flaky the outside was, and the strawberry actually has pureed strawberry mixed in the cream.  They opened one here is Seattle recently, and I haven't tried it yet...but I will because these are freaking great!  They sell so fast they don't have time to get stale, and the price is worth the size and quality.  In my book anyway.
author: Angel L.

description: I love cream puffs, really I do, but I'm not sure what the fuss about this place is. I tried the chocolate filled puff, but the flaky puff pastry tasted like paper to me and was really dry. Don't get me wrong, I love sweets and will never turn down a Beard Papa cream puff, I'm just not sure I'd go out of my way to get one. Unless of course they add a chocolate filled one that's coated in chocolate sauce as well. Then I'm sure it would be worth while to make the trips to the Metreon.
author: melissa g.

description: I went here when the new mall first opened and the lines used to worse than waiting for a ride at Great America on a summer afternoon...Since then I have noticed the lines have gone down and the place kinda lost the "new" factor it once had, but the eats here are good and tasty ..and cheap, can't forget about that. Service is also fast too...
author: Nick A.

description:
after hearing how wonderful it was, I was sadly disappointed. 

I think I would have liked it if I had not heard it was the best in the city.
author: Simmy S.

description: Yummy! These cream puffs were so good. I purchased  2 Vanilla Bean cream puffs for $1.75ea and 2 Strawberry cream puffs (flavor of the week) for $2.10ea. Both flavors were really good. They are light and not too sweet. Great dessert for a cheap price.
author: Cupcake s.

description: Nice SHU-CREAM (cream puff).  It's a good place to have a break after shopping in downtown SF.  I like Macha (grean tea) cream puff the best.  I  taste it with Jasmine Tea from Pete's Coffee.  This is a good combination.  Not to mention their original Shu-cream is also good.
author: Mike M.

description: was walking around san francisco, and happily found myself in front of a Beard Papa's! their cream puffs are definitely good. i mean, anything cream filled is a-ok by me. but i do kind of wish they explained that their "chocolate, vanilla and green tea" flavors were just reffering to the powder on top of the cream puff, and now the cream itself.
author: sheena r.

description: I like cream puffs as much as the next guy but they come out cold. With the strong scent of cream puffs from the outside I was expecting to get one that was warm on the outside, with cool cream on the inside. By the way, I got the green tea one. Maybe if you're there early or something you can get them right out of the oven, maybe they'll be warm then.
author: Mike C.

description: Love this place!  The chocolate options are the best (chocolate eclair - yum!) If you time it right you can get a warm puff with cool custard inside.  Tucked in to BP last week in NYC and it sucked...not sure why?  Oh well, I still haul my ass over to Beard Papa when it's time for a sweet treat.
author: Robert S.

description: Not sure what all the fuss is about.  I had the chocolate and the vanilla just because I had heard so much about this place.  Both were OK, but not something I must have.
author: Kathryn M.

description: Love the "Papa".  2 locations (in the Jukebox Marriott and SF Centre) that are too close to me.  First found this Cream Puff to the the masses in Hong Kong subway.  The basic cream puff is still the best.  My hope is they choose the "In and Out Burger" Route and keep the menus items limited.
author: Jere C.

description: Definitely a fan! Tiramisu was great! Cheescake - was good (not my fav but not bad at all). The cream puff - YUMMY! Last and definitely not the least, the fondant was absolutely wonderful!  Great great great desserts!!!
author: Chris A.

description: hmm, beard papa! this place is good whenever I have a craving for sweet things. Kinda expensive but it's so worthy it!
author: Chen N.

description: Too weird a name not to try. But the damn things were actually good. Better than the ones we ate back in Scotland. And this company is not British. I mean look at what they called it. Just goes to prove that nothing's too weird to start a business on. Cream Puffs... I rest my case.
author: adrian c.

description: Oh my the hype.  Beard Papa this, Beard Papa that, every time I turn around it's all about the delectible goodness that is Beard Papa.  NOT.  Found the offerings to be very ordinary.  We've been  twice and just can't see why everyone raves about this place. Whatever happened to custard?  Delicious slightly vanilla-y custard?  These fillings are flavorless and just plain yuck-o.
author: Glenda F.

description:
I did not like Beard Papa. The pastries were warm (a good thing) and the cream filling was fairly light (another good thing), but the flavors were a bit off. The pastry was a little like it was stale. The cream filling was not creamy but felt a little, well, stale.

I have had some good cream puffs before. I think the bread is usually more croissant-like (flaky, yummy on their own) and the cream is, well, creamier.
author: Howard C.

description: This is a great location.  I love Beard Papa.  These cream puffs are yummy, especially when they are freshly made!
author: j c.

description: After reading all the good reviews this place has gotten, i decided to give it a try and bought one of those strawberry cheseecake sticks. It was pretty yummy but soooo small....you could finish it in 2 or 3 bites.
author: JK R.

description: The cream puffs here are so good but the only reason why I'm not giving it a 5 star rating is because of the parking, but the BEST cream puffs are from the Beard Papa in Redwood City.  The outside is crispy and if you save them for the next day, it does not get soggy.  They give you just enough fillng, parking is much better and the line is ssssooooooo much shorter.
author: Susan W.

description:
it's sooo good!
i love their vanilla cream puffs. 
usually i love when they serve it warm.
author: sarah m.

description:
After going here for the first time, I found myself getting cravings for these things day after day after day, etc.  

We aren't lucky enough to have this sort of establishment up anywhere near Sacramento, which is totally unfair but I guess we're just not good enough. Ugh, now I want more.  The Japanese always get everything right.  Damn this is making me hungry.

Also fuck you for make me randomly crave these things.  I still love you though.
author: Will C.

description:
I love Beard Papa's Cream Puffs!!!  
A dessert should be this way, not too sweet- just light and airy.  
The chocolate one is the best.  It satisfies a craving for something sweet, without feeling disgustingly stuffed or heavy after eating it.
author: ChaCha C.

description:
My sister brought 2 back for me :) 
Supposedly they have em all over the world.. 
Well, I give them 4 stars cause I like my cream puffs to be soft on the inside and out. Theirs are a little to crunchy for me.. 
mmm.. cream puffs.
author: Mari K.

description: Yum!!!! Yum!!! $1.75 for a tasty vanilla cream puff... so light and yummy... if only I had gotten coffee to go with it... then I would have been in complete heaven!
author: Maya H.

description: Far too many of my fat friends love this place but they don't serve anything vegan...
author: Quartknee K.

description: yummy when you're craving a light fluffy dessert. It's located on the outskirts of union square so you have to really be looking for it in order to see it. From the reviews i was expecting to get my socks knocked off.. but honestly i felt like they weren't too unique or different from any of the other cream puffs i've eaten. yummy just because i love desserts and cream puffs but not AMAZING like i expected. 11 dollars for 6 puffs, available in vanilla, chocolate and special flavors.
author: A B.

description: I am obsessed with their cream puffs - especially the pumpkin and chocolate ones.  THEY ARE SO TASTY.  Nice, efficient staff.  Fast service.  A bit overpriced.  I love how they're served chilled, the perfect texture and flavor.
author: Tuesday J.

description:
Why are people all up in arms about this place? I mean yes it was delish but definitely not the best i ever had. The only difference between this cream puff and other ones is that they use a custard/whipped cream type filling instead of a cream type one (I bake french pastries). That's where you get the light and airy taste that everyone raves about. Though it may sound innocent and not "waist"-ful, trust me baby, it is. Go and ask them about their nutritional content. Go ahead, I'll wait. 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
Scared you straight, huh? And teh thing is, I'm not even a health nut. I love indulging myself in everything food-related, but this is just too much for me to handle. If you're looking for a sweet treat, you might as well hit up Sophie's Crepes (my hometown hero) in J-town. I mean for the amount of fat, carbs, and calories you're consuming, you might as well enjoy yourself and eat a whole crepe. Beard Papa's is good, yes, but that itty bitty cream puff can turn ME into a cream puff. In moderation folks, in moderation! 

Final Verdict: Yes, these little treats may taste really good, but go and read up on the facts, like good children should! The facts may astound you,and I'm sure that they would, you didn't burn too many calories in that long line you just stood.
author: Dana F.

description: i am not a cream puff person but one day my fiance' came over and ate like 6 of them and i was like well he sure makes them look good. i took one bite i was hooked. i ordered 40 of  them the next day and kept them in the fridge. ( i didnt eat them for myself, i took them to a party) all i can say is mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm did  i say hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm oh yea mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
author: LaNiesha P.

description: i don't fancy these pastries as other people do.  i've had better cream puffs elsewhere.
author: Sheri N.

description: I was a fan until they raised the price by $0.50-$0.75 a piece.  These things are definitely not cheap, but i guess it's nice to treat yourself one of these.  Sometimes they pump too little cream in it, so make sure you tell them too, because the whole point of a cream puff is well, obviously, THE CREAM! There was this one time where i ate half of my puff without any cream, what a rip!
author: Emily L.

description:
since i'm not really a fan of cream puffs, i waited this long to try a beard papa...
i didn't get the hype.  people with their beard papa boxes everywhere in town...
but after work i had yet another meal at coriander thai at the emporium food court and i was facing beard papa as i was eating my dinner.
so i thought i'd give it a try to see what it was all about...
does beard papa have amazing cream puffs??  i finally was ready to find out for myself... who's beard papa anyway?  and why such a weird name that doesn't really make much sense in any form... grammatically speaking that is...
so i finish my food and head on over.
i decide i'll go for the basic vanilla bean as my first try... so i buy one and take it in my backpack and head home...
all the while i'm thinking the cream puff is just gonna be another lame cream puff... it sure doesn't look like anything special to me...
a while after i get home it's time for my korean drama on azn tv... so i turn on the boobtube and get comfy on the couch...
open up my bag of cream puff and take a bite thinking it's gonna be a dry piece of pastry with some goo inside...
fortunately (or maybe it's not fortunate to have a liking for these things) it's actually a darn tasty cream puff... hmmm... 
well i guess it's possible for charlotte to like cream puffs...
author: charlotte s.

description: it just wasn't that great.  the cream filling is way too sweet and tasted super artificial.  the outer shell was hard and gross, not warm & flaky.  it's just not worth buying.  the end.
author: H. L.

description: not quite the same as getting cream puffs in japan where the lines aren't super crazy since it's not the hot new thing over there, but still yummy.  the chocolate cream puff is like eating soft serve out of a sweet crispy croissant.
author: spiff e.

description: yummy and freshly made to order. enough said. would definitely come back again.
author: Linda L.

description:
sorry - but i honestly have no idea what the hype is all about.  i've tried the vanilla cream puff two different times and came to the same conclusion.  after lining up for 45 minutes just to place my order; then to wait for another 30 is just mind boggling.  

the choux pastry is mediocore (do they intentionally steam, prior to baking?).  and the cream/custard is meh.  granted it's a decent dessert - but it's got no soul - just full of hot air.
author: meijan w.

description: These are not bad creme puffs but they just seem a little above average when I compare them to Pacific Puff's. That said the upside is the cost and choice of flavors, ranging from your basic chocolate and vanilla, pumpkin and even green tea to name a few. Also a plus is the many more locations they have, especially close to BART and Muni for easy access for us East Bay people.
author: K Y.

description: yummy!! i stopped by here to grab two puffs when i got to the shopping center because my stomach was eating itself. best idea ever. i got one chocolate and one vanilla bean and it was pure heaven. in fact i think i'll get one tomorrow too.
author: eliza darling d.

description: undoubtedly the finest asian styled cream puff in the city.  yeah, that's right, i'm a beard papa slut.  they are especially tasty when fresh because the puff is warm, light, and airy.  because they're asian styled puffs, they can be good in the morning, lunch, and dinner.  in terms of flavor,  i'm partial to the vanilla, but am always up for the special flavors (ie green tea).
author: Kazuo L.

description: i finally got the elusive strawberry puff! they puree real strawberries and mix it in with the custard, the resulting concoction being a pretty, pale light pink colored custard that tastes as good as it looks. since they rotate the flavors weekly, strawberry won't always be available but perhaps you'll encounter one of these other scrumptious flavors: pumpkin, caramel, coffee, green tea, and of course, basic vanilla and chocolate.
author: helen l.

description: who can resists these cream puffs?  vanilla is definitely the best, and the second best is the green tea.  if you haven't tried one yet, run run run!
author: Gina T.

description: I'm hooked after one bite!  This place makes the best cream puffs I've ever tasted.  I can't believe how good it is and I can't stop thinking about it.
author: Helen V.

description: I always enjoy the cream puffs here.  While I am a self proclaimed chocoholic, I actually think the vanilla bean cream puffs are the best.  I've tried almost all of the flavors offered, and always go back to the vanilla bean.  If you haven't tried one yet, you don't know what you're missing.  It's the perfect snack to grab during a break from all the shopping or on your way to catch BART.
author: D B.

description: trash. this one and the one on hollywood and highland. might as well directly stick the cream injector into my ass.  i wouldnt indulge in this crap.
author: Hana ..

description: This place is the only reason i like going to the tourist infested westfield mall.  THERS MY LIL CREAM PUFFS!!!! ahhhhhhhhhhhhlllll!!! GULP. GONE.
author: Daniel P.

description: An interesting discovery. I'm not a cream puff fan, but my friend got me to try out this place and I liked it enough. I haven't tried the Mission location, though I've walked by it. If I were more of a cream puff fan, I'm sure I'd go here more. The logo is cute, though.
author: Joseph R.

description: they're vanilla eclairs are like a little piece of heaven....sigh.  if i could eat one for each meal without blowing up I would. ;)
author: quel c.

description: Man this place is dangerous... so easy to just grab a cream puff on your way into SF center from BART... so easy to grab another on your way out. The line is sometimes a bit long, but the cream puffs are wonderful. My friend is coming into town to help with a project and has asked to be "paid" in treats from this place. YUM!
author: Michael H.

description: i have eaten better the vanilla custard inside the cream puff was nasty it tasted like someone had throwen up in the mix!
author: cecilia g.

description: all right, who said it was ok to infiltrate sf?  i've had it, just had it.  when are you going to sell the g&ddammed custard by the bowl?  f@ck the pastry puff, just give me the vanilla custard !!!!!
author: Jane J.

description: I'm a fan.    We get one puff and find that it is enough for two to share.   I wish they would make a Beard Papa "mini", about half the size of the current monster creme puff.
author: BarkingDO G.

description: i'm glad these things are so freakin' expensive, otherwise i'd be tempted to buy more than a couple. i highly recommend taking a gamble and going with their weekly flavors. green tea, not bad; pumpkin, not that good. but i'll be back.
author: Shinn Z.

description: i went and saw drearmgirls with jovanie and my best friend adrienne.i know,how stereotypical of me.jennifer hudson was awesome.but what was even more awesome and noteworthy that day was the smell of cream puffs from beard papa. i went in there during a lull with jovanie and adrienne trailing behind me.before they could stop me i had ordered 2 dozen puff pastries..you know...just for me! the chocolate ones are alright but the vanilla bean ones made me wanna hit someone.they were delicious.and to be honest,i liked them better the days after when i continued to eat them.the shell became a little more soggy and the creme solidified a bit more. their elairs are also AMAZING! i hid them from jovanie so i could continue to get up in the morning and look forward to something. 12 lbs later,and i still have no regrets!
author: Jim M.

description: "I love it when you call me Beard Papa...." fresh...not too sweet.  i was satisfied.  the yumminess oozed out and - YUM!
author: Maricris D.

description:
vanilla cream puff yummy

eating can get messy but it's worth it
author: Julie C.

description: I hate to add a stinky review to all these raving ones, but truth be told, I didn't enjoy my cream puff at all. Don't get me wrong, I love sweets.. While some people's minds are guided by their hearts, mine is guided by my sweet tooth. I've never had a bad experience with baked desserts. Yet, the pumpkin cream puff I bought wasn't very tasty at all. The pumpkin flavor was lacking, and the crisp wasn't very flaky or buttery. On the contrary, it was like days-old croissant. On top of all that, the filling was drippy, with the consistency of melting ice cream. I really wanted to like this place, but there was nothing special at all about Beard Papa's. Oh, and the cashier forgot my change.
author: Anita L.

description: wow. a place that specializes in creme puffs...now thats different! i ordered the basic vanilla creme puff and my BF got the chocolate puff and the chocolate eclair. everything was very scrumptious...creme was definitely light and very creamy. it was yummy but i actually wished there was even more creme inside!
author: yummycupcake o.

description: I actually don't really like cream puffs, but DAMN! These are honestly to die for. The chocolate one is pretty good, but it can't compare to the original vanilla one. Sooooooooo good.
author: Bonnie L.

description: Their cream puffs are to die for.  I've only tried the Vanilla Bean one though.  The cream inside isn't whipped cream- it's some kind of liquidy custard.  Nice place to shop for for a light snack.. only $2.25 which is absolutely reasonable with the ridiculous prices these days.
author: Connie P.

description: Just another reason to head downtown (if not the only reason). Their cream puffs are SO GOOD! No matter how hard I try, I can never order just one cream puff. I always manage to leave with a small box. :) Defeated... yet again. Ah well! You can never have to much of a good thing!
author: Kacey K.

description: Cream puffs are not my favorite, but after many enthusiastic reactions to even the mention of Beard Papa amongst my friends, I was ready dive in.  We had an early lunch downtown, and made our way to the Westfield food court to try one of the suckers.  No line...what a great start!  Although I am a chocoholic, I decided to go with the simple vanilla flavor...First of all, I cannot believe how huge those things are.  I must say, I was excited.  We got them quickly, and sat down.  We scarfed those things down in about 10 seconds...delicious!  I can imagine myself coming back again...and again.   It's a keeper!
author: M M.

description: Best eclair ever!  The only downside is that they are making me a fatass now, cause I eat them all the time!  Great job, and I love that there's on on Mission street too!
author: Mark K.

description: best creampuff you'll ever find
author: Emme C.

description: Ohhh the heavenly place where everyone will be tempted to commit the sin and eat the most delicious thing on earth, not once, not twice, but several times in a row.  Followed by several times in a day.  Ignoring brain's messages that the car parked illegally across the street (driven here across the city just to "try" one more time one more puff) will be towed any minute now.  Does not matter.  Must eat one more cream puff.  I swear this place hypnotizes people.  You never see anyone who is waiting in line talking, they all quietly, and impatiently, wait and wait till it is their turn to close their eyes, breath in delicious smell of freshly cooked cream puff and slowly bite into heavenly dessert.  You must try.  P.S. I am not responsible if you suddenly find yourself indecisive whether it is going to be a better spend weekend playing computer games or stalking Cream Puff shop.
author: Lirrie L.

description: so i decided to be a fat *ss and try an over-sized cream puff on my 15 min break. wow yummmmmyyy....! flaky pastry with fresh delicious vanilla-y cream injected inside (you watch them do it), doused with chocolate. drrooool
author: N. M.

description: i always said that if i ever got fat i would kill myself. beard papa's vanilla bean creme puffs would be the way i would do it. two birds with one stone, you know?
author: parker t.

description: We ordered Beard Papa for our wedding. We didn't want a traditional wedding cake and I had initially wanted a croquembouche. I called a bunch of bakeries and only a handful of bakers in the City does a croquembouche. We found one bakery but the creams puffs were covered in chocolate, and the husband doesn't eat chocolate. We were running out of time so I decided to order a couple hundred cream puffs from BP. The ordering was super easy- I literally made one phone call it was all ready to go. And they had free delivery in the financial district- perfect! They were made fresh that morning and dropped off at the City Club by 5pm that afternoon. No stress and pretty damn affordable. The guests lovvveed the cream puffs. There was a dessert spread, with the puffs as center of the dessert buffet. We rented these gorgeous silver multi-tiered trays and they looked pretty nice if I do say so myself : )  And they were so yummy- chocolate and vanilla. I managed to get one for myself and it really added to fun/casual atmosphere of the reception.
author: B H.

description: ok not much to say here.  it is deliciciously rich cream inside of a puff baked for the sole purpose of holding cream.  i've walked by this place a million times before never tried it; never considered myself a creampuff kind of guy but lo and behold it seems i am a creampuff.  not sure how that will play on my phsyche long term but so be it.  the vanilla is the best.
author: Anthony Y.

description: gf and i always make it a point to eat a beard papa cream puff when we're in the area. good thing we're not in the city too often, because the prices are a bit steep for some cream and puff.
author: jon s.

description: cream puffs are better than saturas!  i love the choclate ones the best
author: chris y.
